review: a great game broke numerous records released as a standalone in a niche market and was a nominee for GOTY all sounds good right? well kinda. for starters the game runs horribly. you need to sell your arm and your leg to afford a rig to play this game. (and they are putting this on console???????????) there are numerous guides to fix this but even with all the graphical changes you still need a decent rig to run it. secondly the game is 20% skill 80% RNG. no matter how much you pray to RNJesus you'll still probably get killed by someone sitting in a bush 400 meters away while you run across an open field with your level 2 helmet and your m16 with no optics. On a more serious note bullets hardly register 8/10 times you'll end up missing your shot even tho you pointed right at him. and getting good loot is literally 100% up to RNJesus. thirdly the gameplay is C Tier at most. 90% of your time is running around 5% is getting loot and 5% is fighting with others. too much running around trying to get yourself the best loot possible only to die by someone you can't ing see. in conclusion I know this game is in Early Access but there are a thousand bugs and glitches that need to be fixed before fully releasing this game. (which if i'm not mistaking are planning on doing it soon???) I hope they iron out the clunkiness before even considering releasing it. This is a good game but I can't reccomend it right now. 6/10.

review: Game was always buggy/laggy which is to be expected in EA however it was still enjoyable and fun. In recent weeks the cheaters are OUT OF CONTROL. 9 of my last 12 games have had people using wall hacks aimbots speed hacks etc... Instant long range head shots wiping an entire squad pop up in the kill feed constantly. I play primarily TPP Squad and Duos on NA servers but I've experienced it in FPP as well. If you're on the fence about this game do yourself a favor and DON'T TOUCH IT until the dev's find a way to deal with the cheating.Edit Original review Oct 31 2017. Update April 19 2018.This game is absolute garbage now. Somehow it gets worse with each new patch. Latency issues every game. Gunplay is terrible. Cheaters still EVERYWHERE. Even free to play FPS games like Heroes and Generals have infinitely better control and responsiveness. Selling out and making crates and keys to drive your dying revenue was a terrible change and completely killed this game. Uninstalled.

review: Might as well be considered a simulator at this point. Except the simulator is broken in some way for everyone everywhere. It's a friggin' great game in it's ability to transport you to an emotional high intensity environment. Alternatively you can choose to play slower and experience a different aspect to this game. They all converge into one at the end.This game has a way in which it makes you rage inside. Increases your anxiety levels inside and outside of the game as well. That's the case for me at least. Then it also has another power in which is creates layers of gratitude camaraderie distrust and perhaps more than a few broken peripherals for others.I can't honestly say this is a great game because it really is bare bones. What people say is correct. Certain aspects of this game were not conceived with much foresight. Your strategy is wholly dependent on so many holes in my opinion that are contradictory to what the intention is. It's just broken and so friggin' popular that it sucks even more because of it. Can't forget to mention their adding more things to buy at every opportunity but should honestly have the resources to fix the game at this point. If the pasta isn't quite al dente you sure as hell better be cooking it longer at that point.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is very fun when you are able to play it and I mean when you are ABLE to. The game has an extremely frustrating and game breaking bug for many people myself included that causes you to be stuck looking at a seemingly infinite loading screen despite loading into a lobby and being able to hear everything going on. Only about once out of every ten games are playable because you load in before the plane comes. However from my experience playing it on xbox I can say that it is a good game it just needs this bug fixed fast. I have tried seemingly everything I could find online on how to fix this glitch to no avail and it seems this pattern isn't going to end anytime soon. As it stands I am going to continue playing Fortnite or anything else over this game because I can play those games every time I get on them rather than having to luck out and praying I load in before the plane.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: First off I don't write a lot of reviews but I will for this game.The game its self is a great idea and its fun.1. CHEATERS!!!!!! This game is literally plagued with cheaters. They ban 42 000 accounts every day on average and are above 1.5 million bans already let that sink in! That's crazy!A friend and I played for 7 hours and almost every game we ran across a some dude cheating shooting through walls head shotting us from a mile out super jumping wall hacking and more its pointless to play thing expiting to win a match since it plagued with thousands and thousands of cheaters.Almost all the tumbs down on steam are from the same thing CHEATERS!.2. Reagion lockThe servers need to be region locked! I didn't know I had to learn every language in the world to play on a North American server.... With almost all the cheaters being foreigners "out side the USA mainly china" region locking the servers would help a lot and make is eaiser for them.I think releasing this on Xbox right now was stupid because they have way more work to do on PC they didn't even fix the main platform it was released on yet...... Now they have two communites yelling at them instead of one.I feel this game will sink and the fad will end because the DEV's are morons3. The gameThe game is great its a good idea even though its a rip off of an ARMA mod but that's besides the point. The graphics are good. Poly count could be reduced better optimization would be a plus shouldn't take a GTX 1070 with an i7 7700k to get 60+ FPS on 1080p with decent settings.I had to put a GTX 1080TI in my i7 7700k test bench to run it at 1440p 144hz with G SYNC.4. RecommendationWould I recommend this game? In its current state no I wouldn't If they fixed the massive cheater outbreak then yes I would but with 42 000 people getting banned everyday I cannot recommend this tittle at all. It is fun when you're in a game without a cheater its intense but unfortunately that doesnt happen very offten.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Its an early access game so manage your expectations for this game. That aside I have played H1Z1 King of the Kill and this game is the exact same premise. Drop in find equipment survive. Where it differs is in the exectution. There is more of a variety of weapons and attachments. Hit boxes and spray patterns seem to be a little more under control. There are still weapons that you need to get otherwise your pretty much screwed just like H1Z1 KOTK. All in all though at least this game added a little variety to their maps like rain or sunset or mid day. This game is like a next level KOTK and I love it.

I get constant "network lag detected" bugs the moment I land my parachute until about 4 minutes into the game. Best case scenario I land somewhere in the circle with no one else around or else I'm dead before I unfreeze and even then I'm minutes behind schedule looting and I'll have a crowbar against people with decked out ARs. It's unbelievably frustrating.

Seeing someone is still only a maybe too as you'll just get your head blown off from 500 yards eventually anyway. Not for me.

review: Many compare this game to Fortnite however in my opinion they are 2 very different games. Yes Battle Royale concept is there however PUBG is much less forgiving than Fortnite. Positioning in this game is key in Fortnite you can just build your way out of trouble. The feeling of being top 20 is very intense in this game very good late game. However the mid game in PUBG is basically running/driving simulator. Half of your games you will chase the circle/ look for people but find none. The problem is that majority of the people in a game are COD fanboys who drop to hotspot areas such as Hacienda and in the first 5 minutes of the game half the players are dead. This makes the player density quiet low in the mid game and can get boring unless. To get some action you have to drop in the same hotdrops as everyone else so the problem repeats. PUBG should fix this.Sound is absolute garbage in this game. VERY loud vehicles guns and bombs. I have to set my volume to low in order to avoid hearing loss. It's that bad. However that makes footsteps almost impossible to hear. They should fix that.VERY buggy UNOPTIMISEd piece of crap. 1 year old bugs still arent fixed. PLENTY of Chinese hackers. Developers do nothing to ban them. Overall i think this game is very much worth the price however developers seem to be incompetent to fix their game. GREAT concept and fun but poor execution.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Now no matter how to update plug in assistance is still very rampant. The plug in assistant mode is to open the steam after running in the background. The general plug in assistant will be identified as a virus or malicious plug in by the computer housekeeper and 360. So I wonder if you can set up an automatic detection system to automatically detect the plug in assistant running in the background after each step is opened.

review: So.... for me this game is pretty good. I rarely play FPS games so this was a good way for me to ease into it.From my experiance I would say it is much more fun to play with friends that way it's not always about the CHICKEN DINNER but about the fun moments this game has to offer. I personally have not seen many "hackers" in the game but my friends always seem to find one in every game.For me the best part of this game is the new custom matches.A group of 10 friends playing cars only normal matches is hilarious and war mode vss is super fun with a .3 circle. Here are the negitives (in my opinion)It can be a running simulator at times Getting popped in the head as soon as you get an awesome load out (without even firing one bullet.)The in game loby chat is a full on autism fest.Everyone is better than me (AKA "HACKERS")Anyway long story short I recomend trying this game if you havnt yet but find some folks to play it with (shouldnt be hard)Feel free to join us if you want...https //discord.gg/RCawWyY

review: Horribly unoptimized game....I can play everything...GTA 5 online COD Battlefield Assassins Creed etc on HIGH and there are no lags...this game is laggy as and sometimes needs ages to load (IN GAME when I land with the parachute..the ing houses won't load ...it takes like 15 20 seconds ..it just looks like a big pile of blurry textures..) driving around with a car or bike makes the world load up and lag because of the fast pace...THIS HAS NOTHING TO DO WITH MY PC! my pc is fine..like I said..I can play everyother game just fine on ultra high..but this game (even on LOW lettings) lags like and don't even ask me about the hitboxes...it is even worse... one thing I don't understand all the people who complain about the cases...yes you can buy it..but YOU DON'T HAVE TO and it gives no advantage at all to anyone...it is only cosmetic...even the ing camo clothes..you can still see the player. it's not like they are ing invinsible..I hope they will optimize the game...but I have my doubts...I guess they will never make this game work properly...and this all for 30 ing bucks...h1z1 kotk is better...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: They say the M16 is one of the most accurate guns in the game combine it with an 8X scope and it's practically unusable. Zeroing in and out between 400 100 meters and the accuracy is so sporadic it's impossible to judge distance. I recently lined up a player who wasn't moving for 1+ minutes around 300 meters away and every single shot in my 30 round mag missed the target (left or right of where the scope was zeroed).There does seem to be a problem with aiming for the most part of this game it's nice the guns all act differently but the recoil of some of the weapons is out of this world.Armour is another thing that seems to be an issue with this game. In theory wearing a level 3 helmet means that you can take a headshot without dying. I don't think this is true at all. I've died multiple times with one headshot whilst wearing a level 3 helmet. Similar problems with body armour I can pummel someone that's wearing a level 1 set and take near a whole mag to kill them but someone can hit me 2/ 3 times with a standard rifle whilst wearing level 3 military armour and I'm dead immediately. Could be down to the constant lag this game suffers from as well who knows...Good idea for a game but at the moment it's still poorly executed. A lot needs to improve before it's fully released.

review: This is a very fun battle royale game. Simply put there is more emphasis on positioning and playing the circle more than actual aim. While this can be advatageous to players that take advantage of it the game itself can cause a player playing tactically to die. For example a player could be hiding in tall grass playing the circle but die because the grass has not rendered for another player further away making what you think is a conceiled position into you becoming a sitting duck for the picking. While some combat situations can be very entertaining the net code of the game is very subpar. Dying around corners becomes a recurring theme headshots or body shots for that manner not registering causing you to die. While this game is very enjoyable core gameplay is not up to par with other battle royale games which hurts the game severly.

review: This game resembles a man born healthy and then had a stroke mid way through life. PUBG was a great game when I started playing it shortly after it came out. It was an amazing game and i spent hundreds of hours playing. Mid way through the game's life is when the stroke happened. I don't know if they just decided they didn't care about the game anymore or what but they ruined the game in my opinion. It is extremely unfun to play the game I used to look forward to playing every day. Movements feel clunky frames are not good for the graphics the servers are laggy the gunplay is very unsatisifying and it all around was simply much better before they tried to change things hastefully. For many many months you could not even choose if you wanted to play on the original forest map or the new desert map. This game was extremely promising but it killed itself. They also showed how low the PUBG Corporation is when they sued Fortnite they simply were jelous that Fortnite was doing so much better then they were while being free and a completely different game. Overall I would strongly recomend NOT getting this game in it's current state. Maybe in the future they can restore this game to its formal glory but I believe the damage was done and it might be too late to save this game with such great potential.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game was improved after 3 YEARS but few features are still bad.PROS + The most unique and serious battle royale concept + Large amount of playerbase + Gunplay is pretty dynamic and tactical. Winning gunfights is very satisfying + Gameplay is fun generally. You want play one more round often + Finally after bigger update I even can play on ultra graphic settings. Previous I played low medium settings. Performance and tick rate was improved a lot too...CONS ...but still you can experience crashing laggy moments/fps drops during early game because textures are still loading and broken hit reg by lags sometimes people can die by shooting surface or wall. Anticheat is cheap and dissapointing. Encountering cheaters isn't rarely. I saw many no recoil scripts or wallhacks even few aimbots too Developer of the game is just greedy. Yes they made bigger update and fixed many problems but microtransactions are more important over fixing the game Absurdly microtransactions and cashgrabing things. Paying real money for keys for lootboxes event passes(early access to new map/content and more stupid missions to get XP and clothing) increasing levels and...even changing name?!NEUTRAL + Graphic is just ugly bugged and cheap. In comparison to other game released in 2018 it's so ugly(look Hunt Showdown for example) but it helps a lot for performance. Blackout have a lot better graphic but works terrible. I played lowest graphic settings and had fps drops often.Conclusions I can recommend this as the best and most fun battle royale in gaming market.I can't recommend this as game with good dev.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Far from perfect but this game can be a lot of fun despite the audio video network bugs and glitches. The new desert map though is more of a camping running driving(if you are lucky enough to find a vehicle) simulator. It's hard to say what PC Build 1.0 will be like since the Test Servers were very laggy and lots of crashes with the kill cam. Definitely a massive in progress game but adding all the bugs/glitches and hacks I am hesitant to recommend anyone spend their money on this if they were not involved in the early access.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game used to be great and fun when it's not much popular in china.Now this game is pretty popular among chinese and it's just plagued by obnoxious Chinese hackers. I'm not saying that all chinese players are hackers but majority of hackers are Undeniably chinese.Even my steam account got hacked by some random chinese hacker a few days ago.He somehow bypassed my steamguard and he played PUBG on my account while Hacks on(This is my guess. since the Steam support did not explain me much on this matter).And now my PUBG has VAC banned and i'm permanently branded as "hacker". Surprisingly both PUBG and Steam cannot help me out.They said "It's all your fault if your account got hacked". I mean okay i get that.But what am i supposed to do against a hacker that even bypasses my steamguard??I've been buying a lot of games from steam since I don't know 2006?My whole childhood was with steam.And now i'm branded as a filthy hacker and Steam and PUBG corporation Won't do anything about it even they knows i'm innocent.Sorry about the little rant guys.. But they really need to do something about these chinese hackers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Update Can't play this game anymore. Doesn't open correctly then crashes hell even the crash report crashes. Even if I get in the game which is very rare i have lags and the game is barely playable. My PC used to handle it up to almost 60 FPS but now they broke it completly. This game looks so fun but its actually a piece of I am getting fed up with this game and the hype around it...The concept alone makes for lots of frustration 1 player or 1 squad out of 100 players will be victorious. Everyone else will waste up to 30 minutes of looting and running around trying to be careful and getting some kills just to die at some point and start over. What do you get from that? Battlepoints that dont do If you are happy with virtual jeans or an ugly baseballcap that randomly comes out of expensive lootboxes then go for it. At least you can sell those stupid crates to some other poor idiot or scamwebsite. There is no progress whatsoever no usefull rewards no beautiful graphics no interesting mechanics or smooth gameplay. Its just another mediocre egoshooter with a survivalgames mode slapped onto it.The graphics are mediocre the performance is bad the charactermovement feels sloppy slow the vaulting only works standing right in front of a wall touching it with your jumping feels like gravity is low. I mean who jumps as slow as that? Does this game want to be realistic or fun to play? Inventory management can take far to much time due to impractical mechanics. Driving cars or motorcycles is a pain especially on Miramar but without them you will die to the zone. There is so much random stuff to this game the loot the zones sliding to death on a hill and doing one hit kill frontflips on a motorcycle.. its more about luck than anything else. The maps are pretty mediocre aswell the houses are empty mostly the same ugly and dont make any sense. The zone forces you to move and people just camp ignoring the fact that they are gonna die there just so they can kill you. Solo doesn't allow any tactical gameplay as everyone wants to be a Rambo. After the latest updates it started crashing after almost every match leading to further crashes trying to start it again. Even the crash report window crashes. IAll of that would be somewhat ok considering the development time but I just dont get why people hype this game so much. I doubt its because it is fun. Its more like a peer pressure I think. "Everyone plays it so it must be fun". It costs 30 which could be worse but on the other hand most of my games had cost less and provided much more content and fun.And no fortnite and all the other out of nowhere battleroyale games aren't better either.Battleroyale is an awful concept. 99% of losers trying to be "the very best like no one ever was".Even "Getting Over It with Bennet Foddy" was less frustrating.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAME! This game has very little to no optimization no player appreciation and Bluehole takes too long to fix bugs and/or release patches. The game servers are terrible and I feel bad for people who play this game only to get nothing but an imaginary chicken dinner and little to no battle points for winning. Don't get too comfortable with updates because the game changes every week... FOR THE WORST REASONS. PUBG will release patches and fixes for things that players aren't even problems with. Maybe if they would make some actual fixes instead of releasing useless patches that cause other problems that weren't there to begin with they wouldn't be losing players. From someone who has 360+ hours in the game don't waste your precious time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: A very challenging and intense game. PUBG is in itself a very big name now since it is a fun and tactical game which requires a lot of teamwork and positioning other than the basic requirements like good aim reflexes callouts etc. On the pros 1. Makes you a better FPS player in general ik all games that require aim do but PUBG isnt as fast paced like csgo ow or as slow as an FPS mmorpg also you get multiple chances at any enemy and in squad you dont instantly die.2. If you are just relaxing then its fun af just land somewhere non crowdy do stupid stuff and get caught off guard then die. I mean its better than getting run over by a 5 man squad in a rush in r6 when you are trying to chill out 3. The graphics in its early access state it had poor unoptimized buggy and laggy gameplay but post its launch PUBG Corp has reworked the textures many times and now they are highly demanding and also pretty.4. Big Community so you can usually find a match within a minute heck my squad doesn't even like the 10 seconds it takes to find a match sometimes since its apparently "too long".5. Great Hitboxes. If someone yells "I hit a headshot" its either that he didnt or the server gave up on him there.6. + a lot more but i think its better if you find it out yourself since the "surprise" element always makes the first impression of a game worth remembering.Cons 1. Laggy af server atleast in SEA server the pings are inconsistent though they removed the server selection option recently i remember even earlier I used to get like 60ms to straight up 150ms pings ingame . During the plane jump you can literally see the huge desync as the plane warps back and forth when a lot of people jump together 2. Terrible Hitreg the hitboxes are excellent but sometimes even made shots dont register and your enemy walks as if he didnt get hit that is due to the incapable servers.3. Alt+Tab while searching for a match and you never return to it. Basically if you alt+tab or change windows while its searching for a match you aren't automatically connected to a match if its found your entire squad will be inside (whoever didnt alt tab) but not you. And if you dont return to the game window by the time the preparation timer hits 0 you can not connect back. I think this is an intentional feature but even so they should notify if a match is found with blinking icon in taskbar.4. Crashes a lot usually while connecting to a match.5. And the funny anti cheat it asks you if you want to enable it lmao.6. The terrain is buggy at times specially rocks sometimes I have got stuck in crevices inbetween rocks and my player model just stuck without being able to move aim crouch or even jump.That's i think it for the negative part but the game in its whole is fun and so are the chicken dinners on victory. Have Fun with your squad )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ridiculously broken game don't even bother with your time. Go back to the drawing board Bluehole. There is not one thing that works well in this game besides the concept which is unoriginal. Just then playing a game few players alive. "Network Lag Detected" pops up on my screen and renders my control completly inoperable. Meanwhile an enemy player is running up behind me with a shotgun i can hear their footsteps and gameplay clearly and i am not lagging as my squad mate is spectating me and communicating with me in realtime. Boom! Shot to the back of the head while i am still stuck with "Network Lag Detected" screen at the most crucial time. Game is now over. What a joke! Had a poor experience throughout the whole game and we were not on a foreign server. Look at Epic Games i know its their game engine but Fortnite destroys this in performance.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Be prepared to die. Unlike other FPSs You are constantly at risk of being shot from both close quarters combat and long range combat from multiple angles requireing a unique sort of hyper vigilence. The ever present sense of dread has made PUBG a streaming success but can make grinding the game extremely frustrating expecially if you're used to respawning in deathmatch or objective style FPS games. That said when you do get a win it makes it all the more sweet. Play with friends for the best experience.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So i doubt anyone who can change this will see this or care to respond but the most upsetting thing about this game right now through my eyes which I hope you don't take offense to is that i'm in the North American region and the majority of the people that I can speak to through game chat are from one of several Asian countries. This causes a problem because most of the majority don't speak English (I understand that Spanish and French are also North American languages). Sometimes I even find that the game has switched me over to the Asian region which irritates me because i have chosen the North American region several times and it still switches back everytime I restart the game. If someone does see this I enjoy playing this and fully recommend that anyone who has both the money and the power buys this. I understand that it has only just come out of Early Access and perhaps in the future this might have some fix if even possible. Thank you for your time anyone and everone who has read this and again I don't mean for this to be taken as a demand for some patch but more as me hoping you might consider what I've said.

review: PUBG rapidly became my favorite shooter of all time. The ability to create your own match be it fast and intense or slow and methodical is second to none. The challenge to make it into the top 10 is a great proving ground but that sweet sweet chicken dinner is ever the true prize. I absolutely adore this game.I cannot recommend anyone to purchase it however in its current state. Cheating is omnipresent. The inclusion of a death cam while wonderful just proves how broken the playing field is. At the time of writing 6 of my last 8 deaths were due to obvious cheating.Additionally the sudden influx of pay to open loot chests is disheartening. I am sitting on around 10 unopened chests each costing 2.50 USD to open. These total almost the cost of the base game at time of purchase. This is greedy and shameful.To the developers I'd like to purchase keys at a reasonable price and I'd like to change this to a postive review after better anti cheating measures are put in place. Please help that to happen.

review: All the negative reviews are right but wrong based.YES at first it feels like a hide &amp seek until you learn that there is no point in hiding you need to actually move and search for people and the game mechanics help you to do it play zones are great for combat tactics in this game.YES it feels (or used to after 1.0 update the game is completely different from early access) like there is a lot to be added or beta or poorly optimized sometimes. DUH IT'S EARLY ACCESS MORONS C'MON and still it's the most played game of 2017 for a reason.About the price I'm perfectly fine with it people wants it to be cheap just because it's an independent company I preferr to pay 39.99 for the must fun game in years to an independent or new company than 79.99 for a AAA game from XXX big company that I will only play for a few hours shame on you people should support other people trying to create great things and PUBG is a great game.50% of people complaning is because they thought they could play this game like it's call of duty or BF wich clearly isn't it's a totally different experience from any other shooter I have ever played (I have not played them all if you try to be a smartass) and the other 50% bought it waiting for a finished game that clearly says EARLY ACCESS.Don't think about it hop into PUBG play at least 10 matches I think the initial learning curve is about that 10 15 matches searching for youtube tutorials is a must I have seen 2 or 3 10 minutes long thats it. Solo is great don't worry but if you throw in a few friends into the formula you will be hooked up forever.

review: I bought this game back in May 2017 and while I really want to say I love this game I just can't. There are too many problems with it. A ton of hackers still and holes in the desert map when 1.0 has been out for what two months now? That's ridiculous. And don't even get me started with lag. I don't know what it could possibly be but it's not like my computer is a complete potato with a GTX 970 an Intel i5 4690 at 3.5 Gigahertz and 8 gigs of ram and my interent isn't terrible at 100 mbps yet whenever I get remotely close to anyone in the game that isn't from America *Cough Cough please region lock China Cough Cough why are they even playing on North America servers Cough Cough* my game might as well crash because I will freeze consistantly for a solid 30 seconds and then once it unfreezes I find that I am dead. Don't even get me started about how long it takes for me to load into the matches either though that is mainly a problem with my Seagate HDD than enything else. But don't get me wrong though I do like the game. Before 1.0 I had almost none of the problems that I have mentioned above exception to loading into the match that was still a stupid amount of time and that was when I was still running on a 20 mbps internet. I enjoy the game and I have put many hours into it but I have founf it really unenjoyable lately because of the hackers no region lock and the unbelievable amount of lag. Please fix your game Mr. Green so the majority of us can enjoy it once again.

review: I love the experience this game delivers. The gritty survival aspect. The realistic and unique feel of the gunplay. The tense butt hole puckering firefights. It's a lovely game when it delivers. I live on the side of the fence with players who never have a smooth game experience. From rubberbanding to full out disconnection you would believe it if someone said they were using 56k to play.Now this boils the game down to usually one of two experiences overall. The game works you play it regularly and it provides as much joy as the amount of effort you put into it.Or you get 1/10 games where your death didn't feel like it was based on technical issues.Popular players generally sit on the luck side of gameplay . However if you watch a PUBG streamer for long even they fall prey to this poorly optimized game.It's truly a sad thing as well. This concept for a game is magnificent. Truly there has been nothing like it before. Had the developers stayed the course and not let the dollar signs misdirect them this would be a game hailed as the next genre of FPS gaming. Instead what you get is an upset and toxic community hit or miss copycats and ridiculous moments like the pan lawsuit.PUBG should've been a step forward for the next generation. A new Counter Strike centered around intense strategy and precision skill. Instead we got a jumbled mess that has split the gaming community into a faceted wasteland for the time being.That all being said at least it's not Fallout 76.

review: Still as sh*tty as ever. They haven't even fixed what's wrong with the game the crappy movement autistic aiming and little sweaty kids pixel peeking you from halfway across the map but you don't even have a clue where they are because the sound literally just rapes your ears instead of giving you an idea of where they're at. You try to pick things up and you're literally SPAMMING the interact button but nothing happens so you're forced to drag it into your inventory which is a pain in the at the start of the game if you landed beside a dumb little squeeker who manages to pick up the Micro Uzi before you. AND DON'T EVEN GET ME STARTED ON THE MELEE. I CAN'T STAND WHEN THOSE DUMB LITTLE CHASE YOU AROUND THE MAP AT THE START TRYING TO PUNCH YOU OUT AND YOU LITERALLY CAN'T DO ANYTHING BECAUSE YOU CAN'T PICK ANYTHING UP WITHOUT HAVING TO DRAG AND DROP. See how it's all connected? Instead of fixing the autistic controls and all that jazz they're adding in more cruddy maps and updating the menu that literally plays a new song every time I play the game. Not to mention the cases who thought it'd be a good idea to release lootboxes into a game where you can barely even tell whether you're fighting a man or a woman as you can rarely see who's shooting at you? And if you do manage to spot them you probably won't even be able to make out more than a few details because your settings are turned down to very low otherwise you'll suffer immense frame rate drops and lag because you need a beast PC to run this poorly optimized game. I see a lot of people complaining about hackers but really I've never run into one. The game is legit just GARBAGE and if I'm honest I don't think it'll ever be good. For all you kids who are about to go into the comments and say about how it's supposed to be realistic this game is far from it. Hell I think I'd rather 1v1 someone in real life than in this game I'd probably have a better chance of being able to spot them shoot at them and run away if need be without accidentally jumping past my cover or some crap. This game is just AWFUL and it's not a surprise that way less people are playing it now. It's just so goddamn boring and autistic. Sad part is they could have fixed it all SOOOOO easily when it first came out. But they just kept rushing to fix the minor bugs and focused too much on advertising the game so they could make more money rather than actually making it fun and easy to play without camping on the edge of zone with a Kar98k and an 8x scope. I'd rather play Minecraft hunger games than this waste of money. I'd rather play FORTNITE than this game and I hate that game too. But hey at least it's actually somewhat FUN unlike camping simulator over here.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have 300+ hours and have been playing since the first private alpha. This game used to be good.The problem is they haven't bothered to fix the fundamental issues and I can't really recommend this over the competition anymore. At this point I play it sometimes because I already own it that's it. Instead of fixing issues they spend time releasing new maps making pointless events and trying to run tournaments on a game that just isn't an e sport. They got blinded by greed and lost sight of what this game was supposed to be.Look the game itself is alright. The problem is that the competition caught up and the competition is free. PUBG would rather litigate the competition than actually make a better game. That's a problem.If you own this game you don't need to read this review. And who are we kidding if you play video games you probably already own this game. If you happen to be the one person who doesn't you should know that it's not all it's cracked up to be. Skip it and just wait for RoE.

review: Great game nicely executed and continually being improved.But their community management is horrible and they seem to lack the necessary experience to manage a community in the millions. The current community manager suggested you should stop playing if you don't want to be griefed and you can be banned for defending yourself against team killers or griefers.Would not recommend if their "company" continues in this direction... total lack of experience and seem to not care at all about their playerbase (or seem completely oblivious as to handle community relations).Adding this addendum Some people think a game company having bad relations with their userbase automatically mean that the friend is poor or otherwise lacking. Like I said the game is top notch wonderful concept... but if this lack of professionalism continues to run rampant none of that matters.ADDENDUM A lot of people seem to mistake my issue with this game. It is not a problem with teamkillers grieving players or a toxic playerbase. This problem rests solely upon Bluehole and the way they have decided to handle their playerbase.This review will be changed to Recommended once Bluehole puts more lax rules and stop enforcing nonsensical out of context rules on players. Also locking someone out of your game for 3 days is not cool especially not if it was because of a mistake.

review: bluehole just stop mucking around please FIX PUBG was so promising and it fell apart.REVIEW UPDATE (changed to negative) While the performace of the game has increased considerably since early access and desnyc problems are encountered much less often Bluehole (or rather PUBG Corp.) have really started taking a dump on the game's community. I find selling a 10 event pass for a game I already paid 30 for completely unacceptable. I would understand this situation if the game were cheaper (like CS GO) or if the proceeds from the event pass went on to fund PUBG e sports (even though I believe the game not to be a very good e sport) I'd support the idea. But so far it seems a complete copy of features from competing games and a you to the players because the rewards from the events are negligible.Furthermore they still haven't fulfilled some of their promises they made at the start of 2018 namely we still have not received limb penetration and there is still no firing range. Considering the fact that the mobile version already has received a firing range makes me wonder if the PUBG dev team consists of 95% artists. The need for firing range is immense beacuse gunfights are sparse and PUBG firing mechanics are difficult to master. At this point if you really want to learn to shoot your only option is to land in a highly populated area or just play a lot.Sanhok is pretty good though.btw I also got permabanned twice for nothing (they said it was cheating though) but I got unbanned but they really only acknowledged and gave reimbursements out for the very last case of false positives which kinda made me salty /shruganyway bluehole pls start listening to the community tnxORIGINAL REVIEW The game is suffering some optimization issues as is the case with most early access survival games. Right now I am hovering around 60fps with i7 6700k &amp GTX 1060 1440p and Very Low everything except Ultra textures and Low view distance.The recently introduced first person only mode is extremely fun and much more challenging as the third person mode because you can not look behind cover without exposing yourself which in my opinion makes the game much more fair.Playing solo is not really my cup of tea but if playing with friends the game can be a blast team vs. team firefights are much more engaging stupid can happen for a cheap laugh and the teamwork is highly rewarding.I really hope the game gets optimized better further down the line I understand that it is not an easy task however it's an important one. While I haven't experienced them myself yet there are several game breaking bugs in the game too like buildings not loading in.As for the microtransactions yes the developer broke their promise but they really don't bother me because it's purely cosmetic so idgaf._also don't use vehicles' horn or you might get banned for stream sniping lol_

review: Net lag is terrible instead of booting people with high ping they are just frozen for a quick second. Manipulation of that and the choppy left to right strafing movement is garbage. 99.9% of the time you are literally shooting a hail mary shot EVEN WITH DEAD ON SIGHTS. I *** highly believe specific high level streamers have some sort of built in ESP/aim assitance.*** I have played this long enough to get a "feel" for it and that is just not there. I have over 8k hours ( almost 300 hrs in this atm of re review) in other similar FPS's and this is by far the SLOPPIEST aiming in all of history. You literally have to throw shots ( not leading at all there is a difference) out in front of them like tossing water balloons at a moving target to hopefully "splash" them. You *** WILL *** encounter snap to headshots believe me you will. They aren't going to stop the hackers/macro kiddies at all... If you do get the game GLHF and get ready to be rage induced. I changed my review from definately pick it up to definately wait for it's release and on sale. It's the HOT thing on TWITCH atm and that is about all.... And no it's not "Git gud noob" It's don't support lazy devs making an awesome metal idea out of playdoh.... oh yeah and still hackers to boot that snipe you with a AKM from NO where.

review: The game is fun. But here is the catch...The servers are complete garbage I can only assume they left them as is and try to "optimize" to the servers. However it seems to be darts and a dartboard for these devs. I do not care if the game is "alpha" "beta" whatever. Those tags mean very little in todays gaming market. Every game seems to be early access or in one of those phases. Ultimately this studio uses thes tags as a license to be second rate devs and it shows.The game needs serious help with latency and server issues. Simply put its bad. The user base knows it and they know it. They simply dont care at this time because the plebs just play to play. The only credit I give them is not making a bunch of skins while having all these issues. Other than that they need to get their sh!t together and fix the most basic part of any competitive game.At this time just save your money and wait for either a sale or for them to fix basic issues that they know make the game complete garbage to any competitive gamer.

review: My grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him "If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately.". Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me "Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. Now I'm 24 and never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a slight sense of regret for never having done it because the cheaters in this game gave me cancer anyway.

review: Hello soldier This game is made by the same guy who did the Battle Royale mod for Arma 2 and 3 (to my knowledge). In its current state (early access) it is a WONDERFUL middle ground between Arma 3 BR realism and H1Z1 arcade. The game isn't too arcade y but isn't slow either. Truthfully I've never played H1Z1 but have many friends that I've watched play it. After two hours I could see myself enjoying this more than Arma 3 BR and Ark Survival of the fittest.I find this game to be very accessible and easy to understand right away from the gameplay mechanics to the ui and etc. It reminds me of editing in Sony Vegas compared to Premiere Pro Vegas can do all the same stuff (almost) but is WAY more accessible and easy to understand to someone starting out. An example would be the tiers of weapons and gear is including the title of the weapons. "Oh this backpack is lv.3 I should clearly upgrade from my lv.1".I see people complaining about bugs and optimization (for an early access game btw). I Personally in 7 hours have only had ONE issue fps drops 1 in 7 games to 15fps for 3 seconds when I first deploy out of the plane. Then back up to 60+ right away. I'm NOT saying bugs and optimization issues don't exist I just havent really encountered any. BUT you have to realize....this game runs on the ARMA 3 engine. Have you ever played Arma2 or 3? THAT CRAP AIN'T OPTIMIZED (as much as I love those games). I get WAY better fps in this game compared to BR in Arma 3.This Dev has never given me any reason not to trust them and I'm pretty picky about my purchases of early access games and pre orders (insert unending list of bad devs with pre order rewards and unfinished EA titles).Short Version This game is great solo or with friends. Bugs and optimization issues exist just not for everyone like myself. I don't think its right to down vote a game in early access when they're releasing patches regularly and tbh it deserves a recommendation even in its current state. Its much faster paced than Arma 3 BR but not nearly as realistic. Its slower than H1Z1 but way more realistic. Its a beautiful middleground between the two. They valued FUN over realism. They promote INTELLECT and STRATEGY in this game.Driving mechanics are on point too.

If you are looking between h1z1 and this game 100% get this game.

review: Until they do something about sites like this LINK REMOVED https //www.iwantcheats.net/playerunknowns battlegrounds hacks steam/ and other t ill be uninstalling it. im sick of getting to a good point in the game got a nice scar and kar98k. i turn the corner and im dead before i can react. or im 1 shot from across the map with an m416 with 0 error. first shot always a headshot. i get it youre still in developement technically. but you have bluehole with ya?!? and you cant afford an anti cheat system that works? those ers are genuinely scamming the hell outta tera and giving players 0 in return you're telling me you couldnt have either gotten a better dev team to help you for one of the biggest games of the year or atleast get them to shell out a bit more for the anti cheat? AND to top it all off the game has horrid optimization issues. I'm on a god damn GTX 1070 SLI and i still get fps drops frequently... you CANT get much better than 1070 sli with i7 7700k. my brother whose on a decent for todays tech pc and buildings dont load for atleast a minute for him. So as stated.. the game has amazing amazing potential but potential doesnt mean if the game is in an unplayable state. its far better than fortnight and other games of its kind. but i still would not recommend it to any player who wants a good legit game.. its to easy to hack the loot system is horrid and its optimization is terrible.

review: Just shy of 1000 Hours played on this game and I've decided I am done its apparent that the developers do not care about the pressing issues in this game the hot issue for a majority of the player base is the hacking issues the hours apon hours of proof provided for how blatant the hacker problem is and yet the original hacks that people have been using since day one still 100% function on this game unobstructed.Out of 970 Hours I've played I have encountered blatant hackers every second game on my local Oceanic servers.There are community members out there who have reverse engineered the hacks to find out how they work with PUBG and yet the Devs have not?And yet the community manager is asking people to revoke content creators videos that showcase the hacker problem cause it publicly displays how apparent the issue is instead of fixing the problem they are too focused on trying to hide the issue and sweeping it under the rug.The game was rushed to production with 1.0 being a incomplete game riddled issues the idea and foundation of the game is strong but it covered in horse the team who developed this game are not devs they are hackers themselves the game is built off foundations of other games they hack code from other sources to peice together there which explains how they have no idea how to fix this problem. I've uninstalled this game was worth my money cause of the hours I've put into the game but if you are willing to put hours apon hours apon hours into a game to get 1 golden game where you can enjoy the content with a friend then its worth it for you otherwise turn yourself around and go get something you can get better value for money like a ball in a cup.

review: i never thought i'd see a game that i could say "this lags more than arma 3" forlike a third of the time the server is lagging so bad that everyone is warping around and it's completely unplayablegun fights don't matter even when the connection is "good" relative to the unplayable warping. the clients are so desynced people get killed 6 paces behind corners regularly it's also 100% client side hitregthe gunplay doesn't matter because there's random spread and drop on top of the lagthe map is so large that you can get to 3rd place without seeing more than 1 player sprinting around fields to every centeri've tried to play like 15 games but nothing you do really matters in it it's totally random. the gun spawns are random the gun fights are random (which matters during the cluster starts) being able to walk without warping is random being able to close doors by pressing F less than 3 times is random gun spread is random the voip actually working is random. in a month when every noob figures out how to play the game it will be totally unfun unless about 10 game breaking things are fixed but 'early access' games have a strange reputation for not changing much after their cash release. the last 5 gunfights or so i've had have been so desynched it looks like the enemies aren't even reacting to me sprinting up on them but they obviously are because they're faceplanted into a wall third person laming but for some reason they don't actually shoot and just let me kill themfor now it's actually not playable there isn't a single thing you can do that doesn't lag and even if it didn't lag the gameplay would still have some pretty massive issues. i can recommend it if you don't mind the fact that it's just a pointless retard shoot around mode that can give you a headache with warping and highly variable fps
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

It will be slightly thick and lumpy but should be well incorporated.Allow the batter to rest while heating a lightly oiled skillet or griddle to medium high heat.Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle using approximately ¼ cup for each pancake.Cook each side for 3 6 minutes until lightly golden brown.

review: Heartbeats per second is inversely proportional to number of players.The BEST Serious Battle Royale Experience.GameplayThe gameplay is fun engaging but sometimes boring if you drop onto less common spots. My style? I mostly land in a high risk high reward spot like School and Prison. Either I die or I get a ton of high tier loot. I go for drops as well. Game's never boring for me. Optimization &amp GraphicsTo be honest it's not as bad as people say. My main rig with an i3 6100 RX 480 8GB 16GB 2133MHz DDR4 RAM plays the game smoothly (70+FPS) on 1080p Full HD Ultra Textures Ultra AA 120% Resolution Scale Rest at lowest.If you think that's high end by any standards my brother's PC Build with an i5 2500K (No OC) 8GB 1333MHz RAM GTX 1050 Ti 4GB runs the game at a solid 50 60 FPS on the same settings but with 105% Resolution Scale and on Full HD Downscaled to 900p (The monitor is 900p). Onto the Graphics. They're not very good considering the game's performance. But on Medium Post Processing Shadows and other settings turned a bit up the game does look decent. But those settings give me a CPU Bottleneck hence I put them on lowest.After adjusting settings in Radeon Settings (+20 Contrast 15 Brightness +50 Saturation) the game looks way better than vanilla. ReShade doesn't work properly for me and this is a great alternative. I have done the same on my brother's PC through NVIDIA Control Panel.Anti Cheating System and Reporting SystemI have over 300hrs on this game and have encountered very low cheaters. If you do get a cheater/hacker in your game he will be banned. Just record the game and post the video on forums if you'd like to speed up that process. Oh and it uses BattleEye which does Hardware ID Ban this means if they buy PUBG again on a new account they'll instantly get banned again even if they do not have their cheats on.The development team is active in banning players and they will respond to you on the forums if you get team killed intentionally. Make sure you have adequate proof I record all my games using Radeon ReLive.ConclusionIn conclusion For an early access game PUBG is very decent. I have high hopes for this game and believe it won't end up like DayZ or those other games which never got out of Early Access. Comparision to Fortnite? Fortnite's way more casual &amp random than PUBG. Just play whatever you prefer.

review: One of my favourite games of recent. For those of you who have only tried a couple games I highly recommend playing Duo or Squad with people you actually know. Solo can be fun once you get more skilled at the game but early on it's going to feel impossible to win. As I have found I played my first couple games on Solo when I first got the game and I'd do really well until the player count is sub 30 which is when I start getting steamrolled. It's a safe assumption that the less people alive there are the better the players that you encounter will be. Once I started playing with some friends not only did the game feel easier but it became more fun as well. In my eyes there are four stages of the game. The first stage is when you have just barely landed seen a few people but not much else. At this point you wouldn't care if you died because you don't have much.The second stage is after you've landed you've got a bit of gear a shotgun or so but even if you died you still wouldn't care that much (70 80 left)The third stage is when you're pretty kitted out. High level backpack vest helmet etc. and a few good guns. At this point you wouldn't be angry if you died but kind of disappointed. (30 40 left)The final stage is after you've gotten a care package or two you've got the max weapons and gear and you'd be pretty if you died at this point (1 10 left) Unless of course you're like me and you get no matter when you die.In the almost 3(1/2) playtime I've played this for I've never gotten myself a chicken dinner but I've come in fourth twice and tenth once. (Unless you count duo in which I came second thrice). I know I didn't really "review" the game but after all of that I'd like to say I absolutely love this game and highly recommend it to everyone who enjoys Battle Royale games like H1Z1 KOTH.Just think of this game as Hunger Games... with guns... and 100 people.

review: I loved this game. My near 400 hours should prove that. After this recent update though. The game doesn't work for me anymore. First it was everyone but now that it seems to be working for all my friends and I still network lag to crash means they haven't fixed as far as I'm concerned. I used to argue that the game didn't need to be early access. Convinced 2 friends who don't do early access games to get this game but with every new update this game gets it runs a little more worse for me and this most recent update has killed it for me. Nothing I've tried works. I don't get error messages but the game just sits there frozen like nothing is wrong as you hear the wind blow in game. I can only shut the game down now by getting into task manager so it I'm done.

review: A lot is being said these days about this game. People reacting negative to banning. Rules are rules and if reported you shall not be banned. But if reported repeatedly... then that's another issue.Gameplaywise this is a fun game.. very fun and exciting game. Best enjoyed and less rewarding (with BP) when played with friends. Either you like to run to hide or to go outfrond in a shooting outbreak this game has to offer all flavours without defining one as the absolute approach. It also redefines early access. Everything is working /responding fine appart maybe from the graphics tuning that has still some work to be done.I certainly recomend this game since it combines good features from different titles. It is a tactical sim some times without being too tiring and it is an arcade shooter some other. Try it feel it and I assure you that after some games you will have some nice action scenes to describe to your friends back home. If you ever return from the island....Cheers all keep gaming !

review: Product received for free. I have now played this game for a good amount of time and I have now come to a sadning conclusion... The game gets it right in so many ways it feels realistic challenging and every time you jump out of the airplane you know that this game is not gonna be anything like the previous 200+. These are the main reasons why I have been palying the game but sadly I find myself spending less and less time in it.This is mainly due to the game being horribly optimized and completly buggy it can truely make you lose the feeling for the game.. Just small things like doors that doesn't open when you really need it or a gun that you can't pick up in the middle of a hot gun fight. I could go on about buggs servers being laggy ect. But another more critical concern is that the performance in the game has been dropping significant in recent pathces I own a GTX 1060 6 gb the so called perfect card for PUBG and when i startet playing there were no trouble staying around the 100+ fps and now I dip below 60 in gunfights. It makes it very fustrating to love this game and I don't see myself keep loving it if the developers does'nt fix the main issues of this game I am not a programmer and I don't know how to fix it but I will surely not recommend anyone to buy this game until it is fixed. Peace out!

review: I can't give this game a recommendation anymore. Theres a few things wrong with it and everything wrong is mainly on the developers side. 1. CheatersTheres tons of cheaters in this game they'll beeline right at you and insta kill you with the weakest of guns or even just teleport right besides you. PUBG team is doing nothing about the cheating situation. They've banned less than .1% of the games population off of cheating when its clearly well above that. (A ban wave that recently came through banned over 40% of the games population off over 800 000 players in the spam of 10/20 27/17. Players just repurchased the game and are now rage hacking and arn't getting banned once again.) They are allowing blatant livestreamers the ability to cheat and its dead obvious that the developers are supporting this behavior. 2. Catering to LiveStreamers by caving to every whim. review: I'd really like to love this game but the dev's don't allow it. The game feels worse than it was in early access. Don't get me wrong... they did a "good" job with the optimization and performance issues even tho' there are still a lot out there like random places with huge laggs whenever you walk across them. I'm talking about hit reg and server performance. Don't you hate those kind of situations when you are getting shot at you quickly hide behind a wall and get killed there eventho' the guy that was shooting at you shouldn't be able to hit you there? It's called desynchronisation. For that guy the game shows you are still running to that wall to hide when he finnished you off. It usually happens in every other game once or twice but in PUBG It's so common you'll be surprised if it's not the reason of your death. The hit reg is just dumb. Don't trust any blood that you see when you hit your enemy It could be a big lie. Also an example If you headshot someone with a kar98 who's wearing a level 2 helmet ( which should be a kill according to PUBG gamewiki Level 2 112.50 damage ) just doesn't work sometimes.Game updates feel like a pacifier to our mouth just to not cry yet some still do which is absolutely okay and understandable. If I'd like you to not buy this game I would write a huge paragraph here about the bugs that this game has.TL DR Gameplay feels really bad. Server issues lack of hit reg are a common thing. Optimization is still a problem yet it's better than it was a few months ago. Updates are mostly really minor eventho' there are a lot to fix. More and more people abandon this game because of the problems thus it's dying. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . Come on Devs. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

review: I have been playing this game off and one since it came out in early access and it is much different at the time of posting this review than it was then.From bad to good? No not exactly. To put it more accurately the game has gone from being a turd to polished turd.Let me lay it out for you if you don t know about the game already.One game you will drop out of the plane into the military base only for the blue death circle to follow you at every closing never touching you while you sit on top of a hill and snipe the unfortunate players that have to cross an open field to survive. The next game you will drop in a large school before everyone else luckily but alas there are no guns on the area of the roof you landed at you are forced to look inside the school. After two rooms and no weapons you get shot by someone who just recently found a shotgun and had the time to load a single shell.Hey if you're one to follow trends this game is for you. But this software is not exactly a game it's more of a gambling simulation. Sure you can become very good a putting the coin in pulling the lever and collecting your prize but that's all you're really improving at in the end the mechanisms that involve gambling (in this case not for money instead your time). Not to mention that the game recently came out of early access and still crashes rather often there is no way to opt into a region lock and the netcode goes from 2hz to 20hz within a frame during the early stages of play . Not to say that these problems will be inevitably fixed just a little side note.

review: While an interesting concept the execution is pretty terrible in early access. Server lag makes engagements more of 'who lives closest to the server' than a 'who is playing better'. As a result the game is incredibly frustrating to play as you teleport about the map at the most inconvenient moments.Optimisation is non existant so far particulary for AMD machines. The game runs very poorly unless you have a high end machine and even then you will find plenty of people complaining about their particular build not running the game at an acceptable framerate.Every patch seems to bring with a host of new bugs althought the developers are supposed to be utilising a test server for future patches so this may get resolved sooner rather than later.If you are undecided about purchasing this game I would stay away until the server lag issues have been resolved at least.

review: This is the best goddamned competitive online FPS / 3rd Person shooter to come along in a long time. It's a hardcore game with hardcore gamers not for the faint of heart. Really noobs spare yourselves. No gore...or splatter? Just spray a sweet satisfying red mist that was your face. I start every round by reminding myself that I'm already dead so go for it. I have (2) Chicken Dinners and like (33) Top Tens. They all tasted glorious.Likes The Unreal Engine Good texture packs the audio is okay. (Being corrected I hear ) fair game play community interactive response from the developers. Dislikes They had this 3rd person view problem. But recently updates have resolved the issue. The new option to go into a 1st person view only server. This creates an experience as real to Battle Royal as one can currently be. I guess some genuine dislikes are that the optimizations setting had to be manually entered. I was running around asking for launch codes. Like that chineese spy in blond wig spy on American dad. You know what I m talking about. I have to run everything in administrator mode to get it to launch. The textures often will not pop until well after I m on the ground I m getting stuck on a fence I can t see or box outside of a melting house right as my parachute hits the ground. a long time and this new patch looks like it needs a little tweaking. I won't stop talking about it my wife and friends are sick of hearing about it. I have heard that it is decimating Wow guild activity and it's not even out of beta. I can't wait to see where this ends up.Sincerely Thank you OMNI

Issues that don't affect FortniteThe skins on the event pass are laughably terrible compared to the fortnite cosmetics. Fortnite had a 100 tier battle pass with unique cosmetics that fit the theme of the game PUBG responds with an equally priced cartoonish event pass with terrible and ugly cosmetics that arent even on theme with pubg as a hardcore tactical military game. Banning your most popular streamer for screwing around with hackers who clearly weren't stopped by your anti cheat auto ban mechanics you bragged about developing a while back. You claim your game went 1.0 at Christmas and 7 months later it still is broken and feels much further behind in development than fortnite. RIP Pubg we all can't wait for the next big military style battle royale to blowup and delete you from our hardrives

review: TL DR I bought this because my friends and I jumped early on the battle royale bandwagon. I regret not refunding this piece of garbage when I could. Do yourself a favour and avoid this one. Maybe *MAYBE* if it's free or at a 90% discount.&gt be me&gt spend 20 something minutes getting geared up. Kar98K and UMP. Level 2 gear all around. Not bad.&gt zone starts closing in&gt I'm not going to make it in time and there is no car anywhere near where I am&gt sprint like a madman waiting for the good ol' _puff_ in the distance and I'm dead&gt nobody shoots me. huh.&gt in the search for snipers miss the cartoonishly obvious cliff drop&gt I mean sign says "careful steep cliff" and everything. The whole nine yards.&gt coyote moment "this is going to hurt"&gt 75% HP zone is hot on my tail&gt realize the missing health might cost me making it to the zone&gt "Sound_of_silence.mp3"&gt somehow make it to the safe zone with a health pack&gt I am now situated roughly 10 meters behind a dude who has *NO* idea that I'm there&gt let the BM begin&gt I take super careful aim at his head with my Kar this dude has no chance of surviving this.&gt pull the trigger&gt game chugs and shudders&gt I... MISSED????&gt dude snaps 180 around and dumps a mag into me like it ain't no thing&gt esl ready my dudes&gt I'm so gonna review this on steam right now&gt Sadness anger and emptyness

review: So far my experience with this game is that its early access launch is far better than the fest that was H1Z1 at early access release. That being said I see a lot of people saying optimization is an issue. I had no problems staying above 120fps at Ultra settings. Hopefully anyone experiencing these issues will stick around for updates to fix their issue. This game is fun. A little clunky but as I said much better than most early access games at launch. Im excited to see where this game goes in the future and the devs seem very active in the community. If you have a high end rig this game should run great. No regrets with this purchase. Buy it!

review: Now I understand a lot of people are not happy with the optimization in its current form. In my opionon this game needs work on the optimization but that is just part of the process of a early access game. I have had so much fun so far that I needed to write this. I have NOT won a single game nor even come close xD But thats what makes it so fun! The fact that every time you play it is almost always different in every way. I enjoy this game because it brings the best of KOTK and Arma KOTH and mashes them up and brings us one of the best BR style games I have played. I just believe that having the right updates as fast as possible i.e the optimizations will need to happen soon ish as it does become tiresome playing on low medium graphics when I know that I should be able to run on High ultra settings. (Edit) So it seems a boat load of players are getting banned for "stream sniping" now while 60% of the time that might be true I have noticed people saying that they have killed a streamer without realising only to find out they have been banned because of the streamers notoriety and they "feel" someone was stream sniping. Until this issue is solved somehow I do feel people are going to steer away from PUBG and there does need to be a decent system in place for this.I however have encountered a streamer and appear to be quite lucky with not getting banned for stream sniping/at least accused of it. This game needs optimization and it needs it ASAP this game in its current state with DSYNC and general FPS state (I have a high tier PC) it won't last or be able to compete with other games that come out.Please sort some things out. I do love the game but struggle to see it last.TL DR Fix optimisation and the stream sniping BS.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pros 1. Combat It's intense Arma/Dayz ish in its tone...which I happen to like as someone who has a good amount of time in Dayz Standalone. Although it's snappier than those games mentioned above which is a huge plus. Weapon variants range from melee to handguns shotguns assault rifles to sniper rifles...with grenades as an extra. Armor can be found as well and looting up takes anywhere from 5 10 minutes depending on first dropping in luck with the area you and or your team chooses to start in. Oh and vehicles which can be used as another weapon in itself or a quick way to get somewhere is a fun thing to experience. Playing as solo or duos with another or squad with up to 5...plenty of options there. The heart adrenaline rush of Arma and Dayz style combat is there to be found in this game here.2. Developer The guy behind this game has experience in this game style as his past with Arma and H1Z1 has been talked about in forums and reddit threads I have come across. Also I can tell this game is going to outpace the competition. Already feels like a more complete game in early alpha than compared to those that have been out for years. They are already talking about optimization passes early on tells me they have their priorities in line before adding more stuff that should be added later. Neutral 1. Optimization The developer has already stated that optimization passes would start soon 5 weeks or so. The game doesn't run bad for me on (HIGH) preset 1440p with (shadows on medium) (AA on medium) (textures on medium) 4gb of vram here as I have an R9 Fury feel free to bump that up if you have more than 4gb of vram. That being said the game currently uses more vram than is needed and the developer is aware of this meaning those with 4gb or less will get better performance going forward. I get a snappy and smooth 40 50 fps average with my setup on the setting I listed above. I have an R7 1700 3.7ghz with a R9 Fury for example. That being said the game looks fine if you ran it all on medium. For those chasing higher fps averages this is a viable option. People that have weaker rigs will cry upgrade I guess if you play a lot of early access games...Cons 1. I knew what to expect going in it's early access. Price could be $5 bucks cheaper however. I am having fun an absolute blast to be honest...so the money I spent eh whatever. It's going to be subjective to people when it comes to spending on early access titles. To each their own...Score 8/10 for me this early on!FROM THE DEVELOPER Players Today is a very special day for me! For the last four years ever since I launched my first Battle Royale game mode using the DayZ mod on Arma 2 I have worked hard to try deliver an intense dynamic and fun experience. Through its various iterations in the ARMA series H1Z1 and now in my own standalone game you all have shown me tremendous support and for that I want to say a sincere thank you. I now want to run through a timeline for optimization of our game. A lot of you have been asking about how and when we will optimize the game so hopefully this post will give you a better idea of our plans over the coming months.One important thing to note. Client optimization takes time and will not be solved in one single patch. We will be working hard over the next 6 months to ensure all players enjoy smooth gameplay with no lag or FPS drops.Initial Performance Improvements Key Objectives To reduce the overload on the CPU and make sure that the GPU performs to its full capabilityExpected Results Frame rates will be stable even when in high density areas Get higher frame rates across all graphic optionsETA Apr. 14th (Expected to take roughly 5 weeks)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Wow one of the best early access games I've tried so far. This is very good refreshing compared to H1Z1. Although there are some framerate issues here and there at some spots of the map I'm sure future patch will enhance the game so much more. I feel like there is a lack of ambiant audio though you can stand outside in the middle of the woods and it'll be total silence. It takes away from the immersion and makes it too easy to detect sneaking enemies. The sounds that are there though are really well done you can really feel the gunshot reverbs every bullet you fire. Hopefully with time additional audio post processing fx will make this game more immersive. Gameplay wise it is very well thought out. I don't really like the original control scheme though luckily there is key rebind options. The hit reg seems really well done even at extreme ranges. Only game breaking aspect I would say are the melee weapons there is a good variety of them but with the game's netcode at the moment it is impossible to hit a moving enemy.All in all a great investment. Hopefully the devs are active with the community and they keep on updating the game regularily.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Not that there needs to be a complete tutorial/training module but it would be nice have some aspects of the game explained. Like I said right now it's early access. I guess I can wait around for an update or two then come back and update my review. Right now I'm struggling to keep the game or return it and get my money back.
