review: Imagine this.. You've looted dozens of houses you've killed a couple other players trekked across half the map and made it to the top twenty top ten whatever. You've got the best weapons plenty of ammo and lots of health. You're in good cover. You've spent the last half hour preparing for this moment. All of a sudden you hear a bang and.. you're dead. That is this game in a nutshell.I've been playing FPS games for many years. Consistently in or around top 10 when playing PUBG. Not boasting just saying I m not new to the genre.The game just gets old very fast. There is very little back and forth crossfire. For the most part it's running around looting catching someone off guard and shooting them then someone does the same to you. It's not like other game types infiltration capture the flag etc. You don't have that fun of trading shots back and forth with the other team.The occasional win is nice. But after the 100th time being shot in the back and instantly killed from some player you never saw its boring. We want action. We want to fight against our enemy. We don t want to walk into a room and instantly be killed by someone hiding in the corner with a shotgun.Trying to be realistic the game loses its fun . It may be more realistic to die in a one or two shots but it's not as fun.Also the recoil on the guns is absurd. As having shot and own many of the guns in the game the recoil is not that ridiculous in real life. Especially in crouched or prone. It seems as though the game exaggerates the recoil to incentivize collecting accessories for the gun which lower the recoil. In real life adding some random attachment to your gun does not make that much of a difference.Every once in awhile you get a good match. Plenty of crossfire. Trading shots back and forth. Maybe pull off a win. But most of the time it's being shot in the back or killed by some random person you never saw. It just isn t as fun as so many other FPS out there.The game itself runs fine. Graphics are good the sound is good everything is pretty good. Of course there are some bugs but that is to be expected in early access. The game is fine its just not fun.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I will focus mainly on the negative side of things. It is important to know everything that is wrong with the game and where it looks like it's headed before you spend $30 on what is certainly not living up to the hype.The PUBG phenomenon has declined into utter chaos. It's an excellent example of why you should avoid picking up Early Access games even when they are hyped to sanctitude by streamers and probably even your friends. I could elaborate on how great PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds once was but ultimately the objective of a good Steam review is to inform you of the game in its current state. Since release the developers have added cosmetic microtransactions. For some people this may be an issue but one must note that realistically there is no advantage especially when some of these items will make you stand out like a sore thumb. The PUBG map is best described as a combination of forests prairies and towns which range from suburban to very small rural outposts. Make no mistake ghillie suits are a rare in match drop that are only obtainable through capturing an airdrop. The gameplay is clunky and unsatisfactory to say the least. Oftentimes in CQC it comes down to who has the itchiest trigger finger and remembered to set their gun to burst/automatic. The combat is reminiscient of DayZ standalone/Arma2. Parachute control is horrendous.tl dr Right now the game is going through a very rocky stage. I hate to suggest it but I'm growing more and more concerned because PUBG is shaping up to be an extravagent cash grab. I have my reservations about the game and I will not be surprised if PUBG crashes and burns with Bluehole never to be heard from again. I'd recommend staving off the urge to pick this up for now.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I feel like this game get's more hate then it deserves. I've seen countless negative reviews regarding the paid cosmetics and how the developer said they wouldn't add them and they did. No I don't think they shoul have broken their promise. But if you don't want to pay for cosmetics DON'T BUY THEM. Nobody is forcing you to purchase them and there is still free cosmetics earned through playing the game. It isn't a huge deal and this game doesn't deserve hundreds of negative reviews because of it. Another common issue is bugs and lag. While I have had a few bugs (Usually in vehicles such as hitting something invisible) most have been minor and I've seen very few. for the most part my game is smooth with no bugs and only the vary rare fram drop. I have an i7 4790k and a GTX 970 so my computer is not top of the line but no slouch either. But my friend has the same experience as I with an i5 and GTX 950 so it isn't that bad. This is also an early access game. Hate bugs? Wait until full release. I've really enjoyed this game so far and I plan on many more hours in it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: UPDATE Don't listen to people downvoting for microtransactions they are purely cosmetic it hasn't hindered them working on the game at all and the money goes towards improving the community around the game through tournament pools.Nothing gets your heart pounding like this game. Hands down a must play. It won't be for everyone but if you enjoy the process of looting and the quick thinking at everystep it will quickly become one of your favorite games of all time.Devs are doing a great job of listening to the community and updating frequently. The first person needs a bit of work but the devs are creating first person only servers which has been largely demanded by the community. This will surely improve the game even further.This game is worth the $30 even with only 1 map can't wait for the next 2 and the vaulting mechanic that was announced at E3.8/10 right now with so much potential

review: DID DAYZ SEEM LIKE AN APPEALING GAME TO YOU?! Until you actually played it ran around in the woods for 4 goddamn hours only to find a fire axe a hat and then die of dehydration? The following day did you try again only to get killed in 20 minutes by buggy zombies that teleport through walls and punch you from 10 meters away? A month later were you determined to have a good time join a less populated server finally get a gun and some decent gear and excitedly run toward a town to find better stuff only to get sniped while running across a field by some dude half a kilometer away?Well boy do I have the game for you. Its called Playerunknown's Battlegrounds and the entire game boils down the fun parts of Dayz into little bite sized nuggets of fun. 100 players are dropped on an island from a plane scavenge for weapons and gear and then are forced into a perpetually shrinking safe zone until one person remains alive. Its basically Battle Royale the videogame only not as as other games that follow a similar formula. Weapons are abundant and since the safe zone is constantly shrinking and you have to fear being killed by the gas that damages you outside of the safe zone each match forces you into confrontations with other players. Another consequence of the shrinking safe zone is that matches don't tend to drag on for a painful length of time. The longest game I played was my first game where I came in 2nd place and the match lasted around 45 minutes. A usual match for me puts me somewhere in the top 40 or 30 players and lasts around 20 minutes. Then I'm back in the lobby queued up for another game in which I will again play terribly.Essentially this game is all of the fun parts of this current trend of difficult survival/scavenging shooty games without any of the tedium and frustration that plagues the genre and I can't get enough of it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Good game. Have NOT been banned for any reason including "stream sniping." Annoying door mechanics movement feels strange because it has acceleration and gun mechanics are good.(*unlike Fortnite where if you use a rifle your bullets will NOT go to the center dot even if you haven't fired yet. This pleases the people who aren't good at shooters*)NET CODE NEEDS WORK. My god I hope they get it right by full release but I doubt it. My PC runs it steady 60 FPS so it's not the problem. Try opening a door then have fun waiting half a second for it to open after keypress. Have fun as loot loads in slowly for first 30 seconds and watch as someone else finds a gun and takes you out in the early 1v1.Sound mechanics are cool bullet sounds and rifle sounds are heard at different times depending on distance. Grenades make me poop myself. 10/10 would poop again from loud grenade. Plane sound still too loud when in the plane. Buggy(vehicle) sound too loud when riding it. Spoopy 10/10 fog levels yes. Rain is fun too. When being sniped in the sun I wish deeply for fog to come but weather doesn't change mid game which is fine by me.Mainly I am pleased by the gun mechanics which is my biggest issue with shooters if they get it wrong. Come for the scare and the gun shooting you'll have a good time.

Spoon desired amount of chili into center of tortilla top with desired amount of cheese and roll them up. Place back on plate cover with the damp paper towel and heat again for 1 minute 30 seconds. review: This game is inherently flawed. I have some room to talk on this matter due to my 200+ hours in the game. Yes it is fun at times but no I will not recommend this game to anyone in its current state. First I would like to question Blueholes motives on having a 300k tournament whilst the game is still far from being complete. Instead of their focus being on the tournament and adding new cosmetic items it should be on actually finishing and polishing their game. I can tell you that in its current state this game is not tournament ready. It frustrates me that Bluehole can't seem to fix problems that the game has had for months now or they fix an issue and a few patches later the same issue comes back. Hit registration d sync and servers flat out failing should be their biggest concern at the moment.At times yes this game is fun. Those fun moments usually come at the end of a game 20mins into the game. 20mins of running from the circle and scavaging for loot with your squad in places that only have enough loot for one person. What I'm trying to say is this game is no where ready for the competitive scene and I doubt it will be for a long time. Not recommending this game because I want the money people spend on the game to go into its development not a 300k tournament.

review: UPDATE If I could downvote more than once I would. I should not be having these problems but evidently I do. This game somehow manages to eat ALL my ram. 8 out of 10 games are useless because it takes 2 3 minutes for the textures to load rendering the core gameplay of the game mute. I don't know if I am just unlucky but this game is insanely unoptimized. Literally unplayable. As I write in my review below I have absolutely no problems running most AAA games (E.g Witcher 3 Dying Light Batman Arkham City Dishonored 2) on max and 60+ fps. I know these are singleplayer games. But they still do not use 6+ gb of ram when running which this game should never do. First of all I very rarely if ever write reviews. So this review speaks volumes about my opinion of this game. Second of all this review is not regarding the microtransactions.The game itself is amazing nothing less. Strategizing and choosing between agression or stealth attacking your enemy is a very satisfying situation to be in. The adrenaline rush gets insane when you get top #20 and even more so top #10 and #5. Gameplay is fun and different. With that being said the game is only fun the few times I don't run into technical issues. At the time of writing I believe I have about 10 11 hours logged in this game. But I can safely say that at least half that time has been spent not playing. I don't know if I am just one of the unlucky few but I seem to run into technical issues quite a lot. I do have a decently powerful rig that is able to run most AAA titels on high settings without trouble. But this game I am not. It feels like 7 out of 10 games the textures of the buildings wont load basically making it unplayable. Other times the game just crashes mid game or goes unresponsive and the screen just freezes. I have searched high and low on the internet for potential fixes but nothing actually helps. I am not aware of how many people face the same issues as I do. But at the high rate I have to deal with these issues I simply cannot recommend this game. I too am aware it is 'just' an early access but I feel like the very least demand for early access is that it is at least playable at some level. Don't get me wrong the game is fun when it works. But this has not been my experience. Hopefully it will change in time. But for now I seem to use more time looking at the game and closing it from my task bar than actually playing the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Early Access games are like a box of chocolates You never know what you're going to get. In this particular case the developer promised that no microtransactions would exist prior to the game exiting early access. This promise was broken. The core game still has a lot of problems from network latency frame rate drops animation problems assets not loading problems with the voice chat client and is still lacking many of the features the developer has said they plan to include. Despite the numerous bugs glitches and other problems that exist the developer decided to devote resources to implement microtransactions. While a developer does deserve to get paid for their work and I don't have a problem with microtransactions in theory the fact that the developer has chosen to prioritize breaking their promise over fixing bugs flaws and glitches with the game should be and is a red flag.

review: (DISCLAIMER! I DO NOT HATE ASIANS) Hello This is Shirskiy. I play a ton of steam games and mass over 8000 hours of gameplay on all of my games combined so far And I have to say this. PUBG is a very good game It's challenging Fun Better than it's inferior competitors H1Z1 and Fortnite And the game is an overall 10/10! Except for one damn thing. Chinese players are hopping from Asian servers to US and Oceania Servers (US Servers being USA Mexico Canada and upper central American And Oceania being Australia New Zealand and Indonesia). Chinese players that come to these servers are abusing the high ping and often times I die by someone I just downed because the ping is so bad. China is across the world from the USA which makes ping super hard. I think China should be Region Locked. This is also because 99% of the Hacks for PUBG are coming from Chinese websites. I will now list the Pros and ConsPROS The game is very competitive It's very successful and rarely glitches or crashes This game takes bullet drop and range into account The weapons are for the most part realistic They have realistic grenades and throwablesCONS Don't plan on playing this with a GTX 960 or below on ultra settings If you do There goes your CPU Small Variety of guns Chinese Hackers and Ping Abusers Brandon Greene (Creator of PUBG) Is calling everyone who calls for a region lock "Xenophobic" (So Basically a snowflake owner) Unrealistic Vehicles Small Variety of Vehicles A pan isn't bulletproof... Randomly banning people who kill streamers for "Steam Sniping" These people are just trying to play the game. Randomly banning people who counter teamkill to save their own life (Really Brandon?) Poor Server Policy (Most Chinese players go from Asian servers to American servers because their own servers are poorly moderated and kept) Lack of responsability Causing Steam to shift from a mostly english site to a mostly chinese site Microtransactions even though they made a large sum of cash on the people who purchased the base game as is.So Overall it gets a negative review until it fixes a few of their issues One being serverlocking asian players. I can't understand what Kim over here is saying because I'm not Chinese. #ServerLockChina

review: This is the first "Battle Royale" game that I've ever played and I was instantly hooked on it.The premise for those of you who don't know is 100 players get loaded onto a plane parachute out over a 64 square km island gear up with guns armour and healing items and fight to the death. The play area gradually reduces over the course of the match forcing players closer and closer together until a final showdown happens. Sounds daunting at first and there is a bit of a learning curve getting familiar with all the guns upgrades and locations while simultaneously fighting for your life but after a long Saturday morning session after buying the game I was well on my way to getting to grips with the game.Solo mode is great if you want to be independent and ensures you're never outnumbered in a firefight. It also seems to be a better way of earning in game currency than the multiplayer options so if you want to grind for those cosmetics solo is the way to go!However the game really shines in duo or squad mode where you can team up into a squad of 2 (duo) or 3/4 (squad) and take on the quest for the chicken dinner together! There is an option to get matched with strangers and the in game chat is okay but having been team killed by some randoms I've matched with I wouldn't recommend it. (NB This can be easily turned off by unchecking the auto match option when you mouse over the ready button.)I have only owned this game for a couple of weeks but I have had unforgettable experiences playing with friends (both good and bad). The first time I won my whole squad getting blown up when a bomb dropped on the vehicle we were in cross mapping unsuspecting opponents with a 15x scope...With the promise of many exciting new updates and currently (July 2017) a new map being teased it's a great time to see what all the fuss is about and buy this game!PS Keep a defibrillator handy because this game will make your heart stop. Every time.

review: Product received for free. Literally the worst Battle Royale game I have ever played (well until I played Fortnite). Even that game Last Man Standing is better. Despite this game's popularity it's really wack. My first problem with this game is how poorly optimized it is even on my GTX 970 I have to turn everything to the lowest settings to simply run this game without immense performance problems. Secondly the servers are crap. Most of the time when I try to connect to the game it won't let me in. The game also has the habit to put NA servers as the default even though I always press EU servers. The cosmetics are also just another filthy cash grab. I'd say get this game on sale but they don't do sales since everyone buys their horrible piece of junk. Another thing that is completely bugged is the *you died from falling* message. Sometimes I get out of my car lose health and then after a few seconds I die from falling. The developers are so incompetent that when you die and you press leave match they give you a *Are you sure you want to leave* message of course I want to leave something I can't do anything in anymore. So here I am playing another and suddenly my character only moves his head now I luckily knew this was a problem with alt because I've played Arma and H1Z1 but anyone who doesn't know this is going to go mad. Healing also takes a billion years so much so that it is almost impossible to kill a group of people in a short period of time. If there is any game that is good for BR it is Arma 3 despite Battle Royale not being an official game mode it is still better. My final criticism is the gameplay itself people have way too much health and the healing in this game is horrible because it takes way too long. This way the game is punishing people for actually getting into action.Update It also happens to crash a ton.Final update (game released now) The game is even more broken now guns don't spawn instantly so people who do see the guns get an advantage because the game is broken. There are also tons of hackers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: EDIT #3 After almost 2 years(!!) the game became is playable on low end to mid end PCs with 60 fps on low settings. But all the other problems such as the random disconnectings crashes hitches desync are still here. Technical issues aside the mobility of the characters is really bad. You don't feel free while you are moving around unless you are playing on FPP. The game was and still is stiff and probably isn't gonna change cause that's the core gameplay of PUBG. After almost 2 years devs have stopped giving us paid crates and NOW they are giving us paid skins! brilliant! The content addition is better than before more guns are coming to the game which changes offers different playstyles for you. Here's the sad thing guys greed of this game's devs ruined it. They just now realized that this great game with all the potential was being ruined in their hands. People who have this game already try to enjoy it as much as you can because the servers aren't going to as populated as now in a few months. People who don't have the game DO NOT BUY IT. It's gonna die save money for BO4 at least you can have some "pure" fun in that game for sometime. Lots of love to pubg.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a great game but has a few cons(keep in mind that this is for the current version of the game (4/11/2017) many cons may be fixed by the time you read this review)Pros Gun play seems mostly balanced except for the AWM which is understandable because it is a high risk high reward item you have to get it from the supply drops. It is insanely fast to get into a game when i click play im in a game within seconds no long queues. Gameplay is not too fast like h1z1 but it can get intense towards the end. You spawn into an airplane and can choose where to parachute unlike h1z1 where you have no choice.Cons Spectator audio is messed up (this may seem like a minor issue but is confusing while spectating for example the spectator might hear shots from his left but the shots are actually on the right or vice versa) Sometimes you might die unfairly (behind cover or whatever) but it is early access and im sure they will fix this in the near future. Sometimes supply drops land in the water which is accessable via boat or swimming but if you want to change weapons you cant because whatever you drop sinks to the bottom.Other than these the game is great. It's fun and intense. It's like Arma 3 Battle Royale and H1Z1 had a Baby but it's more polished and better graphics.Overall I Recommend Feller

review: Its okay not sure why its hyped as much. It was fun for awhile but to get to the top 10 you pretty much have to hide and hide and hide and make sure you are within the circles. Once you are in the top 10 things are a lot more interesting though but until then its a lot of camping and hiding. Not sure what can be done to improve that....maybe a timer on how 1 person can stay in a building or the same position....Also playing in teams is clusterf....most of the times you will have people who kill their own teammembers and there doesnt seem to be any penalty in doing that.Edit Actually its really a massive hide and seek game...like literally if you want to win all you have to do is make sure you are in the circle and hide thats literally all you need to do. Go to each circle and find a nice hiding spot close to the center then move if necessary....made it to #2 precisely doing that.

review: I would like to change review due to some recent updates.FOV you get used to it and won't notice after around 20+ hours in game.Moving you're basically swimming in butter (that can be a problem sometimes when you should move fast back to the corner but your character keeps going towards the other guy's firing line)aiming...they tried to make it some sort of 'Arma like'...and you get used to it but still 3'rd person is kinda tough to see if you're actually hitting someone or it was just the obsticle )Optimization that's something! you have more or less decent PC but you can't play on low (30 55 fps for shooting game really?) FIX they seem to be working on this issue because now I can see textures loading faster yes but sometimes FPS still runs down from 45 50 to 10 20 (on low settings!) bad for shooter gamedon't see why so many people rate this game so good...now I know CRATES!!!P.S. don't see why people are so mad about boxes and keys...these clothes are just rags they don't give you any advantage + you can find most of these in game so don't brag about 'it gives me advantage nobosy sees me in the bushes' The game is fun playting single is a challange but coop changes gameplay entirely

If you enjoy choppy gunfights people teleporting around corners camping just inside the safe zone to pick off people who cant's sprint 100mph to get ahead of the forcefield and of course a forcefield that rules over all servers with an iron fist bringing terror and agony to countless helpless players who dare play on its server then this is the game for you! 10/10 you'll be rage quitting every time.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is what H1Z1 could have been and even better. This game hasn't been out for too long now but players love it. Why? Because this is a GOOD game. H1Z1 had players so hyped up and was a huge let down. This game makes up for that. For the time it has been out it is mindblowing. The devs actually listen to community feedback and give generous updates to the players never messing up the game in any way I love it. This game is a blast to play. Solo or with friends. The feeling of satisfaction when you're the last man standing is inexplicable. Pros &gt Amazing game &gt Wide range of weaponry &gt Good shooting mechanics &gt Aesthetically Pleasing &gt The dev actually cares P &gt Good fluid driving mechanics &gt Realistic &gt Quick matching &gt Vast worldThis game is just going to keep getting better and better.Cons There aren't a lot of cons when it comes to this game but there are a few which will surely be fixed. &gt Few bugs here and there. (Not going to mention b/c by the time you read this they will be fixed which I love.) &gt Heavy requirements spec wise. &gt Needs more servers. Region wise isn't working too well considering I live in India and Asia is my only option. &gt No option/method to check my latency in game. &gt Pathetic optimization.In conclusion if your PC isn't a potato buy it! You won't regret it. If H1Z1 scarred you this will heal you.Edit #1 Server issues now fixed. SEA Server option added. &gt Game optimization much better. &gt New content every month. &gt New maps coming soon (Will update) &gt Bugs fixed. &gt FPS only servers added WITH an Fov slider.

review: Pros You get to pick up guns and kill people.Cons 1. Loot spawns are horribly off balance and often contain pointless items (clothes that don't give anything other than cosmetic effects worthless guns such as the R18 revolver and the crossbow while your opponent found a suppressed AR with a scope)2. Chinese Hackers that BlueHole doesn't care about.3. Horribly unreliable and unoptimized game and servers. Crashes and frame drops are frequent even on a decent rig with excellent configuration.4. The play zone bias (the blue circle will seldom be in your favor and you will spent a lot of time running from it).5. BlueHole cares more about MTX than actually improving their low quality hacker infested game.

review: I'll keep it short for the sake of saving time...For those who're interested in buying this game it's fun and all with a group of friends though it doesn't have a proper anti cheat policy so if you're planning to invest in this game with your precious time i suggest you check something else while DEVs finally decide to do something about it rather than nodding to irrational box transactions...Just a little more extention to this review &gt This game is basically ruined by cheaters and hackers. Right now we come by these incidents on daily basis and it's frustrating to see the devs are only idle about this topic while serving to the pleasure of the streamers. At this point It became worse than CS GO when it comes to dealing with cheaters and hackers since there is no integrated anti cheat system... The process is simple "They cheat get banned and buy the game again with the boxes they bought with in game points which they earned unfairly and repeat the process all over again".In any case if your time is precious to you and if you're hot headed like myself this game isn't for you for now... It's too annoying to see some random guy shoot you through a mountain with a sawed off shotgun in my opinion...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have not really been a fan of multiplayer games for quite some time but I was intrigued by PUBG. I can easily say that it is one of the most fun gaming experiences I have had. The game is much better with friends (either in duos or squads) as it can be a real teambuilding experience. Solo play can feel unfair at times because you might not know where you are getting sniped from.The concept is neat and the devs have done a good job in providing updates. I recommend turning off global chat so that you can experience the game on your own terms. Overall I recommend this game especially if you have a buddy or three who are willing to play with you.

GAME mechanics are broken. you walk up to a door and hit f to open you can hear the door open but it remains shut on your screen you can walk through the door while it looks closed. ive seen players run through walls/fences.. alternating seats in vehicles is instant so players drive around in bikes at 190 km/h and switch to passanger and one shot you driving up.this game is CANCER the community is cancer and the people who jump at the opportunity to tell you how great the game is are brainless COD style of gameplay fans.If you didnt like cod for its randomness and aimlessness then you will not like pubg. PUBG took everything that was great about Arma and the worst from COD and put the two together.get your together pubgPS you can tell your game is trash when the community that supports the game is trash. Just listen to the lobby area for NA servers.Edit Dec 17'Game stoped working completley gives this error on start 23 48 57 Starting BattlEye Service...23 48 57 Failed to initialize BattlEye Service Windows Test Signing Mode not supported.I want my money back

review: PUBG a game from humble beginnings which has exceeded all expectations it's topped the sales charts dethroned Dota as the most played game on Steam it's swept across the internet like an African bush fire engulfing us all in an inferno of twitch streamer kill streak montages gameplay videos and memes. A game which has caused more of a stir than the death of the beloved noble beast Harambe may god rest is gentle soul. Be that as it may something is still bugging me. At first I kinda liked it but after a few hours I was totally bored I kept returning to PUBG not due to any desire to continue playing it but because of it's immense success.The constant nagging from freinds who swear it's the best thing since sliced bread and that it's the only game woirth playing right now luring me into a duos or a squad which usually turns into a game of "how many times do we have to sit in a lobby after one of us dies at the start before we actually get into a real game" After that ritual if we havn't rage quit we usually agree on the sensible option which is "hide like little babies in buildings preying for good gear and a favourable circle" If all goes well you'll be rewarded by making it to the top 10 where you will get to enjoy an exhilarating gun fight with the worlds laggiest combat the glitchiest most buggiest hit registration and the most unreliable aiming mechanics in a game ever. Not that any of that really makes a difference since nine times out of ten you won't even see your enemies as they scope you with a fifteen times silenced sniper rifle from across the map. All of this leaves me asking one question. Why does everyone like this game? Laggy Buggy Crapppy mechanics RNG on a level which makes winning the lotto seem like a matter of skill and even if they some how fixed all of that which they probably never will The biggest problem with the game it's main flaw the thing that makes it an incredibly tedious chore is the gameplay. The gameplay is just horrible it is as exciting as watching your grandpa take a nap in front of a golf tournament on tv on a Sunday afternoon after lunch with the only highlights being the occasional fart and some snoring! Who wants to play a game which lasts 40 minutes only to have 2 or 3 seconds of action 99 percent of your time is spent looting looking for gear searching for items scavenging for upgrades scouring the map for collectibles foraging for equipment and jogging Oh Jesus put your trainers on chaps because there's lots and lots of ing jogging. Endlessly jogging in some toxic blue electrified force field thingy. But wait what if we spice things up a bit make the looting a bit more interesting. Perhaps by adding some magical items to the game looting would become more of an adventure and the game would take on a bit of an RPG kind of flavour. Yeah that would be brilliant hmm let's see what about a magical imperishable crown of undeniable awesomeness granting the wearer immortality charming good looks and a 12 inch oh yeah I forgot they already have a lvl 3 helmet in this game that does all of that let's checkMakes you indestructible check!Makes you look like a bad check!Gives you a massive fat to everyone on the server with harder than an African American inmate serving 20 to life yep check!WAIT WUT!? I thought this was a competitive hardcore first person shooter?! Magical crown of awesomeness? WTF!?! So yeah magic items are actually a thing in this poor excuse of a competitive first person shooter/ 3rd person shooter for noobs/ not really a shooter more of an RPG/ survival game. All that's really missing are the zombies or wait hang on are we the players meant to be the zombies? The mindless creatures roving around the country side aimlessly scrounging for fragments of what might have been a fun game but isn't because it's broken in every way imaginable?To wrap up Player Unknown's Battlegrounds sounded like a cool idea but in practice turned out to be more of a disappointment. Nothing new here folks just more early access pre alpha beta still in development low budget crap. A game that still can't decide if it wants to be a hardcore competitive shooter or a half baked Fallout DayZ H1Z1 blended with the hunger games with a side order of jogging simulator and sprinkled with magic power ups.

review: TL DR Fun addictive gameplay which unfortunately is an unoptimized frustrating hell of lags and low framerates!Can't recommend the game in the state it is currently in. The core is here all that's need is a truckload of spit and polish.ProsFunAddictive2 maps yet it doesn't get boringNot pay to winNeutralRNG sometimes hates youConsPoorly optimized game. Even the main menu tanks!Despite running so poorly it doesn't even look that goodAnti Aliasing doesn't solve the annoying edge flickering while standing stillFrustratingly poor netcode (massive delay/lag compensation)Stupidly long lobby wait time (1min+)Dying in the first few seconds and then having to wait over a minute for the next game to startMicrotransactions. I just hate them even if it is not pay to win!Few free drops (cases without locks) that get more difficult to unlock (with a hard limit after the 7th). Definitely not a collectathon"Driving" "physics"Landing the parachute is sooooo buggy you're just gonna hurt yourself most of the timeBuggy lobbyCheaters

review: For an early access game it's worth it. The developers have proven themselves that they are trying to iron out the issues. Not only that they're adding new features and optimizing old ones. So far I'm enjoying the game a lot. Playing games where you die near instantly because of either poor decision or bad luck and then wiping the floor with your squad backing the final player into a corner and killing them with only your pans. (That last part actually happened!) No matter what I'm always coming back to play. Note I've been noticing hackers on streams or watching videos online but I haven't encountered a single one in person. As well performance issues are always up or down and optimizations do need to be made. But with every patch there always seems to be something done to help with that.I recommend this game the negativity surrounding it I feel is pre mature at best. With the frequent updates it's clear the developers are doing what they can.

review: While the gameplay can be some of the most exhilirating with the game nearing 1.0 the performance is unacceptable.I built a new gaming PC mostly to be able to play this game better. The specs are good enough to run other modern games (e.g. Battlefield 1) on Ultra settings (with resolution at 2560x1440 144Hz) at steady 60+ FPS (i5 8400 GTX 1080 16GB RAM) this game routionely drops below 60 and in some parts of the map as low as 25FPS making it completely unplayable.The servers are routinely overloaded adding lag to the above FPS problem. At peaks loads you might not be able to join the game at all.

review: If you do not speak any form of Chinese I cannot reccomend you purchase this game.The developers of this game have a deaf ear pointed in the direction of their player base. The only reason it is any bit as successful as it is has been from Bluehole. The main factor they brought to the table has been their minimally average understanding of what mechanics can make a game enjoyable. The issue with this game is the fact that 90% of it's total active players are from China where a copy can be bought for the equivalent of roughly $13 USD. All they need to do to completely ruin a few hundred matches is select "NA" on a sliding menu on the bottom of the their title screen and the game does literally nothing to detour this behaviour. They destroy the latency of matches. They use the disposable level cheap copies they are offered by using cheating software to ruin matches for other players for weeks on end&gt recieve a ban&gt buy a new copy&gt and repeat that cycle countless times.Region lock China.Ban PC hardware that hackers use and stop repeatedly shilling out this game to hackers at the expense of honest players so you can rake in more cash. The greed is so obvious and transparent.

review: I purchased this Early Access game against my better judgment to play the same game as the majority of my friends.Immediately I was greeted with a buggy nigh unplayable mess that crashed my computer at every given opportunity. I was permissive thinking They ll fix this on release but I ve always been very careful not to call PLAYERUNKNOWN S BATTLEGROUNDS a good game.There are certain elements that could have made it great I d waited a long time for a mainstream Battle Royale style game the post soviet aesthetic of a decaying island was an interesting arena to fight 99 other people on and there s no denying this game was fun with friends.Soon other games imposed on the Battle Royale gameplay notably Fortnite. I saw this as an opportunity for BlueHole games to recognise what people wanted from a Battle Royale game and to fix a lot of problems pervasive in their only major western release.Instead I ve been treated to lootcrates no region locking in game advertising and the cherry ontop of the cake pay passes. I might have overlooked ONE of these issues for a free game but for a Early Access full price Beta..? There are still bugs from my very first session that are yet to be fixed.TL DR corporate greed killed an interesting idea.Uninstalled with no intention of reinstalling.Wouldn t recommend even for free.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ugly atrocious graphics mediocre gameplay poor optimization generic setting terrible controls...This game is a total disgrace and what's even worse is instead of actually improving the major problems of the game like the god awful optimization and the fact that the game is on Unreal Engine 4 but looks roughly equivalent to ArmA 2 the developers instead chose to release somehow even WORSE console ports and attempt to sue the competition out of existence (The competition that by the way also produces the engine that PUBG Corp. is using!). The game *had* potential but it lost any hope of that around the time the developers lost their minds and instead wanted to just milk it as much money as they could rather than improve upon it.

review: This game is one of the best games I have ever played. Honestly. Probably the most fun I have had gaming in the last 5 years. Unfortunately in the last few months it's gone downhill. The game it itself is still great but sometimes it seems impossible to actually find a game. Too many times I've spent 10 minutes waiting for a game just to exit out because it isn't worth the wait. This is a game where you can die in the first minute not a problem when queue times were instant but that is a big problem with 10+ minute queues. I wish I could recommend this game because it's so much god damn fun. But at this stage I find it's nearly unplayable. Queues tend to be a faster when you're in a group which is when the game is it's most fun. But solo has been literally unplayable.

review: BAD GAMEDESIGN / WASTE OF TIMEPUBG and other Battle Royal games are the worst type of game you can play. And here is why Comparison PUBG with other games/genresWhen you for example play a beat em up and you and your opponent are at a similar level the chance of winning is 50/50 %.Now when you play PUBG (or other battle royale) and all player are kinda the same level your chance of winning is only 1%. And specificly in PUBG there is so much luck/randomness involved so your chance of winning is probably less than 1% (Except you played it more than +1000h) This is very unrewarding. And when you finally win... its not that big of a deal. Everyone else is already dead and nobody knows you even won because they already startet a new game. Very statsifying... NOT. other flaws of PUBG Ton of glitches long waiting times. Seriously half of my playtime is waiting for other players (friends) to be ready Lobby waiting time jump from the plane wasting time maybe dying early and waiting 20min for your friends to finally die. IT IS A WASTE OF TIME.RATING SH!T / 10Sory for bad engrish. Greetings from Germany.

review: After buying and playing this game on release I feel it's finally time to voice my opinion about this game!This games has many pro's but also many cons which it I will get into in a moment but first I would like to state my PC specs Intel i7 6700k OC'd to 4.6GHzGTX 1080 OC'd to 2000MHz16GB DDR4 RAM 3200MHz All games running from my 1TB Samsung 960 Pro NVME SSD.This is no way bragging but it will help when understanding performance when later discussed.First let's start with the Pro's VERY VERY ADDICTING! This game has the ability to entice you to play it for hours and hours even if you don't win a game getting kills in this game is very rewarding and get get really intense at times which certainly gets the blood pumping.Great Dev Team!Bluehole and PlayerUnknown are the people behind this game if you didn't already know player unknown is the genius that made me buy Arma he is the person that created the battle royale mod which has since led to games such as H1Z1 having very good success. There a weekly and monthly updates which are always released on time and you can find very descriptive details about them on the website. The weekly updates try to improve server performance and game stability where as the monthly updates add new items optimisation and lot's more. Good Gunplay!This game has very satisfying gunplay it isn't quite as realistic as Arma 3 or DayZ but the weapons all have there fair share of bullet velocity bullet drop off and recoil. This enhances the game as it requires people to think carefully about which gun they wish to carry and also doesn't allow people to spray down enemies at a distance due to the recoil. Good customization!If customisation appeals to you then player unknown is quite good for that. You can choose exactly how your character looks on first launch of the game and as you play you earn point that will allow you to open crates an customise further with more clothing options. Customisation is also good once the game has started as there many attachments that can be added to weapons to enhance the way the weapon shoots and feels. Cons!!Performance! Remember those specs listed above should be able to run a game with ease at 1080p right? It's does with this game until I look at a town and due to the amount of LOD's the game is trying to load FPS can certainly take a hit and spikes making the game unplayable. Although my game is on the max visual settings even turning the options down doesn't improve the FPS drops and this is very irritating considering the spec of my PC.Server LAG!!As to be expected with early access titles the servers are not great. It doesn't help that this game sold loads of copies. The server performance is definitely sub par. The servers sometimes lag and and make my game stutter this is also with a fast internet speed and low ping. There are also some questionable decisions with what runs client side and what runs server side. Bullet travel is server side but building are rendered client side this essentially allows cheater to remove the building from there game and shoot people through them as they cannot see the buildings! WTF!!! The servers also sometimes jsut refuse to connect and this can be very frustrating when trying to kill some mother f**kers!Driving!Vehicles are a great tool in this game and can be very effective. There are both land and sea vehicles and this is great BUT the land vehicles can be a tad problematic. If you like driving a slower route and following the road then the vehicles will behave nicely however if you tend to take the off road route then expect to be flipping those vehicles quite regularly. The handling is very twitchy and not very stable when travelling across terrain even when driving slowly. Conclusion!Overall do I recommend this game? F**K YH!! This is by far the best battle royale style game i have played in a while and is very stable for it's age. If the errors and bugs are ironed out over the coming months and server performance improved then this will be one of the best games of 2017 period! I definitely recommend buying and sticking with the developers as it's looking very promising!I hope this review helped out in someway or another!Thanks for reading!

review: Game is more often a disappointment than not. That's the most distilled version of my nearly 1k hours of play time.Steam requires you describe what you liked or disliked about this game and whether you recommend it to others.Dislike Performance is super janky that's the scientific term for it.In game voice chat is entirely populated by the sort of people you hope never breed.Footsteps you know that crucial aspect to most shooter games are utterly unreliable.there's more but who cares...Like It's a battle royal game with a large enough player base to have minimal or non existent wait times when you want to play. UPDATE Reinstalled the game after a major update to find that many improvements had been made. This is very promising and is probably the reason I keep making excuses for the atrocious performance but at hte end of the day it's still dropping frames constantly and generally performing poorly. Still can't recommend.UPDATE #2 The game is currently performing at mostly acceptable level performance wise not great but acceptable. The game mechanics are less great barely acceptable. Overall the game can be fun with friends but it takes real turd to not be at least a little fun with friends. This game is not a complete turd but it's not great either.

review: EDIT Updated on 7/30/2018 This game has made me a racist. DO NOT PLAY. Its just garbage. Original review Honestly the game itself is pretty fantastic. Its been a while since I felt as much pleasure and accomplishment as the day I earned my first chicken dinner. Are their bugs? Sure. A lot of them make the game kind of charming in a quirky sort of way and usually result in a good laugh. Over all I'd absolutely LOVE to give this game a thumbs up because my friends and I have put in a ton of hours and for only $30. EXCEPT for the RIDICULOUS amount of hacking that goes on. I've been playing Counter Strike for 18 years and I've encountered MORE hackers in PUBG in 2 months than I have in nearly 2 decades of CS. I'd conservatively estimate that 80% of my games end with obvious hacking. Blue Hole has taken the indefensable approach of releasing more loot crates because that will certainly disinsentivise hackers. BH has made efforts they've released patches to address security flaws that were exploited. And those were effective for all of 7 days. The last 72 hours something has changed and the hackers are back with a vengeance. I'm done. The only thing that will bring me back at this point is getting rid of the market altogether which would disinsentivize the hackers. Or region lock the geographical locations whose job prospects and economy are so poor as to make hacking a video game a viable job. Until you do one or the other the game is nothing short of utter garbage and I can not recommend it. STAY AWAY from this cheat fest.

review: This game is terribly managed by Bluehole. The company that created this game cares more about updating cosmetic items than actually fixing the mechanics of the game. Everyone knows this and it's really pathetic that despite an onslaught of negative reviews the company continues to do absolutely nothing about the game's inherent problems. Hit boxes are erroneous. The parachute mechanics are broken. Shot gun physics are terrible. Network connection is shoddy. Players from other continents plague North American servers and cause severe network lag issues. Frames drop frequently especially during combat. Graphics are way behind the current standard. Vehicle physics are extremely shoddy. Swimming physics are complete Bluehole continuously patches things that don't matter (like nerfing the AKM or adding guns that are useless like the mini 14 and tommy). The company does not listen to its players and seems to only care about numbers and hype more than fixing the game's actual problems. Nintendo in 1989 was doing a better job in releasing quality games than Bluehole is in 2017. This game is the most over hyped game in the history of games. I hope to see a studio with actual talent produce a battle royale game soon that over shadows this broken piece of software that a high school programming student could eclipse. I'll never get my $30 or my time back. I hope this game sinks and fails as soon as possible and is forgotten forever. I hope that history sheds light on this game as an example of over hyped inflated BS. Thanks a lot Bluehole. Get a grip.

review: WELL. GET READY FOR A REVIEW FROM SOMEONE WHO JUST GOT HACK KILLED.Where do i begin. After playing countless hours through all stages of the game I have come to bring friends family and even enemies to play this game. Either for team mates or target practice. I have stood by this game and not judged or said a damn word publically about the horrible state of the game because for me the fun was worth it that adrenaline hit when your in the final 10 final 5 and even in the last one on one I have never experienced before to that degree. Oh my god when you win? you feel like your on the top of the world. You JUST KILLED 99 MOTHER****ERS AND CAME OUT ON TOP! Safe to say this game is extremely enjoyable and deserves its place on the best sellers list and on the lips of every twelve year old who wants mum to buy the next big thing in gaming. I understand how the studio feels I understand the immense pressure that has been placed upon them when all of a sudden their pet project glorified half broken mod blew up and became what it is today. Since then the community (including me) have been begging for more content more this more that fix this and fix that. So what have the developers done? Done an EA and put microtransactions for cosmetics (which is like every other bloody game these days so they get a pass for that) they add new guns new locations fixed the map fixed the guns and how they fire even added a NEW MAP OMFG GUYS. But wait oh its another map where it can be exploited by those who have an easy time going through the coding and finding ways to exploit the game. BUT GUYS BUY THESE KEYS YOU MIGHT GET A COOOOOOAAAAAT.This game has lost its focus what was an incredible experience has now been ruined by hackers cheaters and the barely held together structure of the game itself. YES I understand that a game this complex with 10 000 000 000 players (over exaggeration) is not the easiest thing to fix. But for the love of **** the development studio would have made millions upon milllions upon millions of dollars how hard is it to hire more people SPECIFICALLY to combat cheaters and another team to target the games optimisation? Hire twenty people for each team to fix this now stale and aggravating experience that I used to crave playing the second I finished a 12 hour day at work. HELD BACK RANT OVER It's a good game if you haven't played it yet buy it. You might just be paying for the game to be fixed for everyone.

review: Yeah yeah I've only played for 9 hours so far as of writing this. But in those 9 hours I've experienced things in this particular battleground game that I haven't ever even come close to in King of the Kill or The Culling.Now it's early access. There are bugs memory leaks lag but the gunplay is solid. The best I've seen in this type of game yet.But that's not even what I want to say in this review aside from the fact that the devs seem to be really on top of things.This game is extremely DYNAMIC. And when I say dynamic I mean...In one game with a friend as a duo I was forced to make a split second decision while we were both stuck in the blue field of death and on the brink of both of us dying. I had to decide if I was going to die right there trying to help her up or bust 10 feet in front of me for the safe zone. Albeit I got blasted in the face by a shotgun about five minutes later but WOW lol I felt kinda like a jerk after that.In another game the final battleground area was being constricted to a completely open field. If you've played this for more than three seconds you know that open fields are probably the worst place to be. So I'm crawling through the grass like a snake only getting up every once in a little bit to get to the next safe zone. I come up to the FINAL area and some dude is rushing a shed 50 feet in front of me. The wood of the door blasts out and someone inside murders this dude right there. He's DEAD. So I'm crawling through the grass like "I'm gonna get there and I'm gonna shoot that guy and win this!" There's 4 of us left. But out of completely nowhere this woman in a trench coat literally steps on me and then she STOPS. And we get stuck in a three second stand off where we BOTH die right next to each other lolAnd then I had this OTHER game where I'm watching a house cause I thought I saw someone in a window. Sure enough some dude runs past one of the openings inside the house. I'm open to rush this place and put this guy down so I can loot what I need. But THEN a yellow car comes out of NOWHERE and this guy goes in and takes this guy out just like I was planning. ARGH. Although sitting there in the grass like the snake I am I notice he's taking longer than I expect. So I'm checking the windows and moving real slow. I hear him screwing around inside the house still so I STEAL HIS CAR.This is such a good game! Oh my god.

review: At the time I am writing this review I have only played 3 hours so keep that in mind. TL DR at the end.First let's start out with some pros and cons.Pros Very well balanced everyone gets weapons and nobody is truly left unarmed. Great hitboxes and damage multipliers If you get hit in the head you are dead. Love it! Fluent controls controls feel very responsive and when you die you don't really blame the game you blame it on yourself. Cheap for what you get. Considering this game will forever be $29.99 I think this is almost stealing! For the content that is in the game and the replayability I say it is well worth it.Cons Not very optimized. My computer's specs aren't anything special but I can only get 50fps on very low graphics and 1280x720. Could be better optimized. Sounds seem to break every once in a while but that could be me. They seem to scratch at certain points. Punches are overpowered in their current state. Usually I can get punched in the head twice and be dead. Blood sprays are very exaggerated but I understand why. It's so you can see if you hit them I get that the devs don't want to put a generic hitmarker but the splatter could be a little less dramatic. Vehicles are a tad wonky to drive. Making a slight turn could send your car flipping and tumbling down a hill effectively killing you. No random/procedural map generation. I hope this becomes a thing later on. The same map can make for a bland experience.Overall Rating9/10TL DR This game is everything that H1Z1 and DayZ could ever dream to be. I truly think that this game is the best survival arena game out there. It makes everything that was bad about survival arena games good. It needs some optimization and gameplay balancing but it makes for a very fun experience. I could see myself playing this game for days. It is worth every penny.

review: I got this game around August and I'd say that was the golden age of pubg. I really enjoyed it and pubg was my main game for a while. Toward December it started going downhill. In the current state of the game I can't say it was as good as it was in August. I have 400 hours total on this game and I did like it a lot but right now the way it is I just can't give it a good review. I don't like fortnite either I really hated it because it was copying pubg but even now I'd rather play fortnite than this and fortnite sucks. The server issues and cheating issues are really bad and with them suing fortnite and the event pass being a thing it's evident they're just trying to make as much money as they can before pubg dies. The hitreg is more broken than rainbow six siege at this point in this shroud clip herehttps //youtu.be/z38B0rSpPWE?t 2m53sThe amount of times I've been in a fight with someone hit them in the head 3 or 4 times and they shrugged it off like it was a foot shot is just horrible. With a game that focuses hugely on gunplay aim and strategy this is really bad. and it's not ping problems either it's the actual servers.I just don't enjoy this game anymore and I wouldn't really recommend it to anyone anymore. It's just not fun and the devs don't care anymore.

review: About time i posted a review i have played over 300 hours of Pubg and have to admit i love this game everyone saying the game need to be optimized well it all depends on your spec and gfx card i use to play this game with 80fps on low/med settings with a gtx 770 without minor issues i have since upgraded to a gtx 1070ti and i am running at 144fps without issues yes the game could do with a bit more optimizing and hopfully they will work on that.The main issue on this game is the amount of cheaters that lock on head shot you with guns without even scopes for far now i know you are hard at work trying to make this game good and adding more guns and maps but maybe focus a little more on the cheaters if you don't start getting rid of them your game will die over time.Also my next issue is the items we have in our inventorys not allowing us to trade them to mates the items are ours to do as we wish as we have paid for them with our own money a revert back to allowing us to trade would be great inless you are going teh same way as CSGO is then you will lose over 150k players in a few weeks.Apart from the above and a few things needing to be fixed i do recommend this game its fun and team based game with mates and i love it.

review: Bought this game super excited to play. Got into the game noticed immediate frame stuttering. Play about 20 30 minutes and game crashed. thought okay no big deal wont happen again. Nope as i started to play longer the more it happened. for no apparrent reason. Flash grenades litteraly break the game and cause frames to drop significantly tried lowering graphic settings and somehow the gmae performed worse than before. This game also somehow was able to use 100% of my video memory. I have a EVGA 1070 SC 8GB card. It seems that a game that was originally made for PC is the worst on PC. I love the gameplay of PUBG but the constant crashing and frame stuttering is a deal breaker and a game breaker and makes it unbearable to play. review: Fun yes but unless you have a high end and i mean high end system you will likely find the game unplayable even on the lowest possible settings. Crashes are common audio stuttering making audio worse than if it was playing through a fan and consistant FPS below 15fps is common place as in every match. Some report getting mostly 60 fps on lowest settings with very top end systems but fps drops are still very common. This game is not even remotely worth the asking price at this time but it does has a ton of potential. Now they are bringing this to console so do not exspect half as much work to be done on fixing the PC issues as much of their staff will almost certainly be working on that for for some time. Even a company with money takes time to exspand their staff for such a task. If you have performance issues with Arma 3 you will almost certainly have preformance issues with this game. I recomend waiting until it gets better but keep an eye on it for sure. 4/10

review: This game used to be fun back when it was in early access but now it's just like any other bad game. Here are some examples on why this game failed and why it will probably never change.1. To many hackers in this game it was so bad to the point were 9/10 games you play you will get killed by hackers even after them fixing the situation people always find a new way to hack.2. This is one is related to the first reason it has no region lock most of the hackers you encounter are mostly all coming from china legit everyone wants it but of course they won't add it to the game.3. removed all weather from the first map and gave us a map that is plain terrible it saddens me kowing that they took the weather changed that we loved and gave us a dessert map that wasn't even that good in the first place.4. This reason will also be connected to the third reason which is no map selection it came to a point where 8/10 games are all dessert maps and when there was a glitch to remove the dessert map and only play the first one you fixed the bug like your life depended on it instead of focusing on hackers. 5. TOOOO MANY UPDATES you have no idea how many times you have to update this game literally every single day you have to update the game I know updates are good because they're fixing the game but most of them just fix things on the maps they don't fix the hacker situation or add things that the game really needs to be good useless updates that is just taking space on my memory.Yeah this game has a lot of unique things that are really good but when the devs just get monet hungry and start adding skins for weapons and more crates when they haven't even fixed the main issues that are ruining the game then no matter how many good things the game has or as much potential the game has it will eventually fail and that's exactly what happened to this game. Such a waste but oh well maybe one day this game can be better but at the moment it's a no for me...

review: This game does not get better to longer you play it.The repetition of finding guns and ammo gets old really quickly spending 10 minutes looting to get shot in the face really is NOT fun and engaging gameplay.You are either choosing to play stealthy and and try to make it to the end. Resulting in running around and hiding for 25 minutes with the occasional kill or getting killed. Really unrewarding either way. It can feel rewarding when you win a round but after playing many games you start to notice its big portion of luck wether the white circle will close into a location in your favor.The 2nd way of playing is just going in Rambo style find the buy areas and try and get kills. Again not very fun diving into a busy area not getting lucky with gun spawns gettting shot because someone found an AKM or another asssault rifle whilst you found a pan.The game is pretty overpriced at 29.99 as well. Sure you can get some hours of it. But looking at a value proposistion. You get 1 (arguebly poorly designed) map (more are on the way) a couple of guns copy/paste a terrible physics engine. It quiet litterly feels like a MOD for games such ARMA.Additionally its an Eearly Access title so expect the following Bugs Poor perfomance Poor networking Performance etc.

review: Player Unknown s Battle Grounds is a First/Third person shooter with survival and king of the Kill style game play. Despite still being in early ALPHA development this game often plays like a finished product and has been the fastest growing game on the Steam market for 3 consecutive weeks recently boasting over 2 Million copies sold. Player s biggest complaints with the game seem to be a demand for MORE content and server stability. The future is bright however as game developers have outlined both weekly and monthly updates promising optimization content and variety. So far this timeline has been adhered to well. Set in a sand box style arena the map is a 10k x 10k Russian island where players will loot/find an assortment of weapons vehicles medical equipment explosives and cosmetics all designed to help each player be the last remaining survivor. Tempo of the game is controlled in part by 'resupply' containers dropped by C 130 aircraft which contain high value gear. Players are forced into smaller and smaller areas by 'the blue wall' or 'poison gas' which slowly confines toward an undetermined location on the map. Max players on a server at any time are set to 100 while game mode options are Solo Doubles or Squad (4) at a time. The game has an open Steam market where some rare 'Player Unknown' items sell for $100s of dollars. Solid performance in game earns the player Battle Points which can be turned in for cosmetic items none of which provide an advantage in game beyond looking cool. Recently Blue Hole the game studio which is developing PUBG hosted a Twitch Tournament for Gamers Outreach and raised over $100 000 which Blue Hole matched for a combined donation of over $200 000. The PUBG Twitch community continues to flourish with over 2 000 streamers playing PUBG daily. Final words PUBG provides players with a heart pounding experience which promises each game to play out in a unique ending. For $30 dollars on the Steam market with the monstrous following and professionalism so far displayed by Blue Hole I highly recommend picking up this title when you can.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I used to love this game.Nowdays I wouldn't reccomend buying it tho.The game back then was clunky to play and had it'sProblems for sure.. But it was alot fun to play andsince it was early acces it didnt bother me too much.Where the Dev's are going to take this game tho kinda pisses me off.Brendan (Player Unknown) back then said that they will focus on Pc only.It's no big deal for me that they release an Xbox verison but ever since theysaid that they are going to publish it on Xbox the game suddenly received nolange huge Updates. Inbefore there was always a huge Update every week withtons of bug fixes and optimisation and Since the Xbox announcement thoabsolutly nothing. And they're going even further. Brendon confirmed that they defently want to make this game crossplay at some point. I am sorry but this is a ing joke. Theres simply NO way on earth to make this game crossplay able.On end will always have a huge disadvantage. Rather it be the Xbox for playing with controlleror the Computer because controllers will have aim assist. Brendan actually already said that he likesthe way that Destiny managed the aim assist. Its not only aim assist but "magnetic bullets" . Means thataslong as your bullet is close enough to the body it will just hit the body anyways.Also I don't see ANY point in making this game a full release this year. I am pretty sure that NOBODYwould have any problems with it beeing a bit longer early acces until everything is finally fixed. Buttrying hard to make it this year just seems pointless. I am not willing to pay for a game that's running with 16hz Tickrate servers desync of hell thousands bugs a kinda still bad sound engine. review: This game has two modes.Fun and irritating. One thing I lack in terms of skill for this game is turning off the part of my brain that says "Rush them now". It worked very well in other games like CSGO / Battlefield 3 / 4 (combined 4 KDR in Battlefield) but it doesn't work in PUBG. I am literally for the first time an average player. And that's fun. It's challenging. Playing against a pool of 3 million players at any given time is going to be a challenge.But for the love of god region lock China. I can't even play in North American servers any more. It's that bad. Chinese players as some of you know have made up about 99% of the total bans according to Battleye. This is not just alarming it's screaming for a solution. The only solution is to region lock. If Bluehole were to region lock China it would off one country but make it easier for the rest of the planet to play under the impression that there's a level playing field. I have never ever encountered a game with an overwhelming issue of rampant cheating. This game deserves both a recommendation and yet no recommendation at all. I'm choosing to recommend this game because of how much fun I have had with friends in European servers.

review: tldr It's a great game when you can look past the poor optimization the hackers and the awful servers. The game is meant to run at 60 fps on a GTX 1060 but in my experience rarely reaches that point and fluctuates constantly. Besides this the game rewards those who play on lower settings by making it easier to spot enemies as it gets rid of most of the foliage. In a game as competitive as this it seems odd that a player with a capable PC would be punished for wanting their game to look good.The hackers though not a big issue are still quite common. I usually only play the game for 2 3 hours at a time and more often than not I run into one during that time. The amount has died down but could certainly be taken care of better.The servers are probably my biggest issue with the game. I live in NA and am met with lag in at least 2 of the matches I play in the few hours I spend on the game despite playing on NA servers. Though it's mostly short bursts of 5 10 seconds of desync they tend to come back sometimes every 5 or so minutes while other times it returns every 30 ish seconds.The regional servers are also a big issue. Despite having servers for various regions players aren't locked to whichever region they live in. Though I can't speak for the rest NA servers overflow with people from other regions Asia being the most common. This wouldn't be such an issue for me but they take advantage of the heavy desync caused by this which makes it next to impossible to kill them. It's gotten to the point where most of my matches are half full of people from other servers many times exceeding this. Playing against others abusing desync and using it to their advantage ruins the game and makes for a very irritating experience.With the newest update 1.0 a vaulting system was added in. The system helped to change the game dramatically and did a pretty good job in my opinion but could certainly be reworked. The system was meant to feel seamless allowing you to get over obstacles quickly without them slowing you down a ton. Instead vaulting feels clunky often starting with a brief pause before you climb over something and then another brief pause after. These pauses make the system more annoying than it is helpful.To sum it up the game's great but its underlying issues prevent it from shining and reaching its full potential. Though I recommend avoiding this game for now that may change in the future should they optimize the game improve their anti cheat and fix the servers.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Just sometimes comes up and annoys you.FINALLY "aim down sights" can be put from toggle to "while button is pressed".Sadly there is still no way for you to properly test the guns on a test map or anything. You get less than 60 seconds before the start of each game to make a run for guns to test on a super small island north east of the actual island you will later play on.Any guns with a range greater than 60 meters (aka everything aside from pistols) can't be tested also you get NO attachments on that mini island.So good luck testing on your own how attachments work out for you...Except on the new map where you get no guns at all before the start.Hitboxes have improved quite a lot but still are wonky at some places.Mantling improved gameplay and feel a lot!Now if they fix the loot table on Miramar...

Bugs have not been addressed many more have been added. Hit detection is pure trash and the server tick and desync and lag spikes have gotten worse.The devs either are useless and incompetant (multiple daily patches for seemingly no reason leads me to think thats a yes) or they just dont care or both.At this point if you have not bought it DON'T don't give them more money wait til they get their sorted or die. If you need a battle royal game fortnite seems to be the way to go they have hackers under control hit detection seems to be on point and server rates are about 22 30hz where pubg is 2 8hz. If you dont like the cell shaded build and shoot of fortnite i don't really have any alternatives. The others of the like where radical heights that went under and the other free ones by the cancer team that made warz/infection survivor stories/romeros aftermath plus that horrid wild west game. There is still H1Z1 but thats got a pretty toxic community and over run by chinese greifers.But really at this point dont support this game players are jumping because its sinking. Also when you run into a hacker or an exploiter 9/10 times its one of the Asian players on the OC servers. So frustrating. Until they fix their servers go play another BR game.If they dont fix their games like fortnite will end up taking all of their players.

review: HERE lie the answers to the questions you may have (For those who HAVE played H1Z1)Q Is it as good as King of the Kill? A Actually it's better. (Visuals Mechanics Variety Pace)(General Questions)Q Is it a good Early Access game? A It's pretty good yeah. (Surprising quality Addictive gameplay)Q Is it worth $29.99? A No. Unless you constantly play survival games and enjoy repetition anyway. (You WILL play more than 2 hours worth if you purchase it and enjoy survival)(Closing remarks)No horrible glitches encountered. Occasional main menu freezes brief framerate drops and delayed action (picking up items/weapons) are the worst I've experienced. This game is brand spanking new. It isn't going to be smooth. If you want a full product wait. If you want to be a part of the developmental stages don't wait.Bye.

review: Easily one of the clunkiest glitchy games I've played in years. God forbid you lean next to a window. Or try to aim over a ledge. I really couldn't tell you how this the most played game on Steam. It boggles my mind. It's just the default Unreal FPS example project but with a circle that closes in on you. I really don't know how they could have screwed it up this badly. Even the menu is broken everytime we play. Everyone ready's up one guy is not ready. He ready's up then all of us unready somehow. Someone is in a lobby with singles even though it shows them in our lobby.Don't even get near the vehicles. Hit a crack in the ground? Prepare to somehow break the laws of physics and flip over or go flying hundreds of feet in the air. I mean we have vehicles in so many games and they all work fine. There are vehicle assets that you can buy in Unreal. I really don't know why they are exclusively bad to this game. The maps are great and there is a good variety of weapons and gameplay styles. It's fun to play with friends. Verdict 3/10

review: This game has some of the worst game devs and customer service I have ever seen... The game has very laggy servers (at least for NA) that are almost impossible to play on. I have been killed many times through indestructible walls and/or objects and some of the times it isn't always the server. The amount of cheaters in this game is unbelievable... about half of the games I've played of PUBG has been filled with cheaters (I know that this is an issue for most games but it is very very prominent in this game. Also region locking servers to IP's would make the amount of cheaters on NA servers decrease).These cheats ranging from aimlock speedhacks or the most seen... no recoil scripts. On top of all this the game still has lots of bugs that should have been fixed a long time ago... For example taking 75% of your players health on parachuting in (when you don't even fall from a high distance) or like I said earlier dying through walls that can't even be shot through. Listen... although this game can be enjoyable at sometimes it really is lacking or in need of the crucial pieces of the puzzle to make a great game GREAT. Thanks for reading and I hope this helps anyone thinking about buying.
