review: 30 EUR for this piece of crap of a game...but let's just sum up the game itself CONS it's buggy as hell and they ignore it instead of fixing the damn 'frying pan helmet' bug they release an update adding a fog and crappy skins. the movement controls make me feel like I'm crippled or partially paralysed. picking up items is cancer in it's purest form sometimes the animation goes through and you hear the sound as if you've picked the item but it's still on the damn ground. weaponry selection is very very poor in fact majority of weapons you find are useless against snipers not to mention asset store models. nades trajectory line shows WRONG trajectory! You aim it at the window and it bouncess off of the top portion of the frame not following the drawn trajectory at all. windows sometimes don't break when you throw nades into them no that's not a 'feature'. zone favours 3 major spots in game spots which if you don't reach them early in the game you won't get there at all that's a promise. the menu.. have never seen anything so badly made in my life. I'm really surprised that no matter what I click I have to pray it doesn't pop an error and it ing does most of the time it'll get me "connection closed" or "matchmaking failed". lag spikes.. there's just so many of them in the least wanted times. shooting recoil aiming.. this game doesn't follow any rules of 'skill' it follows mainly rule of who saw who first (which in 99% of times is the guy with a sniper rifle). parachutes.. landing with them near any structures is painful just fly too close to a builiding and you'll fall from little to no height and lose 70% of your health not to mention that you can get stuck for eternity. third person.. just don't play in third person.. really.PROS vehicles they are quite fine playing with friends is funI do not recommend this game in the current state even if it's 'WIP' they still would rather add fog and skins (more ways for them to earn money) rather than improving the game.

review: For a game that can so satisfying to play it really is disappointing for it to be so fundamentally poorly designed and inconsistent. Every Patch that supposedly brings about fixes makes the game seemingly operate worse mostly in the under the hood stuff that my brain can't think of a word for it. But sometimes it comes in game form too I don't know why the crossbow was added back into the game regular firearms give little feedback on missed shots and damage as it is but the crossbow? May as well only pick it up just so your enemies realize they wasted their ammo killing you. At least firearms give you a puff of dirt or a puff of blood not that it's much better when it feels like you unload a 7 10 shots into a dude and watch his organs apparently liquify into a red mist and watch him run gaily off into the distance. Meanwhile you can be decked out in some hot new military grade and get blasted away with what seems to be a single round. And that is where the greatest fault of this game is besides it general optimization and performance is that the lag makes every gunfight feel like joke. Hard enough to factor in bullet drop and movement into a shot but factoring in random lag feels like an unnecessary task. It makes it impossible to tell if you really outclassed someone with your marksmanship or tactical skills when to them they emptied a gallon of 12 gauge into you and it did diddly. And with this newest patch adding in the nice feature of pausing the game and telling you "Network Lag Detected" not if it is yours or the host or what and leaving you a sitting duck for your enemies or just ending the game session altogether. All of this brings down a somewhat fun island battle royale but the constant feeling of getting cheated when you lay into someone and it breezes over them like a spring wind and then get steamrolled with a single bullet harkens back to trash like CoD. This game can be fun with friends but you'll only really get consistant fun if you are playing wildly and not playing to win because that will be a struggle for 98% of people.

review: This is a game which gives me both pleasure and the sense of defeated.I got this game in about May or June in 2017. During that time the game stayed unfinished. The menu was built by web and needed to load every time I opened it. It was not friendly to Chinese internet at first. I really had a hard time to connect to the server. Each time I got several kills and heard another man's sound my game would crash or the internet would go down. It killed me honestly. But this game is good. I continued playing this game till now and everything seems fine. The FPS was stablized the internet issues were "about" fixed(though I got some loss sometimes.) Though TPP was full of unfairness and hackers hmmm I mean this game is still playable once you are patient enough and pay less hope of getting a chicken dinner. The game is progressing hope it will be better in the future. Hope there will be fewer hackers and more fairness... Peace out.

review: I only have invested two hours at the time of writing this review but having said that I have tried the base mechanics and have a general understanding of the game. Even though the graphics are a little old for it's time it is clear that they possess a certain charm to them which is reminiscent to the S.T.A.L.K.E.R series. The frame rate is excellent and runs very smoothly which helps gunfights and player actions commence seemlessly and naturally. The looting system is well designed with higher tier gear on the Hostile NPC's and 'civilian grade' guns located in the world. The quest system isn't particually my cup of tea but those who enjoy RPG's might take a shining to this. The AI in the world is well balanced and poses a REAL threat unlike some other survival games dayz *cough*. The only complaint so far is that the temperature and illness system needs to be nerfed as it is almost impossible to traverse at night without freezing up and dying. TL DR Cheap survival game with fun pvp gameplay and interesting pve interactions.

review: I have played this game for over 300 hours now so I feel like I can actually write a decent review for this game. This game is a must play to start off. Early access must be kept in mind for the entirety of this review even though this is an extremely positive one.Most games I get bored of pretty quickly and don't have enough replay value for me to keep coming back to them. This is the game that cures all. Countless hours have been spent parachuting into the battleground looting countless numbers of buildings and either killing other players or getting killed. Although I have 30 chicken dinners I have over 500 rounds played between solo duos and squad. The constant weekly/monthly updates makes me excited to see new features and how the game has improved. I started off playing before the first monthly update and after two major updates this game has improved tremendously. Sure there are games where I load in and all the buildings look like claymation the game crashes and network lag ensues. This game brings me back no matter what. I've met new friends playing this game and it has made me more happy than frustrated. Thumbs up!

review: Nice Battle Royal Game.Gets worse performance with every patch. At least no more mouse over menus.Rubberbanding hacking Lootcrates while being buggy as hell...The whole game is pretty close to rolling a dice. First 1 2 Minutes laggy/rubber banding (guess what happens if more than just 1 player starts at the same place). And afterwards it is either "kill as much as possible" or "camp your way 'til the end". This game is far away from being "E Sports ready". Glitching through stuff a lot of visual and audio bugs vehicle misbehaviour aso.I would like to give positive feedback but after so much time... I understand that people need to earn money and that marketing is part of it but releasing an unfinished game just because you added some more features doesn't mean that you finished it. You ended it.I will keep an eye on this but there is just too much wrong with this.This game has/had a lot of potential and used it in some degree but it is far away from a clean PvP experience.I still have hope. And do not misunderstand me I had fun. From this point of view the game did nothing wrong.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I can't in all honesty recommend this game right now. The server system is completely broken and is completely flooded with players from China. I have no problem playing with players from other countries and I find that the Chinese players are very skilled. I've been playing squad matches all day today and matched with 1 just 1 other player who spoke English. This is on the North American server. How can I possibly work with teammates if they all speak a different language? There needs to be some sort of limitation as this is entirely turning me off to the game. I don't fully understand why all the Chinese players play on the North American server to begin with.

review: Battlegrounds is easily the best Battle Royale game to date and it is a good middleground between the realistic Arma 3 version and the arcade game feeling that King of the Kill gives. It is also already more polished than H1Z1 and it has a much larger gun selection and a lot more gear to use. It is the most balanced Battle Royale game as well and you never feel like you died because of the game you always feel like it's your own fault and that you actually did something wrong which is good.

review: Although it's still in early access this game is one of the best games I've played in terms of pure fun.It understands exactly what it wants to do and it perfects it from the strategic decisions that you have to make every second whether it's where you land or how you approach an area where you think there are other people to the straight action and tension you have every match you'll rarely be disappointed and if you are then you're disappointed with your poor performance. The devs are also very open about their vision and what's important to them which makes it feel like you always have an outlet for your questions and problems. All in all if you want to do a barrel roll to the top of a building just so you could attack from above while your teammates attack from below a team inside the building you're in for a ride literally!

review: So far I've played the game 43.2 hours and I have to say while it can be boring at times it's only if you use my previous tactic of sitting in a building for an hour and not actually playing the game properly. I've yet to come across a hacker to my knowledge (except for one questionable death in the PTR). The game is very entertaining in my opinion.However there are some issues with the game 1. The game's optimisation is awful I recommend you play with very low everything except textures which I have at medium.2. The game as it is can be a bit boring but it is in early access and is being updated frequently. I currently mainly play on the PTR due to the climbing mechanic and new map which makes the game much better.3. The point rewards system is unbalanced between solos duos and squads.Overall though PUBG is a great game that has a lot of potential.

review: I still love/hate this game and I can't recommend it. What a waste. They could have easily learned from the mistakes of H1Z1. They could have listened to the players.The idea of Battle Royale has been such a blast in gaming. I saw the rise and fall of H1Z1 and I can plainly see the same mistakes causing the same problems all over again.People have been asking for ping lock for months now they finally implemented some half measure and you still get people with 300+ ping able to shoot you around a corner. Still broken.People have been asking for better anti cheat since this game started. Ever play DayZ? The same garbage anti cheat BattleEye that does not work there also does not work on PUBG. People with ESP can see you through walls shoot you through walls with iron sights at 400m while you are driving a motorcycle because they have auto aim. I stopped counting the amount of times I ran into cheaters long ago.People have been asking for better optimization and bug fixes. They've been working on it but come on they released this out of Early Access and we still have same bugs for months. How many squad games have I played in which myself or one of my squad members get stuck on a load screen and have to reboot their game? And really after generating a billion in revenue you would think this company would do more to listen.We still only have 2 maps We still only have the 1 game mode zombie mode is pointless as it is so I cannot count more than just the battle royale. The only content being added are cosmetic skins for micro transactions. They keep adding skins and creating a market for the skins and their crates and this draws in many players who only play to try and generate profit! They will either idle their games or they cheat to get quick points to purchase crates. Even if/when they eventually get banned they have already generated enough to buy another copy of the game on another account. It is really disheartening. I really enjoyed this game and at times I still do. I just know it could have been so much better and with all the financial support it has received I believe it should have been. TL DR I've had a lot of fun in this game but I can no longer recommend it. Hopefully things might change sometime soon but if it doesn't you should probably save your money because this is going to end up a sinking ship just like H1Z1.5/10Follow our curator page here https //store.steampowered.com/curator/6716139 Nox Noctis Gentis Obscurum
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: These are the bad guys.Bluehole's practices are rivaled by the likes of EA. As far as I'm concerned the game is still in early access. But they slapped a "1.0 update" on the game to cash in on some loots crates and cashing in is all they've done since. PUBG started out with a lot of promise (hence my 400 hrs) and paved the way for a lot of future battle royale games. But they way they've handled the game is something I cannot endorse. Now with the annoucement of an "Event Pass" I must finally uninstall. They charge $30 dollars for the game. The only progression system is locked behind a gambling based paywall and now they peddle a $10 pass available for a "limited time" for a CHANCE at exclusive items. All while core aspects of the game are are still at beta level stardards. They are even REMOVING features (FPP on OCE/map selection).Vote with your dollar guys our actions will influence the next games we buy. And if I can leave you with any lasting impression let it be this Hail Hydra

review: Overall this game is heaps of fun when playing with friends. It's a great battle royale game and has an easy learning curve once you get the mechanics settled in.However you can definitely walk upon a numerous amount of flaws from the game usually expected from a early access title. The optimization is a little bitter as the performance doesn't necessarily bode well and is accompanied with some major frame drops when entering the lobby. FPS can be seen to be lost in many occasions with particular graphics cards unless properly configured to lower/lowest settings in which help boost the frames The hit registration can feel disheartening at times as well as most times just leave you wondering how or what. The spectating can also use some work as most players can be seen to be aiming or firing in unusual spots when they are really pointing elsewhere. The vehicles can be better done as well due to its lack of proper movement. Especially with entering vehicles the game can be better helped with fixing the delay or lack of input when trying to enter one. But just as I had stated this game is fun. It's addictive and deserves the amount of gaming time I give it. The developers sincerely care about this game and are working hard to make sure it stays as one of the great games on steam. Every flaw I had put up above is actively being solved and is giving most players no worries. Everything from optimization to damage output is being looked on and solved.Overall this early access game has given me its full attention and I recommend it to any person willing to rage every now and then just as with most competitive games.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It looked really fun when I saw my friends play and some online gamer streams of the game. When I bought it not so much. I quickly realized that the game is extremely time consuming and the combat is sparse and very poorly designed. There are good games and there are bad games... some where you have NO GEAR and manage survive for 40 minutes just sitting and running or the games where you have all the gear and you are clearing a house and get ambushed and killed in 1 shot. So there is a lot of ecitement and not very much continued enjoyment. It is more like waiting in a 30 minute line for a rollercoaster that only lasts 2 minutes. There is some realism to the gameplay but it just does not feel like a 2017 game. It feels like a 2009 game at best. Cool concept needs serious development.

review: I can see why people enjoy this game but it's not my cup of tea.. and here's why.I have around three hours of experience in this game which is enough to make a review.The game's literal goal is to not get killed. This means you can win by camping or killing everyone else.But here's the fun part the play area gets decreased over time. the players outside of the play area will receive damage over time this means they have to rush inside the play area otherwise they'll die.The concept is pretty simple but why does it have such a large playerbase?I think because it's a great game to play with friends. It's fun to team up and plan strategies to eliminate the enemies.Also the game's world is very big which makes it pretty cool. This means no game is the same because you will be playing on different locations.So why am i not recommending this game?I think the concept of the game is pretty cool. But i cannot stand the game mechanics.The aiming is terrible and so is the way you shoot your guns. It's all very clunky maybe because i am used to playing CS and Quake and stuff but still..Another thing that is really annoying is the way parachutes work in this game once you are close to the ground with the parachute you will slow down so extremely much everyone will know where you have landed. (Please take some notes from the Just cause series).Also i think the game is way overpriced. $30 is nowhere near the value of this game $15 would be more reasonable.Conclusion Wait for it to go on sale it's not worth $30.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Very nice game but frustrating at the same time.There are a lot of corner campers 3rd person peekers and sudden deaths in this game you can have this crazy game where you get 8 kills with amazing headshots but then get one shotted by a shotgun who is lying down in the grass making no sound and no movement. On the other hand getting that first chicken dinner is an amazing feeling and the action and looting is really what makes this game great. The combat system is pretty good as well and nerve racking at the same time. Early game situations can be very funny due to the panic everybody has looting as fast as possible and fighting everybody. Don't go to school if you don't want to die. ) 29 99 is a pretty damn good price if you ask me for a game that's played by over a million people every day.Go get it if you don't have it. I have played about 80 hrs right now and my aim is still potato.Also notice that this game is still in early access and already so much has been added to the game like a new city new guns etc. This game is going to be great and have new game modes as well. Also very little bugs encountered so far.You do have to have a (semi) high end PC 'cause the FPS can go crazy even on High ends especially in early game also connection can be pretty bad some games. That's a down sider but sure they'll fix it in the future.

review: I would rather vote to repeal net neutrality than to play one more round of this garbage.At best this game is like chewing gum. Great and fresh in the beginning but quickly becomes stale uninteresting and completely pointless. At worst it's a poorly optimized buggy hacker infested dumpster fire run by people that would rather sell a 5% share of their company to a company that DEVELOPS HACKS FOR THEIR GAME than to actually put in a working anti cheat. The best way I've seen someone describe this is "95% running through a field 3% looking at bushes that look like people 2% actually fighting" The basic formula of the game is simple and interesting but it fundamentally fails in executing almost every single aspect of simple game design. Allow me to break it down into the 7 deadly sins of battlegrounds. 1. Movement on foot is slow and feels like you're waist deep in water. Driving the various vehicles in the game even without the bugs that instantly kill you is mostly frustrating. Bikes take a lot of practice to not immediately flip over and kill you just by touching the slightest pebble. Most other vehicles save for the buggy either spin out or flip over so easily you'd be better off walking sometimes. 2. The shooting is complete and total garbage. What happens when you attempt to make a realistic shooter in an engine that was designed to make fast paced arena shooters? Guns that have no weight or satisfying punch to them (save the AWM M24 and M249). Just aiming in general is awkward as it in keeping tradition with the moving feels like I'm underwater or swimming in jello. Half the time the game can't decide if it wants to do call of duty hitscanning or battlefield/arma "your bullets go out of where your gun is pointing not where you're aiming". Which makes quick reaction based flick shots near impossible. 3. The graphics are just plain ugly and uninteresting. Maybe the game looks better on higher settings but...4. The optimization makes Dayz blush in how ridiculously pathetic it is. It has definitely gotten better over time going from "completely unplayable" to "begrudgingly playable". This is on a rig that runs literally every game except for large MMOs on complete ultra 120 fps+ (battlefield 1 battlefront 2 doom just cause 3 etc) I get above 60 fps so infrequently on this game that it's confusing when it happens. 5. The servers are ing pathetic. I can't begin to recall just how many firefights I've lost simply because my bullets don't register as hitting when I'm actively watching them leave my gun and enter the guy 5 feet in front of me (sometimes with blood splatters just for the added "yeah you buddy"). Dropping into populated centers like school military and po i acts more of a lottery on who can stop lagging and pick up the gun first. It's very VERY common to be smashing f on a gun with your character doing the animation of picking it up multiple times just for someone else to come over and pick it up and shoot you. And if that doesn't happen expect to see groups of three people all huddled around one gun frantically spamming f hoping they stop lagging first.6. The community is a disaster. I've only seen people this arrogant stupid and toxic in the likes of Dota 2 and LoL. Look in the forums and you'll see thousands of people shouting off the exact same lines. "Lol get good I win 9/10 games I play" "the game is early access you can't criticize it" "not everyone that kills you is a hacker" And speaking of hackers...7. This game has more hackers than a lady of the night has genital warts. They are EVERY WHERE. From speed hackers to aimbotters to people that kill half the server "by punch" if you can think of a way that this game can be hacked there's people doing it. There are numerous other smaller issues (sound design being plain awful generic menu music bad map design) but they pale in comparison to everything else. Writing this review feels like breaking up with a partner that you know has been cheating on you. this game to the moon and back. Never again.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

It's clear these developers have no clue how to fix this issue. Fortnite is killing this game for very good reason same exact game engine (Unreal 4) yet better hitreg and less lag. I'm not sure why PUBG won't hire some Epic devs to come over and fix the game? Or at least contract that work? Makes no sense to me.

review: I dont review things very often but i have been seeing all the hate/negative reviews on here and so i think i need to write a more positive one. It is true that most of the things in the negative reviews are real and people have good right to be frusterated and angry at how everything is going currently. I know it really pisses me off and i think its marketing on their part as ill never buy another game from these guys without a real hard second look as to what im actually getting. All that aside though the game itself is an amazing game there is nothing that compares to pubg in my opinion. As far as the bugs go i feel they have made a fair amount of progress. Sure everynow and then ill have to shoot someone 10+ times to get a kill but that is very rare and stuff like that happens in almost every fps game. Summary If you want a game that is lots of fun that you can play by yourself or with friends and you dont care about having the cooliest outfit and gun skins then i deffinately would recommend this game. review: GREAT GAME !!! Just need more features and improvements Welp what else can I say ? This game has a huge hype and a big sale rate to back it up.But believe the hype ! Worth the price tag ? Just perhaps .EASILY a very addicting game and the first one to make me like "survival/ battle royale" concept as Im sure you already know of .It's pure fun ! You can go solo/duo/squads.Still in Early Access ( &amp hopefully not forever) so it IS buggy and still has a lot of room for improvements.Also many developers has their eyes on this concept now that PUBG has popularized it.So the devs of this game need to add features and keep it updated to keep its appeal .Which hopefully they do because we &lt 3 the game !!!There is Fortnite but that ha s adifferent approach .Some improvements I would suggest are more added features like customizations (more complex character edits etc) weapons... More stuff to keep it exciting like more interesting maps &amp weapons places... Definitely needs better optimization as well. Also I think some elements of the combat mechanism could be improved. Like melee attacks are kind of awkward and not as smooth. Simple stuff like pressing a single button to immediately hack away with a melee weapon or one button to throw grenades/bombs ... As oppose to assigning it to a slot and activating it via the attack button. Maybe even more modes I would honestly want one where it is more focused on survival with th eneed of food consumption animal attacks etc. Ain't that fun ? xDPROS ______ Good &amp realistic graphics (which makes it more intense and sort of immersive) Pure fun gameplay Big population easy &amp quick matchmakingCONS ______ Still Buggy laggy &amp not optimized well Need more customization items and features Need Improved combat mechanism A small thing but better menu/ UI &gt a premium lookThat's all I can think of for now

review: I find this game very addicting at times. Sometimes I play too much and I go do something else but then I always come back to it! After getting a beta key from a friend and then finally paying up a couple weeks after release I don't regret it.Since I've been playing the game has gotten a lot more optimized new vehicles and weapons already the spectator sound issue has somewhat been fixed and a couple more things. However there are plenty of things still wrong with this game First I think the sound system needs improvement. It's SO much better than the beta (because now gun sounds actually sound distant because they are distant not sound distant when they are fairly close) but just listening for where shots come from is screwed up. For example if I hear shots that sound like they are coming from my left I go look towards the left but when I look left where I thought it came from (while shots are still going) it still sounds more to my left nearly directly behind where I was looking at first. I can tell you that it isn't my headphones or my hearing because all my friends have this problem too. Secondly the supressed shots have gotten better but still need work. If you are out of a certain distance you are unable to hear where the shots are coming from (I am used to ArmA where there are bullet snaps as they go by you). This gives anyone with a supressor plenty of time to finish of a kill or even mess with you.Getting out of the sound problems the hit registering still needs some work. It's worse than Battlefield 4 on release because I will be hidden behind cover and then seconds later (YES SOMETIMES SECONDS) I will have taken damage from someone else. So far from what I've witnessed it's people with bad internet connections that have this advantage. I personally have really good internet speeds but it seems that people who I see rubberbanding around are the ones who are able to hit me while I'm behind cover. Sometimes when you kill someone you still take a few bullets right after their face falls to the ground but the dev's thought of this and made it where their bullets don't do any damage which is nice but this is a big problem if they aren't dead yet.Enough with the negatives let me talk about the positives! Killing people in this game is more satisfying than any other Battle Royale type game ever! I think that matches go by pretty fast actually. People say the game is too slow and it might be to some people but personally the matches are around the same length of time as King of the Kill but much faster than ArmA 3 Battle Royale. Obviously duo's make matches more lengthy and squad matches can last even more longer than duo's but it's so worth it. If you die after looting for 15 minutes you still might rage quit but you probably won't uninstall. DayZ on the other hand even though it isn't a Battle Royale game it's a whole other story... The super unrealistic blood splatter is so satisfying to see while hearing the amazing gun sounds they have in this game. The mechanics for holding you breath are so fantastic and remind me of the game Squad but better. There are plenty more positives it's just too long to list.Some people say this game is skill based some people say this game is luck based. The truth is it's both. You can be unlucky in this game in plenty of ways that can be frusterating and you can be extremely lucky by having potato aim and ending up in the top ten because of where you started but realistically it's always a combination of both. An example? You might have the worst possible position known to man in the last minutes of battle but are able to react fast enough to kill whoever might kill you first. If you can't then practice. This game isn't like ArmA 2 where whoever peaks first dies it's whoever knows the map guns and the games advantages and disadvantages that will thrive. TL DR This game is very fun. It's very satisfying to kill people and your heartbeat rises as the number of people remaining shrinks. This game isn't skill based or luck based it's a combination of both. There are some problems that need fixing but aren't always game breaking. This game can be frusterating at times but is overall a fantastic gaming experience. I was initally waiting on purchasing this game during the Steam summer sale to save that extra couple dollars or so but I eventually gave in and it's been worth every penny!P.S. Lets all pray that the Dev's don't everything up like The Culling. Remember that game? Yeah... Yeeeah....... Yeeeeeeeaahhhh........

review: Written after 35+ hours After having tried and hated The Culling I was pretty sceptical about the hype on PUBG. The BR type of game just sounded like an even bigger reason to rage quit and go bananas over a random bullet ripping you a second one compared to die quick/respawn quick games.And actually I was not so wrong about the rage part. Getting your face blown away by surprise in some dirty bathroom by a guy with a shotgun who heard you and set up an ambush is not a pleasant experience for you nor for your keyboard or even neighbours depending on how much of a frustrated person you are. That being said I still absolutely love the experience and the adrenaline rushes that come in different flavors Paradropping on your target praying to Jesus our Lord &amp Savior that no one else would drop with you seeing that 5 other guys are doing exactly the same thing running as fast as you can setting the houses upside down looking for whatever could be used as a weapon hearing a door opening downstairs rushing the intruder with a frying pan smashing his nose in enjoy the sweet taste of a small victory. OH GOD OH GOD OH GOD Minding your own business in an attic as a proud owner of a slightly rusty 1911 scavenging for an energy drink or two when you hear a jeep pulling over. You peak and see a fully stuffed rambo coming your way. You tighten your grip on your pistol as you feel your bladder abandon you. OH GOD OH GOD OH GOD No idea how this happened but you're in the top 10 and now eating grass in a very narrrow zone most likely surrounded by meanies. You litteraly feel your heart accelerate and can see your aim shake through your 8x scope. You're drooling and can't help but throw your headset in the air when the screen fades to finally display your triumph. You made it. You f!cking made it. You start throwing gansta signs in the air and repeatedly yell at an imaginary crowd to enquire about who their paternal figure is. You're not sure but you feel like you just gained 2cm down there. OH GOD OH GOD OH GODDidn't even mention the duo/squad mode the amazing map and much more11/10 would punch my family out of anger after getting shot by a camping noob again
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: EDIT Also updating my review to mention the RIDICULOUS SERVER issues this game has. I can't connect with my friends i can't access the main menu. Servers are busy servers are not responding servers are offline Connection closed reconnect connection closed again. This is just ridiculous.Alright so this game is pretty much a phenomenon by now thanks to all the streamer/youtuber and media hype. Truth is its actually a really good game idea and PUBG is definitely the best iteration of the idea. There's a really good game to be had when everything is working fine.However things are not working fine most of the time. The game has ridiculous hitbox issues extreme lag issues and weird graphical bugs. To give you a few examples about the graphical bugs a few times i've spawned and there were no buildings rendered making me able to see other players inside them and run them over with cars even though they were inside buildings! Other times i spawned and all the buildings were rendered as distant lod making them completely unusable.Trust me when i say that these are not hardware related issues as i have a quite powerful pc.Patches are infrequent and long awaited promised features and bug fixes are nowhere to be seen. However the developers have plenty of time instead to implement paid lootboxes and a steam marketplace with ridiculously expensive ingame cosmetic items even though they promised that the game would never contain such things!!Listen i get it. They're taking the opportunity to make as much money from this game since it was such an unexpected hit and has completely blown up and sold over ten million copies. I don't hold it against them that they're trying to make as much money as possible however they should first deliver everything that they promised fix all the bugs and then make 400$ ingame coats that add nothing gameplay wise.Final conclusion its a fun game but Its riddled with bugs maybe they'll fix maybe not. This is early access we're talking about.

review: Addendum as of 11th June 2018 almost a year from this first posting.Since the history of this game it has had bad press due to poor representation from it's developers it's had poor management poor focus and absolute poor quality in what could of turned into a fun game which changed completely the moment they added in crates and pushed for full release. This game was fun even with those bugs back in the Early Access because we'd assume these would be fixed and the company cared to refine and define the genre fast forward and we've still have a low quality product as we had then with just some extra content. The issues is poor networking poor processing/coding. This game would be bearable if it was fluid but the actions of the devs themselves are a laughing stock this product has a stain that can not be shaken and as for it's future it is not bright. Companies that act like this ( suing under false pretences using absurd reasoning rather than using rational reasons shows them as petty and petulant corporation company what ever they wish to call themselves ) Should not be supported in my opinion look at their history to see what I mean. This game is bare bones minimal to what it can offer. Fortnite and the others that have come after it you may not like it but they bring ingenuity and quality.So if you haven't yet decided whether you want this game or not I have to slap a big NO on this product save your money buy and enjoy something that will be less frustrating and that supports a deserved developer. Early access review.I have enjoyed the game with over 380 hours to date. The problem lies upon the Company itself and their behaviour.1. The face and name of the title Playerunknown had stated that no micro transactions would be in the game during early access. Whether he has the power or not the fact that this man is the face of the company for PUGB and clearly stated that such would not happen only for the company to do so. A lie is a lie no matter how you spin it.2.The attitude from the company to the players this isn't just a PR team problem it's the company as a whole. The fact they're allowing people to continue to publicly speak where they say the resolution to being greifed is to not use Auto matching. As if it's your fault for wanting to just play a game with random people. Other incidents involving banning of players who defend themselves against those who wish to teamkill and ruin your experience and to latest date banned because streamers cry stream sniping. Apparently it's always our fault and not theirs.Overall I can't condone business practices like this nor should anyone else. This isn't about cosmetics this is about abhorrent behaviour from a company that basically do what they wish and seem to not care how it comes across.Update PU apologised for said behaviour with crates.however to note he didn't do this through his personal twitter account after a week of twitter and discord comments defending the crate fiasco and not showing any signs of apologetic behaviour only to place his apology in a patch notes as opposed to his personal twitter after being lambasted by the community and more importantly from known figures in the gaming industry such as TotalBiscuit. This was a corporate apology at best and feels non sincere. There was also no mention of mistakes and apologies for their banning policy or PR. If they had simply come out sooner and used their mediums such as twitter that they used to defend this as opposed to wait for a patch after a week and acknowledged their PR disaster I would of removed my negative review.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pubg is a fun game when it first came out i had alot of fun with my friends playing this game i was playing this game when it came out maybe 2 or 3 months after it' early access launch so here's what i have to say about PlayerUnknown's BattleGrounds after a year of it being in development and it's out of early access launch.I can describe this game as a Realistic Military kind of Battle Royale game everything moves slow and steady compare to other battle royale games that are "Fast Pace" like H1Z1 and Fornite but this game is getting alot of negative reviews recently so let me say why people don't like this game that much compare to before when Pubg clips would be on social media alot.So let's beginHACKERS Pubg is almost unplayable because of the amount of hackers in a game mostly some are from china causing people to ban china from the game or make a server region just for them.Battle Eye does do the job of banning hackers but even with Battle Eye banning thousands of hackers a day it can't keep up with the ridiculous amount of hackersOPTIMIZATION This is mostly spoken about in the community forums about how the game runs poorly on low end and even high end hardware because of poor optimization of Unreal Engine 4.Server performances are also in this since picking up an item especially dragging it to your inventory might take a couple tries because of the latency or dying because of lag.I know the optimization of the game has been slightly better compare to before after it's out of early access launch but well this game isn't really fully optimized yetCRASHES when i started playing the game again after months since launch mid game in a shotgun fight my game crashed and when i load up the lobby the game crashes. I don't know if it's only me but this is so annoying especially in an intense fight when it crashes on you randomlyREPETITIVE I gotta admit that it was so much fun getting a chicken dinner especially if it was your first time but i find it really boring winning since the coins they reward you for winning or dying after a game isn't worth it in my opinion i don't know if i'm that unlucky but i get jack from opening a crate or i get a crate that needs a key to be opened and if you expect to earn profit because of the in games items trust me you can't sell Pubg items anymore but even if you could old stuff is barely worth anything mostly gun skins or new clothes are mostly selling for a high price now.IS THIS GAME WORTH YOUR TIME AND MONEY?If you like this type of game then sure it's worth it if other battle royale games don't fit your style but i find it really boring to play this game since well you do the samething exact thing over and over again.I know there are new weapons cosmetics and maps coming soon but tbh with you all i see BlueHole doing is just adding new content instead of fixing a broken game and don't get me started how bad this game is on Xbox.PUBG was fun at first when it came out but now i find it really boring and repetitive nothing new just more skins weapons and maps coming
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: (02/08/17)While the game is fun to play i cannot recommend it at this time because of server issues.For the first 5 minutes or so of the game you will have a tremendous amount of lagg.i cannot even begin to count the amount of time i was one of the first people to die because the moment i got shot at my game froze for about 1 second and then proceeded to lagg for a couple more seconds untill i was dead. Or the amount of times i died because someone could still shoot me due to server latency even though i was actually already behind hard cover. This game has very much potential but unless they fix the servers i cannot recommend it.Edit(17/03/18) Although the servers are now mostly stable the game still has quite some bugs. Also they got a new issue. The game is full of hackers. About 1 in 4 games you will be killed by a hacker using either aimbot recoil reduction wallhack or speedhack. It really ruins the fun in most of your games.

review: I'm unfamiliar with H1Z1 DayZ and some of the other games associated with the game so this a fresh experience for me. This is an outstanding battle royale/king of the hill style game that does a lot of things correctly. The devs are even supporting it with patches and updates on a weekly basis which is uncommon in the Early Access era. I would recommend this game in it's current state. HOWEVER the following aspects absolutely NEED to be improved for this game to grow as noted by the community NEEDS a general/text chat function NEEDS a killcam. You will have no idea how you die 99% of the time camera in close quarters is extremely clunky interferes with combat reward boxes have 0 value. I've opened 3 with in game currency and received an in game t shirt and gas mask.....nothing more. stability issues lag

review: So you purchase this game. The hype is on the skies. You enter the game go for a solo game. Haha you try to loot and when you get the pan you get killed by someone. You stop playing "this game is crap" you think. But then 5 minutes later you start again the game and go for another solo game. You take a more coward approach this time. You go on the side of the map. Wohoo you found a submachinegun. Then you discover that there's a blue area that doesn't look very offensive at the start. So this game becomes Marathon Running Simulator (there's even explosions like in Boston 2013). But unfortunately there's always a guy with a sniper rifle which kills you and he's not even in the same time zone as you with your 50meters range submachinegun. So you stop playing again. The next day oh what a bright day the sun shines outsides the birds are singing so you decide to stay inside and play another solo. You drop in the middle of Po i with other 10 men. So you start looting well a shotgun could always be worst like a frying pan... So you continue looting you hear steps someone is entering your house so you rush to hidde on the bathroom. You camp like a boss you're not even breathing the world record is like 20 minutes without breathing but you're as still as a greece sculpture. He opens the door you hit him once he tries to shoot back but your shotgun is too powerfull and you kill him on the second shot. Congratulations! Your first kill. Now you step outside to loot another house and you get killed. You stop playing you repeat the process. You even make it to the top 10 by playing hide and seek. Eventually after 50 games you learn how to become the hunter. You start getting an average of 2 3 kills per game and you feel like a boss. And finally after trying very hard Winner winner chicken dinner!Release EDIT Since there's a lot of hate recently I want to clarify a bit about this game. First of all the game is very playable and every gaming PC 500$+ should run it in mediums/highs. About the lag there's a bit of lag the first minute of the game but it rapidly gets good. On the EU server i haven't yet seen a hacker i think a lot of people is tilted because they are bad and now with the addition of the deathcam you can clearly see that they don't hack they are just better than you. The new vaulting is 10/10 and it makes first person cam so much entertaining. 30$ buy this game you won't regret it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG is a game that I truly wanted to love. I spent over 400 hours playing it with friends having some of the most intense firefights of any game that I have ever played. However the game comes up so short in almost every way. The game is currently being developed by people who would rather take your money than fix the issues that are killing off the player base. How can a game be "esports ready" when the netcode is 20 hz? Easy answer it can't. Getting killed by another player while being behind a wall getting killed by a random play camping a building without moving for the past 20 minutes or being killed by a player who appears out of no where because the game can't properly display parachutes is just unacceptable. The negatives of the game completely outweigh the positives. It just is an unfinished project but hey you can buy a crate for $2.50 so don't worry their priorities are straight.

review: starter PUBG (Playerunknown's Battlegrounds) is an addicting Third person Every man for himself aspect. It has gripping gameplay. And makes you always stay on your toes with cutting edge combat systems (from ARMA). Gameplay So it has amazing gameplay. You a friend or a squad are dropped down onto a HUGE island. With three objectives. Loot Kill Win. Play competitively against 100 other players (who always seem to ing follow you no matter where you go).Like the title says. It's a battle royale and it's done well. Unlike its counter part H1Z1 Still a good game but too arcadey and un realistic for my tastes. Graphics even though it's in early access and has only been out a couple of months I still have to touch on this. The game is poorly optimized. Favouring the people with better computers who have the advantage of good graphics and decent frames. Even running the game on low with a 960 or 970 would limit your framerate to 40 50. Which is alot to some. But in this game the eye is quicker than the hand in most cases. Meaning frames are everything. To benifit gameplay I'd reccomend going on low graphics for the maximum framrate capability. Weaponry Exept for the frying pan I love the weapons they provide. They have a WIDE veriety of pistols rifles shotguns SMGs ETC.But they all are realistic to an extent. Even though it was modded from arma. The only thing they kept was the balistics. Which are bang on. They make the fights more about skill over luck and spam. The range a shotgun can travel is realistic so is the spread of it. The rifles have a semi realistic drop off point. But i think personally the weather system should effect the bullet drop/speed. But that's just preference. Conclusion It's an outstanding game with amazing balistics addicting gameplay and alot of fun in general but poorly optimized. Leaving an advantage to the people who can afford better PCs + Not many bugs+ Good gameplay+ Action Packed Fun+ Adrenaline feeling+ Amazing with friends+ Many guns to keep on going+ Beautiful graphics+ Not long waiting queue for online matches Some performance and loading issues but not many Teamkillers and lone wolf duos often happen a lot. Potato housesOverall 10/10. Can't beat it for battle royale

That should warranty it some value to save itself here. there was no option for middle ground review.Here's why short and sweet why I don't recommend the game in it's current state as of 4/6/2017 It runs like on every system that it is tried on. There's no help. There's no way to get a decent fps no way to deal with the breaking lag. I will say this in it's defense What it does do it does well. The game plays on very low settings. The matches are fun when you can play a good one with little lag. The shooting is clean and clear. Weapons work. However one of the downsides once you pick up a weapon melee is no longer an option. If you have a gun with 0 bullets you are basically useless.

review: In games where there are leaderboards there will be cheaters.This game is no exception.Too many people have decided that cheating is the best way to reach the top of the charts and the creators/mods/"anti" cheat don't seem to care.In CS GO if you are a certain rank you are able to watch some replays of reported players and decide (based on the VIDEO EVIDENCE) if you think something fishy is going on or if it was a lucky kill. If a certain number of other players judged the player based on the evidence the same way you did then there would either be a ban handed out or nothing would come of it.I doubt we'll see that in this game.I doubt there will be much done about the cheaters....and besides the cheaters always seem to be a step or two or ten ahead of the dev/"anti" cheat teams anyway.Long story short fun with friends you WILL die to a cheater

review: PUBG is a 100 player battle royale game with intense battles aswell as realistic gun mechanics (atleast more than fortnite) Pros It is an intense 100 man battle royale in which players have to scavenge weaponry and various items in order to help lower the chance of them meeting their doom. PUBG is extremely fun especially with companions to aid you in your endeavor of total dominance and survival. It has a pre lobby with snakes and people singing which depicts a realistic depiction of mental illness and that China remains number one. A team led by Sebastian 'forsen' Fors won beating Michael "shroud" Grzesiek in the last invitaional of the game which as one of the best pros to be identified. Forsen was quoted after the tournament telling Shroud to "just win" which is extremely inspirational. Cons The game has been to be extremely rage inducing especially with incompetent team mates such as LoneWolf who focus on loot rather than reviving their team. Yes there are not that many cons.This review was created as a part of an IB CAS Project

review: A lot of people that are leaving negative reviews are leaving the review due to the addition of "Microtransactions" or due to Stream Snipers getting banned.This game is great. It's not amazing (yet) but it's great. There's so many moments to be had it's got a neat little skill ceiling and very interesting game mechanics. And it is still only in early access.With so many updates coming out all the time and with the expected launch out of early access at the end of this year I really think that this game has huge things coming for it. There's got to be a reason it's the second most played game on steam. It's because it's a good game!Of course it's early access so it's going to have bugs glitches optimization issues and what not. But it's obvious that the core game is great! It's done what other games have tried to do but the difference being PUBG has made it enjoyable and playable. I'd highly reccomend this game to anyone who's looking for a new fun game to play. It's especially fun with friends.Remember to make sure you meet the system requirement before buying.

review: The game itself is great. Even with all the bugs/glitches/desync problems the game is super fun and thsoe can generally be overlooked. Each update I notice great improvements in those areas and the design and additions to the game so far have been great.Over time however the game has been so over run with hackers that it is nearly unplayable. I unfortunatly believe I will quit playing PUBG soon becasue it is to disheartining. In the past month I dont think I have played a single night without being killed by hackers at least two of the games. Ive had several nights where I died to hackers 4 5 games in a row. It really has become completely rediculious and its a shame.Some people are blaming the Chinese for the huge influx of hacking. Im not sure this is the case its just numbers. The Chinese have spilled over into all other servers. Most of the NA server games are around 70 80% Chinese players so the likelyhood of the hackers in the server being Chinese are obviously going to be higher most of the players in the server are Chinese so that makes sense.The bottom line is with a game that has this many players that also has created a market for hackers through selling and trading crates and crate items I doubt there is really any way to get rid of the problem other than killing the market they are feeding off of. As long as an envirnment exists where hackers can make more money than the cost of perchasing another copy of the game by the time they are banned this plague will continue to exist and it will breed anotehr group of hackers that are resentfull and will hack because they are being hacked constantly. If and when this environment no longer exists I believe the number of hackers will deminish slowely until its at a normal percentage. Like locusts they will move on to the next cash grab game.Until something is done about the rampant hacking I cannot recommend this game. If nothing is ever done about it I do believe the game has already seen its best days and will bleed players and die over the next several months. Theres still hope but action must be taken. Ill be back if and when the game becomes enjoyable again.Save your money! Depending on how long it takes BlueHole to take action the game may be much cheaper then.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Quick note for the huge rash of "stream sniping bans". If someone is leaving a negative review claiming they were stream banned check their profile. If you don't see a game ban in red letters to the right of their profile they're just trolling or going for the meme points. Also there's been a large amount of negative reviews and discussion board spam from Chinese players for some reason I'm not aware of. Issues such as bugs/performance are mostly legitimate as well as concerns of microtransactions in a limited window for a tournament. That said I've personally enjoyed the game. It's currently the most refined Battle Royale style game out there and has a solid core gameplay loop. This is a EA title and as such if you're not comfortable with purchasing a game still in development then you should wait.

review: As someone who put over 100 hours into H1Z1 I can say without a doubt that this is the game I ACTUALLY wanted.For a game that's in early access PUBG far trumps anything that king of the kill is today and that's a "full release" game. So if you had fun playing H1Z1 but couldn't stand the "polish" of H1Z1 please consider picking up PUBG. Solo/Duo(haven't played any 4 player matches yet but I'm assuming they're just as fast) are always full of lobbies as soon as you click play you're in. There are exceptions sometimes though at 4 A.M. Est. I had to wait upwards of 4 seconds to get into a full 100 person lobby. Seriously though this game is a ton of fun. It's not greatly optimized for lower end gpu/cpu(and even some high gpu/cpus takes a little settings tweaking) but outside that the game runs like smooth butter. Maybe a little lag during peak hours but it usually resolves quickly and you shouldn't have anymore trouble.In short yes in long exactly. Try out PUBG today!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: A tribute to PUBG or How I met Arielle It all starts one day a Weasel does what a Weasel does. Climbing mountains enjoying the view and the sunny weather. Eventually the Weasel found a motorbike and thought 'Hell why not let's try it and enjoy the sun and the wind on your fur'.So he took the bike running downwards the mountain as fast as he could to meet other humas so they feed him with chickens when suddendly a ramp appears. The Weasel cried happy tears "Look at me I am a flying Weasel" before he hit a branch.The motorbike flipped towards the ground the Weasel hit his head softly but obviously hard enough because the next thing he remembered was cold wet water on his fur. Picture 1 He found himself trapped in water below the island. He tried so hard to reach the surface and he seems to reach it because he can breath but it's probably just a surface below the surface. He yells at humans but they are just passing by not recognizing the wet ball of fur. Picture 2 The zone is coming... the chickens are running... Ursula is sucking my soul out... RIP WSL Picture 3 Highly recommended!

review: Don't bother wasting money on this Here's why It's a game where even if you operate in on a high tech plane system it would still lag and give you no fps. Only way to win a round is if you've sucked RNGesus' every Wednesday night. Each update is completely useless just adds extra nobody asked for (like new guns and... well that's it) and a ton of filesize along with it of course. Game's almost fully out and not optimized AT ALL. Community sucks it's full of 10 year old that will mic spam in the start area or when you kill them on the field. Camping HEAVEN. If you're not lucky enough for that RNG circle to spawn right on top of you then you're going to get killed by a guy hiding in a house or behind a wall inside of the circle. It takes about 40 secs to enter a game then sometimes 3 extra mins at the starting area then about 40 ing seconds of skydiving (which is honestly the most fun part of the game) and then you get killed 2 mins into the game after landing of course if the terrain and loot load on time. Sometimes it's different tho sometimes you can fight and loot and travel and survive all kinds of and then after 20 minutes of surviving you just get instantly killed by someone who you haven't even seen yet. Most likely a camper and who tf wants that?It seemed fun at the beggining but I've played this game with at LEAST 20 DIFFERENT people and every SINGLE ONE OF THEM gave up on it and uninstalled it. No idea why people like this so much it's not worth the money at all. You'd spend your money better on a lottary than on this RNG piece of (And for those saying that optimizing the game is hard and costly don't bs me PU has made a fortune out of this game and can hire an entire ing company to make this game good)

review: To be honest this game was great its first few months until early Fall 2017. Way too many cheaters. I love that they have added the death cam so you can watch how you die and this only further confirms my suspicious. Sure there are plenty of times when I see myself get killed legitimately but since they've added the new desert map the cheating has become a lot worse. Several times I have watched enemies in the death cam kill me through a hack unknown to me. Basically they just aim downwards through the ground and all their bullets hit regardless if I am behind several walls in a different room etc. Sad that the devs arent doing anything about this and people continue to play with these hacks. I often wonder if reporting any of these people are doing any good.

review: I didn't want to write a review until I'd had a chance to get past the honey moon phase and give the game some time to have fixes. It's been 7 months now. Good things Game type is fun. Winning feels good.Bad things Hit reg is a mess RNG is bad Lag is unbearable in CQB combat. Enemies warp all over. Mechanics are so wonky and slow. The engine is so poorly optimized for this game. Vaulting has not been implemented. So you just can't get over walls which hurts tactical combat movement. Netcode is bad. Bad. Bad. Servers have so many problems. There are a lot of hackers. They aren't all obvious. Some just use walls/aimbots. At this point I would not recommend buying this game until they can seriously improve upon it. It is a mess. It's like having a significant other who is a manipulative sociopath. They are so much fun when they want to be but really they're out cheating on you and wrecking your life.

review: Overhyped game. Me and my friends refunded the game and I can not recommend anyone buying it.Why? Because of 2 things 1. The game claims to be not as slow as other "Battle Royale" games buy constantly reducing the battlefield during play Well in reality this idea has no effect Everyone is constantly camping in buildings the "zones" are big enough to just stay in one room for 3/4 of the whole round without being forced to walk outside. So the best way to win is to simply sit there camp and kill those few poor fellows who run around. The only time you are forced to move and fight for survival are the last 5 Mins when the battlefield has become really small. However 30 EUR is way to much money for me for a game where I camp around 30min and only play for 10min.Looting buildings? Collecting weapons? Exploring the area? All sounds cool but if you wanna win this gameyou should do none of these things. So wheres the fun in here then? Well there is none!2. Yes the game is early access however there are serious server issues that makes it impossible to connect and play. The game has become a huge success the available lobby servers however seem to be unable to handle that.Verdict If you love camping and you are not into survival this might be your game. For me this is just too boring gameplay.

review: Product received for free. I know that my playtime is still not a lot but here comes my Quick review.Even though it is an EA title. #1 GraphicsThis isnt a Next Gen eye catcher but the graphics suit this genre of games. FPS wise I am running 100+ FPS with everything on low and an average of 60 with everything on ultra. Nothing here to complain about here. #2 SoundsWeapon sounds are great with a few exceptions of the UMP and Vector that sometimes are extremely loud when shooting.Footsteps are pretty impressive and 95% of the times you are able to pinpoint where in the building your opponent is by the steps itself. There is a few exceptions though where the enemy is running around in the house next door and it still sounds like he is below you.Vehicles might need a sound rework since sometimes the it sounds like the are next to you even though they are not even close to you. #3 Gun Play/MovementGun play is sweet a bit like in the old Dayz Mod for Arma 2 Hit regestration can sometimes be a curse from the RNG gods but keep in mind it is still under developement. Movement cant be chunky at times especially the first 5 10 secs after landing with your chute. And some small walls are a pain to try and jump over #4 ControlsNothing to comment here keys are the standard WASD layout and easy to remember the medickit/firstaid keys is a must to rebind though. At least for me since I have "small" fingers ) #5 LatencyServers seem to run as smooth as you would espect there might be some chunky rubberbanding the first couple of secs after landing and hit reg is a bit RNG as stated in #3. But it seems to run smooth I have noticed that even though I am sitting in scandinavia the Difference between EU and US servers aint that big. #6 Learning CurveGame is pretty easy to get in to. The first 2 3 matches you are a little lost and hoard everything you see. But after that you will quickly understand what mods you need to pick up for the weapons that you use and leave everything else behinde so you have more space for Ammo and med kits. #7 OverallGame is great and if you have to get a "Battle Royal" game this should be it.Even though it is an Early Access title It runs pretty smooth compared to other EA titles. Playerunknown is the reason why we have H1Z1 King of the kill The Culling and tons of Battle Royal mods.So in other ways this is his jewel.If you like this type of game this would be something that you would enjoy. I would recommend this title to anyone who enjoy shooting stabbing driving over or blowing up other players.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: EARLY ACCESS REVIEW (I'm bound to edit this review come full release at some point. Hahaha)This game is beyond amazing. Well made well rounded and well executed.I will say though this game is definitely Early Access. At this point at least.Servers are buggy as all hell the game is still notoriously difficult to run optimization isn't the best. Bugs glitches you name it it's here. But the game. Is. Fun. Fun to play with friends by yourself or even just watch someone play. It's entertainment at it's finest and it's by far my favorite game of 2017 and probably one I won't be putting down for a long long time. In the past three months I have logged more than 130 hours into this game and unlike other games (cough cough CSGO cough cough) I don't regret a moment of it.Overall? I give this game an 8.5/10.**POST RELEASE REVIEW**The game has changed and not in a good way.While I'm still going to give this game a positive review as I've stuck by this game's side since the beginning I do want to warn all new players. The game. Has. Changed.I played the test server some disliked the new map in the end and I was looking forward to the full release where the maps would be evenly distributed and you'd have a fifty fifty on which map you get.WRONG.Instead there is a 9/10 chance of getting the desert map where weapon spawns are lowered the new guns are absolutely garbage and there is absolutely NO COVER. A terribly made map that I wouldn't mind getting every once in a while along with the old map but now I'm stuck playing over and over again.The game has lost a lot of my interest while I'll still be playing faithfully it won't be nearly as often as I used to.Fix the game Bluehole please. You've done a wonderful job so far but this release has been a poor excuse to put your game on a console and to get another map out there. Please for the love of the community fix this game. Review of the Released Product 6/10.

review: This isn't a clever or witty review that plays up the latest trends and memes the gaming community is playing up in this game this is just my experiences and caution against friends buying.I have played this game for over 30 hours now and had some great moments and some awful ones. In the end I cannot recommend a friend purchase this title for a few reasons... I wont go on about being banned for being near a streamer as it has not happened to me or anyone I know. However I am concerned about the developers actions in some of these questionable bans. I wont complain about having games ruined by hackers as I have had a few questionable deaths but the lack of feedback the game gives on deaths makes it impossible for me to be clear if it was a hacker or the result of the jank and erratic server performance/lag. However I am concerned about the rising reports and videos of the ease of hacking this game. I am not complaining about purchasable cosmetics providing better camouflage as the graphics in this game at any distance are poor at best. However I do find it concerning the developer broke a pledge to not sell cosmetics until after full release as there are many rough edges they should be fixing before making that cash grab. A significant amount of jank still in the game with movement driving physics server performance.Overall I think this game can be fun to play AT TIMES (when jank and lag and poor optimization do not cause problems) with friends and there is potential for a great game here but it is NOT a great game overall or even a good shooter at its core once the EA jank loses its charm you are left with a game with many issues that have been given a pass by many people due to EA or the novelty of silly physics or the simple steamroll the popular sentiment became for this game.Due to this my biggest disappointment is that the developer has raked in TON of funds and has not fixed any of the above issues despite having the resources to do soIts cool if you like the game this is not an attack on anyone and their gaming preferences just my feelings noted down for any friends (or anyone else) who cares to read.

review: DayZ + H1Z1 + Rust More cancer thats the same. Its better than fortnite but that is the same as saying Cancer is better than EbolaFully released game &gt still crashes/fails to load EVERY first gameSpends money on making skins and boxes &gt Game still needs massive optimisationOnly two things happen in this game A great 5min arena game where you join get deafened by screaming and noise then jump out of a plane and die in a few seconds.orA sh*t 40min DayZ simulation where you get some decent stuff and then die after firing one single bullet.This whole game is RNG based. Everything is RNG. Skill is only half the game whereas the other half is getting stupidly lucky. Weapon spawns are completely random now and you can jump into towns that will only have pistols or shotguns in every house and nothing else. To add to that bullets dont hit where you think they do and just because there was a blood spray that doesnt mean you hit him.The sound... Jesus... They might as well have just gone and ed everyone here. It sounds horrible and you literally have to spend hours upon hours tweaking your equalizer so you can actually f*cking hear ANYTHING over the sounds of cars and guns. Most people use 3rd party software to enhance their sound anyway and generally have an unfair advantage.The fact that you can change your graphics settings to low and it makes it easier to see people is pathetic. Why even bother with graphics in the first place then?Oh and theres so many hacks and sh*t for this now that you cant even tell who is cheating anymore (Hooray for Battleye).One of the worst and most overrated FPS games ever made. It's literally a piece of sh*t and the Devs sold out completely!Go play DayZ since it's probably better.

review: A good solid start for a Battle Royale game.Before i start i want to commend the modder Playerunknown for his previous works.Its developer Playerunknown Is undoubtedly skilled and committed to the development of this game. His previous experience included modding and making Battleroyale modes for Arma 3 and developing H1Z1 King of the Hill.For now i would rate this game 7/10 due to many things i'll explain in a bit. (as of Sat 22/4/17)Pros "At its core our game will follow the system I created in Arma 3 Battle Royale. We intend to have a larger weapon selection an attachment system and other elements familiar to Arma Battle Royale players. We are also working on leaderboards with an ELO based ranking system in game replays of all rounds and other features that will help provide a great framework for competitive play."If you have played Arma 3 Battleroyale before you'll know how good its system is. Battleground is combined effort of Arma 3 weapon attachment and base animation and H1Z1 loot leaderboard and other system.A map that can support up to 99+ Players and it should not necessarily cause lag (Connection Lag)"PUBG has a very different gameplay then H1Z1 and while neither are bad poeple like one or the other or both PUBG lacks the style H1Z1 has but at the same time H1Z1 lacks what PUBG has such as tactical gameplay waiting out things and so on."PUBG empathize Tactical Gameplay Stealth and decision making rather than bold action battlefield mayhem and other chaotic "gunning people without really thinking" stuff. Its proven to be fun atleast for me.Community is alive and kicking and unlike DayZ. PUBG Dev do actually respond to your messages which is quite surprising for me.Frying pan + jumpGood animation (shooting reloading running crouching etc)Cons The performance can be quite for some older PC (and sometimes newer one too.) Im pretty sure that this would be improved (as they did improved it a bit after the last Wed 19/4/17 updates.)This is not vital but the clothes seems a bit boring (I dont expect much since this game is still on Early Access but adding new clothes would be great)Conclusion?Tactical. Thrilling. Battle royale. and totally worth your time.If you own an older PC it is reccomended to wait a little longer before buying.But if you cant wait for it then yes. Buy it.

review: SO this game has a lot of ups and downs...but really it just takes a good computer/processor to run it and then everything is fine...Personally...I only get about 50 frames on all low settings and I'm fine with it! The hitboxes and the inability to see where you get shot from half the time can get annoying sometimes...but it's all how you react and adapt to it. You start getting a sense of where people are or where they will be just by playing lots of matches and applying game sense. The driving is a gamble...whether in terms of how you are kinda an obvious target or where you might hit something that looks harmless and flip several times..once again it's all about learning and applying when it's the right time to move or hit the gas and what angles to take. For example just yesterday I hit a hill with a 3 seat motorcycle (the one with the sidecar) and didn't realize to stop hitting the gas when I got to the top and proceeded to fly for a good 5 seconds didn't crash but it was just a heart attack that I could've ruined my match if I didn't land right. Literally 10 seconds later I planned to drive it into the ocean...didn't realize there was a giant rock right in front of the cliff and was like "HOLY IM GONNA EXPLODE" just to actually land on the side of the rock with the bike and my friend and I were both able to get out and avoid any damage whatsoever. Overall I feel like this game is 1000 times better being with a friend or in a squad of people you know. Another game I was with a friend and we did a synchronized takedown on two people who were in a firefight with someone that was on another side of a town. It was thrilling and the fact that we were able to do that and loot their stuff and their vehicle without dying was already like we won the game in our eyes.Just don't take it too seriously...If you can't run it well it's half on the optimization half on your computer. Both can be fixed and obviously both will take time. So if you're just getting the game and you can't run it right now...there's a refund option for a reason. Just wait it out this is a great game and a lot of people enjoy it. If you ever want to try to play go ahead and add me as well. Peace.

He needs prospective buyers to believe he actually cares about stopping cheaters so he blatantly lies about doing so. Please don't fall for this pathetic marketing gimmick. The facts are the facts he can eliminate 99 percent of cheaters and has already said he won't be doing so.Also the game is an un optimized mess with horrific servers. review: Pubg.I feel like i mostly have positive things to say about this game. It's really fun and you notice how the creators of this game is focusing on a more realistic tone while its competators (H1Z1 and Fortnite) Focuses on a more arcady style. I really like the realistic tone of the game (Sure it's not really realistic with the blue field and such things but it's a way of solving the camper problem that exists in these kinds of games). I don't know why i like this game so much more than H1Z1 both are great games and they both has got a bright future up ahead if the creators of these games prioritize the things that needs to get fixed so they actually get fixed. The biggest Con of this game is that Bluehole doesn't really do this well.Sometimes it feels like they just prioritize money making instead of making the people that plays the game happy. And if you just look at blueholes twitter facebook or even the review here on steam you can see that people are upset about this game getting on becuase of all the money this company is making. They've been getting better at prioritizing i must say and it shows off that they actually do care. They've been trying to solve the cheating problem for a long time ( REGION LOCK CHINA GOD DAMMIT! ) they always update us on facebook about the progress they're making and this makes me comfortable and i feel like bluehole has finally got back on track with the making of this game.Well here comes some PROs and CONs... PROs The military gamestyle makes this game really intresting and fun in every battle. No Matter how much you've played this game the battles are always intense and sometimes really difficult even against the noobiest of noobs. Good Communication from bluehole. Beautiful graphics. Big playerbase you can find matches really fast. CONs Some hackers I haven't seen them alot but people complain about them all the time so it must be a problem. Prioritizing things wrong. *Network lag detected* It's not the best optimized game out there.In conclusion Pubg is a great military realistic BR experience and it's worth every dollar you pay for it. IMO it's greater than its competetors on the market. There are some flaws in this game but the good things makes these flaws seem like breadcrumbs in a nice fancy kitchen. As in current state i would rate this game a 8.5/10. There are things that can make this game even better but it's still really good.
