review: Tired of seeing all the bad reviews for this game. We get it they never should have banned people for honking horns. The game has issues (what game doesn't) be it getting killed by a car glitch doors that you have to open twice before they work or other issues you might face. Honestly they happen rarely. If you do not have friends to play with like most of these other trolls you probably should not pick it up. This game is the most fun with one or more friends. The car crash glitches end up being just another laugh the grenade that hits the window bars and ends up at your friends feet is going to put a smile on your face even if he/she is for a few seconds. If the game feels slow stop dropping on the edge of the map and join the rest of us at school or other popular spot. The game is worth the price of admission. Most of the negative reviews have over 50 hours of play. Can you imagine paying less than 1 dollar an hour for entertainment. Spoiled brats. That being said. there are a ton of cheaters. Does report actually do anything? Im not talking aimbot. Reporting people that run faster than cars while shooting you.

Oh and if you have played the game and all you play is FPP how many times have you had to leave a match and click on FPP AGAIN! Why can't it just stay on what we play the most or on what we want to play! I'm sick of keep clicking FPP over and over again especially after a bad game. I won a game pretty much every day it's because I wasn't 'forced' to play the map of not my personal preference. review: Good god they need to fix this game!In a game that's based on 99% vocal communication I get teamed up with nothing but asian speaking people in the North American servers. If they don't shoot me for no reason they'll shoot me for guess what?..............NOT SPEAKING ASIAN.Also just had two chicken dinners on the line in a row. BOTH ruined by hacking. The first guy in a Ghillie suit running in the blue with god mode on. The second came in 3rd with two guys sniping through walls from hundreds of yards away.Bet you can't guess what language they were speaking either. Oh wait! It was Chinese.Please please please change the game so that only english speaking people are put with english speaking people and other groups with other groups. It stops the communication break down and if they do just leave a report button. Almost 900 hours in this game but it's beyond frustrating with the hackers as of late.Also it's about 10% of the time I'm teamed with someone my language

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a last man standing shooter being developed with community feedback. Players must fight to locate weapons and supplies in a massive 8x8 km island to be the lone survivor. This is BATTLE ROYALE.RECENT REVIEWS Mixed (76 680)ALL REVIEWS Mixed (285 655)RELEASE DATE Mar 23 2017DEVELOPER Bluehole Inc.PUBLISHER Bluehole Inc.Popular user defined tags for this product Early Access Survival Shooter Multiplayer + View Your Queue Follow Not InterestedIN LIBRARY PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is already in your Steam libraryPlay Now2.3 hrs last two weeks / 104.3 hrs on recordWrite a review for PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDSPlease describe what you liked or disliked about this game and whether you recommend it to others.Please remember to be polite and follow the Rules and Guidelines. Yes NoPost reviewIs this game relevant to you?104 hours playedIn the Top Sellers2 friends want this game 16 friends already own this game Multi playerOnline Multi PlayerStatsRequires agreement to a 3rd party EULAPLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS EULALanguages Interface Full Audio SubtitlesEnglish Korean Simplified Chinese French German See all 13 supported languagesViolenceBloodUsers InteractTitle PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDSGenre Action Adventure Massively Multiplayer Early AccessDeveloper Bluehole Inc. Publisher Bluehole Inc. Release Date Mar 23 2017Visit the website View update historyRead related newsView discussionsFind Community GroupsShare Embed Early Access GameGet instant access and start playing get involved with this game as it develops.Note This Early Access game is not complete and may or may not change further. If you are not excited to play this game in its current state then you should wait to see if the game progresses further in development. Learn moreWHAT THE DEVELOPERS HAVE TO SAY Why Early Access? Early Access is a great platform as it gives us the ability to get feedback from new players as well as our existing community on new and existing content. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is being developed with full transparency to our players and we will make adjustments and additions based directly on their comments. Feedback from two alphas and a closed beta test along with responses from a broader group will guide us in the creation and addition of new content and gameplay tuning. One of the ways we'll use Early Access is to test Custom Games by giving certain players the ability to create their own versions of Battle Royale. This includes the option of setting the number of teammates the type of weather looting limitations and various other game options. Our initial goal is to test this feature among a smaller group of players and if all goes well we'll gradually roll it out to everyone. We'll have more details on Custom Games once we begin implementing this feature. Approximately how long will this game be in Early Access? Update Jul. 6th 2017 Players Today I want to update everyone on PLAYERUKNOWN S BATTLEGROUNDS progress through Early Access. The amount of support and feedback we have received from our community has been incredible. I want to thank you all for your bug reports feedback and suggestions. As we continue to fix bugs improve gameplay and add new content it s important to for us to deliver you a fully realized and polished Battle Royale experience as we look towards launch.Over the past few months I have done a lot of interviews and in many of them I said we hoped to be out of Early Access six months after we first launched. I ve come to realize that restricting the window to a specific month could hinder us from delivering a fully featured game and/or lead to disappointment within the community if the launch deadline is not met.So we have decided that we are going push the full launch back a bit from the initial six month timeframe but want to assure you that we are still planning a full release before the end of Q4 2017.We will continue to push weekly and monthly updates until full launch as we want to ensure that the game we release is the best version possible. This is why we re giving a launch window rather than an exact date. We hope this makes sense and appreciate your understanding.As always I want to thank you all for your continued support.See you in game PLAYERUNKNOWN We don't expect Early Access to last longer than six months. How is the full version planned to differ from the Early Access version? The full version will incorporate modding tools that will allow players to customize and play the game the way they want. We'll deliver a complete Battle Royale experience based on the feedback that we receive during Early Access with a focus on optimizing gunplay weapons and attachments animations vehicles the loot system and much more. In addition we plan to add even more content and new features that will be based on feedback from the community during Early Access. We are committed to full transparency with players and will provide frequent and regular updates to them. What is the current state of the Early Access version? The game is stable and we've implemented a lot of content and features based our community's feedback during the alpha and closed beta tests. For Early Access we are going to focus on implementing the modding tools and readying a fully polished battle royale experience. We have weapons and attachments animations and gunplay in the game and will concentrate on tuning each. We will use the additional feedback to help us with the implementation of new features as well. Will the game be priced differently during and after Early Access? The game will remain to be at the current price even after Early Access. How are you planning on involving the Community in your development process? Transparency and constant communication with the community is crucial. We will invite certain players to test our Custom Games feature before we roll it out to the broader group. We'll be posting dev diaries updates and asking for feedback on Playbattlegrounds.com. PLAYERUNKNOWN along with our community and development teams will engage the community to discuss play mechanics new features and the overall experience to ensure they get the game that they want. READ MOREBuy this game as a gift for a friendBuy PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS$29.99 Add to Cart 2 friends want this game.Just add this game to your cart. Then during checkout choose a friend to receive your gift. RECENT UPDATES View all (38)NOVEMBER 3Update On New Anti Cheat MeasuresPlayers First of all we would like to sincerely apologize for the inconvenience caused by the cheaters and we are sorry that you have not been able to enjoy PUBG in a safe and fair environment. Our development team is doing their best to detect and ban those who use cheats in a more proactive manner. We are aware that we still have much to do. We will use all available resources to combat cheaters and foster a safe and fair in game environment. We will also continue to take actions against those who develop and distribute cheats. As we announced before we are in the process of adopting new tools to detect and verify users with unusual gameplay patterns and today we will be rolling out additional measures. We will continue to permanently ban those who are using cheats. When unusual gameplay patterns are detected from an account that account will be temporarily suspended and investigated.Although we hope to bring about a safe and fair environment in PUBG as soon as possible our battle against cheaters will not end overnight. We will continue our research and development to establish a better system for combatting cheaters.

review: This game is fantastic. It has great gun play beautiful graphics and a gigantic player base. I'm going to list a few pros and cons of this game.PROS It is incredibly fun. Playing this game by yourself or with friends is equally fun so you dont necessarily have to have a full squad to have a fun time. The graphics are very nice playing this game on ultra is about the equivelant to a good nut.The guns are ing awesome.huge player base.Cons The game isnt that well optimised. Make sure to have a beefy computer if you want to play this game at high settings with smooth fps.It is very frustrating so if you're easily angered be sure to calm yourself before playing lol.I've seen many people teaming and using the third person camera to gain the advantage when peeking corners. When people do this they are barely playing the game properly this problem isnt too bad but it gets annoying. At least there arent any hackers though.Overall I strongly recommend this game if you've got the hardware required and a calm mind you'll have a ton of fun.EDIT There are a ton of hackers now. .

review: I played Rust and Dayz. Both have similar mods but this game has 2 major problems 1. CHEATERS (reports for sure won't do anything about it) 2. There is NO CHAT in this game. So you might get killed by guys shooting throught floors or HS from kilometers away. Sadly after I bought the game I saw that it's Early Access (did again the same mistake like buying Rust or Dayz). Also way too expensive for what it offers (1 map low mechanics you barely jump over obstacles or have decent bike/car physics cheaters big latency and so on). If you press find match the cancel option doesn't work (of course you can quit the game but that's not the point).Dissapointed but fun game if you don't get a cheater or you don't die in first 30 seconds because someone landed on a weapon.Lastest update The game is unaplayable. So many CHEATERS and Blue hole is a Black hole actually where normal gaming stops. Also this game is unable to keep 2 options saved server and mode. Once searching for a game it's impossible to cancel it. I think they hired 1 programmer to do the job.

review: Where to start! This game is so fun to play!! Its fun in all types Solo Duos and Squads. Awesome 3rd and 1st person The only thing is that this game has a fair fews bugs and places where you can get stuck. But I mean what early access game doesnt have these problems.The one thing that really bugs me in this game is the vehicles you could ride a motorbike up the biggest cliff do backflips and survive but if you hit the smallest little little tiny bump on the ground you just fly 1000m metres of the bike and die straight away.I've also noticed a fair few invisible walls around the map you'll be driving your car then nek minut you hit a invisible wall and lose 1/4 of you hp.. A example is in the Military Base Hangers.Anyhow though these arent gamebreaking bugs and they will be fixed overtime you just have to remember this is a early access game!Have fun folks!

review: I honestly wanted to recommend this game as it is quite fun. But the recent update not only made the game completely unplayable for me as I can no longer even move or see anything move at all get no sounds so basically only get one frame for an entire game.While I have been able to find a workaround for this problem the performance issues still exist.The most recent update (currently still on Test Servers) implemented a new anti cheat system which is good but cripples peformance even more as people report frequently.Not only performance but server issues (probably connected to the net code) plague the game. It feels horribly sluggish. After pressing the button to pick something up it takes about a second to actually collect the items. Same with doors they do not immediately open and it takes a bit for them to actually open. It's not extremely bad but enough to feel strange sluggish and really annoying.There are synchronization issues with people killing after you made it to safety behind a rock or a wall.I will update my review again once they fixed pressing issues but for now I cannot stress enough how awefully optimized the game is. Do yourself a favour and don't buy at this point.It has huge potential but right now I recommend rather playing Fortnite BR since it's f2p.

review: Great game but yet again South Africa has to suffer with bad ping. Due to the fact that the closest servers are EU and looks like we will never get our own servers. There are thousands of PUBG players in South Africa that has to connect to the EU servers with a ping of 200+ and lets be honest its hard to play the game with constant LAG and character jumping(teleporting) across the MAP or emptying a clip into a person without killing/ downing him and that classic death without ever being damaged. And the best ever the constant Network LAG detected error. Is it worth buying the Game? Yes If you are fine with bad latency and constant disconnecting from the game. Please PUBG give us a proper server to play on.

review: Have never reviewed games before but I have to give this game a negative review for being banned for seemingly no reason. Was in a game where I killed 2 campers in buildings opposite each other. They were shooting out the windows at each other so I went in and could tell they were upstairs by the sound of their footsteps. Killed one with the shotgun. Again I could tell he was upstairs just by listening to the sound of his footsteps upstairs while he was moving around.After this encounter I got killed on my way out of town so I had a total of 3 kills that game which isn't even that good. Next time I logged in I got banned. If killing campers is a bannable offense than I would steer clear of this game.

review: I used to religiously play this game and it is really fun. However there are a lot of issues with the game that I'd like to detail as well as explain why I'm struggling to give this game a positive rating.1) I run this game on an SSD and with most games by the time I load in I'm either dead or in a far flung corner of the map. I have also got a 1060 and 16gb of DDR4 RAM and I still get this issue.2) A lot of microstuttering on a regular basis makes the game unplayable3) This is an issue from the past but the way the game handled (and to a degree still does handle) financing via Microtransactions (MTX) is scummy. I bought the Sanhok pass and within a few hours all my rewards were removed because of some temporary timer t. What's more is that the market is massively restricted and almost nonexistant.4) In general the way the game performs on my high spec system is a joke. I constantly have sound issues as well as the aforementioned microstutter and general slow load times that put Fallout 4's Release version Elevators in a good light.Overall when the game runs properly the gameplay is fun and they are adding new content semi frequently. They really need a proper FixPUBG initiative where they don't just add new UI and they say "we fixed the game lol"

review: This game is defenetly on the top 10 games i have ever played alongside great games like battlefield 4 portal halflife 2 black ops 2 ori and the blind forest battlefield 2 Rainbow six siege hearthstone and dishonored.If you dont have a medium to high end pc setup you should probably not pick it up though if you care about getting above 60 fps because its really demanding. I have heard that people with pc's that are not top of the line have alot more crashes.With that said if you are going to start playing this game i highly recomend playing the first few matches in solo games just to get an idea of how the game works before starting playing with your m8s. Then when you are a little bit more familiar with the game mechanichs and starts to comunicating and working out strategies with friends taking down enemy teams and getting your first wins thats where the game really shines in my opinion. P.S. thank god for the mute feature (ctrl+m) when you are on the spawn island before the games starts.

review: I have played FREE games with better game mechanics and less bugs. They are not pushing out the needed updates in a timely fashion unlike other games in Alpha. There is no sway when standing people are able to pop around corners with perfect aim and the no or very little deviation on the bullet (These last three items make it really good for aim bots) Even with all the Bans they do (which is more and better than most other companies). Servers are hit and miss lag randomly comes and goes this also affects hit timing mechanics. I would recommend other games as this is too much of an arcade style and you will find most of the time you will be running from the circle than in actual combat. Please see Heroes and Generals (better gun and camo mechanics) SQUADS (better sim) ARMA (better sim/gun/camo)

review: I can't recommend this game in the state it is in right now. It can be so much fun some of the times but I'm finding especially now that this game is becoming more frustrating rather than being enjoyable. Just like DayZ this again feels like another mod running off of Arma. Don't get me wrong for what this game is and has to offer it is something fun But (always the Buts!) as it is EA it's clucky horrible connectivity and server lag at times and unreliable aiming/shooting for a shooter. And for me personally just way too many features and controls that aims to add 'realism' to the game that instead just creates a way too complex control system that ends up becoming over encumbering and breaks any immersion into the 'realism' it's trying to achieve. After 80hrs of gameplay this is how Im feeling right now which is why I cannot recommend this game at the moment. I m just wondering if and when these problems will be getting fixed. And now that I'm seeing that the testing for micro transactions and its systems are seemingly now under development and coming into the game ahead of the game's development itself is kinda making me feel like this another game that is going to be in development for a time. It s making me lean towards thinking "Hey well it s just another EA title on steam" (I'm sure many of you know what I mean when I say that it sucks). All in all it can sometimes be fun when you can muster up the patience to deal with it s flaws (a bit better if you have a group friends with you). However I still just can't recommend the game seeing how it's functioning right now in it s current state. In my opinion it's just too much frustration for only a little enjoyment...

review: I've been playing this game since it was in "Early Access" and I had high hopes for it like many others. The foundational concept was really strong and interesting but somehow the developers managed to be the most money hungry narrow minded failures possible and have just about completely killed the game. The amount of sheer money grubbing garbage in this game is incredible. Rather than fix any of the extremely obvious issues the game has they repeatedly add more and more pointless stuff aimed at squeezing more money out of the player base for no real return on the players' side. Collecting cosmetic items is the only real progression system in the game and you can only earn them through random reward crates. More often than not you'll receive a locked crate that requires a $2.50 key to open and the rest of the time you'll probably get a duplicate of something you already have.These are the greediest most ignorant game developers I've ever seen. Don't buy this game. They don't deserve your money.

review: I'm leaving a negative review until all the bad buisness processes I'm hearing from BlueHole go away. These being Payed cosmetics in a non free to play game CSGO styled crate opening for said items Non contextual player banningNow these are small gripes but there have been one to many times where an indie developer has created a great game witha great idea and then kill their own buisness but greedy buisness moves. My favorite example is OVERKILL's Payday 2. They got greedy and implemented cosmetic and crate drops with keys. Also there were plenty of other stupid moves but I turned away unable to keep watching the fire. So there's OVERKILL and then there's an Indie Company liek CD Projekt Red who created the WItcher series. A very small franchise which turned into a major power house the last few years making one of the most exclaimed games of this century. How did they do it? They made a great game with a good price and made great DLC for fair prices. They didn't bleed their product out for to much money why? Because they want a future they are looking for the long term. If they continue making great games with this tactic that their fanbase will ador then they'll keep making money for the long term. Most Indie companies feel the high of money for the first time then fly off the handle and shoot themselves in the foot. I pray to god that Bluehole dosen't do that beause this game is fantastic right now. I love the adrenaline rush of playing it the smooth controls the animations the gun play etc. Great game. Yet I don't want to stop playing it like I stopped playing Payday 2 because I just couldn't handle the companies practices.At the end of the day it's majority vote here. If everyone wants crates etc (Which I hope to god they don't) then bluehole will provide. At the end of the day I'm just trying to do my part as a player of this community. If Bluehole start watching what they say as a professional company and start making smart and likeable buisness moves then I will stick to them like a devote christian like I do CD Projekt Red. If they change this game into a eldritch abomination the likes of which I can't even recognize then I will keep this negative review. Remeber the good moments I had with this game and never play it again.IN SHORTThis review is subject to change just as this game in Alpha is. If you're are weary on buying this game I don't blame you. Wait a little bit longer.

review: I have spent the better part of the year defending the devs but have come to realize they will never get their act together. Where do I begin? The fact that this game runs awfuly on low and high end hardware?( i7 8700k + 1070Ti LAG ) The fact that when dropping in a hot spot you have a 50% chance of your GPU being used under 40% effectively making it unplayable.(MASSIVE STUTTERING) The constant microstuttering issues or what they call "hitching" while traveling the map. Hit reg goes from great to awful patch to patch with no explaination of what is happening. I have spent nearly a thousand dollars trying to get my PC to run this game well and it hasn't helped much. The movement is slippery feeling like you are always on ice and you are easily obstructed by things your character should be able to walk over. Getting into a game with friends or even by yourself is often a chore since they break the matchmaking UI every other patch. Only east coast servers in the US which seems a little cheap and scummy to do after making billions of dollars off us. More positive side I do think people are unfair to the devs when it comes to accusations of the game being full of cheaters and feel like most of them are mad about dying. The game has some of the best gunplay mechanics in multiplayer gaming. Guns are very well balanced. I enjoy the hell out of this game when it works correctly which unfortunately is about 20% of the time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is an exciting take on the battle royale genre. Having roots in modding this exact gamemode into other games such as military simulator Arma 3 PlayerUnknown took a larger step to create a full scale version of the mod an entire game. There are many other competitors in this genre but in my experience and that of many others they don't capture what PUBG manages to. PUBG gives a more exciting experience and room to improve on your own personal skill to be better than everyone else around you. The skill gap between playing everyday and working on your skill compared to the casual you get matched with is huge and rewarding. Being good at this game and successful in a match is extremely rewarding as a battle royale has to be to sustain a player base. PUBG has many flaws but is constantly being worked on. Having the dev. team split onto another game is probably the main reason updates aren't as constant as they used to be but they get rolled out nonetheless. The flaws in this game as of pre 1.0 update can often be game breaking stuttering and server lag hindering your ability to win fights and engagements and is ultimately the most frustrating part of the game. However most of that should be fixed soon with some handsome adjustments come 1.0. When this game first came out on Steam I described it as the "best worst game to play" and that still sort of holds true but will hopefully shake that reputation come some new updates. Regardless of the consistent flaws and agony involved this game is so much fun and so beautifully rewarding it's definitely worth $30.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Review for PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds. Got the game early October/late September. Play time 205.0 hours. Banned Yes. Ban reason Unknown.First off i'd like to start with saying that I did enjoy the game while i could play it just that some glitches and bugs within the old "Early Alpha" build of the game really and i mean REALLY me off. But for the Build 1.0 have to say this...1. The Scenery Improved lighting and weather effects. Distance between buildings / areas / cities is clear. The flare from the sun is blinding.2. The weapons Starting with the pistols P92 Shoots .45 ACP 7 rounds in a mag still weaker than BB pellets. P1911 Shoots 9mm 15 rounds in a mag stronger than the .45 ACP.P18C weakest gun out of the 3 previously mentioned but has the Fully Auto option which is nice i guess.Old R8 Shoots 7.62 ammo 6 or 7 in a mag i really dont remember cause i didnt have the time to reload the gun.New R8 Shoots .45 ACP ammo 6 in a mag as strong as a pump shotgun from close range. As weak as a P92 from long range.Shotguns S686 5 gauges max you have time to reload one of them before someone will chase you with a fully loaded S12K or double barrel.Double Barrel 2 gauges max reload time is longer than you expect so you will probably stop reloading and swap to another gun thinking that youve reloaded it but no..S12K 5 gauges in a mag reload time is the fastest but the spread is also the biggest you can put a 4x scope on it and hit people from across the map but you will deal 1 10 dmg after the 20 metre mark.Sawed off 2 gauges max used this gun once shot a guy 6 times didnt die came at me with P92 and killed me. ARs M16A4 Probably the best AR for long range better than the Kar98 equal to the mini 14.M416 Shoots slower than the SCAR L and is weaker but has more attachments which is nice i guess.AKM Only used this for longe range cause the recoil on this gun is just bad...... You can have a flash hider on it and still flick to the sun after the first shot.SCAR L My favourite gun out of the 4 has medium high DMG output reloads fast recoil control is pretty OK with the first 15 shots. Groza Pretty much the bigger and stronger brother to the UMP.SRs Kar98 5 rounds of 7.62 ammo shots miss most of the time use M16A4 instead.Mk14 Fastest shooting Sniper Rifle Shots hit 97.whoknows% of the time does enough dmg to kill a rabbit from 10 metres.M24 Shoots like AWM reloads like kar98 bullet drop is very low or atleast you cant tell cause you cant see where the bullet goes. Hope for a hit and kill.AWM Aim at the neck area Kill confirmed from any distance.Other guns UMP No recoil dmg the same as P92.M249 No recoil for the first 10 shots then the recoil is of a SCAR L or M416. DMG output is incredible but not really effective at long range. Only use this when you dont have another AR.3. The community Best community ive ever played with before the game you have 60 seconds to talk to other people but you dont use that time to talk to other people oh nonono... You use that time to scream "China numba wan" "Taiwan numba wan" "Follow me i'm a snake" "Hello" "How do i zoom in" "Is my microphone working.. testing 1 2 3".But when you do meet someone that answers you instead of screams at you. You and the other guy will become the bestest of friends. unless you play duos and your teammate doesnt connect 90% of the times. Thank you for taking the time to read this review. As i mentioned before i dont know what my ban was about but other than that the game is worth playing.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: From the creator of Arma 3 Battle Royale and H1Z1 King Of The Kill This game has the potential to become the basis of more battle royale styled games to come. PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS does have it's pros and cons though. First lets talk about gunplay. Gunplay in PUBG is definitely one of my favourite out of many games it is not only smooth but also unrivaled. For a battle royale gamemode the option to paradrop anytime you please is definitely a great addition. Team versus team is definitely refined just get a bunch of friends together and my oh my some hinds are gonna get kicked! The negative aspect of PUGB currently is latency issues. (1gbps internet here). Rubberbanding back and forth during a firefight is definitely the last thing you want happening. Overall I think PUGB is definitely worth the 35 dollars.

review: SUPER EDIT I TAKE MY WORDS BACK. AS MUCH AS I HATE COD FRANCHISE I GOTTA ADMIT THAT I LOVE BLACKOUT. ITS PURE JOY COMPARED TO PUBG.Crappy game made by money hungry crap developers. Not worth the money.Adding a little bit more context The mechanics in this game suck. Feels like youre controlling a mentally handicapped character that takes half an hour to change directions or make any other move. The only other FPS I can recall with similar movement mechanics is BF BC2 but this is ten times worse. The gun mechanics on the other hand are fine as is steep learning curve rewards only dedicated players(although shotguns and pistols need a rework)Then comes the networking related problems. Shot someone in the chest with a shotgun from one meter away? Well get ed because you missed. Even if you had your crosshair dead on. Lagspikes desyncs etc. This game has it all. Even DICEs BF3 and BF4 launch was heaven compared to this crap which is supposedly "ESPORTS ready"(lmao)Overall this pos isnt worth even 1$.ED Installed the game again to see if something has changed. Uninstalled after 5 minutes. Still crap. Waiting for any AAA devs to make a proper FP BR we can all enjoy.ED2 Played this piece of crap again today 2 (?) months after my first edit. Uninstalled the piece of crap again.Still waiting for a AAA dev team to release a good BR game. *Treyarch doesnt count as AAA and COD BLOPS BR SUXX*14/10/2018. This game is still And it will keep being made by devs.

review: I love this game its fun and all but with every major update they bring out they just come out with another way to take money from you. I was really hoping this game was going to be a game that is not only fun but the dev actually care about the game more then they care about the money but no it seems thats just a long lost gamers dream. They came out with pay to open creates and now all the time you spend in game earning BP is pointless unless you wanna spend 2.50 for a key because you are most likley to get a create that requires a key and now they are joining every other game in doing a season pass. So now if you want any of the cool items then you have to go buy the pass then play so you can get the cool stuff. This game isnt even free to play unlike all the other games that do the same thing. So if you want to look cool go ahead pay 30 dollars for the game then go ahead and buy a lot of keys then once youve got all of that go ahead and get the season pass.Thanks for ruining the game.

review: PUBG as many people have said has so much potential but what it has in potential it lacks in execution. First off PUBG has a huge amount of hackers their anti cheat software is as good as nonexistent. Just to put into perspective how many hackers there actually are I would say between 60 and 80% of my deaths have been due to hackers. I don't mean to be racist when I say this but most if not all hackers I have seen in the game have been Chinese. Everybody knows this yet they refuse to land lock China. With that huge influx of Chinese people there comes another problem communication. I am assuming that most people reading this are not Chinese as it seems like every Chinese person in existence owns this game. At least half of my teammates in squads have been Chinese people who not only speak very little (they sometimes say things like "China numba wun" or "you no good you bad") if any English but they also just seem to micspam. This makes it very difficult to play a game as I have to mute the mic mid game.

review: It's actually kind of disappointing that this is the most popular game on Steam right now. The base gameplay is solid but it's by no means original and the game has some flaws. It's not well optimized the gunplay and overall gameplay feels very clunky and unpolished and there's a notable crate bot problem right now to where on average 20 30 people every game are bots and instantly die (usually hiding in the ocean). While the developers are trying to fix the issues improvement has been slow and often not as much as it could be. There's also a separate issue to where the developers bend head over heels for streamers. Killing a streamer can get you banned even if you aren't stream sniping a streamer can just go to the devs say you were stream sniping and you're banned. Is the base game concept good? Of course it is it's not even the first game to do it as much as the uppity developers like to insist they are with their copyright claims of other games and the past games before it had plenty of issues too. Well so does PUBG and I wouldn't recommend it for its price unless you have a fair amount of friends who already have it.UPDATE After becoming their own company the PUBG team has put in game advertisements and other poor choices into the game.

review: PUGB The most boring BR game due to all the waitingIt's a game where you spend first 5 10 minutes to get into the game you loot for another 5 10 minutes and if you are blessed with RNG you can find loot but most of the time you probably have fists/pistol against enemy's rifle and you are forced to repeat the 10 15 minutes of no playing. And if you manage to get some decent loot you probably die because of the game's META another reason why this game is boring.Meta is to wait until someone with loot comes to you not you hunting for loot. Which means if you want to have a decent game you basically sit and wait for players to come into the blue zone and that means atleast another 10 minutes of camping which is really boring and makes the game more like a camping simulator than a fun BR game.Also one of my main problems with this game is like I said in the beginning all the waiting you have to do until you can even try and do something. If you die within like 2 3 minutes after landing which will happen like 90% of the time you have to repeat all the waiting first you search for a game which can take as long as couple of minutes and then you have to wait for players to connect AND even after that you have to wait 1 minute for the plane to start. AND then you have to wait until you reach the place where you want to land and by the time you land you already have spent 5 15 minutes without doing ANYTHING and then you just die instantly because of bad RNG. I just don't understand why they made the game such a waiting game if most of the time you die instantly after landingOnly good thing about this game is it's first person camera
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Where do I even begin with this? Hackers galore Inexcusable lag Anti cheat that is based on the hours you have and the amount of kills you have per game *(will explain later on)* and the lazyness of the devs. I started playing this game about 1 year ago and back then it was honestly one of the best games i had ever played especially seince it was the first battle royale game I had ever played. I'm a casual player who generally only plays this game with friends so most of my hours spent in this game have been in squads on the good ol' map back before hackers ruled the game. ( and no it wasn't a good player since I don't think even a good player could headshot you while you are prone in the upstairs of a house with a pistol.... Just sayin)Lag has always been an issue in PUBG since the very beginning especially in the beginning of the matches when you first land. Back about a year ago this was never really an issue as we knew it was in early access and just rolled with it since we knew it was (hopefully) going to be polished and profected in the future. Welp 1 year later and we are still haveing inexcusable lag in matches not just at the start but throughout the entire game its like their servers aren't meant to handle this many players playing their game. Now their anti cheat is good in thought but very impractical while in actual use. To get more than 6 kills in a game you need 200 hours to get 10 kills you need 500 hours and in order to get 20 kills you need to get 1000 hours in the game. So if you have a friend that just started playing and only has 98 hours are really good at fps games such as armam and get 7 kills they are banned within 24 hours This counts for event also such as the war event that is taking place currently. A firend of mine found out the hard way and now bought a 4th account just so we could play together still on weekends.Now in order for a game to be successful you need updates regularly and changing the speed of the playzone doesn't count either... The last update this game has had was when it was released fully back in December and that was the AUG. I admit new guns are fun at times but when the game is still struggling to run even on good pc's thats what they should focus on not by pleasing the youtubers and content creators with new guns to try to reel them back in to this pos game.I loved this game in the beginning but to all you who are thinking about getting it i'd suggest saving your money till the issues get fixed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 400+ hours on this game and it suddenly decided to stop working on launch Does not even work anymore..Devs arent bothered about fixing these issues awful company.

review: PUBG started out to be a dream come true. It is so satisfing getting a 15+ kill game. A truely fun battle royal game with friends. one thing though. Never trust an EA game. Lets start by talking about the servers. the servers has been the one problem me and my friends were so frustrated about. It has been abosulte garbage ever since the game came out. Now the game is on Xbox with weekly updates!!!!!!! and we are sitting here just wondering why the do they not care more about pc. We don't get weekly updates wtf??????Without pc there would have been no PUBG. but here we are the servers are still trash. Actually they are more trash now after 1.0. HOW the do you up the servers even more almost a year after the same problem. Bluehole(PUBG CORP now) is such a terrible company when it comes to servers. I am so discusted with this game. Don't even get me started with hackers because they will never go away. The devs dont care at all. They dont give a anymore. Yes i will still play the game. review: Product received for free. To start this review I would like to point out that this is an early access title and that there are bound to be issues bugs etc. My account would have you know that I've played the game for 4.2 hours. This isn't true as I've merely had the game opened for 4.2 hours but as far as the amount of time I've spent actually in matches probably doesn't even equate to 45 minutes total. The gameplay is pretty fun when you can get into a game. I have persistantly had a weird bug / glitch that prevents me from loading into matches and merely says that the game "Lost connection to Host" when I never connected int he first place. I sit watching a loading screen until I return to the main menu with an error message or on 5 special occasions I was able to load in and play the game. I've only played 5 matches total out of the dozens of times I've tried playing via the in game matchmaking system.I have tried and tried again to troubleshoot this issue using the Steam Support forums for the game and it turns out there are a ton of other people suffering from the same issue and theres nothing anyone was able to do as there is rarely a fix that can be performed on the user's end. Some people were able to fix the issue by disabling their firewall on their computer to play the game but for obvious reasons this is an issue.Overall the gameplay is pretty fun based on the experiences I've had in game even if they were brief. The gunplay is solid the mechanics are pretty good and it's a fun game ((WHEN IT WORKS.)) Basically The game is still in early access and I understand that there will be issues present and some are pretty major. When the game is online multiplayer only and you can't connect to matches theres just not much that can be done with it. At its current state I would reccomend waiting for them to better optimize the game and work out more kinks such as the one that I suffer with on my setup. It's not a bad game but it still needs a lot of work. I was fortunate to recieve this game through a gift copy from a friend but if you're spending your own money spend cautiously.

review: Don't buy this at all.Yes I've not played enough to make a strong review point but that's because of matchmaking and hackers that's it.The matchmaking is ed in two ways firstly no matter what server you log into you'll find ing Chinese who can't speak English and thus render a useless teammate. *REGION LOCK CHINA*Second is that you're not matched according to skills so you're matched against straight up pros who can one tap you in a second and no effective way to even practice the game thus it straight up demoralises you to even play.Then comes the hackers/exploits one guy camped INTO A MOUNTAIN and when I climbed it he shot me literally from INSIDE THE MOUNTAIN. One guy was even able to spot me through the whole terrain thus killing me without a line of sight.Unless these stuffs are fixed this game is completely useless because you'll be running through the whole map for like 15 20mins and then will die in one shot completely ruining the competitive fun of it.And most importantly there s no way of you to check your ping or loss thus you don t even know if you re actually in a playable server or not until you teleport through the ing map or disconnect and never connect back in.Update Don't buy it still !! FixPUBG is just a hoax and servers are crippling with chinese who doesn't speak anything other than thatt ruining any multiplayer "fun"

There are serious bugs if you land where textures aren't fully loaded and ofc game is still at early access by the time this review is being written.You need to unplug your controller otherwise the game will show commands based on their buttons.On the other hand the game is good quite re playable excting and lots of fun. I strongly advise you to play with (a) friend(s) and to have a mike to talk to. Gameplay You basically jump from a plane and decide where to land. Can loot weapons clothes and ammo.You can find motorbikes or cars through the road and can drive them.The game still has one map but they are adding a new one soon and supposedly leaving early access by December too.Recommended but be aware to have a fast hdd and some friends + mike.

review: While I have put lots of hours into this game and I have to admit that it was fun in the beginning exciting and a new experience. It was like the new smartphone you've bought and you can't get your hands off it.However after you put a decent amount of time into this game you realise how god awful it is. With a budget of 1.3 bil $ they are unable to optimize the game( I still have to play on the lowest settings for the game to be playable on a r9 390 and 6600k) code some actual half decent netcode fix the bugs that are everywhere. At this level of popularity the devs' incompetence is unacceptable. I will list some of the qualities this game from a company with a buget beyond 1 bil $ offers you Graphics that are worse than Half Life 2 in 2004. The game looks ok(ok by a stretch because it applies a horrible sharpening effect that god knows why it is there) on ultra but i dont think anyone with a reasonable pc can run it. Horrendous netcode that leaves you frustrated after most deaths.In the past 2 weeks I've killed and been killed behind walls. Fortnite is vastly superiour. Unstable game. Crashes every 3 matches fps drops hiccups stuttering bugs servers shutting down for no reason. Bugs that were previously fixed come up again after new updates. How is that possible i do not know. Anti consummer practices. Microtransactions that do not affect the gameplay but make no sense for the player(you are rewarded with BP after good performance but with those you get crates which are locked behind paid keys. Why? why give us progression if it is locked behind a paywall). Absolute incompetence from the development team. They nerfed the m16 when they stated they buffed it the game runs worse by every update released they remove map selection after we begged for it so much time releases a smaller map which runs worse by a large margin compared to the bigger ones(which are 4 times larger mind you).This state of the game that makes me sick is the reason why I cannot recommend it. I try to like it but it cant be done. A good idea executed more poorly than expected.

review: This game Sucks! Why???First you may think "Oh its because of cheaters!"... Wrong!Before I start to tell the bad things of this game I will tell about the good ones 1) The idea of forcing playes battle each others being the last survivor to win thats is cool.2) The graphics are very good.3) The variety of weapons and equipments.Thats all I thing about the good points.So if the game is so bad why keep so many players buying it like myself?Whell because they dont know about the things below or dont know how much it affects all the game.So I tried to rank the bad things starting from the worst 1)Theres no votekick/voteban option! There are not even an Players List like in most FPSs. That simple option could solve majority of hackers/cheaters issues alongside the item below 2) Theres no information about server configurations as wich files the server allow customization. Theres not even a Serverlist! You join spontaneus server wihout any trusted information!!3) The "Third Person Perspective(TPP)". That should be eliminated at all. Its ridiculous how people stay behind buildings using the corners to see others around without being noticed! This is a joke! There the game losses all the respect especially if want to be considered a serius shooter.4)No latency indicator!!! Serious? how can you hide it from the player? Have you ever played an online shooter? Do you have notion of how latency affects playability??5) Theres no Text Chat on the game!!!!!! Why not??????????????????????????????????6) Aiming behaviour. The bullets dont go where you shoot! In various occasions I shoot an stand target and nothing happens! Another times where I was clearly not aiming at the target the in enemy died! WTF?????????????? So you may say "whell you must learn to shoot!". Like from 10 meters with an SMG? No its not my aiming the problem i assure you. The rifles too its cool to se the bullet falling on long shoots but again its a weird behaviour. 7) BUGs! What the you did with the physics on this game? I exploded a bike 100% healthy by simple touching an guardrail. The parachutes landing is comic. Plz do fix some BUGs its the least you could do!8) The community Players! Most are deff or something angry and trow their s.h.i.t on you.9) The crates and itens market. Thats really annoying. Stop asking for my money and do a better service FIX THIS GAME.Well as I can remenber thats it. Hope it may influence you to Not Buy a "WorkInProgress" game that's sell as a "finished" one.

review: Blue Hole / PUBG Corp. deserve every negative thing said about this game. Despite hundreds of millions of dollars infinite patience on the part of the player base and a completely unearned boost from popular streamers PUBG chose to squeeze every last dime out of the player base while delivering what can only be described as intentional incompetence. There are more detailed takedowns of the flaws of this game but a few of the main highlights Little to no optimization (never fixed) Intense lag / d sync that makes the combat fundamentally flawed (never fixed) Numerous bugs left for over a year with no fixes Complete failure to roll out effective anti cheat measures (fix perpetually "delayed") Actively encouraging cheating by introducing micro transactions and loot crates that could be sold for real money Prioritization of loot crates over core game mechanics Continously delayed content releases Some more loot crates that even with a $2.50 price tag give you the same crap items at insanely high probabilities More loot crates 70s themed woooo! Numerous changes to unflawed parts of the game over core game mechanics (change the UI font but leave the d sync).I have never bothered to leave a steam review before but this game derserves every downvote to move it from Mixed to Negative.

review: I have 780 hours in this game and have watched it go from a fun and gritty no bs shooter with a few issues to a full on mess.Yeah you have seemed to sort a few issues out desync etc is not what it used to be and the lag seems to be as common as any other unreal 4 engine game. Fair enough yes. The map selection returned and also a ranking system was finally added.Fine.Problem is it took you too long. People dont want to play this game anymore it had everything going for it this time last year and what was Bluehole's PRIORITY????Id say more but to be honest you don't deserve mine or anybody else's opinion any more.Congratulations for failing Im going back to my '10 year old free regularly updated game'PUBG is dead to me ill still play with friends i met on there. Until something replaces it. And i cannot wait for that to happen.Thanks BLUEHOLE PUBG is like a bad ex girlfriend that maybe once or twice gave me a good shag.

review: Here is my list of problems with PUBG.1. You can still get shot a full second or more after moving to cover without being visible.2. Updates take place during Prime Time hours and don't give a notice of maintenance in the menu screen.3. Patch notes are severely lacking and aren't even available most times.4. Death cam is so terrible you can't even tell who is cheating or using macros or commands.5. Most skins can't be sold on the market which gives no incentive to buy crates skins or any limited time items.6. You can get run over by a car without even touching it. Cars are fatal at slow speeds. Speeds that should injure you but not kill.7. Level 3 helmets should be removed or have a feature that the face shield can be destroyed. A sniper battle between someone with a Level 1 2 helmet vs. a Level 3 is too much of an advantage.8. Loot crates have such low chances of getting anything of value. You typically lose much more money than you gain. You get way too many duplicates of the same items.9. Melee weapons are useless. You should start out a melee weapon since they're so useless.I could go on but these are some of the glaring issues I have noticed.

review: Pubg in my experience is a great and very fun game you have to survive and be the last man standing (or the team standing if you are playing with friends). Currently there are 2 game modes the standard one and the first person only (which o prefer). Most hate comments on pubg are because of "stream sniping" in my experience I have never got banned for stream sniping If now you would get banned it's only for 7 days or so... I think you will survive 7 days without pubg. On to its community the game's community isn't a lot toxic and there are not that many cheaters or hackers. But everything has negatives for example the servers are pretty much like Ubisoft's servers if not worse and the game has performance issues so don't suspect playing this game on a potato pc the game though is still new and in Early access so give it some time (even if we all know how that usually ends...Yes I am talking to you dayZ). In conclusion the game is great especially with friends and worth your time so get out there and get that chicken dinner!

review: Great Game! As you can see I have put my fair share of time into this game already. Ive just been having a blast. The gunplay feels very natural and is far more rewarding when you actually land a kill than other games. Yes there are some issues but its early access. I dont understand all the negative reviews. The devs have been very open on their plans with this game and so far they have done nothing to suggest they wont stick to that plan. I feel like as long as the devs continue to release updates and work with the community that this game has longevity well past its $36 price tag.

review: Things most frequently heard on mumble while this game is being played"That's annoying.""Where did that shot come from?""When does Destiny 2 come out?"This game is about 10% fun and 90% pure straight annoyance. You will die constantly from people you dont see from people who randomly bump into you then happen to get a headshot from the circle screwing you over from bad item drops and so on. The game is also extremely unoptimized. It is pretty heart poundingly exciting when you finally win one especially in solo. I dont think that makes up for the flaws though. If this werent the only game my friends like atm I wouldnt play it. Dont recommend.

review: If you could make a game that takes the most unrewarding experience ever and combine it with incomplex underdeveloped Battlefield elements this would be its brain dead offspring.Throw in a handful of dim whitted frat members and hackers and you get PUBG! Seriously its like this kind of franchise is slowly being destroyed. I have no idea why so many people play this game theres very little to it maybe thats why. They really could add more elements like why isn't there RPGs?? Battlegrounds without RPGs? I mean come on!Anyway it does have some replay value although very little and the maps are great which is kinda put off by the basic gameplay.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: For a long time I felt this game went into the right direction but recent events made me change my mind. Best example is the BROKEN PROMISE about NO MICROTRANSACTIONS IN EARLY ACCESS. They clearly said there will be no microtransactions in Early Access. But now they announced to implement loot crates for 2.50$. They said this money will be used to fund a tournament at gamescom and the 350.000$ price pool. And some will go to charity. How much will go to charity? No word on that. Why do they need microtransactions to fund a tournament with over 5.000.000 copies sold? No idea. So no thank you. Your game can go itself.

review: i'm 2 hours in and thought i would give my opinion. PUBG is a fun game rule enforcement seems to be good. I come from a fps background so for me the game is pretty easy... i came third in my second solo game with 7 kills... but otherwise i think the 3rd person would feel weird to certain people. The devs seem to be okay other than banning legit players but hopefully that will change as its had so much publicity. At its currant state the game would not run on your parents laptop setup which you get 100 fps in CS GO. i have a gtx 960m and i7 6700hq so not a bad setup and i only get 30 40 on LOWEST. You would definately need a dedicated GPU. But if you feel your setup will run it definately give it a try.

review: Honestly this game does not need any reviewing. PUBG is a name that is very common among the gamers today. I bought this game a while back when its popularity was on rise. The gameplay is fine and the graphics are amazing. It has managed to receive an overall mixed review but that is all because of its early access period.Although the dust has now settled and plenty of people play this game today. There is a lot that can be done in PUBG (neglecting the bugs that the creators are working hard to fix). It has been my very first Battle Royale game and the gameplay impresses me. Although I am not a big fan of the genre but the game definitely has a lot of potential.Recommended for those of you who want to try a new type of online multiplayer game.

review: Got 44 hours into the closed beta and i truely loved the game so far!. There was no Battle royale game i like but Battlegrounds. The intense feeling you get playing this game the feeling when you win is amazing even if you don't win it's fun to play!. + Gunplay is great and the hitreg is amazing besides some server issues here and there.+ Realistic gameplay and tactical but not too slow. + No crafting t No jumping out of a fast moving car t. This is Battle royale. The game is in Early access so don't expect it to run flawless. The circle need some tweaking in my opinion It's too easy to see through the circle when walking behind it so you can have advantages against someone sitting "Safe" behind a rock scanning through the fieldsIf you are looking for a tactical battle royale this game is for you.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Holy what a bunch of babies. "Don't play this game it's trash" they say while have 300 1500 hours in the game. PUBG is as fun as you expect runs fine for me here in NA. I had no idea the fanbase turned so hard against the game...Critiques worth making Hackers are a thing. The better you are the more likely you'll run into them. Not nearly as often as some are claiming though.Can't find a car and the safe zone is on the other side of the map? Running Simulator 20XX.Microtransactions. Damn it I bought this game. This isn't some FTP game where microtransactions are their income. I'm not going to gamble my money on cosmetics release them in packs if you want more shekels out of me. Community is a bunch of tryhard whiners apparently but there are cool and funny people out there. Final thoughts This game is worth the thirty bucks as you can see from the play time people sink into it. Very replayable especially with friends. It's okay if you're garbage (like me) PUBG matches you with people of similar rank. That doesn't mean it will be easy you just won't be playing against people who can drop you from a mile out right away. The gunplay is so tight I love scavenging and kitting out my weapons. I'm definitely putting a few hundred more hours in.

review: This game.... its fun to play but quickly gets annoying. Compared to similar games this one has is the most laggy and sometime seems impossible to pick up items open doors get in vehicles and jump up on top of anything above the players ankles. From start to finish its annoying shooting down from the plane should seem easy but half the time where it looks like youre going to land doesnt match up with where your actually going to land.In addition to this driving any vehicle is somewhat enjoyable but for some reasom there are invisible rocks that youll hit and lose HP plus it puts a full stop to your vehicle. The impact of the weather is also a huge problem you would think that if its foggy your would drop more reddots 2x 4x scopes..... nope there are the same drop no matter if its raining foggy or clear as day. I also feel like if you let the player choose between fog rain or shine that youll see that no one likes the first two. Lastly often there are NEVER and vehicles around which gets suuuuuuuuuuuuper annoying when you have to run accross the whole map. It feels like who Blueballs or who ever made this game decided " ya know what this isnt ready yet but lets release it anyways". I say these things hoping it helps improve the game but right now it ing sucks and im going back to Counterstrike and H1Z1

review: I have approximatley 280hours on this game. The game is fun in concept however in actual execution it is a broken POS.Lag and latencey issues are terrible and un avoiadable. You can be shot at run several meters behind cover and then seconds later the hits will register and you lose health or die. Gun play is never consistant due to variences in server latency. Lag in the beginning of the game even makes it difficult to pick up critical items. Its very frusrating when this is always present and you don't really get to enjoy the game for what it is.Cheating is huge and it seems like the developers don't mind it. Get used to being killed by people with digits as a name who hip fire headshots at 200 meters.The game was much funner in the beginning of early access. Unfortuanly the developers are in a virtual urinating contest with fort nite so you will see more useless features added (the emoji system) rather then the real gameplay issues being addressed. This WAS the best battle royal. Thankfully battle royal games are the flavor of the week and another good one will be around soon.

( I have a brilliant connection it's not me ) How you managed to make it worse for performance than the test server I will never know but you managed it. Everything that's done client side is a joke i'm sure a lot can be done here to fix your netcode.As an aside I still believe this game has potential. You have a huge task ahead of you Bluehole. You have to make this game work before a real dev team comes in and does it properly. review: Before I bought this game I was initially toying between buying this or H1Z1 king of the kill. Let me just say thank god I invested in PUBG instead pay the extra 10 bucks for this it is worth it 100%. H1Z1 is multiple steps down compared to PUBG in every way and well I think it's pretty clear that everyone else sees that based on the ratings I'm looking at. Honestly for the amount of work that has gone into the making of this game the devs deserve more than your measly $30. Grab it while it's cheap cos this game is definitely going places. The devs behind H1Z1 clearly lost interest in their main game and switched to king of the kill pretty indefinitely. One good game beats 2 average games easily any day. So if you want an exhilerating heart pumping fight to the death survival experience then BUY THIS GAME NOW! Oh just make sure you have a solid rig to play it on or you're gonna have a bad time.

review: It can be a fun game and i think it's best enjoyed with a few friends that sometimes mess around but are also serious about the game. So far i've been enjoying the game a lot and i've even put some money in clothes (i ing play dark souls i like my hero to have style ok) and even though i think the prices are a bit high and some clothes give a small advantage it adds something to grind for i guess...(yes that it's just microtransactions). I think the whole stream sniping and is ing ridiculous and should be removed from the game because it kills the fun for so many clueless people because of one dude simply dying in a battle royal game like what the ! I think also that the game is very much broken but for now it hasn't been annoying me too much. Should u give it a try? yes. Why? Because if u overlook the very much visible early accessiness of this game (yes that is a word aparently) it is at it's core a fun experience for coop and solo and it is the best of it's battle royal genre

review: I as many of us joined this game in 2017 when it was still in early access. The game is now an official release although it didn't make a single step forward since EA weather effects are not even present now while they were back in 2017. I remember a MAJOR patch when they introduced the vaulting mechanic but was the only change I've seen this game go through. This really is at an alpha/beta development stage but since devs realized they could still milk the crowd without ever needing to finish the game progress has simply stopped. These problems I am about to list where already present 8 months ago desync and rubberbanding glitching and getting stuck dying/glitching on landing high ping advantage (whoever has the highest ping wins the fight see chinese) a rampant chinese hacker community that farms skins and crates servers busy (even if you change region) won't display online friends loot spawn is as stupid as ever lots of situations with 20+ players and only 2 guns to be found vegetation still disappear at a certain distance so that you can never be hidden if looked at from afar TL DR game is a joke and if you buy it then the joke's on you

review: I'm sure everyone knows about this game so there's no point reviewing it.... but here goes anyway.This game is horribly optimized buggy laggy and just a bit of a mess technically. Despite that it's one of the best shooters I've played recently at least. It's incredibly tense and thrilling even though you spend most of the time avoiding gunfights. Playing cautiously is the way to win (I assume I haven't won a match yet) and it makes it unlike any other shooter I've played. High reaction times and aiming skill are less effective in PUBG and if you generally suck at other twitch based FPS/TPS games it doesn't mean you won't enjoy this.The crate/loot system in game at the moment is pretty good you can easily unlock aesthetic items just by playing although there is a key system for some crates. No pay to win elements at the moment. The fact that the developer said there will be no paid loot system in Early Access and then implemented one is pretty disconcerting and apparently the crates you can unlock by playing will be taken out when the game releases fully. Whether that will make me give the game a thumbs down is yet to be seen.At the moment though a definite thumbs up!If anyone is worried about whether their PC will cope with the game here are my somewhat awful specs Pentium G4560 3.5ghz Dual core8GB DDR4 RamGTX 1050ti 4gbI'm running off a 120gb SSD.I get approximately 30 50fps in the lobby and anywhere from 45 100fps in game with the odd stutter. This is at mostly very low settings with textures at ultra and AA at medium.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game gets on my nerves nearly every single time I play it but there's a reason I always come back. The feeling of winning a game and the tension building up to it is unlike any other game that I've played and if you put the time in it isn't a hard game to get good at (This does take time thought). However there are obviously a lot of problems. 1.0 fixed some issues but the dev team are focusing far too much of their resources on cosmetics and cheating (by focusing far too much time on cheating I do not mean that spending time trying to get rid of it is pointless but they wouldn't have to work on it as much if they just region locked China). I don't think that the devs should just region lock China however. They should just make it so that you can only play on the closest 2 servers to you geographically and only if you can have a reasonable connection to them (under 100 ping). If the devs just fixed some annoying issues and sorted out cheating I would reccomend this game to everyone but at present I would only recommend it if you are willing to stick it out with this game and wait until many of its issues are fixed.7/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a truly amazing game which offers a great experience both for solo players and while playing with friends. I by all means recommend the game even though it has some downsides to it.The thrill of being in top 10 in both solo duo and squad modes feels intense and fun every time it happens. It will challenge you and make your heart beat really hard. The feeling of getting a chicken dinner (be the last person alive and therefore win) is not to be underestimated. This might sound like I'm speaking from beyond the pink clouds but i do understand the fact that the game is having quite a few downsides.I do know most of these downsides are because of the fact that the game is still in it's early access but i decide to name them anyways since most players tend to forget that a game is early access and being developed on.For everyone with a budget pc this game is at this very moment not for you. The game is by no means optimized so either play it and get used to the fps which will eventually get better when they optimise or wait it out till it's off early access. (Or buy it and try it out for 1 hour and see if your pc can handle it). There have been quite a big drama about the streamers that Bluehole (the devs) nuture and care about since they were the reason the game became popular. That have now drifted away and isn't really of importance. It feels like the developers have understood the magnitude of their actions and learned from the bad experience.If you buy an early access game you must expect crashes poor optimization bugs and glitches. It's part of the game until fixed and that is why it is early access. This game is not finished yet. The developers are really great at listening to the community and are probably working their asses off trying to fulfill it all.One main problem is their timeline they have promised the game to be out on a specific time having sold very very many copies they should be further in the development process but sadly is not. Therefore i expect the date of final release to be pushed into the future. For me i do not care as long as they keep us updated and do what they promise.This game got the core gameplay down and that's why so many players love it. You can play it hours on end without getting bored especially with friends where it in my opinion really shines!I would most certainly recommend giving it a try especially with a price tag of 29 99 Euros which in my opinion is cheap for a game. (Well it would be cheap if this game was a final release but for now it is a decent pricetag for how early access the game is...)Hope i could help you in your decision making...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I enjoy playing online with friends helps keep us connected after college. I'll still play this game but can't recommend anyone new buying it. Maintenance takes down all NA servers for 4 hours minimum on random days for updates often evenings when we're just done with work and meals. Feels like updates are occuring once per week. Can't speak for other regions. Gameplay relies heavily on random chance for looting and positioning choices which is fun but in combination with poor network setup (network lag input lag frame rate etc) every other game ends in frustration. I'm not confident this game will improve even after full release. Hope I'm proven wrong.

review: The best Battle Royale game as of today.It is poorly optimized but they have really made improvements overall and it feels like they are working continuously to improve the game further.I think unlike many others that the release of the new desertmap Miramar will be great for the PUBG community so we all have something to enjoy while they are working further towards the smoothest experience possible.I do think however that the game runs pretty smoothly on a decent computer. Make sure you have your grapichs drivers up to date as this reduces microlags tremendously.Nevertheless it's equal for every player. The game is loads of fun to play teamed up with your buddies raiding buildings jumping off cliffs with vehicles charging towards the latest airdrop.It's a great experience well worthy of the its price.

review: The Good This is one of the most interesting shooters I have played in the last 10 years. It combines the FPS experience fire team tactical based action with a survival/battle royale experience. The maps are enjoyable the War Mode is a nice change of pace and they are always adding new content. What I like most about this game is that there is no pay to win element at all. In the end you decide if you are going to run and gun ambush or sneak away and avoid contact with enemy players. The longer the game goes the more the tension builds and the feeling of a win is probably the best feeling of any game I have played in my entire gaming career (20+ years). The game also doesn't have the childish feel of some of its competitors. Its graphics are good (even on low which is used to increase frame rate) and the game feels realistic without being annoyingly realistic. The Bad The problem with this game is that it consistently has bugs and connection issues not to mention cheaters. Blue Hole needs to 1) Resolve the connection issues clean up bugs and continue to work on eliminating cheaters. *24/9/18 Despite the crying twitch streamers the connection issues have improved althought desync is still a problem. They have also added a nice feature to tell you when your report has resulted in a ban on a player that cheated"2) Advise the player base when server maintenance will occur in game and ahead of time. *24/9/18 This is being done at least same day*3) Remove the red zone it is useless and only causes frame rate drops. 4) Create a shooting range/practice area. Allow new players to get better with the weapons and existing players to try new guns. *24/9/18 This has been added and is excellent*5) Have the final zones be centered for all players to mitigate at least some of the RNG. 6) Allow players to select what map they want to play. *24/9/18 Partially fixed you can choose between the new and the old maps at least*7) Have more events but reduce the cost and make all content won permanent. *24/9/18 More events have been added with no cost other than time in game. Very nice*9) Add weather to all maps. Rain and fog on Erangel and a sandstorm on Miramar. *24/9/18 This has been added to great effect.*I would add two new ones as of 24/9/1810) Slightly increase loot on Erangel. I shouldn't be dropping with my squad in hot locations winning that location and coming out with one partially upgraded gun.11) Vary the final zones a bit more. On Sanhok the zone is consistently ending in the same predictable place.

review: Terrible development team 2million concurrent players and still unable to fix the most mundane bugs from day 1. Months without any improvement. Terrible 10 tick servers heaps of desync. Huge fps problems and fps changes based on where you are looking making the game feel terribly sluggy and runs poorly on even the most expensive of graphics cards. Half fix bugs and making more problems trying to fix them. Forced post processing to fix a fog bug? Removing .ini editing to fix a crouch bug? Putting bars on apartment windows to fix window jumping bug in all buildings? Vehicle sounds are ridiculously loud. Can't look behind your character in first person. Went back on all their promises about development and in game cosmetics. Put ads in the chinese client. Proning in the field of grass and having perfect third person accuracy. The servers are so utterly bad it is almost like a roll of the dice who wins the gun fight. Hit reg is so bad 2 3 hits register at the same time with another 2 after you get behind cover. Damage bug that if you get shot in the crotch you take full damage as if you are wearing no armour. That's just the peak of the sh*t mountain that is this game. If you are thinking about buying it definitely do not.

review: The most overhyped game in gaming history what i know.They have tests and they still releases updates which totally ruins game with crashes unstable and lower framerate and other technical and in game issues. How the hell is this possible? They presented Fix Pubg project where they openly released what and when they will fix. What happened? Nothing absolutely nothing. Wish i could refund this waste of time and money.25 minutes of running/driving/waiting and 0 15 minutes of actual gameplay. That's in most of the matches. Why should i play game where's the most of gameplay just stupid running or waiting. And that isn't biggest problem for me.The biggest problem is RNG... Is any game more RNG than this? I don't think so. I really don't understand how can someone play any game where is RNG more than skill. It destroys feeling of improvement in most of games. How can someone have fun in a game where your improvement is only small part of success. Matchmaking is even worse because there isn't anything like matchmaking at all. You will play against players with 2k hours and die everytime you meet them of course. You're just playing game by game and wish that this is that game where you'll have a luck on timings drops and not that good opponents. 0/10 unplayable hope it will die soon (it looks like it will so yeeey)
