review: I'm not going to tell you this game is good. As is it is honestly pretty bad. However from what I have seen and heard about the 1.0 release version that will be released in December gives me hope that the game will be fantastic. From gameplay looting looks 1000x smoother ballistics is improved driving is not so spastic and it lags so much less due to optimization. The addition of a new map which is set to release with 1.0 will give the game a fresh feel as it grows. New guns and vehicles are also something I look forward to with the 1.0 release. Thus I recommend this game and feel like it deserves a 8.5/10 because of how bad it is right now but how amazing the official release looks. Buy it now in case the price raises following the official release.

review: This game is really fun to play. A King of the Hill type of game. What do you have to expect You sit in a lobby with 99 other insane people. (Sometimes there is a lot of screaming and russian swearing but thats okay.)After a few seconds you sit in a plane and fly over an island. You can look on a map and decide where you want to go. After you jumped out of the plane you have to land and find your equipment to protect your life and kill everybody else. You can play in 3rd or 1st person view. You can play super stealthy and sneaky or really agressive. Both will work. There are a lot of weapons and vehicles to use. The longer you play the smaler the circle of death gets. You can t stay in one play you have to move. If you play smart you can win your chicken dinner.Currently there is only one map but this will be updated. Of course there are still bugs but it is still fun to play.Mostly I play with my friends in a squad. Duo and Solo are also fun.

review: PUBG is a very good game. I definitely recommend it however for lower end PCs I recommend to upgrade before playing or purchasing this game. The optimisation could use some work and there are still some glitches which will most likely be fixed in the near future. There is a solo option although I do recommend to play this with friends as it can get a little boring by yourself (you can matchmake with other random players but some troll don't play properly or don't speak your language so it is best to have friends. This game is completely skill based you can buy crates but they do not help you at all and are completely cosmetic. There are only 2 maps in the game right now (5th April 2018) but it is inevitable that more will be added. This game is very competitive and concentration is needed. If you re looking for a more chill and laid back game then I recommend Fortnite which is free. However I do believe PUBG is worth its price and it includes many more features such as modded servers.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I legitimately hate this game. Do not buy it. Guns are not fun to use. It feels like you're shooting off brand nerf darts at your enemies. Not even in damage but in response from using the gun and scoring a hit on your enemies. Get ready to spend an hour wandering around waiting for something to happen only to die to a sniper that's nearly invisible. Poorly optimized. Even on my PC which is capable of running VR at a smooth framerate I sometimes experience huge lag spikes. An absolutely rediculous monetization model. Loot crates paid cosmetics and something reminiscient of Fortnite's Battle Pass all in a game you have to pay $30 to enter. This is absolutely stupid and shows how greedy its devs are.If you want a Battle Royale game that's fun there's many free to play alternatives that are better than this dumpster fire. The Darwin Project and Fortnite are much more polished and fair gaming experiences than PUBG. PUBG is not refined but it shows its dev team's hunger for cash. It is a complete waste of both time and money.

review: I can't believe I actually spent money on this. Not only is it horribly optomised buggy and very clunky but really boring. I get it I am new and will suck until I get the hang of combat. I typically drop in gear up kill a couple of people but die to an annonmyous sniper shot from far off. Not that there is anytnhing wrong with that I love picking people off myself. I just hate that the mechanics of the game force you to always be on the move due to the massive world sizes although while at the same time having such an open and airid world leave you open to just be picked off. It really isn't tactical just kind of a boner killer. Most deaths are not preventable just you desperately trying to reach the inner circle while some jerk off with a rifle picks you off from the edge of the circle. THAT'S ALL FINE! Maybe it's just me but what got me most was just what a blantant money grab the experience was. I'm so sick of buying my games in tiny pieces.As a community we can not let ourselves get walked over by money hungry devs shoving microtransactions down our throats. It's like buying a meal and being charged extra per fry. I'M SICK OF YOUR CORPERATE!

review: I'll try to keep this fairly concise..To start off don't get me wrong I really did enjoy this game and as a whole it's really not bad as far as entertainment goes.Graphics are good optimisation isn't bad to the point where it's unplayable and there's no p2w mechanics (thank god).And the feeling of being in the top 10 and constantly being wary of where your enemy is is always a great adrenaline rush no matter how many times you do it. Unfortunately I cannot recommend people to buy this at the current time. Save your money and go pick up Fortnite for free and maybe shell out $10 for the battle pass if you really like it and want to support it. Sure this game might have a more realistic feel to it but personally I couldn't care about realistic graphics if you just don't enjoy the game. And what really is my main gripe is that blueball entertainment is constantly pushing out insanely large updates. But is it bug fixes to a large amount of clipping and graphical glitches or the abhorrent audio (Let's not even talk about the servers)? No. It's freaking cosmetic updates that consist of outfits and other junk when the game is in dire need of patching to improve game quality. I could say a lot more but right now it just seems like the devs are giving minimal attention to what is really dragging this game down.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG Where do I start.I've had a lot of fun playing it both alone and with friends.The gameplay can be very diffrent and you can often choose what kind of game you want to have If you want to have a lot of action you drop in a location where you often find enemies (Cities large complexes etc.) If you are one looking for more of a quiet game then you just try to drop at a more remote location.The various guns are quite skill based as they have unique spraypatterns and that rewards more experienced players over new ones. Saying this doesn't mean it's impossible to win a game just because someone is better experienced than yourself.The randomness of the game has two sides. It makes every game a bit diffrent and you can't always play the exact same way. If you find a sniper for example you probably want to get some distance from your enemies when engaging. And if you only find an SMG it's the opposite. This also makes the game a little unbalanced as some won't get barly any loot and some will be stacked after just a few minutes.Overall if you are fan of the BATTLE ROYALE genre this is probably one of the best ones out there right now.

review: At the time of writing I have 360 hours in game this game is addictive as hell and really inspires that just one more try mentality as a multiplayer game it doesn't have a set way to play it and therefore offers tonnes of replayability and is a pretty beautiful game. (Especially if you use reshade). My only issue is that I had to purchase an SSD to play the game as the game suffers from a memory leak currently where old hard drives that spin at less than 7400 RPM can't process the game files fast enough to implement the game effectively so if you are buying this game for now at least install it on an SSD9/10 Minor inconvenience withholds it from 10/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pros Great game. I have played shooters since COD4 and this is my favorite so far. It is right up there with Battlefield 3 and 4 as far as "fun" goes. It is not like them in a lot of ways but I played BF3 and 4 a ton. The best thing they have done with this game so far is make a 1st person mode. It makes the game much more intense and skill oriented. It also discourages camping. great map design plenty of different guns realistic gunplay mechanics good weapon balance easy to get a game going with friends the "rush" all the memes it is pretty EXTREMELY frequent updates and responsive devs projectile based bullets HIGH skill cap for good playersCons netcode or connection to server. This game is very inconsistent especially at the beginning of matches with regard to proper server refresh and hit detection Can be buggy and crash quite demanding in the graphics card department inconsistent frames poor 1080p performance with a GTX 970 ( 80 100 or so fps on lowish) occasionally getting killed around corners occasionally derpy physicsOverall This is a great game. I would recommend it to anyone.

review: I only play this game because I enjoy playing it with friends and its style suits me better than Fortnite. That being said I would not recommend this game to anyone for a few reasons One of the worst optimization jobs for any major game I have ever played. Frequent crashes and other performance issues regardless of PC capability.Despite promises to the contrary hackers are a constant issue and are rampant on any region.Most updates add cosmetics rather than addressing issues lying within the game leading to the next point...Overall very buggy game with issues that are never addressed even since launch (parachutes as an example)If you enjoy a different Battle Royale game play that one instead of wasting money on this. If you do want to play it with friends I would give it a maximum price of $10.

review: This game is incredibly enjoyable exciting and gets my adrenaline rushing like nothing I've ever played....BUT until the devs stop banning people because streamers say they were "harassed" I'm giving it a thumbs down.Devs honking a horn is NOT harassment. Explain to me how that effects someones stream or is harassment? Kill the person if they're doing that and if they're in your squad don't play with that person again (DUH). Also when you're constantly being thrown into random servers the odds of actually "stream sniping" someone is virtually impossible. This isn't like other games where you can find the server name and follow the streamer into it. Who the hell made this decision?Also the broken promise regarding microtransactions. That is pretty goddamn shady. That's bad enough but when there are so many glaring areas that need work ignoring all of that to add a feature you said you wouldn't add until release is a straight kick in the nuts to your supporters. Devs don't forget We made you successful and we can undo that by choosing not to buy anymore games from someone who isn't trustworthy and thinks prioritizing streaming to the point of BANNING legitimate players who may not even be aware the other person is streaming is INSANITY. Whoever made this decision needs to be FIRED.You guys have created a PR nightmare for yourself and until you make it right it's only going to get worse. It's like you started out with a row boat and now you're flying around in a Yacht. Except now you decided to blow a hole in the bottom of the yacht allowing it to take on water (which will inevitably sink it) but you choose to pretend the hole isn't there and that you didn't make it. GET BACK TO REALITY.Actual hacks deserve a ban not because someone did something that some sniveling streamer didn't like.Also out of the 100+ hours I have played I have never had a game run so poorly on my computer. The building almost never load in time and I get messages saying that I have no connection....I can run RUST on my internet and computer with less problem than this game.

review: PUBG is popular because it's popular and it's not call of duty. This game does not feel polished. The graphics are dull and generic. The game was fun for several hours because of the high levels of tension with each match and the rewarding feeling of killing opponents and turning them into victims. However the gameplay is repetitive and promotes campy defensive behavior which is not a style of shooting game that I enjoy. Its even difficult to get good at the game because you spend so much time walking and looting and almost no time shooting. The shooting doesn't feel particularly good and doesn't provide good feedback on whether you are close to hitting an enemy especially at range. The game does not perform well either. Its hard to recommend this game at this price point.

review: Extremely enjoyable with friends. Still fun solo. 2 maps a grass land one and a desert based zone.This game is basically if you took games like DayZ H1Z1 or Rust and actually made the movement and control scheme feel 100x more natural. I feel one of the most powerful plus sides to this game is that everything feels fluid to do and not some clunky mess of buttons. This just makes it feel less like a chore to learn and more instinctual.Yes there is an issue with players from countries far away from your server region joining your server ping wise.I feel the new replay + report system will help with cleaning up any domestic or foreign cheaters found in your game.Warning Unless you have a powerful PC the game may not run perfectly though they have made massive optimizations around the beginning of 2018 which make it run a lot smoother. I pull a constant 144 fps with recent updates.

review: I struggle to understand why custom games are hosted on a PUBG server with a ten player starting requirement. Its dumb. In games such as CSGO when I want to host a private game with friends the server runs off my computer and friends can join the server that is created. It's a simple peer to peer system. Now I do appreciate that PUBG is more intensive for a sever to run but at least make hosting your own server and option for those who can run it. Also the 10 player requirrment is silly it should only be 2 players to begin. In my honest opinion custom games are great however the devs have once more managed to turn something that should be awsome into something that we all have to complain about because of uncalled for restrictions and stupid limitations to something that had the models of other games been acknowledged could have been excellent.

review: 200 HOUR REVIEWOver 300 matches played and I have won about 20 games total.Let's talk about hackers So in game there is a death cam feature that lets you see from the enemy's perspective that killed you. If your playing in a squad you will need to wait until everyone is dead in order to see your death cam. Furthermore you can always see the entire match play out using the absolutely awesome Replay System. It is really fun to watch replays.I have witnessed teammates accuse people of hacking around 25% of my games. I usually will watch the replay in order to learn what types of hacks exist. The bottom line is 99% of hacking accusations are false. Yes that guy put three head shots on you with a M4 at 200 meters. Yes he does miss shots sometimes but he is really that good. Deal with it.In 300 matches I have encountered TWO hackers.OK so now that we have that talk done let's talk about pros and cons.Pros Addictive Looks good and sounds good TONS of fun with a small group of friendsCons As a FPS it still needs some tweaking on the back end and a few major bugs persist. The Devs seem to have their heads up their asses a bit. Hopefully they will humble up more. Priorities need fixed. No signs of discouraging toxic behavior. It's 2018 and unfortunately games need to be more proactive with bans and such.Overall this game is well worth the $30 price tag and I highly recommend trying it out!

review: I dont have much hours of playtime. And I don't have much experience in MMOs but one thing is certain. I DEEPLY REGRET buying this game. Waste of money. The lag or whatever it may be is horrendous. One second you are grabing a gun and the next you are 5 away from it and with a bullet in your head. Hackers are everywhere. I have got one shoted with a pistol from miles away. You think you can get in cover? get shot throught cover several times. I dont recommend it. But if you guys still want to try it go ahead.After some time after release my opinion remains the same. The game gets several updates and patches more often compared to other games. It has a new integration which is good. It seems good for the community and the game. Although I know the bulky patches fix little or nothing. I keep having lag... and is not because of my internet. I play other mmo games and none of them are like pubg servers. Other bugs remain. I still think this was a waste of my money.

The games you go in last for about 30 to 40 minutes which depends on how far you get and i liked it more then other games because it feels cleaner then other games like h1z1 and it it better to play in my opinion and there are alot of guns which i like and i like for how satisfied you feel when you hit a long ranged sniper shot. Because of all the fun and good times that i have had playing this game i would recommend it to others. And because other people are missing out on good times like little glitches that cause a big laugh between the group

review: I enjoy playing PUBG when it works. Which is not often.There are multiple errors that you'll become acquainted with when you try to play. Failed to authenticate from external provider Wrong MatchState Pre Login InProgress A PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS Process has crashed...These happen daily and I can't play more than two matches without some sort of error popping up. It's fun and I like playing with my friends. I just wants to actually play instead of getting dropped from a match or not even loading in.As a bonus the developer continues to release new stuff which in any other game I would be ecstatic for. However all I want is the game to work. Once they've got that sorted out then make new stuff.

review: Greetings Steam Community Are you looking for a game that is H1Z1 combined with DayZ's survival? Do you want to become the number one and become the king of a hundred players royal? Well PLAYERUNKNOWS'S BATTLEGROUNDS is the game that your are looking for.Pros Amazing graphics that make the game unique.Such an amazing community.Best seller on the market.Combined with your friends this game is at the top.Battle Eye Protector which gives hackers and instaban and IP ban too.Early access game which means that the game improves as you play.The map is huge so that you will not die right when you fall down.Cons Many desktops cannot play the game as it requires a "monster" build.As for a battle Royal game it can take 40 60 minutes to complete a match.Some weapons are inaccurate while shooting which will get you in trouble.Campers are everywhere.Players that have no idea about Battle Royal games have to get used to the game otherwise they cannot play at all.Those were my pros&amp cons. Please keep in mind that it is my opinion and many players may find some of them or even all of them wrong. Although that I do recommend the game. It is a must have on your libary. So what are you waiting for? Go ahead and buy yourself a game that you will not regret buying it.Signed by Raymon

review: Ok so this game surpassed all my expectations. When I first saw it I thought it was just a H1Z1 king of the kill clone and didn't want to even take a better look at it but since most of my friends bought it I decided to give it a try and all I can say is that I was amazed by how polished the gameplay and shotting were and because I have a pretty beefy rig I didn't even notice the optimizations problems at first and after the 1.0 release I get around 120 fps+. So good job Bluehole for making an awesome game where I can mess around in solo and do whatever I want but also where I can have a competitive experience with my friends and try to get that chicken dinner ). And I do have to say that it does get frustrating at times when you die from a camping sniper on a hill or when you die at the start when you couldn't pick up that shotgun faster than that other guy near you. But other than that I really recommend this game to the player that wants "THE ULTIMATE LIFE &amp DEATH FIGHT" and who doesn't mind having some games where he/she spends 30 minutes looting and then dies to a camper hiding in a bush.

review: Loved this game immensely for the 15 hours I had the opportunity to play it. I was banned for cheating after about 15 hours of game play. Had 3 kills in 15 hours of game play. Contacted steam Bluehole and battleeye to investigate the false flag so far nothing. It was funny though my ban came in about 30 seconds AFTER a kill... The first kill I had in about 4 hours. May have capped a dev or a moderator and they didnt like it. Thats my suspect. I hope someone sees this so they can investigate and fix this because I really did like this game. I never played it for stats its not a game you play to get the most kills... Its a game you play to get into rediculous situations trying to take out a group with automatic rifles with nothing but a frying pan.

review: Garbage game. Badly optimized super repetitive slow and boring gameplay. The game is also full of hackers and they're not doing anything about it. They also didn't keep on their promises Frequent updates (each month) out of early access in autumn (still in early access and we're in winter now) etc. They keep adding things that are not absolutely necessary to add immediatly (like a ton of new weapon...). Like seriously I'd prefer having an optimized game over useless content. (I say useless because it doesn't matter how many weapons they add to the game the gameplay is always going to be the same one SLOW AND BORING. Also 90% of the weapons they had are crate weapons...) Anyway don't waste your money buying this game. As soon as it gets out of early access I'm gonna charge it back...

review: Good game to play with friends I find it pretty boring when solo. Buy it if you have a good gaming PC if you have an average or low end PC don't go for it as it is less optimised and leads to crashes and Immense FPS lags even on gtx 1060 OC. Matchmaking is very fast so you don't have to wait for more than 5 seconds but in some servers shots don't eally register well. Conclusions Do not buy if you don't have a good PC. Fun with friends not much in solo ((Might be my personal experience)) Fast matchmaking! Barely have to wait so its game time! Servers not very well optimised ((But they are good enough to let you play in peace with few lags or delays))
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a great game with great psychics It has slight lag issues since my pc has a bad cpu but it otherwise runs great. In combat it stays decently steady frames. The weapon drops are very fair but it sometimes seems very hard to find even a pistol. The alternate bridge from the military base I think should have a better way to counteract bridge campers. Overall it stays at decent frames has fun mechanics and has many strategies to fight an enemy. I don't see why more people are still waiting to buy this game it predicted the future. The flooded city was basically a warning for Texas.

review: THIS GAME SUCKS! GET RID OF THE RED ZONE! GET RID OF IT! HOW MANY TIMES HAS THE COMMUNITY TOLD YOU BLUEBALLS!? NOBODY WANTS THE RED ZONE NOBODY! YOU GUYS MAKE ME SICK! ...MAKE ME SICK!IT'S PATHETIC GAME DESIGN THINKING AND BALANCE. WHY DO YOU HAVE RANDOMIZED RED ZONES IN THE GAME HUH!? IT DOESN'T MAKE SENSE! BUNCH OF IDIOTS! TAKE IT OUT TAKE IT OUT!!!THESE IDIOTS AT BLUEBALL ENTERTAINMENT!I'm gonna take a diarrhea I'll be right back That was a Dr. DisRespect funny moment if you didn't understand the reference.In all seriousness I do recommend this game wholeheartedly. It's by no means perfect. Far from it actually. There are many bugs and quirks some even game breaking but despite all that this game will be responsible for many hours of your life if you give it a chance.I purchased this game back in Christmas of 2017 when it left Early Access along with gifting it to my friend as a "troll" gift. PUBG has basically been the only game we've played since then. There is no other game that gets you as adrenaline pumped as being in a top 5 situation in the final circle in PUBG. It took me 60 hours to get my first chicken dinner. It was 2AM and me and my duo partner were literally screaming into the mic as we got the final kill for the chicken dinner. Every game is a different story with different circumstances. Every chicken dinner you win will be a new experience.The truly crowning achievement of PUBG is the gunplay and projectile based ballistics system. There is nothing as satisfying as getting that 500m+ Kar98 headshot kill for the first time. I've tried other battle royale games including the most recent Black Ops 4 and I always end up coming back to PUBG due to that tight gunplay. There's also no BR game out currently that's grounded in realism. H1Z1 and Fortnite feels too arcadey BO4 feels too futuristic and fast. PUBG hits that perfect balance betwen realism and survival in my opinion.Most of the big bugs have been fixed and I can say the terrible optimization claim is greatly exaggerated at this point. It's just become a meme status to say PUBG has terrible optimization (Assassin's Creed Unity anyone?).The three biggest issues have been largely fixed.1. Server tickrate All server tickrates have been upgraded from 20Hz to 60Hz.2. Framerate Framerates are quite stable from a variety of systems I've tested. I've tested on high end GTX 1080 Ti systems and mid tier GTX 1060 systems.3. Desynchronization The latest hotfix has fixed the big desync issues. That's not to say desync doesn't exist anymore. Due to the nature of multiplayer FPS games desync and peeker's advantage will always be a thing.The biggest issue that remains is matchmaking. As of now people in Australia and South America have issues finding servers to play on. NA EU and Asia do not have issues finding servers. If you aren't from the above mentioned 2 regions then you should have no issues jumping straight into a game.I give this game an 8/10. I want to rate it higher but due to bugs and need of more polish I can't out of principle. It has the potential to be 10/10 once all the issues are polished. I haven't been this captivated by an FPS game since CS 1.6
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Yeah just because they slap a big 1.0 on this game and relaese it from early access doesnt compensate for The game's just as broken as it was in early access until you get into mid game. On a side note they have mad incredible changes to performance which can not go unnoticed.Until this is fixed i would not recommend buying this game unless you spawn well away from anyone and waste 20 minutes playing seculeded simply to avoid the chance of dying from early game rubber banding.

review: A good game with good mechanics but god please fix your rules of conduct they make you Brendan Greene look like an actual ing child. Saying like "Ohhh you'll get banned if you cuss! You'll get banned if you friendly fire!" will not help at all. I mean surely there are people that are s and friendly fire But guess what? That can simply be fixed with a switch of a button(meaning taking friendly fire out of the game)! If you were aiming for realism on this one then why would you say "no friendly fire" if you didn't want them to shoot each other in the first place yet they're able to anyway? Think about that. Now I'm gonna start with these "rules of conduct" and rant about them a little bit. Starting off regarding the vulgar language that can't be helped. It's guaranteed that people will be going around shouting "niggger" in your game and there is nothing you can do about it Is it wrong to some people? Yes. What can they do? They can simply mute voice chat outside of their party if needed(if that was a feature that is). As for making threats of real world violence and harassment and what not I completely understand but all of this stuff is put together like I'm playing on some god damn DarkRP server in Garry's Mod or something. Now this one's an obvious one reading "Do not engage in request or offer illegal activities or materials " like hell I'd do that! Greene makes it sound like he's making some PSA to children under the age of 12 to not break the law. Rule #7 "Do not impersonate other individuals " this can easily be fixed with a simple username system in which names cannot be used more than once(which seems to be in place already so I don't see the point of this). Rule #8 "Do not spam be it in text or voip " okay there is no actual text chat in PUBG at this very moment so I don't see the point of text spamming at all. As for VOIP once again that can't be helped so this rule entire is also pointless much like Rule #7. Rule #9 seems understandable which basically is "don't cheat " but that can easily be fixed with an anti cheat system rather than just putting up a line of text on a website saying "don't cheat guys it's not cool kid behavior". Rule #10 they have people of the community enforcing this one I guess which is basically just teaming with other parties is prohibited However one must go to the forums on the actual game website in order to do so and they must gather *video evidence* in order to submit a report. Rule 12 "no stream sniping " this also is an easy fix so it's pointless to put here. Most of the livestreams be it on Twitch or YouTube Gaming or Mixer have a little bit of delay so that isn't much of a big deal. Rule #14 seems more of like a stupid remark made by a 12 year old on the internet saying "Do not share your account don't grant access to your account to anyone else and do not access anyone else's account even with permission " everyone knows this Brendan so there's no need to actually post this absurd and make a giant list of rules that sound like a child's minecraft/DarkRP server or something like that. Also one more note Greene please stop getting into arguments with other people on Twitter it seriously ruins my respect even more for you and it makes you look more immature. This is simply just some harsh criticism that must be taken care of and I hope he acknowledges his mistakes and corrects them from then on. Overall I really like this game and I think it has great potential but I really do not like the people behind it because they make terrible decisions and I believe something should be done about that. Until things change in the future(which is unlikely at this point in time) I will leave my review as negative.EDIT I decided to throw in a Pros/Cons list just because I feel like itPROS Good BallisticsGood graphicsHigh Player activityCONS Terrible netcode ed up hitboxesHackers. Lots of them.Microtransactions that no one has asked for even though the devs have plenty of moneyDevelopment team has a work ethic Like c'mon FIX YOUR ING BEFORE YOU RELEASE NEW CONTENT MY GUY.Brendan Greene has the mentality of a 12 year old on a DarkRP server enforcing the rules even though he isn't a staff member
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: TLDR The game is in a good spot the microtransaction controversy it stupid. PUBG isn't perfect but the best battle royale on the market and even if pubg doesn't last forever you should jump on the bandwagon while you have the chance the game is freaking awesome right now. Since buying PUBG weeks ago i've been having non stop fun. With the latest patch people seem to have changed their views negatively but i feel that most of these people aren't reviewing the current game but what they fear it will become.The largest issue most people have is that the dev's went back on their word and implemented micro transactions before a full release. I understand why people could be put off by this. But i feel that most of these people are either younger children or lack the understand of how development of a game actually works. It cost money and lots of it especially if the devs are wanting to expand in the ways they have seem to let on. I think that if the dev's feel it's time to implement microtransaction's then i trust them as they haven't let us down yet and the game has already grown faster than most other games.now for the gameplay I've never been hooked to a game so fast in my life. I luckily fought my way to the top 10 in my first game i played and oh boy was that an adrenline rush. I was hooked from then on as i migrated to duo's and squads where i found exactly where i wanted to play. 4 man squads are some of the most fun i've had in an online game and it has been a true emotional rollercoster. I've had many hilarious moments with the friends i've made with just as many heart breaks due to a thrown game.(I don't have any friends that i play with i use the pubg discord to find groups so solo players can play squads too) I've yet to find any game breaking bugs in over 80 hours of play and i don't seem to have any hit registration problems ( I tend to stay on na servers where i live) and am starting to beleive that the people complaining honestly suck and are trying to blame the game.looting can be rng based but i've only really had problems when landing in a low loot population area. The reason you see so many people drop military and school is because this game is high risk high reward and that's where the best loot is. I see no problem with having loot scarcely located in the lower end loot spots and if you want a better chance at the gear you want then you should have to fight for it.end game is much more tactical than early/mid game and i feel that a large amount of people that say the circle is rng lack experience in the late game. If i play safe and sit on the edge's of the circle its bound to close on the opposite side of me some times. Most people who win position intelligently. Honestly the game is about 70% strategy 20% skill and 10% luck. from my experiences the game isn't perfect but it's obviously one of the best games out thats why the queue is instant lol. Don't let the addition of purely cosmetic microtransactions stop you from playing a game that has what so many other games lack Damn good gameplay.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Do NOT buy this game.. dont get me wrong the actual gameplay and idea is amazing however (yes i am aware that this is an early acces game but that is no excuse) constant fps drop lags and other bugs makes it a terrible experience. You can be in the middle of an amazing game doing well and then all of the sudden the server shuts down or the sudden drop in FPS will make it impossible to play. "sorry for the inconvinience but please bare with us" is a sentence you are gonna have more interaction with than the actual gameplay. And to set this game (at its current state) to 30 is simply outrageous.

review: Thoughts about game I've loved this game for the most of 500 hours i've played it's unique and great and represents a great future for the g.Shortly after a many hours i've noticed a ton of hackers which basically ruin the game but i still have high hopes that the anti cheat will prevail and be able to detect the cheats that are being used. Besides the hackers this game is basically one of the best games i've played and i would recommend it to any who would like to purchase a fun action packed game But be aware the game is still in early access and is working through many of the bugs and cheaters at a fast rate.Another opinion i'll have to add to the game is that because of OC having no players PUBG has decided to get rid of OC servers. In my opinion this is one of the reasons i have stopped playing the game as i dislike having around 200 ping everygame i play (gives me a massive disadvantage to other players) let alone still seing hackers until this day If you live in Oceania don't buy this game unless you are going to take it competitively and go into faceit games that are Oceania based.10/10

review: 1. It's going to be the usual gambling with crates and paid keys (2 50$ each).I'm totally fine with microtransactions when you actually know what you get for your money. Selling a set of costume for 5 10 bucks or so would be completely acceptable. Slot machines are not.2. It's an Early Access game. It has many problems fixing those and then adding more content and game mechanics which has been promised before should be the priority.According to Steamspy the game sold around 5 350 000 copies so far that means after the 30% cut of Steam they made roughly 100 million dollars before taxes. They barely had to spend on any marketing either so my guess is that's enough revenue to get this thing actually finished without the need for a few more millions.3. They said they want that money to launch the first PUBG eSports event during Gamescom.As I've said before they have enough money so might as well fund this tournament by themselves. Even then we still haven't got our final product what we paid for.Competitive games tend to have a team composition with selected weapons and roles the gamemodes or the maps usually even out the chances for both participants and the outcome of a match comes down on pure skill and/or teamwork.Here from the very moment of your feet touching the ground RNG takes a HUGE part in the experience. It affects your loot it affects your positioning by the placement of the circle.When you can camp inside a 3 level building with an SKS and at least lvl2 armor on you for like 20 minutes while others have to run kilometers to be inside the playzone or even better drive there so everyone hears you and knows your position before you even realise there are others in the area than the chances are far from equal.I have no idea how it's going to work without altering the gamemode or the loot system. If they do than it's not really the same game anymore. If they don't than it's not competitive gaming but a little get together sponsored by the devs.Oh and of course the game is unfinished it has many problems yadayada. Altough i haven't mentioned many of them especially from a technical standpoint they are still there and should be taken care of before holding competitions with prize pools and such.4. The devs promised there will be no microtransactions until the game is finished.No comment on this this was a straight up lie.Now it feels like the Early Access warning has been just stamped on the store page and has no actual meaning anymore since the game is being treated now as a complete product or at least that's how it feels like so be aware.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well often I try to get 30 or 50 hours on most games more depending on what type of game it is. For PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS it didn't take me long on whether I enjoyed this game or not. I do enjoy my fair share of battle royale game The Culling (before the terrible patches) was enjoyable Arma 3 BR was awesome and H1Z1 BR was also great. This game tries to bring these set pieces to the next level and it horribly fails. The optimization in this game makes it unplayable at times. I understand that its a working process but my god this game is unplayable at times. The customization is actually really cool but if you don't get a viechle the game can turn out to be a running simulator. It kinda depends some landings you can have a fun instense gun fight (if the game doesn't break down) or you can be running around just looking for loot or someone to fight. Also for me it can get tiring pretty fast and for a BR game it actually is kinda predictable. Half of the time you get shot by some dude camping or you get a couple of kills and have your car tip over for no reason and kill you. Overall this game is 3/10. It is below average and I suggest to wait till the game is complete to play it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PERFORMANCE UNKOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS I think you guys are not here for me to tell you what this game is about and who made this game etc. so lets get straight to the point.This game can really be fun alone and especially playing with friends as a team. Being one of the last few survivers or even being place 1 can be a thrill as you can see I have played quite some hours myself. What so ever the performance is so horrible that PUBG is used as a BENCHMARK now a days. Half a year ago the performance was bad but the performance got even worse from patch to patch. If you dont have a mid highend gaming PC like an i7 7700k or coffelake i7 8700k CPU + a good GPU such as an NVIDIA 1060 and and better you wont be able to enjoy the game because it is literally unplayable. If you have a worse GPU as mentioned you will have to play on very low medium settings and still have lags and loading textures. When your game isn't bussy crashing and you are even able to play at all.Don't get me wrong it's not all bad about the game but unless they fix the performance it's not recommendable at all.EDIT 12.02.2018 YOU HAVE TO SPEND REAL MONEY TO OPEN THE LOOT CRATES YOU ALREADY BOUGHT WITH IN GAME MONEY....WOW WHAT A SCAM

The amount of cheaters is extremely exaggerated mostly due to the replay mode being pretty inacurate. There are a few annoyances like vehicle physics being pretty buggy and shotgun spread not being too fair but in general the game is really good. I'd mostly reccomend it with friends but solo is also a fun gamemode.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS Jest to gra akcji z wieloma elementami fantazji przykładem tego jest jazda motorem po prostej drodze (zazwyczaj wyjebie ciebie w powietrze w najmniej odpowiednim momencie a następnie zdechniesz). Przedstawię wam plusy oraz minusy tej gry (według mnie). PLUSY Gra jest ciężka do ogarnięcia system strzelania jest trudny. System loot'u przyjemnie przeszukuje się lokacje (chyba że jest to jebany mirramar). Leśna mapa ma wiele świetnych miejsc do trenowania swoich umiejętności np. Sosnóvkę szkołę bądź szpital. Jeśli masz kolegów do gry to warto kupić PUBG'a szybko ci się nie znudzi. Kooperacja jest to gra taktyczna a nie czysto skillowa jak np. H1Z1 musisz przemyśleć każdy swój atak chyba że ktoś nagle wybiega ci na ryj w budynku... Na squadach albo duo bez kooperacji nie wygrasz. Normalna społeczność (w większości) ciężko tutaj znaleźć tyle dzieci co na przykład w CS GO. Modyfikacje broni. Możliwość otworzenia skrzyni za darmo (wystarczy grać i zdobywać punkty). Gra w nią fenomenalny gracz "Sokół". MINUSY Nie możesz wybrać na jakiej mapie chcesz grać. Dodali spierdoloną mape "mirramar" której duża część graczy nie lubi a większość serwerów jest właśnie na niej. Skiny do broni niedługo stanie się jak CS (według mnie)... Spotkasz w niej dużo nieogarniętych polaczków np. Natec'a. CereS dokucza. Twórcy to rasiści czarni ludzie przyciągają bombardowania. PODSUMOWANIE Uważam że warto kupić tą grę jest cały czas rozwijana. Jeden z lepszych battle royale'i o ile nie najlepszy. Ogólna ocena 8 5/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: While this is a good game in theory it does the opposite of what the point of a game is to be more fun then not.If you are not a player of highly skilled aim then it is best that you dont pick this game up you will likely be met with frustrations over and over again HUH what do you mean?Well you spend the first 2 minutes getting the match started ( time and region depending) before you are boots on the ground at which point you will spent about 10 minutes trying to get loot that you are happy with ( basically any weapon above a AK 47 tier) and armors of atleast level 2 before you will even want to think about running out in the wild which is to an extent is just rng if you actually find any and make your way inside the zones and after all the zones it very often can just come down to luck will the final circle be to your advantage or not and during this 30 minutes of getting to the final circle you may just get 1 shot killed at any time leaving you with nothing but repeating that exact scenario over and over again and to be fair with a 1/100 chance you should get used to the over and over partso what is it about this game that draws in the numbers? it gives you the same feeling gambling does when you get a win where as in this games case its often not a win but just a single digit finish because even that wont be a easy feat for you if your aim in this game is below averageSo take in mind that this game can be a very large time investment with no emotional payout and that if you wish to have fun then this game is not constant fun its about rare single bubbles that last for a fleeting secondIf you have an above average aim then i see no reason to play this but if like me and you are so so then you will have a lot more fun plaything any other shooter that has short 3 5 minute rounds

review: This game was promising and highly addictive when it first came out but the developers just don't understand how to code anything. It's plagued by desync terrible servers horrible optimization all around most people just use low graphics to keep a high framerate regardless of hardware. Best of all is Brendan Greene won't acknowledge any of it. He thinks the game is in such a good spot that they can push it out of early access. It still plays better than most online early access games but it's the blind leading the deaf in their dev department. Instead of optimizing the game they push new weapons and maps.There's also no region lock or latency limits so you get Asian players in NA servers and they continually desync and lag all around while hacking and using aimbots. That's probably the biggest issue.

review: Don't waste your money. Just go play fortnite. This game is so buggy it is impossible to play. I bought it and I thought "okay maybe it just takes some getting used to" and i played about 20 hours and decided that the game is just trash. Watched the death cam to see one of them go full auto at me from between 100 200m hit every shot at full auto he then gets up his buddy whom I knocked out. I go and watch a team members death cam (they were killed by the guy I knocked out) and this fella gets up uses an item for about .002 of a second and then is at full health and proceeds to shoot my team mate through a car. You literally cannot see my team mate from the players perspective.At this point PUBG is a broken game and must be fixed. With over 450 hours in PUBG and thousands of hours in shooters in general I would compare PUBG in its current state to the disgrace that was known as WarZ.Yes Bluehole you are doing alot to combat hackers **BUT YOU ARE NOT DOING ENOUGH**. Also sidenote as if you'd ing bend over for the whiney es that were leaving fog matches and complaining about it and remove the map from the game. That was my favourite map and you ruined it. review: Personally I do enjoy this game and while this game certainly does have its ups and downs I am not here to praise or criticize this game. I am here to offer a phenomenal 4 Cheese Ravioli recipe!Here are the ingredients you will need!Ravioli Dough 2 cups all purpose flour 1 pinch salt 1 teaspoon olive oil 2 eggs 1 1/2 tablespoons water.Ravioli Filling 1 (8 ounce) container ricotta cheese 1 (4 ounce) package cream cheese softened 1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese 1/2 cup provolone cheese shredded 1 egg 1 1/2 teaspoons dried parsley.Pesto Alfredo Cream Sauce 2 tablespoons olive oil 2 cloves garlic crushed 3 tablespoons prepared basil pesto sauce 2 cups heavy cream 1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese 1 (24 ounce) jar marinara sauce.1. Mound the flour and salt together on a work surface and form a well. Beat the teaspoon of olive oil 2 eggs and water in a bowl. Pour half the egg mixture into the well. Begin mixing the egg with the flour with one hand use your other hand to keep the flour mound steady. Add the remaining egg mixture and knead to form a dough.2. Knead the dough until smooth 8 to 10 minutes add more flour if the dough is too sticky. Form the dough into a ball and wrap tightly with plastic. Refrigerate for 1 hour.3. While the dough is resting prepare the ravioli filling. Combine the ricotta cheese cream cheese mozzarella cheese provolone cheese egg and parsley and mix well. Set the filling aside.4. Heat 2 tablespoons of olive oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add the crushed garlic and pesto sauce and cook for one minute. Pour in the heavy cream raise the heat to high and bring the sauce to a boil. Reduce the heat and simmer for 5 minutes. Add the Parmesan cheese and stir until the cheese melts. Remove the pan from the heat and keep warm.5. Meanwhile in a separate saucepan warm the marinara sauce over medium low heat.6. Preheat an oven to 375 degrees F (190 degrees C). Beat the egg with the tablespoon of water to make the egg wash.7. Roll out the pasta dough into thin sheets no thicker than a nickel. To assemble the ravioli brush the egg wash over a sheet of pasta. Drop the filling mixture on the dough by teaspoonfuls about one inch apart. Cover the filling with the top sheet of pasta pressing out the air from around each portion of filling. Press firmly around the filling to seal. Cut into individual ravioli with a knife or pizza cutter. Seal the edges.8. Fill a large pot with lightly salted water and bring to a rolling boil over high heat. Stir in the ravioli and return to a boil. Cook uncovered stirring occasionally until the ravioli float to the top and the filling is hot 4 to 8 minutes. Drain well.9. Grease a baking sheet. Place the cooked ravioli on the sheet pan and bake in the preheated oven until brown about 4 minutes.10. To serve the ravioli divide them among four warmed serving bowls. Drizzle the marinara sauce over the ravioli and then top with the cream sauce.

review: Anyone Downvoting this game by far really is idiotic. "gameplay feels clunky too many bugs hackers not well optimized". Fellas the Game is in Alpha for god's sake. It's already running better than H1Z1 and all other end stage Battle Royale games/mods. By far it's already passed up CS GO in popularity and already surpassing League of legends in viewers for Twitch. Reason For My Upvote People are crying about recieving Bans for honking their horns around said streamer and weren't aware. First off the bans being dished out are investigated to a fair extent. Keep in mind that they view the games you leave after already joining a lobby until people "Coincidentally" stay in that one lobby out of dozens they've let to harass these people trying to stream a game to their fans. Accept the ban and stop acting like idiots. Simple. Having to argue it out with the developers and being stubborn about getting caught won't help. Negativly reviewing the game for this said reason isn't right either. I think these are being dished out fairly. That's that. Developers are pumping out very much needed updates and since the release the optimization they've worked on the game is incredible. I went from running the game at 30 50 frames with Low/Medium settings to 60 100 FPS on Medium/Ultra settings even while streaming since the release of the game. They are slowing down on very small updates so they can dish out on bigger updates. This means there will be less patches on fixing things since they've been working on bugs/optimizations non stop. Monthly Updates will mean more content and a smoother experience. They've been pumping out patches rather than cosmetics more than anything. People are a bit flustered about the gamescon crates but in my opinion that's stupid. The game has grown so much in these past few months that it's already about to show an appearance in the Esports scene as an Alpha state game which is amazing. Give them credit.

review: Not a fan. I return to it every so often to see if the same feel is there... it is it always is.You know when you're done eating a hella messy burger and you reach in the bag to grab some much needed napkins but you find a single one steam pressed under your fries into a moist crumbled ball? That's this game. But hey you still had some form of a napkin around.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I love this game. My friend Zach and I play this nonstop duo challenging each other racing each other to a vehicle to see who gets to drive. We're very... 'not serious' when we aren't being pressured. But the second an enemy is in our line of sight you already know what the is gonna happen. Well on to the actual review now.Now there's a lot good to say about this game. But of course to every good game there's the bad parts and to the bad game a good part. We'll talk about both.Pros Addictive gameplay. Your only opponents are actual people not AI zombies (coughcough) A mix of simple AND complex controls for both types of players. Custom games that are almost always available to join! Clothing variety (my guy looks like a technician for some reason lmao) Weapon/vehicle variety It's a game that anybody can play learn and eventually win. You don't HAVE to buy crates. It's optional. If you don't like how your character looks save up 3 00 BP and you can change him/her! NO RESPAWN. When you die you die and you have to join a completely new lobby that holds the people who went through the same situation you did.Now then to the cons.Cons Voice chat in the lobby/plane is pretty annoying. It's impossible to have good luck. The devs can get a little crazy some times...And those are the only cons.I decided to exclude the whole thing about people getting banned for 'stream sniping' because it's absurd. If a streamer was in a random solo game and not custom you'd have to have a load of bad luck to be in the same one as him.Also this 'stream sniping' thing could stop if the streamer never said where he was going and block out his map.So yeah. Those are my thoughts. I recommend this game to anybody who has played H1Z1 or anyone who hasn't.

review: In my opinion latest updates have almost gone backwards due to the Xbox One stuff but still gotta give this game it's credit with a review saying there's no battle royale that's even close to the feeling of a game of PUBG. If you haven't picked it up you've obviously seen gameplay and have decided either it doesn't look like it's for you or you're just too poor to buy it at the moment in which case I'll see you around the battlegrounds once you can get it!Update 2018/07/07 Seeing a lot of negative reviews lately about skins and optimization skins are optional and a GTX 760 with an Intel Pentium will run this game at higher then 60fps on low medium graphics (if you need proof add me up would love to show you). and I run this game maxed at 4k with a 1070 and an I7 7700 with around 80 150fps Anyone saying that the game is un runnable has a pre 2000's pc and I don't know what they're on about.Update 2018/10/26 Games going strong UI and gameplay smoothest it's been and overall a great game definitely a contender for GOTY 2018 not even any competition.Update 2019/01/16 Recent parachute changes and the new Vikendi map were a nice change and made the game feel a lot smoother took a little getting used to but it was definitely for the best. There's definititely a reason why PUBG's stayed on top of the player count on Steam and it's because it's damn good.

review: Awesome game with huge potential and a relatively short projected early access period. Once they add first person only servers which the devs have confirmed are coming I will be playing this game A LOT more. If you played and enjoyed the battle royale mod for Arma 3 are looking for something a little less arcadey than H1Z1 or want a game to experience the battle royale game mode for the first time this is the game for you! Keep in mind that this IS currently in early access so the performance might not be the best at times and you will experience bugs from time to time. For me none of that has been game breaking and the superb gameplay makes up for any of the early access drawbacks. 100% recommended!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The "Battle Royale" game mode popularized by the Arma 2 &amp Arma 3 mod(s) &amp most recently the wildly popular H1Z1 King of The Kill makes it's return in PLAYERUNKOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS. The frantic looting and uncertainty of each game although repetitive feels fresh and new each new game you play. Weapon balance ballistics and hit registration feel natural however horrible de sync plagues nearly every game to some degree making what would be a refreshing experience into an infuriating one nearly irregardless of skill. As with most early access games PUBG also has it's fair share of bugs. Although very few feel game breaking and even those so seldom occur it isn't the biggest detriment to having a good time playing. The bugs pale in comparison to the persistent and unyielding de sync issues which we can only hope will be fixed much sooner rather than later. The developers appear to have a pretty clear line of site on what they want to achieve with this game and the steady stream of patches are always a good sign. Weekly patches to address often small and insignificant bugs/issues and monthly updates that focus more on big ticket issues such as new weapons or vehicles and performance and stability upgrades. Sadly atrocious de sync makes this potentially great game only enjoyable some of the time.

review: biggest complaint for me is the server performance. I bought this game when it was quite new and had hopes the server performance would get better but it didnt really change. the game performance changed in an odd way and many settings didnt change perofmance at all. Its a fun game but if they want to come out of early accesse they better start spending some of that loads of money on at least a 30hz tik rate servers. bf1 does 60hz with 64 players so 30hz is well with in the possibilitys exspecailly after all the money they have got for this game. but i fear they will put xbox server performance ahead of us pc users. in the end i am glad i just payed 20$ for this and not full triple a price

review: Introduction I'm honestly shocked how decent this game is. As someone who has played a decent amount of H1Z1 lots of Arma way too much Rust and don't tell anyone how much DayZ it's rare to be impressed these days. Almost every "pre release" game is a buggy pile of that gives me instant buyer's remorse. This game is a welcome refresher.Below is my quick summary of PLAYERUNKNOWN S Battleground (Let s be honest the worst part about this game is the name)The Good Quick matchmakingPre game lobby is entertaining since you get weapons. It s chaos!Spawning is novel jumping out of a plane as you fly across the map is a great twistHuge variety of weapons and attachments possibly the most I ve ever seen in an FPSGreat map it seems realistic with good building placement and lots of varietyAt $29.99 it s decently priced and worth every penny. I probably wouldn t say that at $39.99..The Bad It seems a bit laggy at times. You ll hit a function button and nothing will happen. You mash it a few times and you ll actually pick up the item. No way to check your ping and understand your lag. If I m lagging.. Tell meOdd vehicle placement.. They are often in the woods or in random spots never in parking lots or garages.. You know the places where people would actually leave working cars..Vehicle desync.. It s not Arma bad desync but it s still a little wacky. Why can t anyone figure this out?Jumping. Sometimes I can jump over something.. Sometimes I can t. It s weird and inconsistent.Conclusion Buy it. It s worth the dough. It s not perfect (but what is these days) but I d wager a bet it s the best KOTH shooter out right now.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I was waiting for full release to write this review. I really wanted this game to be amazing and in some aspects it is. The gunplay is fun the looting and running is fun tactics are fun this is a great game to play with friends BUT its being ruined by the ignoring of bugs and ridiculous features that lead to insanely infuriating moments that still havent been addressed even in 1.0.The parachuting is random sometimes it slows you so much you might as well leave because there will be a heavily armed welcome party when you reach the ground. Sometimes it just leaves you hanging in midair for no reason the parachut isnt snagged gravity still exists but lo and behold you will die from being shot like a sitting duck or just from the fall damage you take after. The vehicles are deadly. Bikes flip on flat ground cars going 0.1mph will kill you if they get within a half metre area of you including if they are just moving alongside you. Sometimes (although this is rare) they just dont start for no reason full gas no damage 3 seconds into the game? nah doesnt wanna work so it doesnt. The terrain and urban areas are ridiculous. Aiming through huge hole a crumbled wall? bullets wont go through it. Wanna climb something while running away at 1mph? you are just thrown over it no option to climb ontop you have to stand still for a few seconds for that one (although I will give them a pass since vaulting is new to the 1.0 update). 10 degree incline hill? go around this is too tough for your puny legs to walk up. Aiming around a tree or doorway with your gun clearly able to be shouldered and aimed? Nope you gotta move further out wouldnt wanna have you using that cover now would we?The zones on the new map are stupid most of the time. The hills make it so you take ages to run to where you need to be. Even if you start as soon as it is revealed you will only just get there in time.Picking things up is garbage. Aiming at the foregrip on the floor infront of you? I think you need that level 1 backpack 15 feet away just outside the door instead. Within arms reach but wanna pick it up through the tab menu to avoid getting the wrong thing? sorry its magically out of your reach now.Grenades dont go where the UI trajectory tracker shows and they constantly kill through walls and floors and somehow flash through solid objects.You may think these are uncommon once in a while problems but no 9/10 games I experience them and 5/10 I die due to them. Its a fun game but its a pot luck if you die by skill or by RNG glitches or just plain terrible features.

review: PUBG is a very frustrating game to love. The physics and gameplay mechanics feel great and it has a stealthy tense quality that many other battle royale games lack. That kind of slow paced very intense gameplay is why I play and love PUBG.However the developers have...strange priorities to say the least. That the game still runs this poorly so long after its EA launch is absolutely unacceptable. The microtransactions are un fun and useless all the skins are boring and the event pass is honestly insulting.But again it offers an incredibly fun kind of BR experience that is hard to find elsewhere right now.If you do buy this game understand a few things 1) It is very very difficult at first2) It will likely not run great on your computer if you have anything less than an i5 6000 or Ryzen and a GTX 1060/RX 4803) You will have to put up with unpatched bugs and terrible optimization for what appears to be the life of the game.If like me you can accept these faults because PUBG is such a unique battle royale experience then you will have a great time. If the realistic feel isn't as important to you or if you have no patience for bad developer choices there are far better BR games available.

If you use a weapon change the fire mode if you can! Take one of each grenade to increase your chances of survival. Pick up (the higher type) helmet or vest to get less damage than normal damage. Pick up (the higher type) backpack to store more item in your inventory. Optimization I know that this game at Early Access Status now but I think it's good enough. I know I did not get my real fps with my pc but I happy with it.In sum I think it's worth trying you can have fun with it.*Edit 2017.12.29 Game Optimized successfully in 1.0 Version.

review: I really wanted to say something postive about this game. But I really can't. I played this game from the start I had to leave the game. This game made me enjoy Fortnite. And I could never forgive Bluehole. It was a huge kick in the face for a moble counterpart for this game be 10 times better than the original. And still is. I see people playing PUBG Mobile more than the PC version of this game. It's really dissapointing. I've been playing PlayerUnkown's Battle Royale gamemodes since ARMA 2. Back when it was a mod for a already popular mod. What is really sad to say is that Epic Games was able to make a game of the same format that is infinitely better than this pile of garbage. Two years since it's been out and it still has all the problems that I left it for in the first place. The only good thing about this game is that they fixed the horrible parachuting mechanics and revamped it. Honestly they need to do that for everything in this game. The hit registery is ing god awful a shotgun blast to the face doesn't kill someone but they can shoot five bullets into your feet and you die. At least Fortnite and other games can get away with this because they have a shield mechanic that works hand in hand with the health system. So a shotgun blast that deals "109" damage to the head can exist. In PUBG this really can't apply. Even if you have helmets and body armor it never adds more health or a "shield bar" on your screen. Only on your HUD. Making it really inconvenient to check your armor. Plus some armor breaks faster than others. It's all a huge clunky mess that is still under a "$29.99" Price point. And it even is more infuriating when the game is a huge ing mess and you add microtransactions and A ING BATTLE PASS. At least Fortnite is a working stable and a functioning game. Despite the horrible fandom and it's cartoony graphics. Fornite is a fully devoloped game and it works for the most part F L A W L E S S L Y. Yes if you don't like building Or that the third person camera kinda throws people off. I get it. It's not for everyone. But for people to defend this game time and time again is really sad. The only thing that I can really say is that if you like games like PUBG go play Blackout. It's basically a first person PUBG.Oh and one more thing. https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 1tKWMkpr8eQ this video is a little old but I think it still holds a lot of merit in this game in a whole.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Overall this is a great game. However there are a few minor drawbacks to this game.1 the game engine is very unstable and will often freeze for a few seconds (sometimes while in a firefight) and can even hard crash with 0 warning.2 in my opinion the gane volumes are terrible let me explain. If you want to enjoy using turtle beaches and hear people around or near you to have the edge in game you need to turn the game 'effect' volume up however if you do that the bullet sounds goes up with it and its WAAAY to ing loud and will scare the out of you all that for just barely being able to hear someone walking not even creeping around good luck hearing that. So you either have to rely on eyesight (which you'll instantly be at a disadvantage) OR you get ear Terrible feature and i hope it gets fixed along with the engine.Other than those two complaints the game is a lot of fun and even more fun with friends and if they can fix the sound and the game engine i would recommend but as it stands today i don't reccomend buying it right now. wait until the full release and the fixes.Update 23/12/17 the game runs worse and sli is taken out now DONT BUY!!

review: The game was fun when it was new but now their servers cant keep up with increasing players. Dont understand these game developers logic of early access literally it been almost a year now and still cant get the game running more than 60 fps even with gtx 1080. Server is so bad that most of the time u will get hit by enemy even if get behind the cover. Most annoying thing is matchmaking for some stupid reasons even if u play on EU servers your lobby will be filled with chinese players 90% of them cant communicate. Funny part is when you play as squad these chinese teammates dont mind killing their own teammates! I always have to keep an eye on them rather than on enemies LOL. Another problem with this game are hackers speed hacks auto aim 100% accurecy headshots and list goes on an on. I really dont understand the devs why they just cant fix this game when they know that they have the higest number of base players. Instead of fixing the PC game they are too busy working on XBOX consoles another LOL. If you cant run this game properly on pc i dont know and its beyond my understanding that how this will run on consoles. I just can not wait to see how miserably they will fail at lauch preview.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've had almost 250 hours in this game and let's just say that this game ain't the greatest. Sure it's fun when it actually works but then it doesn't. For the last couple of weeks Battleye has been taking a dump every time I touch down from parachuting. Within a couple minutes I get kicked out and get a message that reads "Battleye Corrupted Data" and then it throws out some bs 6 or 7 letter code I don't even know anymore. Lets see what did PUBG corp do when they get bad reviews? Throw out a new map. Not even a good one. Mirmar feels like they rushed the map and it doesn't seem to be designed very well. Loot is harder to find and there really isn't any cover on the map. For the past few weeks this game has been getting worse and worse reviews and it seems like the developers don't care. They're working on a new map again instead of making the damn game work? Load of trash if you ask me. And don't even get me started on the hacker problem. I'd write more but I'm outta time and I've got better things to do.

review: I love this game but I don't recommend it for the $30 I had to pay for it. I don't exactly know what is the problem with this game. But I have talked to some people the game either has bad optimization or the servers are just crappy. Personally I think that the problem with this game is that the servers are crappy because I see that my character just looks like it is teleporting around the area. Which usually points at bad server connection.Honestly this really runis the expierence for the game. But if these issues get fixed then I may recommend this game. Some might say "Get better internet" but that is not the problem. There are many players that complain about this issue and I do think that the developers of this game are trying to fix these issues. Due to how popular this game is there are a lot of people in one server (up or 90 people) which really makes the game laggy.Also this game is CPU heavy kinda would like this game to not be CPU heavy.Edit (6/11/2017) Yea it may be CPU heavy but my CPU should be able to get this game running perfectly fine. However still I don't recomend it. PBUG has has a problem with server connections my internet is perfectly fine and should be able to play games smoothly. But when I pick the servers of the country I live in NA servers I should be abble to pick close by severs. But nope the game still manages to have problems with the servers. Seriously fix these problems because this game is now just unplayable.

review: *** Update Feb 2018 ***Update on game post launch Game is now FULL of cheaters. No exaggeration here when I say that 80 90% or more have cheaters in them. This is in OC for us but I have heard other servers are also quite bad. The higher you score in your ranking means you get placed in games with more experienced players which also means you are put in games with more and more cheaters as their rank increases.Until BlueHole/PUBG Corp implements region locking on china/hardware bans on cheaters the game is 100% not worth buying. Your lobby all chat will be filled with people speaking mandarin and games filled with quite obvious cheaters. PUBG Corp have admitted that 90% of cheaters and cheats are coming from China but are refusing to implement proper punishment as yet aside from an account ban meaning the cheaters buy another copy of the game and keep doing it.If and when this problem is properly fixed or heavily reduced then the game might be worthwhile playing. I've currently got around 1100hrs and do enjoy the game but it has gotten far too to play.______________________________________This game is addictive at times fun and at other times rage inducing. The current state is early access so I'll try to keep that in mind. Currently players (at least in OC) will experience server lag disconnects and generally laggy gameplay. The devs assure us they have the highest quality servers but it won't stop you from getting shop around corners and sometimes having your own shots not register when in a gunfight before you die. The desync is pretty awful and there is still plenty of bugs and crashing is a common thing.The RNG of the spawns seems wildly imbalanced. I understand the nature of the randomness but I've seen the extremes of it too many times to thing it works. Same goes for the play area circles. The weapon balancing is welcome but always seems to leave one or two weapons far surperior or broken. And another big problem is cheaters/hackers which there is plenty of. Final verdict decent game with cool weapons and gameplay but not worth buying in its current state. Perhaps in the future when the BattlEye system is more comprehensive in blocking cheaters and more bugs are patched out with better balancing the game will be much more enjoyable and worthwhile.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game was fun when it was released as there was no other options quite like it. This is no longer the case as the various bugs and glitches stop the game from playing well compared to other battle royale games (yes including fortnite). The game does offer some fun mechanics like attachments vehicles and multiple maps but these features are being done by other similar games. PUBG now lacks the fun and exiting nature it had to begin with due to the slow and often boring gameplay with gun fights happening few and far between (except off landing). This game is fun to play now and then but there are other games that are more valuable for the 40$ price tag.

review: Let's all be real no one is being extremely xenophobic. The issue is that this game requires communication you cannot play with a team that speaks a completely different language than you. Is it okay every now and again? Of course! But every damn match where North American English servers are completely and I do mean completely filled with Chinese players is just ruining it for everyone. Chinese players can't understand half the American Enlgish speaking players and vice versa no one has a good time in the end. Do not get me started on latency I have shot and watched these people walk through building disappear take 10000 bullets lag out etc.We get it you don't want a huge media disaster "PUBG VIDEO GAME CREATOR HATES CHINESE PEOPLE!". Let me tell you this a step by step guide on how to not lose all your playerbase as NA is not the only victim check out EU too.1) Stop being a cuck it's not racist to try and balance a game based on language compatability.2) Add some sort of region locking system yes it can specifically be for the Chinese as they have 10x the amount of players.3) Do it FAST.I have had over 30 friends switch to games like Fortnite and even dare I say H1Z1. SOLELY so they can communicate with other English speakers.You are ing up your game you are ing up your fans you are ing up the future of video game politics.If it wasn't for us the players you would still be PLAYERUNKOWN and not a big time hot shot. Fix it before you lose what you've worked so hard for.#REGIONLOCKCHINA

review: Welcome to hackfest 2018...great idea great execution just Bluehole really enjoy the money the hackers generate for them so they do SFA about them. Sure they ban them but they love that the hackers will then just buy new copies generating huge truckloads of cash for BH. So there is no incentive for BH to actually lock down the client and servers to stop the ever so easy to detect hacking that is rife on the servers in the first place. Admittedly the level of hacking fluctuates you may even go a whole day without someone aimbotting/speedhacking/wallhacking your sorry butt but then there are days when every game you watch the deathcam to see you being shot through a wall a hill even multitap headshot by a pistol at 400m...(great idea the deathcam now you can be 100% sure the hacker you only used to suspect of hacking is hacking...it's like rubbing salt into the wound)...The only way BH will clean up it's act and be proactive about stopping hacking will be when they see sales drop off because of the nuisance value. Do not buy it until that day! I'm sure the reviews will reflect when that day happens.

review: I wanted this game to be great it had so much potential at the start. I watched my friends play and wanted to play with them because who doesn't want to play with their friends in what seems like a game loaded with potential? But it is far from optimized which in itself could make this game somewhat recommendable. What little effort has been put forth in hindering hackers has done absolutely nothing to put a dent in the number of them that are present in the game. Rather than focus on making the game itself better they've spent more time trying to add features to copy Fortnite and cosmetics that you just end up getting endless duplicates of from the free to open crates or you have to pay out $2.50 for a key to open a locked box that you end up getting &gt 75% the time you purchase a crate. To boot now you have to buy Event Passes to gain experience points towards unlocking things during these "events" that aren't really eventful. Rather than giving you a good fully functional game where you won't die if you run over the wrong rock in the grass on a motorbike they're just grabbing for more money and giving little in return.And I just keep playing anyhow because friends and sh!t. /
