review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS REVIEWWhen it comes to battle royal games knowing your surroundings or having decent items can win you the game and this game shows that in a great way. Currently this game exceeds H1Z1's King of the Kill in regards to gameplay and popularity. I have been playing this game for just under 50 hours and have enjoyed every moment of it even though you will die alot even at earlier stages of a match. Winning is a thrill and a challenge at time which takes time to be good at something of this genre. I have not played many games like this due to be a MMO veteran but when I play this game with friends the fun never ends. First off the gameplay reminds me of the old times of ARMA 2 which I loved so much and even though there might not be loads of things to do I am glad that the developers did not charge full price for the game compared to others.My first thoughts when jumping out of the plane not knowing where to go and hoping no one would follow me were scary but after some time understanding the map and went up the ranks faster than I thought I would. I have only won 1 game in solo which made my own heart not stop beating for sometime due to the thrill of excitment rushing through my mind when that last shotgun shell tuck my enemie's last breath and jumping out of my chair knowing that I won. This is a very addictive game and not matter if you are alone or with friends there is a different experience when your feet touch the ground. The problem I have with the game at the moment is the rubber banding through walls server lag and even the worst FPS drop I have ever seen. I do hope they get it sorted but when you start a match and the number of people go down to about 70 people I get a good 60 fps most of the time. The other disadvantage to the game is the slow motion of landing on the ground whilst in a paruchute and the slow start to find the best loot to take your foes not to mention the god aweful melee mechanics in the game where even punching someone they start lagging all over the place or the hit marker does count. For example there was one moment where I punched someone who landed in the same area as me so better take out the competition quickly but he managed to kill me even though I punched him more times than anything.These are only small issues to the game which thankfully are being fixed by the developers so they are listening to us. So in my opinion the game is worth every penny due to the addictive and adrenaline fun action you get with each match. Maybe as an alternative just wait a few months for the patches to come through to fix the game performance but other than that the gameplay is amazing. Not to forget that this game is an awesome way to make friends which having a mic is mandatory is you are playing duo or squad. PROS *Very Large Map*Good variety of loot*Customization of Weaponry*Character Customization with rewards from crates*No Microtransactions*Quick Matchmaking*Plenty of Vehicles*Option for First Person or Third Person*Realistic Gameplay*Active/Talkative Community (but press Crtl+T when on the plane to mute annoyance ' _ )*Sounds of guns are helpful to tell you were someone is clearly.CONS*Lack of variety of guns*FPS Performance*Forces to play game in very low settings for decent fps*Server Lag*Terrible Enviroment Sound Performance (not gun sounds)*Rubber Banding (rarely happens)*Disconnections from a matchs due to host leaving

review: PUBG Playerunknown's battlegrounds is by far fundamentally the worst game i have ever downloaded and this includes free games! First of all the movement and just simple slowness of the game is literally mind boggling. It feels like im playing console on my pc. Secondly the sheer amount of buildings and hidey places in this game is disqusting.. ive made it to the top ten 3 5 times and have yet to even see a single player and even if you are to be shot by someone theres no mechanic in the game to be able to the where the shot came from what kindve gun infact does the game even have mechanics? ive landed in the most populated places multiple times and always seem to get killed by someone just hiding in a room or hiding on the roof. The sound ques in the game are absolutely garbage considering the red zone is almost always in the distance but makes just enough noise to drown out anyone moving. The parachuting in the game feels like they used a farming simulator to create. The map is literally so large that a game will take around 40 minutes to complete and thats just the top ten who knows how slow it is from there on. Im not a person who hates games at all playing a wide variety of games from OW to wow COD h1z1 witcher god of war all kinds of games and i have never had less fun than i have had playing PUBG! If i were to say there were good things about the game they would be extremely minor such as the gun models and variety of guns keeps each landing fresh and spontaneous however almost every AR is worthless without a scope. The only thing i really enjoyed about PUBG was the cars. And why do you think this games so popular? Is it the large streamers that play it is it because of the realism or is it because you just dont enjoy other battle royale games? If it is realism i just dont see it. If i were shot in the back in real life i would know i was shot in the back and would turn around in PUBG you could literally be shot in the face and have no idea where the bullet came from. Anyways if you read this all I would like to know what you think?

review: Absolutely amazing game especially with friends. Without them pretty meh still good but much better with them.The constant talk of cheating and microtransactions in the reviews is ludicrous in my time of playing as well as many friends none of us have ever come across a cheater.The microtransactions are simply aesthetic and so I couldn't give less of a just like everyone else should. It is funding a tournament and so shouldn't be taken out of the original funds gained that would be stupid to revoke some of that success for such a large scale event. The constant updates and bug fixes are pleasing and the gameplay is amazingly fun.For those who are getting a bluescreen every three seconds remove any overclocking including automatic overclocking in the BIOS.Overall great game couldn't be recommended any more.

review: Fire up PUBG... start any game you choose... wait anxiously for the action...Nope! You drop out of that plane and don't see anyone for half the game. As the game moves on you take down a few here and there while working your way into the fight and running from a seriously annoying force field thing that kills you. And then at the last circle.. its you and three others. Bam bam bam! Now its you and one other! You could win (at least win something for all this hard work fighting and gathering pointless equipment that doesn't work very well right?) but NOPE you die pointlessly after unloading an entire clip and grenades on the other player.An entire hour in one game just to die at the very last stand.. Guess what... you get NOTHING for playing that entire hour. Whats the point?Play in "North American" servers... just kidding! Its flooded with chinese/other speaking squads. (speaking chinese/other is perfectly fine but its clearly not regional servers and for better or worse I speak english)Weapon drop spawn sucks. "Driveable" vehicles suck. Buildings/structures are not destructable. Textures are horrible. I just can't. Personal opinion don't hate me but not wasting anymore frustration/time on something so unrewarding.Great idea poorly exectuted. Hopeful but extemely doubtful they'll make it any better once the game is "finished"... if that day ever comes.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Want to give this a neutral review.All of the negative reviews of this miss the main point. There may be a few bugs or fps drops but if you aren't trying to be an esports hall of fame twitch streamer you'll have fun. The worst part to me is how great scopes are and how much of an advantage that is.The biggest issue of this game is that it's arma stripped down.It looks like arma plays like arma and only has some ui improvement and slightly better mechanics then arma.Otherwise you can get arma 3 and play pubg mod dayz mod gta mod tons of other mods as well as arma.The instant queues because of the massive player base is the only thing that really separates this from arma. If 6 million people bought and played arma 3 there wouldn't be much reason to play this.

review: Millions of dollars can't freaking find netcode specialist to f****ng fix this game. CRATES SKINS. We don't f***ng need that. We want this game fixed. I'm being killed behind the wall because of the delay people that I hit with a shotgun die after a SECOND after being hit. Just now I landed in Sanhok and f*****ng counted the times I pressed F and my character reaching with his hand to grab a gun. SIX times! SIX! 4 more times I tried to pick up the ammo and got killed by a shotgun. This game is literally unplayable if you love to jump crowded places you just can't pick up a weapon and fight the first minute or two it's too laggy. Oh and don't forget it chunks down to 30 fps on my gtx 970 the first minute or two randomly in crowded places. Good job Bluehole. You spend all your money on cocaine? Greedy developer. I loved your game and was defending it throughout all the year and a half that I've played it. That's f****ng enough. You ruin good guns you ruin the balance you ruin framerate NOT fixing the f****ng netcode. What's wrong with you guys? You've got all the money in the world and you do NOTHING besides introducing new cosmetics + a new map (which looks good btw). Prioritize on f*****ng fixing all the network issues please.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is one of the better games that I've played in a long time. It is just plain fun not to mention addictive. You just want to try again and see if you can improve more and more. To be honest I didnt think I liked the battle royale game mode after trying to enjoy the Culling H1Z1 KotK and the Arma 3 BR mod. Truthfully I almost hated those games. This one just nails it though. The pacing the intensity the level playing field etc. Also squading up with pubbers you don't know through the matchmaking system is actually really fun and a viable way to play (most of the time anyway). I have had so many 4 man squad matches with strangers that were excellent. The game simply encourages tactics and teamwork. I love it.I'm looking forward to enjoying this game for a long time to come. New maps are in the works too.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I deeply regret paying so much for this game only to realize how incredibly boring it is. You basically just sit around for half an hour camping doing nothing then when you come out in the end it's a gamble of pure chance whether or not you win. Yet if you try to make things fun by being more aggressive you lose before getting anywhere near close to the final few people because you end up being an easy target out in the open for all the other people who are camping like you're supposed to. The gunplay is also very boring. PUBG may have gotten the battle royale craze going but there are a lot of other battle royale games on the market that are much more fun and action packed rather than this camping simulator. This game is a total waste of money and I would not reccommend it at all.

review: this game could be the worst case of wasted potential ever.i bought this fairly early on and for a while i played it every day. i had 166 hours in it and spent a lot of my free time playing.at first i was willing to write off the problems in the game (and there have ALWAYS been many) due to the game being early access. after all if you buy games advertised in that state you can't expect complete polish. but as time went on and as bluehole (or is it PUBG corp now?) made more and more money i was increasingly unwilling to forgive them. as the game transitioned from early access to retail it got even worse.the first problem for me was how appallingly badly made the game was. the game is horribly optimized runs badly and yet also looks awwful. it's rife with stock assets that at first i was willing to write off as placeholders. as time went on i increasingly started to realize that the issue was simply that bluehole was not willing to hire an adequate team. this is the unreal engine a VERY common one and so finding developers familiar with it would not be a difficult task. yet the horrid optimization poor graphics and tons of placeholders remained and increasingly stuck in my craw. adding to that the game was absolutely rife with bugs many of which were quite literally game breaking (transparent walls) and took ages to fix. the movement is also very janky and nothing feels smooth.the second was that despite playerunknown saying the game would not have microtransactions while in early access it did. this was when red flags started to come up for me. bluehole had already made an absolute fortune just off sales alone and despite work on the glaring often literally game breaking bugs and glitches being slow in coming when it came at all they decided they needed even more money from their fundamentally broken game. i have no issue with microtransactions in FTP games but they have no place in paid titles especially in paid titles where the devs have no interest in improving or fixing their game.the last and final straw for me was the cheaters. cheaters are absolutely rampant in this game and there was a time where the entire leaderbords would be cheaters who were openly advertising their hacks. that's not hyperbole. they would make their username a tinyurl link where you could buy their hacks and then use their dominance of the scoreboard (often for weeks) as advertising. punkbuster has outright admitted that there are unprescedented numbers of cheaters in the game and that despite banning more than they do any other game the number remains high. cheaters are a problem in a lot of games but when there are that many and they remain a problem for that long it indicates a fundamental problem with the game. rather than dedicating resources to stopping this bluehole was too busy further monetizing the game which had already made hundreds of millions from sales. early on players wanted the servers region locked both for reasons of lag and stability (the servers were often overloaded resulting in massive lag and huge influxes of players from far away just made that worse) and also because the vast majority of the cheaters according to punkbuster themselves were from china yet played on US servers for maximum exposure (as again they were doing this to sell their hacks and make money)maybe bluehole is just utterly incompetent or maybe they realized that every time they banned a hacker they'd buy another copy of the game thereby making them more money and continue on. maybe it was a combination of both. regardless the game was rendered virtually unplayable. a game which already had serious performance issues on both ends was so beset by hackers that you'd often run into them in every game. i quit playing after it all just became too much for me. i wanted to like this game. the concept was good and i prefer the aesthetic and style to things like fortnite but the idea was just so badly executed that i would not reccomend this game or games by this developer to anyone. it became readily apparent that they were far more interested in squeezing every dime out of players than offering a good fun and compelling product. this developer (bluehole) despite their rebranding is a company known for stolen assets and exploitative mobile games. they will not improve and they have done this before. i legitimately regret that i gave these hucksters even a penny of my money and i never played with the microtransactions. don't make the mistake i made. don't buy this game. you will be disapointed. this sort of behavior should NOT be rewarded.

review: Let's start at the top in PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds 90 to 100 players parachute from a cargo plane on to one of two islands either temperate Erangel which has been in the game since its early access launch or the desert Miramar which is new. Once on the ground these players clad only in whatever rags that loot chests have granted them raid abandoned buildings for weapons and scramble to kill each other while avoiding a vast forcefield that slowly closes in on a narrow area of a map. Die and you are kicked back to the title screen survive and er you won. That's it. Battlegrounds can be played solo or with a team in first or third person but this weaponised form of hide and seek is what it amounts to.This formula has made Battlegrounds one of the biggest games in the world with a seemingly universal appeal it is both the game that boosted Steam's presence in China and the game that my friends who play one game every five years are playing. It's a truth apparently unacknowledged that what the world really wanted was paintball on demand and the rewards for the first game to successfully render this experience outside of ArmA mods and H1Z1 spinoffs are apparently limitless.Battlegrounds is not on the surface a particularly elegant game. Its strengths are in scale not detail and it has not quite risen above the sterility shared by most games with military sims in their DNA. There are vague gestures at this being some sort of edgy TV show a flame motif logo that looks like a bad tattoo and a cast of appallingly dressed mute weirdos. Theme and atmosphere don't matter much here however because these things are provided by the scenario itself and crucially by your friends.To get straight to the heart of it PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is successful both as a game and as a business proposition because it is fundamentally social. This unfenced form of shooter where it is fully possible to go half an hour without seeing an opponent or firing a gun is an ideal place to spend time with people a shared survival story that regenerates itself every time you load into a new game. Your successes and failures lucky weapon finds long range kills and moments of vehicular bravado mean more because other people see them and because they contribute to the feeling that maybe just maybe this run will be the one where you finally make it to the end.Your imagination does a substantial amount of the heavy lifting here. At any given time the excitement of a Battlegrounds match is bound up in your sense of what might happen rather than what eventually does. After all this is a game where only one player or one team walks away feeling one hundred percent good about what just happened and yet somehow despite the most consistent experience of Battlegrounds being failure it retains its appeal. Hell it's often fun to fail my favourite matches are frequently the ones where I'm forced to survive in the bushes with a crossbow rather than the ones where the first house I raid contains a lovely UMP submachine gun with all the trimmings.Your imagination does a substantial amount of the heavy lifting here. At any given time the excitement of a Battlegrounds match is bound up in your sense of what might happen rather than what eventually does. After all this is a game where only one player or one team walks away feeling one hundred percent good about what just happened and yet somehow despite the most consistent experience of Battlegrounds being failure it retains its appeal. Hell it's often fun to fail my favourite matches are frequently the ones where I'm forced to survive in the bushes with a crossbow rather than the ones where the first house I raid contains a lovely UMP submachine gun with all the trimmings.

review: Pubg is very addictive. I enjoy the ability to play first person or third person and a combination of both. The last man standing idea is very intense and it is my first experience with this type of game. I enjoy this immensly. However there is so much cheating going on and Blueholes anti cheat program is not having an impact that I can see on this issue. I love playing with friends and it is great when there are not cheaters playing against us (and I have many video's of cheaters). review: So I love the concept for this game but I have a few issues with it.1) It's horribly optimized. This game will run horribly if its installed on anything other than an SSD. If you have any graphics card worse than a gtx 980 expect to recieve less than 60 fps on medium or higher settings. I have the game installed on my HDD and joining a server forces me to look at a loading screen for 5 minutes while everyone else has been in the lobby the plane and then been able to jump out. I can hear sound all the while and can move around but I am stuck on a loading screen. I basically have to jump blindly out of the plane then wait 5 minutes on the ground until I can see which is a massive disadvantage.2) It's incredibly buggy. Try not to tab out of the game... you're gonna have a bad time.3) The devs refuse to address the bugs that many players axperience in the game instead focusing on trivial things like weather and vaulting over fences.I'm uninstalling for now. If the bugs are fixed and the game is optimized I will reinstall.

review: I bought this game after i played fortnite and the mobile version of this game. I wanted to judge for myself which battle royale game was better and i just thought it would be fun. Here is why it is not1 no region lock2 map is unreasonably big so you can get screwed by the white circle easily3 parachuting is complicated 4 controls are hard to learn even if you change keybindings5 most of the time you are killed by people with better guns or by people who see you first so it dosn't feel fair.6 buggy7 fall damage feels incosistant8 no tutorial (or at least i cant find it) (would be fine if the game wasn't so complicated)9 there are features from mobile that should be added into this gameI REALLY wanted to like this game but i just can't. I put 85 minutes in to this game and i honestly can't play any more. Im not going to tell you to play fortnite instead because i dont wan't to be that guy but i will tell you that i had more fun playing the mobile version of this game. Thank you for you time.sorry for my poor gramer/spelling

review: Game developers Bluehole have made a severe and potentially fatal mistake with PUBG. They have ignored the outcry of loyal longtime players for change when it comes to region locking game servers.I don't mind playing a game with people who don't speak my language. I don't mind it every once in a while. But when I sit down to play PUBG in a North American server there should be some English speaking players at least every so often. I started playing again a few days ago after a year long hiatus (back when region servers had purpose) and so far after around twenty or thirty maybe more matches I have played with a total of three English speaking players.This isn't about not liking Chinese people. I've even tried to learn some Mandarin to ease the in game struggle of communicating during intense moments and pathfinding strategies. But this doesn't make any sense. The amount of Chinese players in the North American servers is absurd and unacceptable.And Bluehole has ignored the overwhelming response to the issue. Now you have to go out of your way to find an English speaking community in PUBG for the NORTH AMERICAN servers just so you can enjoy playing. But the way I see it this is as much a problem with the game as any technical aspect that might cripple a player's experience and if the game's broken I won't recommend it.I loved PUBG when it came out. I'm trying to stick around and keep enjoying it but I don't see myself staying on too much longer. There are other games that work as intended with region locked servers that make ing sense.Don't waste your hard earned money on this a once beautiful and thrilling combat experience reduced to rubble by shameful ignorance.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As a kid this was the game I would dream about. Deaths that matter sneaking looting amazing sounds that reveal enemy positions and from time to time the opportunity of amazing team shoot outs during car chases. This is exactly how I love battle royal.So when the game got popular I got very excited the game was far from finished but with all the money they could fix all the issues easily and make the game better than ever! I was 100% convinced this was gonna be my new counter strike if it would get a good competitive mode.The devs focused however on different things. New content new platforms the game would be released on and let's not forget new ways to milk money out of the people that would come for the said above new content. Not as I would have wished to see things go but whatever there are different people with different skills working on different things in the game so as long as they would fix the issues as they promised....For a long time I withheld writing a negative review things looked promosing and improvements definitely have been made. But the thing is the game is still a mess to this day. Just to give you a tiny snippet low framrates laggy servers rubber banding and floaty feelings awfull GUI's and that all in an overall ugly game. I don't like Fortnite at all PUBG is my kind of battle royal but I'm glad they snapped the crown as PUBG absolutely doesn't deserve it.

review: Another Early Access game that has potential but the developer has already broken its promises and added the said transaction for the purpose of raising money for the Gamescon tournament.If they've sold a little over 5 million copies at 30 euro I assume they can offer a tournament prize without going back on their promises. The amount of money they made off an early access game is more than enough for a small company to afford paying a 1 million tournament prize.It's not about adding the crates/keys I've purchased several myself I like to have cosmetics I always buy them but they went back on their word of not having microtransactions in the Early Access period. I'm worried that it's only the beginning and that they're going down a road that will cause more harm than good to the game and its community.It's way more likely for people to spend hundreds of dollars on cosmetics if they're not lied to. (Like CS GO Dota 2)I will still play the game but I'm now skeptical and somewhat lost my trust in their promises. The problem to me is that they might follow the same microtransaction ridden business model like they did with TERA and continue to offer only recycled content(no new weapons models maps etc.). If you do not have money to throw away I'd recommend waiting for the full version of the game(unless you have a couple of friends to play with squad games are really interactive).Update 22/11/2017 the servers are still in shambles and at times they seem worse than before.Frequent crashes teleporting through walls and desync.Hopefully the next patch will make the game playable without the previous issues.

review: First of all I have more playtime than displayed in Steam because I participated in the closed beta. This game is in Early Access so it is still in development. As long as the developer pushes out updates I don't see Early Access as a bad excuse.PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS (sry caps) does many things right. The game is far more complex compared to H1Z1 for example. Its tactical depth is superior to any other Battle Royale game (and comparable to the ArmA mods).The technical aspect is still a critical thing in the Early Access version. While having 70 FPS maxed out on my intel Xeon E3 1230 and Nvidia GTX 1080 the frames drop down to 20 30 FPS in cities surprisingly often. Also I don't have stable 70 FPS outside crowded areas. Too often I have about 50 FPS.Does that kill the fun? Definitaly not. Does it hurt the fun? Yes a bit.PUBG is a realtively bug free battle royale game that has some critical performance issues. Apart of that it does hardly anything wrong. If you are into battle royale games and if you can get along with the technical issues you could enjoy this early stage of the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So far this game as brought me a ton of fun to myself and my friends. The game has its issues though.Pros The game is extremely fun and leaves you at the end of your seat for the entire match The map is insanely big and doesnt get bland after a few games The sound in the game is pretty great when the audio doesnt lag. The game actually looks pretty decentCons Bugs Bugs Bugs... However this is still an early access game and I feel that when it is all said and done the game will be one of the best games I have ever played. This game is really fun to make a squad of friends and go for the top spot. Just beware that if you buy this game there are bugs. The game is still in early access phase and so it is going to obviously have some flaws. These flaws include Lagging audio Frame Rate Drops Lag after spawn Sketchy graphics sometimes lag and more lag and finally sometimes it just completely freezes.But however do i recommend this? Yes.

review: Do I recommend this game? Yes! Is it in perfect shape? No! Its an early access title and should be expected to have some issues.Note If you only like games were you "win" all the time then this might not be the game for you.The Good This game has a bit of learning curve but anyone can jump in and have fun. The most approachable Arma mod I have ever played. While the map remains the same every match (for now) its massive and I am still finding new areas after playing dozens of matches. The gun play is Arma gun play. I like it but not everyone does. the 3rd person 1st person option is also cool. Tons of intense moments.The Bad Its early access so there are glitches. Often times they come at very inopportune moments. Also performance for me isn't great. If you have new PC you should be fine but mine is over 3 years old and struggles to get 60fps even on medium settings. Going to test it again when I get my new GPU and see how It does.Update New GPU and game patches have really helped. Still some big dips but I average about 75fps at 1440p now.

review: PUBG is now notoriously known for the loss of the potential it could've had. So many purchased copies and millions of dollars in revenue from the consumers yet this game has rejected me 3 times in a row on separate occasions to play this outdated looking and sticky game. And after finally being able to get online after hours of waiting I played two games and then was kicked from the game saying that there were too many people playing. That's unheard of for games like Fortnite CS GO and Overwatch. Yet after all it's time in early access and it's updates after post release this game is hardly running any better. Arguably worse than before its release with the never ending crashes and bad developer choices. The reviews have become mostly negative after a trading controversy but it just goes to show how little this developer actually cares at this point. Brendan Greene has said that it isn't a matter of throwing money at a problem but time will solve these problems. I find that very hard to believe with the success of Fortnite and the examples made by mostly all developers in the game industry. If Fortnite took a fraction of the time to completely lap you in this race then start over and get a new engine. Make new assets. Get new team members. You charged $30 for a game half the quality of your competitors. Make changes or have this game become a phase as opposed to an empire.

review: I honestly feel that this is the best battle royale style game on the market. While their questionable decisions with the season pass situation and the issue with servers and hackers at times can be pretty rough the game as a whole is really enjoyable.When it comes to battle royale games on the market currently most seem to be rather cartoony or very far from any realism to a level where I can't really enjoy the game. PUBG seems to find that good place in the middle for me. While it isn't full on simulation the gunplay and overall fluidity of the game is top notch. The gunplay is tight and actually changes from weapon to weapon unlike many other games out there. The character customization is a nice plus too I like the fact that we get to do what I like to call 'play Barbie' before loading into a match to stomp some people. There is a nice variety of clothing to choose from and with them partnering with twitch to have Twitch crates our options are getting even better. We even get to choose weapon and parachute skins and while many people don't see this as an added selling point I personally do.Overall the game is a good time especially if you have a group of friends to play with regularly. I'd recommend the game to anyone in search of fun battle royale gameplay with intuitive mechanics to really keep you on your toes.

review: I do not recommend this game YET.this game provides much fun and can give you a great time with your friends. the atmosphere is high and the style of the game is perfect for battle royale hungry players world wide.there is alot of technical issues within the game like crashes and bugs. one time my game crashed 5 times in 1 match without the error screen (this has never happened before). Of course crashes and bugs are to be expected in a early access game but 3+ times in 1 match is just too much. some of my friends also experiences random crashes at the beginning of matches which is a big problem because if you crash before you jump out of the plane you are stuck in it. It appears that you cannot jump out of the plane after re joining the match and forces you to drop at the end of the route. The game can also crash in late game and THAT is a huge problem (obviously). it is the game that crashes and not my PC. The game is not very good optimized in my opinion.gameplay is SOMETIMES very frustrating like when somebody jumps and shoot you with great accuracy. jump shooting should be removed in my opinion or at least lower the accuracy when jumping how it is now... is just insane. also hitboxes should be improved.I think there should be more guns added to the game but that's nothing major. BUT I really think that the micro uzi should be able to use scopes too it is actually aggravating how you can not use scopes on it.and I think there should be at least 1 gun in every house maybe just a pistol. I looted 4 buildings before getting a gun once same with backpacks.after playing this game for nearly 200 hours I think that if you're going to buy it you should wait until they fix some of the major bugs and maybe releases the game fully.this is just my personal opinion that some people may or may not agree with which is totally cool. I would love to hear your opinions and thoughts of the game a game that slowly but surely is getting better.EDIT it's now released and 2018... we're ed

review: The game can be pretty fun especially with friends. However I will not recommend it for two main reasons. Firstly and most importantly it is very poorly optimized. Servers are still not as good as they should be. I experience frame drops often especially in firefights. There are simply graphical and performance related issues that I only experience in PUBG. These can often be rather game breaking.Secondly the gameplay is kinda boring. While they are working on the blue circle mechanics and doing some things to make the mid game more enjoyable and less slow paced there's still far too many games where I collect some loot run through open fields for approximately 20 minutes and then get shot in the head without firing once. Yeah yeah I know I'm bad and all that. However many games I've played end with either a horrendous firefight with awful performance or a boring nothingness capped by a single sniper shot to the dome. PUBG obviously isn't all bad and remains extremely popular. The gunfights can be very immersive especially in squads. Some things also look to be improving such as with the new smaller Sanhok map. The devs have also recently tried to address some of the server problems and optimization has been getting better. But because of the poor performance and often insipid gameplay I will not currently recommend PUBG. A couple other things I'd like to mention bluehole is a lifeless inept company concerned solely with profit and there are a lot of cheaters in this game.

review: Why I can't recommend this game 1)HackersPubG is one of my favorite shooters but I cannot recommend this game at its current state considering how bad the optimization is and how serious the hacking problems are once I hit 2 000+ rating in AS and SEA server I ran into at least two hackers every single day and meanwhile devs are doing nothing to improve their anti cheat system if there is any. An Early access game should never be called "esports ready" finish your game before putting it on any league tournaments and prioritize user experience first.If you look at the leaderboard of pretty much every region almost all top tens have "WG" in their name that means cheat in chinese I am so ashamed and sad because of the toxic hack community and the inability of the devs to stop the hackers from ruining the experience.2)Optimization &amp glitchesIf you label PubG as a competitive shooter and put it on Electronic Sports League the game should be fully ready and optimized. So far there are a huge number of serious glitches that can be exploited for example entering a house through window by ejecting from a car. In addition there are some animation glitches that should not even be in an early access game. Bluehole is a studio that only made mmorpg and it is absolutely not enough for PubG they should really hire more developers who know how to make a proper esports ready shooter.

review: Before Starting this review I need to tell people to look past the games flaws. Yes this game is pretty broken but complaining about will make you hate it but there is a lot to make you love this game. While maps are a little big and mid game can be a bit slow the game puts you in intense gun fights sometimes multiple. This game is designed to reward players for taking risks and not sitting in houses although a good strat you wont learn much.Bugs Galore and bad servers can be a pain but things are starting to look up more these days.You cant expect the game to work all the time but when it does and you take it slow and play the game it was meant to be played you can have fun. Dont always drop hot dont sit in buildings Land early ride the edges of circles read your opponents dont always take the fight head on play tactical not fast. This is not fortnite dont compare the two because they are different. so long story short Look past flaws.Always know the game probably isnt on your side. You will die and most of the time it will be your fault but you will blame the game but most times its justifiable.Devs are a little stupid but they are really trying.This game is hard to master but easy to grasp dont go in there and think you can win because you wont get farther than 30th place with 4 kills.Patience my friends.... "Be Water" Bruce lee

review: I found this game fun for a bit but eventually just lost interest. The battle royale gameplay is fun in general... you don't feel bad dying all the time because there's only ever one winner. When I played it the game had numerous bugs and issues and absolutely terrible performance. Gameplay wise PUBG just seemed to reward camping way too much. Being aggressive and moving around a lot was pointless as someone is going to spot you and take you out. Third person mode makes this issue worse as people can peek around corners through windows while being out of sight etc. It just promotes the camping style. First person mode fixes this but it still felt clunky. Battle royale is fun but I think you should try one of the other BR games instead.

review: I have had this game for a very long time way before release. Back when there was no FPP Erangel was the only map and there were guns in the pre game lobby. I highly highly recommend this game especially over the more successful competitor Fortnite BR.People say its dying/dead don't listen to them its not. Sure its not the 5 million players at once monster it was back in the good old days but I still see 700 000+ players on at once regularly. Rainbow Six Siege has around 65 000 players (on PC) online usually G Mod has around 20 000. You wouldn't call them dying or dead would you?However the game is not flawless hackers especially on AS servers and servers they can get a decent ping to such as OC (me) or SEA are quite common and can really ruin the game. The matchmaking needs improving too in Australia I can never find FPP matches and it isnt uncommon to be sitting for 10+ minutes for TPP and the event pass is a load of Also I'm not a fan of paying for keys for loot crates but thats a thing you just have to live with on SteamOverall though I really do recommend this game and I encourage you to buy it as I have always had a great time playing whether its solo duo or squads.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Now im going to be very honest when i write this. when i first started playing this game it was in early access filled to the brim with cheaters of mostly asian decent and was filled with game breaking bugs. Did i like playing the game then? Yes i did. I loved the aspect of the game where it was the only BR out there which actually worked and was realistic to a degree. The guns were well thought out and their stats were reasonable. Back then i would of gave this game a solid 9/10 purely for the amount of fun i had playing it.Next came the release of the desert map. The idea was great and made it harder to be hidden in the open compared to the OG map. More urbanised areas but in a more centralised area. I had many great games on there and secured a fair few number of wins on this map. However with a new map came a new wave of cheaters the early stages of de sync and a whole lot more game breaking bugs. At this point alot of my original squad had lost interest because of this. I decided to stick around and see if it would smooth out. To some degree it did they fixed some minor bugs which helped gameplay but seemed to ignore the bug issues. They added a new car which in most peoples opinion was not really needed. And then added a new gun as well as removing weapons from the crate. At this point i became fed up with the game. The devs were not listening to what their market was saying and adding things which they wanted and didnt bother fixing the problems we were facing.Sanhok was announced and it actually brought a few of the players back from their dis interest in the game. it was a smaller map less urbanised and truely focused on the pure bloodlust a BR game should have. I thought that the game was going to be revived from its seemingly dying condition. And to some degree i was correct. The devs listened to what we wanted regarding content being added to the maps etc which got a lot of the community thinking that they would fix the major issues reagrding cheaters and de sync. However we couldnt be more wrong. They implimented a kill cam which was suppost to help players reprt hackers in more indepth detail. However yet again BlueHole didnt smooth it out before releasing it. Major de sync issues were experienced in the death cams and it was really hard to tell if opponents were indeed hacking. This in particular really me off. The one opportunity in my opinion to turn this game around then they went and ed it up so easily.As of recently they announced 'Fix PUBG' and to be honest the flaws which were needed to be fixed at an earlier stage of the game are to far gone to be even adressed now. Their intentions with this plan does mean well however it has come far to late into the game's full release to solve these issues now.I do come back to this game every now and again to see whether i can get back into playing this game seriously on my own again. Do i still enjoy it? Kinda yeah. After playing other games for a few hours its nice to come back to the game and improve my general reflexes and tactical thinking. But in all honesty its only fun to play it with friends and then just doss about not taking the game seriously.Overall do i recommend this game? Yes i do despite its flaws it still hold the potential to get its act together and still be as popular as it used to be. Yes i know other BR games are now out there and soon to be releasing. But PUBG will always be the game which truely took off the genre. Its a nice game to play when you have mates and want to doss about. its also a great game to test your mind out. But it will never meet the potential it needs to become a proper e sports game. Yes they have had tournements but its still not to scratch as CSGO or Dota is.Graphics 8/10Guns 7/10Vehicles 6/10 (still bugged to hell)Competiveness this varies but for me its 7/10Overall rating 7/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have almost 500 hours in this game. I bought this game when it first hit early access and was willing to put up with bugs and issues because it was an EA title. But after the game hit 1.0 and still ran like garbage and still had issues with desync grass and terrain not rendering and most importantly was overrun with hackers I stopped playing for months. I came back a couple days before the event pass dropped and the game felt a lot better they really had made some serious improvements to the gameplay and it felt smooth. It still wasn't up to the standards that I'd expect from a fully released game but it was definitely better than it was when I stopped playing. I really had some fun the last few weeks and even bought the event pass. While it has been annoying to have to check the Reddit to make sure the description was translated correctly because the developers obviously use Google to translate from Korean to English. Descriptions are missing words or are so confusingly worded that you don't actually know what you're supposed to do i.e. "Heal 200 hp 5 times in a single game" which is actually supposed to be "Heal 200 hp in a single game 5 times". But that's really not a big deal I have had some genuine fun doing a lot of the challenges and am currently level 28. The biggest issue I have with it is that it forces you to play badly for a lot of the challenges. Being forced to take damage not kill other players or when the event pass came out and you did any of the challenges that required you to be in the top 3 5 or 10 then you had to purposely lose to get credit for the challenge. Putting the mediocre event pass aside holy this last update is terrible. It feels worse than it did when the game first hit Steam. The fact these developers are this inept is actually astounding. I've come to terms with the fact this game will never be perfect or even come close to living up to what it's capable of but this is just pathetic. Every single match is flooded with Chinese players with ping so high they teleport around you and don't take damage from bullets due to desync. I have gotten behind people and ADS sprayed them in the back from 10 15 feet away blood pouring out of them with every shot only to have them turn around and kill me. Then on the death cam you see that only 1 or 2 of the 15 bullets that hit actually registered. I am not an amazing player by any means but I frequently get 7 or 8 kills in a game. My point being I know when someone should be dead and these Chinese players are not dying like they should. Watching the death cams is just depressing at this point and my buddies and I are just done. They were rank 18 and rank 40 last season and they have given up as well.There are so many game breaking issues that have been present from day one and have never been fixed. Such as If there are too many sounds around you then footstep noises won't register. Vehicles control like the tires are wet bars of soap and the ground is made of ice. Items take 10 15 seconds to load in when you land and while early game lag is better it's still not acceptable. Bushes rocks and trees don't always render properly at a distance so you can be seen in the open when you are behind cover. And most importantly Just because you see blood doesn't mean they actually took damage. Because while this may be a fully released product its netcode is still back in the pre alpha stage. To sum it up I don't recommend buying this game. The developers either do not care that the game is broken do not have the skill to actually fix it or both. My guess is both. Because when you've made almost a billion dollars off a game and have millions of players who are still willing to pay $2.50 to open a ing loot box and $10 for a pass that should have been free then why would you feel the need to fix anything? China should have been region locked over a year ago simple as that. But the developers don't want to risk alienating that large of a demographic. But as you can see from the recent reviews their playerbase is tired of the t. To put it simply it's an unfinished game with a $30 price tag kept alive by the Twitch community which fortunately is starting to move over to Fortnite and other superior games.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: All the makings of a bad time. If you run solo you have to basically keep your voice chat muted because you have every little squeaker screaming at the top of their lungs into their microphones at full volume with full amplification followed by ignorate s using every slur in the book like they just discovered it yesterday. The majority of games have been with literally the most irritating people I have ever encountered period. If it's a fair representation of the community from the hours I have put into this game it's absolute filth.And then there's the gameplay itself. The combat is janky especially at the beginning of the game. You go to pick up a weapon and someone gets to the same room a few feet away you pick up the weapon and then all of a sudden it's in your opponent's hands and your brains are either being blown out or bashed in. Then there's the gunplay where every shot taken feels like a random dice roll per shot decided by the horrid 17hz servers they decided to host this game on especially in close quarters. Then there's the hackers. Make it to the last ten? Don't expect to make it much further because your epic run is going to cut short by someone who is either using ESP or blatantly aimbotting. I've watched many a death cams where my killer was questionable. Staring at me through a wall when my footsteps aren't audible. Shooting me unhindered when they've gotten a face full of flashbang and a completely whited out screen. Shooting at me through thick fog killing me and then snap aiming to some other unsuspecting player who is also obscured by fog. And more than just a few times all of the above at the same damn time. With as bad as the hit registration is in this game I can kinda see why they do it. You have to basically hack your nuts off to get any decent hit reg.TL DR This overhyped joke that Blue Hole and PUBG Corp has put out is nowhere near worth your time or money. Just don't do it.

review: Too many reasons to mention on why this game has gone down the hole. For the first few months the game played great. Performance was alright minimal lag and plenty of opprotunities to win.However these past few months have turned this game completely upside down. First and forthmost you're going to run into a hacker about 1 out of every 3 games. Before last month you might've ran into one 1 2 months. Completely destroys the fun of the game when I'm driving my buggy at 90mph and get double tap headshoted by someguy with an AK far enough away that I can't hear his unsupressed gun when he comes to loot me shortly after.Another issue you're going to run into is the UI. The menu UI is web based sometimes not even loading othertimes giving you random error messages such as "too many users" or "https error" or "could not connect". The cancel button doesn't respond or work most of the time when you're que'd in the wrong game mode/server forcing you to leave the lobby you just joined so you can load the buggy UI and wait another 2 minutes for a que. Additionally I've had a couple times where I've loaded the game up only to recieve a crash report as soon as I hit the menu. Ive never seen another game with a main menu that crashes on start... have you?Lag is another big issue. About a month ago this game ran perfectly smooth for me. Everything loaded and rendered fine no frame skipping no half rendered clay buildings. Since then my cpu and memory usage have both rose from 40 50% to 80%. I'm not sure what was added to the game but it ruined performance substantially (at least in my case). Now instead of smooth fluid movements I'll have situations in the game where I'll be in a gun fight recieve a lag spike teleport 5 ft away and die. Once again competely ruining the point of playing. It's also pretty annoying to pick up a weapon only to find the game didn't actually pick it up due to lag. Overall network lag and client lag are huge issues requiring you to use expensive hardware in order to play the game smoothly instead of having an actual optimization patch.Game breaking mechanics and bugs. Crashing a full health motorcycle into another cars tire shouldn't result in an instant explosion and death. Destroys realism. Driving my boat on open water only to watch it flip over 180 degrees and smash me after a random lag spike. Destroys realism. Buildings failing to render at the start of the game an uncommon bug but it still happens Allowing people to drive through houses and see through walls unintentionally. Buildings failing to completely load at the start of the game Making looting them near impossible and giving a huge advantage to anyone with superior hardware. Gun damage 25% chance your gun isnt actually going to do the damage its supposed to two shotting someone with the double barrel shotgun at point blank range then being killed by a pan because 8/10 of the pellets your shotgun dispensed curve around the enemy. Unrealistic. Crossbowing someone in the center of the neck and dying to a pan because an arrow to the neck isnt a one shot kill but a pan headshot is. Unrealistic. Spraying your entire AK clip at point blank range and only having 4 bullets hit without a kill. Unrealistic. And the list goes on as you start to play more and get a feel for how the weapons should work.Random number generator mechanics. Game should have at least one weapon in buildings. There have been times where I have fully searched five buildings and have not found a single weapon only to be shot down by some guy who rode up with his UAZ and shotty. Seven copies of the same backpack in the same area isnt going to improve gameplay for anyone nore cosmetic appearal that takes up space for actual items that influence the gameplay. Vehicles should also be reworked as many a time I have played running simulator because out of the ten spawn spots near me the game chose to fill in other spawn spots nice and tightly packed together. Sometimes you're gonna see 5 cars in 300km othertimes you're going to see 0 cars in 2000km.Team gameplay. If you only know english better find some friends to play with. North america Europe and Oceanic servers tend to be filled with non english speaking users since this past month. Not sure why this is but I can't even play squads with automatching because my teammates cant understand me and vis versa destroying part of the point of actually playing squads in the first place. There are also people who intentionally greif squad games less common but still a problem.Overall the game isn't worth the purchase or your play time until these problems are addressed. The only redeeming quality of the game I can think of is the idea of the game itself. Right ideas terrible execution.

review: Ok well lets start this off with Awsome concept of a game...BUT...This game has soo many bugs.. Yes I know this is a early access game... BUT when you can die from getting hit behind a wall with a car Or endless falling when standing on solid ground or looking into a scope at a person long range and there moving 10 feet then freezing then moving 10 feet there is something wrong with this game.. those where just a few examples I have experienced and sure others have too. I have videos to prove this....On top of all this you guys held a tournament for a broken game... Alot of players helped support you before this game was release FYI pre purchased..Not much has improved sence the release. Stuff still does not render properly...I myself am at the point that I am uninstalling this game and giving you a bad rating..Because I dont see improvement with this game sence the release and waited to see if there was going to be change..BUT there hasn't except it dont crash as much but still does and expect people to report your failure with encoding a game that needed way more testing before it was released...iv seen this alot in early access games companys pushing the game out to fast before testing it..I know it all comes down to making profit and thats allright but when a game has this many bugs it should of been tested more...!

review: Awfull hit detection the optimization is horrid. If you buy this be prepared to walk for 15mins just to get shoot by someone still in the killzone or if you're lucky you'll get the drop on someone but none of your bullets will hit on their screen. Oh and the game is poorly optimized to say the least I have a gtx 960 and even when everything is on the lowest possible settings it still drops frames in combat and whenever it wants to.Update Now the game is nearly unplayable due to chinese players and cheaters now overunning NA servers. Also after months the game is still a buggy and un optimized mess and now the developers announced a mobile version when the original is still running like a toaster powered by a potatoe. Now with the 1.0 update it takes longer to load into the main menu then the actual game and the NA servers are still overun with chinese players who lag it make it virtually impossible to win. I will give credit though it seems with the 1.0 update the hit detection is better but long range combat is still garbage even when you calculate for distance your shots never seem to go straight.Second Update Cheating still rampant and hit detection has yet to be improved so far it seems this game may never be actually completely fixed. TLDR Bleach is alot more effective and quicker.

review: Over 200 hours played. I can safely not recommend this game to anyone that wants to keep their sanity. It begins as a love hate relationship with this game. Because A Youre not very good yet and you want to get better to win. but B You keep dying over and over because you havent learned the way you have to play in order to win. I understand its a survival game. But the amount of camping in this game would make any normal gamer tilted when you just have no clue someone is sitting in a house making no noise in a corner with a shotgun. And theres nothing you can really do about it but die. Unless theyre bad. The moments when you win at first are very exciting and pretty fun. But its soon drowned out by the countless times you die over and ing over to complete ing t. And after youve won like 5 10 times it really starts to lose its fun. Mostly because youre already so off about how many times youve died earlier in the day youre just like "yeah ING finally ing ass game". Not to mention the bugs and lag in this game where I swear like im prefiring and shoot someone like 3 times before they even start shooting at me yet i ing die. ANd they didnt get a headshot kill. Like wtf. game wait for more content to drop on it like maps where people wont ing camp as much. EDIT THIS GAME NEVER BUY THIS PIECE OF ING TRASH

review: Game PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDSGenre Multiplayer Battle RoyaleDeveloper Bluehole Inc.Publisher Bluehole Inc.Copy supplied by Steamhttps //youtu.be/AGVHOpEG2dk1999 Japanese writer Koushun Takami publishes Battle Royale the story of high school students who are forced to fight each other to death. The following year a feature film adaptation directed by Kinji Fukasaku and starring Takeshi Kitano was released to great worldwide acclaim. With the success of the movie there have been multiple directors and writers who have been influenced by it (Quentin Tarantino The Hunger Games The Belko Experiment Gamer etc.). The influence can also be found in the realm of video games with a couple of hits (Fallout New Vegas Dead Money H1Z1) and plenty of misses (The Culling Last Man Standing DayZ etc.).Enter PlayerUnknown s BATTLEGROUNDS at first it might seem like any other quick cash grab ArmA clone that is exploiting a recent trend. But if you look closer you will see that it is breaking all sorts of records on Steam it is actually getting updated by the developers based on player s feedback and it is made by someone who has quite the experience in this type of games. Brendan Greene (a.k.a. PlayerUnknown) has been working on mods for quite some time and he created a Battle Royale mod for ArmA 3 as well as working as a consultant to develop H1Z1.The game is quite straight forward 100 players parachute on an island and they have to kill each other till only one player is left. As time moves forward the play area becomes smaller and smaller so that you are bound to find other players. As of right now the game can be played either Solo Duo or in a 4 player Squad. Graphically it looks very similar to the ArmA games with more action y movements and animations. The island is vast and at first you are gonna get lost very easily but the more you play the more familiar you become with the cities and bases sometimes reliving glorious victories or painful defeats.The placement of weapons and vehicles is randomized. You start off with your bare hands and you can find guns and melee weapons of all kinds pistols shotguns crossbows assault rifles grenades molotov cocktails frying pans crowbars There are also multiple attachments that improve the quality of your weapons as well as police vests and helmets that can protect you and medkits and bandages to heal you up. You can also find some loot crates that are dropped from the sky which have better weapons and tons of ammos. But beware of entering a red zone once there a 1 minute bombardment will take place and running through an open field with giant explosions all around you is both memorable and terrifying at the same time.What makes the game truly unique and replayable is the combat unlike other games of this subgenre the shooting is quite fluid and natural both in 1st and 3rd person. Encountering another player gives you an adrenaline rush and it makes you scared for your life knowing that a few well placed bullets could mean the end for you. Both hiding and running into battle are valuable strategies with many players crouching near a toilet in an abandoned building pointing their double barreled shotgun at the door hoping that no one opens it. Can you really blame the fear of dying? Knowing that you won t respawn there are more instances when players decide not to kill someone just out of fear of being noticed by a third better equipped player.Sound design is a huge aspect of the game and it truly sells the experience hearing footsteps inside a house means that someone is exploring it hearing a door open up means that an intruder is on his way listening to gunshots in the distance can tell you which areas are more dangerous and populated than others the sound of a car approaching gives you both hope (that you can use it to run away) and fear (that the driver has noticed you).Overall even though it is still in Early Access PlayerUnknown s BATTLEGROUNDS deserves its status as THE multiplayer game to play this year. Thanks to responsive controls enjoyable combat high replayability and constant updates and patches this is a survival game that those who want a quick adrenaline rush have to pick up as soon as possible. There is a reason why it has the highest number of players for a non Valve game.Story n/aGraphics 8Gameplay 9Challenge 10Sound 9Replayability 10ENJOYMENT 9FRUSTRATION 6Follow me on Twitter nickygra97Subscribe to my channelLike on Facebook www.facebook.com Join my Steam group
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Had great potential during the first few months of release WOW?! An early access game with incredible gun handling gfx and group potential. The proof is in the pudding over 16 million copies sold. You'd think a game so popular and striving with money would be banging out weekly if not monthly updates right? Wrong. We got absolutely nothing since release but a few guns minor optimization and a poorly designed map. With the new map just being tested I thought to myself wow PUBG really is going places. Until of course they announced a port for Xbox to be released before Christmas.. *sigh* I wonder what the reason behind that is. The PC community funded this port which we never asked for. To add insult to injury it's probably the worst low effort rushed console port to date. Now they'll have to have two teams one working on PC and one working on Xbox thus slowing down the speed of development like it wasn't slow enough. Putting all these things aside the game is full of cheaters bugs lag server issues all that the devs refuse to address. All in all I could not recommend this game to anyone the fact that Bluehole is willing to ship the game as a full release in its current state prove that they are doing a Dean Hall.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This anime visual novel was one of the best I've ever played. It had one of the most compelling stories I have ever experienced. The anime girls were well fleshed out characters that I really cared about. You may be wondering why I have over 100 hours of gameplay in this game. Simple answer is because of the beautiful plump juicy tender anime tiddies in this game. This game is actually not a thrid person battle royale shooter it is actually a compelling romance visual novel that will completely blow you away you will be playing this for countless amount of decades like me. I've been playing since the year 1943 where I was in afghanistan on the front lines fighting against the murderous psychotic nazis. But this game has saved me from all the horrifying experiences I have ever had on the front lines of WWII. This game has stuck with me till now my wife who is actually a body pillow loves this game. I do not like real women because they do not understand me like body pillows do. Me and my wife sakura chan played this game for countless hours on end because we can relate so much to the main character and his shocking past where *SPOILERS* His mum and dad both died from a terrorists attack where they were taking a holiday in russia *SPOILERS* I could relate to this because my parents got gassed by the Nazis and Sakura chan had her parents killed by a terrorist suicide bomber in a basement of a hentai store in Japan where I found sakura chan when she was buried in the rubble and aftermath of the bombing. I got her out of there and have been caring for her ever since. Many tears have fallen from our eyes because of this game. Few years later we married because of this game we have bonded so much and fallen completely in love with each other. The characters in this game made us so heart wrenchingly sad because me and my wife connected so much to them. There are approximately 25 endings to this game all with different out comes on all of them. This game is very detailed and well made and it has made me a WWII veteran and full grown man shed tears everytime I played. please do check out this game as it is a masterpiece and has connected with me on a very personal level.Jebediah the WWII Veteran.

review: so far from what i've played which at this point is 75 hours i have won the game around 4 5 times and those games were probably the only fun i have had with the game. 90% of the game is just running around and looting which i find very boring most games you get killed after 30 minutes of looting and runnning by some guy you can't see. The game rewards you with these battle points that can be spent on a lootbox for cosmetics none of the cosmetics look good at all accept some of the rare ones that you will never get becuse the game seems to only give out the lowest quality. The game is not respectful of your time at all games go for ages with very high chance that you will get shot by a guy with a better hiding spot. In this state i believe is not recommendable. You don't need to agree with me most of my friends are playing this game all the time and still having fun.There are still things this game does better than other battle royal type games but it seems like they are in their early stages. thanks

But suprisingly they managed to push it out and we have full release this December (2017). Many things have changed besides the optimisation they released new weapons and a new map. This is one of the most successful games this year and I'm glad I can recommend this to others. This is your ultimate Battle Royale experience.

review: *stands up*Why can't i recommend this game? Because microtransactions. Seriously. This is ridiculus. !!!NO DON'T STOP READING "IT'S ONLY SKINS THEY DON'T CHANGE STATS SO IT'S ALRIGHT TYPE OF PEOPLE" Did I get your attention? Good. Now read ALL OF IT. the rest of you potential buyers just go to the shorter section of my review and ignore the rant"(Attention now you are about to read really "review/rant") if you don't want to waste you time proceed to the end of it)Legend M me Y potential you Microtransactions and why they are not right M Ranting First of all you have to look at it from wider perspective. They said earlier that they won't be able to deliver this game on time and get it out of early access. Maybe if'd they focus more on an actual content rather than "microtransactions test drive" they'd have enough time without having to move premiere date. Now for the "it' s only skins guys" In this game the clothes give an actual advantage because spotting someone first means life or death it's huge advantage. Now these clothes they presented are all flashy and stylish but the next pack might be "grass type" or anything that makes the player harder to spot. They could also make clothes available for player for ingame gold really colorful and bang! it's that easy now players who bought crates with better clothes have advantage. 3rd argument. From ethic standpoint there is no excuse to even "test drive microtransactions now". One of the best selling games on steam for many months now. It clearly paid itself already many times for such a small dev team. And i know the more cash the merrier and bussiness always have to earn more but they could also do it in less obvius and greedy way. *sits down after angry rant* Y But wait! Adures! It's for charity and tournaments!!! You... you don't understand. M No i don't. They could easily make a week or a month when some percent from their sales go for a charity but of course not they had to make loot boxes. As for tournaments how about they go out from early access first? As i said earlier they already are behind their schedule. They have many bugs to fix befire they make this game "tournament worthy". Also no need for loot boxes. They could easily get money on tournament from sponsors (and they probably do but don't quote me on this) Y WTF Adures! but what about the actual game!? Do you like it? M I can't deny it the game is fun but still buggy and needs more optimalisation (still better that most other survival games on steam).The gameplay is really good the shooting feels satisfying and you can really feel andrenaline rush in the end game which can get really intense. We are still waiting for new maps and some features tho. Y Aaaaaaalright Adures... so you say you can't recommend this game even though you like it? M Yes wait for a full realise. After 3 years i finally wanted to give "early access" another chance and I still don't know if that was right decision. With further monetisation this game could really go downhill in half a year. Trust me wait for a full release and then decide. If the game won't be ruined by microtransactions you still will have a lot of players to play with. For now find yourself different game. There are already more really good released games that you will ever be able to play.*********************************Shorter version**************************** All in all it's just shi**y to put microtransations in early access game. (reasons stated above) Graphics is good gameplay is fun Shooting players in this game feels really satysfying Still really buggy Needs optimalisation They have a long way to go. We are waiting for new maps and some other features
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: For me it's a big No No. After 250h you would think that I enjoy the game? hell no. I enjoy the concept of it. Everything else is a copy past of outsource modules that have been quickly blended in to amke a prototype. And with the success of the game currently I lost all hope to see thise game beeing reworked to it's core to fixe thos massive core gameplay mechanic issues.As Dev I can safely say that a massive portions uses marketplaces to build their game. Most of the assets have been bought online with a quick pass of simplygon on top of it ( hey guys Sympligon isn't supposed to be used that way ) meaning a lot of Lods in the distance are completly incorrect and you can end up beeing able to see someone behind an invisible rock or having Houses without windows due to the low amount of polygon Sympligon cutted. The weapon ballistic is an unreal engine 4 plugin. The outfit customization was made by a third party who sell it working as is out of the box. The whole FPS system is likely to be the basic Unreal engine 4 FPS template once agian UE4's crosshaires for weapons and grenades and since this engine wasn't made to accomadate such a large amount of players there is obviously a massive amount of lag input and hitreg and it's not entirely due to the Servers but because of the engine itself not being ablee to handle so many players at once.So now the devs are asking Epic to fix this problem... aherm excuse me? if the engine isn't working as intended it falls on you bluehole to rework the core code and make it work Not epic.I know this company doesn't have the talent to pull this out. Hell even with the massive amount of money they got from this early access they simply won't be able to fix thos issues.You will still have archaics and clunky gameplay mechanics full of imprecisions issues for the simple fact that " most of the work on this game is not theirs ".I wish I could be refunded for the simple reason that after 5 months I have seen no significant changes on the core gameplay side of the game and most likely never will. Their " transparency " is laughable compared to Cloud imperium Games and Star Citizen who have a video explaining everything every week. With concrete work showcased.Don't buy this game wait and see if they " REALLY" are going to fix the majors issues.Core gameplay should be polished by this time. it's not the case with this game.

review: Had to delete my old review and start again...I have been playing this game for a while now (casually) coming up to 1k hours and honestly all I can say now is don't waste your money.All the developers think about is money.The servers have worked fine for a couple of months but now there's a lot of de sync since the recent updates (July 2018)Still no region lock and they don't plan on making one still no ping lock so you're still going to get shot behind walls.Expect to get put into squads with a lot of chinese players who don't speak a word of English or Russian kids with ridiculously loud microphones.You play countless hours and save up battle points then decide to grab some crates from the store (all cosmetic items) 80% of those crates will require keys and no you can't just get a key that fits any crate each crate has different keys each key costs $2.50 the chances of getting something better than a common item is probably less than 1% and most of the time it's multiples of the same item.They recently bought out an 'event pass' if you want it that's anouther $10 out of your pocket what do you get for it a few skins if you grind for long enough if you don't buy it though the best you'll probably get is a couple of skins that last 20 or 30 days. half of the 'missions' to get xp are also exclusive to the event pass so you won't progress much without it.The best I can describe the game is like drugs to a drug addict it's ridiculously bad but you keep coming back you think they will fix the problems but they don't. Meanwhile all people will see that don't yet have the game is the countless big stage events the developers are hosting which they shouldn't be because their game is far from ready for that.They are some shady people and put money in front of the player's needs they even tried to sue their competitor for 'stealing their play mode' even though Bluehole uses their engine! It's all laughable!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game sucks!! Battle Royal is not a new thing. Not sure why it took off like crazy with this buggy mess of a game! Aside from my general dislike of BR there are much better games in the genre. Now that Apex Legends is out and free there is zero reasons to play pubg. Apex Legends and COD Blackout are far superior. And at least with COD you get to play the regular multiplayer mode as well. Just say no to pubg!

However until the game is out of Early Access our development resources will be focused entirely on improving the Battle Royale game mode. Only then will we consider the addition of in game purchases."I can't help but down vote and not recommend the game to anyone. You can't trust the developers as promises they made are very quickly broken with little transparency nor remorse. It's all $$$ to them.

review: Another early access game made by the same guy that ditched the DayZ standalone. Horribly optimized walls my gpu at 99% doesnt have sli support fps sometimes dips to single digits and stays that way until I have a hard restart on my computer. Graphics suck. Mechanics are buggy and bad. Cannot get any consistency in performance. I have 2x 980ti's which can handle most games at 1440p no problem even single card should get 70+ fps on high to max settings. No major improvements have been made recently and I have a suspicion that the main dev will bail again. This game will likely stay in early access forever. It will never pass a beta state. The cuck devs will always be able to say "oh its early access its still a work in progress" 2 years down the line. This tells me the devs know they can be lazy and get away with it all whilst filling their pockets to start the same cycle all over again. I only play this to play with friends. otherwise I would have refunded it.
