review: In my screenshots which I hope you can find. You'll see some screenshots of what I've had to deal with in PUBG. To be honest the game has some great concepts. When it works well it is a lot of fun. However on my i7 3770 gtx 970 8gb of ram half of the time when I join a match it goes to a black loading screen and stays there. I hear the sound of the plane and it forcing me off I hear parachuting and landing on the ground then nothing. I have to quite the game (which is caused issues with my pc for some reason) then relaunch. When I do get into a game there's another 75% change I will land only to see buildings with the most atrocious textures and polygons you can ever see. (check my screenshots) You can't get into buildings which is essential to finding weapons. This issue shows up regardless of my settings and friends with stronger and weaker pc's have never had these issues. This is an early access title so when I bought it I gave it some mercy but since such a gamebreaking bug still exists I can't recommend this. Fortnite which is also in early access (and free) doesn't have any issues like this and is made in the same engine. I find this unacceptable in a title that is in public hands.I hope this game gets better I hope the bugs get fixed I hope the performance gets better but honestly I think the developers aren't focusing on what they already have and working too much other stuff (I haven't seen any notible changes to the game though I do know they added a few things). Judging from the review bomb that happened the developers have issues that they need to work on.

review: For those of you worried that Bluehole ran off with your money Don't be.I was able to play the test server for the 1.0 patch this morning and holy crap was it refreshing. I was starting to become burnt out on this game but the test server is extremely refreshing. The game feels much more polished and runs so much better (1080 7600k consistently between 110 and 144 FPS even when in school!!) vaulting is a great new mechanic and the changes to gunplay are extremely refreshing. They reworked vehicles to be way less wonky and gave them some great new sounds too! Many of the issues with lag (primarily when first dropping into populated areas) have been fixed or are significantly better and it all blends together for a much improved experience.Overall this game should be able to deliver when it is released in December. It's an extremely fun battle royal game with the best shooting mechanics out of any games in the genre right now. Based on this test build I highly recommend it and I would recommend getting it now in case of a price increase and just to jump in now so you can start to learn the game and be ready to win some games when it's released.

review: This game has a huge playerbase where MILLIONS are playing at once with that being said there are a ton of reviews and from the looks of it as of mid august the game is rated mostly negative. Most of the bad reviews I've read are people who say the game is unstable or that they are being killed by hackers. When people say the game is unstable I really want to believe it is just their computer when people play most games they want the most beautiful graphics so they put the game on ultra settings and on the pubg steam store page they give you details on minimum and recommended computer specs to play the game. I kinda feel like all the people that say the game is unstable (Long loading times Network lag frame rate) are some of the people that think that if they have the minimum computer specs to play the game that the game should play on ultra. Pubg has some great graphics and can run on most computers but you should also consider that not all computers should be running on ultra. When it comes down to hackers yes there are some proven hackers and PUBG is doing a great job to get rid of them but in all 400+ hours of this game I have ever played (played for over a year now) I can say that there has been a few people who killed me and seemed slightly suspicous and in that case I reported them for suspicous activity but I have also noticed that whatever hack they do (unless it's like a god mode hack but i haven't ever come across that) that the hack usually isn't as threatening as most people think. Before things get to far I do wanna say that this game should fix the hacker problem but that most of the time killing a hacker would be the same as killing any other player and even then coming across a hacker (in my experience) is very rare I don't have numbers off the top of my head but I would confidentily say that every 1 out of 100 matches you player there is a hacker you most likely confront. Overall though I highly recommend this game if you like any other shooters or the literal hand shaking thrill in the top 2. Just make sure your computers performance matches with the configurations of the games video settings and that coming across hackers isn't as common as most people say.

review: The concept overall is excellent and does provide a good deal of enjoyment. This is however countered by the developer's attitude toward the player base. The implementation of a gambling based loot system (although still not affecting player performance) as well as a negligence to address cheating/game balancing are unacceptable. Ping restriction on server connections must be addressed as any truly competitve game bars the game from being called truly competitive. Few things are less satisfying than being shot from behind a wall or taking a bullet from a dead man. Regional/language restrictions would aide player communication and address most of the cheating issues as 99% of cheats are coming from China (http //www.legitreviews.com/brendan green says 99 pubg cheats china_201098). Regardless of regional attitudes this cancer to the game should be addressed. The preferred solution would be to have effective anti cheat measures and ban those who employ them on an IP level in order to create a level playing field for the Chinese players who indeed do play fair. Another possible solution is allowing individuals to set up client servers with their own rules/guidelines as to who may join (ping related) or control banning. As it stands I am having progressively more negative experiences with PUBG and am irritated by Brendan Green's (being the face of PUBG Corp) attitude toward the player base as not having legitimate concerns.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Edit It's now out of EA version 1.0. With "improvements" made to performance it performs even worse than in EA. One of the most unoptimized public releases I've seen especially considering it was in EA to iron out things like this. Pathetic disgusting and disgraceful.Edit SEVEN months later still an unoptimized mess laggy servers horrible netcode. Laggy clients still get to make decisions like shooting people that aren't really there walking through closed doors and what not.Edit Two months later.. Still has severe client server sync issues. e.g. state of doors not being synced getting killed through closed doors since the client doesn't have the correct state from the server hence the enemy can see you and kill you through a door you think is closed.Also there is a bug where sometimes the walls/floor doesn't load on the client causing the player to see through them but also SHOOT through them which is horrible since it proves that the CLIENT is making the decision whether or not bullets can go through walls or not and not the SERVER. Even a noob developer with 30 minutes of experience wouldn't make such a stupid design decision.Edit One month later... still plagued with mediocre optimizations and clunky servers.The client/server desync is real especially when client shows shots as hits while the server seems not to.. after playing for many hours with shadowplay we got a few videos where auto ing half a mag at point blank spewing blood over the screen still doesn't kill ppl..one has to wonder wtf is going on.Server desync causing items to disappear your mate drops ammo at your feet still doesn't show up on your client..Flickering black squares when using red dot sights.. flickering textures in general in some places..Getting stuck in objects like rocks/debris etc is far from uncommonGame freezing when trying to load back into the main menu after match..Spectate is still a joke you friend zooms in with scope at an enemy what to do you see? 8x zoom into the ground straight down ggDon't forget the running jump punch hs that deals as much damage as a 7 62 to the head logicInitial review 5th of AprilExtremely poorly optimized both client and server/net code.Can't even run it fully smooth with semi lowered settings on a Titan X 12 GB VRam I run Witcher 3 on pretty much maxed out settings with very little problems.Desync issues are real af be ready to get shot half a second after running behind a wall.This game also brought me my first Blue screen ever on Win 10 impressive feat.Other than that the games is fun but since these issues especially the net code can ruin a game so easily I'd not recommended it until they actually spend some of the new earned money on hiring some people who know how to develop these aspects of the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Here's exactly what your match will look like. Approximately 1 2 minutes of excitement after jumping out the plane followed by 15+ minutes of the most spineless gamers on the internet. You at this point have two options sit alongside these other toxic players or try to progress the game and get shot at through a bathroom window. Fast forward 20 minutes of literally sitting in one bedroom (because if you didn't someone who was hiding killed you) Now the circle is small enough where they actually have to shoot and be moving around.. At this point the game becomes laughably simple. All the spineless hiders start dropping like flies...All in all if you enjoy 2 minutes of gameplay followed by 20 minutes of hiding this is your game. Shooting mechanics are good though. 5/10

review: Please dont buy. The game is so frustrating in every possible aspect. Audio is garbage I cannot tell how far away any of the shots are let alone if they are in front of me or behind me gunshots and cars are really loud compared to other stuff so youll go deaf from the gunshots before being able to hear any of the footsteps clearly speaking of footsteps its impossible to guess which surface your enemies are stepping on because they always sound like youre walking on dirt or gravel and every gun sounds the same.Dont worry the visuals are awful too the game is still very unoptimised (I have a gtx 1070) you can see textures loading in right next to you the render distance is garbage even on the best possible settings. The maps are so lazily throw together every building looks the same making the game really repetitive and boring to look at nothing on the map truly stands out because of that. The shooting feels really rough the guns are inacurrate and the recoil is all over the place. You can never tell where youre getting shot from because of the lack of tracer rounds making the use of bolt action snipers all the more enjoyable since you cant tell where your shots are landing.

review: I finally upgraded my graphics card for this game and I must say that I have had a blast with it. I have only managed to kill myself once with a frag because I was talking to the wife. I just want to point out that most of the negative reviews that I have seen are due to the microtransactions but that's just a way for a company to make money. You shouldn't judge a game by that. That's like judging a game on graphics. If you really are getting that butthurt then request a refund. It's not that difficult. I just hate that Steam users are doing the same thing to PUBGs that they did GTA V when a mod was shut down. With the rant out of the way here is what I have to say Played mostly Solo games they're pretty great because there isn't much communication going on. Even if there is trust no one. Beware of campers.Duo is cool if you have a scrub you can play with more danger due to if you see one guy 10/10 there's another nearby. Squads is duo on steroids. Everything is a trap.AKM is bae.Also on the lobby island there is a tin building behind the cave (have to go around) there are weapons in there to try since anybody with an SSD will take most of the table weapons.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game needs to take a few pages from rust mods of the same genere. For example having a first and third person observation of the game after death would allow for something to do afterwards instead of just disconnecting from the server to re navigate the menu system back into a new game only to die and do the same thing. At the moment it feels kind of like a menu navigator with some fps aspects added on. Also being able to aim down the sights of the guns would be a plus. Unfortunately as I paid $20 for Rust and $30 for this game I cannot honestly say it deliveres a game worth reccomendation.

review: Just to be clear the issues I will cite are not system or network related. I run an overclocked i7 with 16gb of fast RAM and a 1080ti on a 150M/150M FiOS connection averaging 6ms to Google DNS and have been a custom PC builder for over a decade.With that in mind this game suffers from fundamental issues like epic server lag terrible distribution of weapons/gear too long to get into a game (2+ minutes with silly shooter "lobby" and airdrop) and unoptimized graphics. At Ultra on my rig there's tons of stuttering making it almost unplayable. Elements in the game are unpredictably unresponsive (often lag between sending "open door" and door beginning to open) and your shooter experience is slave to the glacially slow animations of your character reloading a gun or throwing a grenade. Vehicle dynamics are decent. Oh and apparently the grenade timers are set in hours because they give anyone in the area plenty of time to pour a cup of tea finish it and leisurely walk away before it goes off. Very unhappy paying money for this game. Initially enjoyed it until the real flaws started to grate on my game after game after game of dying before I could even find a pistol (occasionally 5+ minutes into the game.) Really guys? Your next update better be a doozy or I'm going back to Insurgency for a pseudo realistic FPS experience.

review: This game is fun to play but there are some things that make this game not so fun to play.Sure I can credit the game in general the realism the weapons the maps (although Miramar is quite off) the character models the vehicles (the physics are funny af) the downloadable content new cases being released every so often and other things that won't be listed here.There are some neutral things that I will say however.First the game uses a ton of video memory which can be quite frustrating even on the lowest settings. But it's the unreal engine so what did I expect?Second the game crashes unexpectedly but that could be a problem with my computer (yes it could be my computer or completely random but a larger sample size needs to be established in order to get better result).And now the things that really get me angry.First what is this Failed to initialize STEAM thing? It occurs every 2nd time I play this game and it is really annoying to me. It makes the game unplayable. This "feature" should go and other games using the EXACT SAME GAME ENGINE don't have this. This one thing makes the game so infuriating that it turns me away from playing the game despite all the stuff I've credited.Second get oceanic FPP servers in lulThis game without the negatives elicits a positive rating from me.This game with the negatives elicits a negative rating from me.

review: Player Bases Kids Everyone Casual players Gamers Hardcore Gamers Graphics Minecraft Really bad Bad OK Good Beautiful Masterpiece Price/quality Full price Wait for sale Average Refund it if you can Don't do it Free Requirements 90' PC Minimum Medium Fast High end NASA computer Difficulty You just need 2 arms Easy Easy to learn / Hard to master Hard (couples of hours getting beat up) Nope Game time/length Really short ( 0 2 hours) Short ( 2 10 hours) Few hours ( 8 20 hours) Long ( 30+ hours) Endless (Depends on the player) Story It doesn't have Still better than Twilight Okay Quite Good Fantastic Bugs 24/7 Bugs Bugs sometimes crashing the game sometimes Some bugs there and there Few Bugs Funny bugs Nothing Summary I love and hate this game. I'm not the biggest Battle Royale fan I hate the randomness with looting and the general game length to action ratio. I love the exhilarating fights the gun mechanics and the feeling of winning though. This game isn't for everyone (even though everyone seems to play it) but for $30 you'll definitely be able to get your money's worth. And for fans of the Battle Royale genre this is the best we have for now.

review: PUBG gets a lot of for streamers reporting "stream snipers" and then the players getting banned for a baby from COD shouting "cheater!". The only difference now is that it isn't "cheater!" it's now "stream sniper!" and now they're actually getting banned from the ing game. While this is a problem on the Dev's part the game itself is very good to play.Just like any other game you have good days playing the game and you have bad days. You may lose a ton or you may win a ton but that doesn't mean you have to write a bad review for the game itself talking about how it is when you lose a ton of games. I've played with people who are absolute garbage at the game and still won. I've played with people who are professionals at the game and I've still lost. I've played alone and I've won more than I lost because there was only one target to killSo why am I telling you this? Because if you're absolute at the game and you've either played five minutes or seven hundred hours then get ing better at the game and don't write a negative review about the game itself. BUT if you got banned from a stupid who screamed "stream sniper!" at you and you were just minding your own business then write all the negative you want.In conclusion devs if you're reading this stop banning people because a streamer yelled "stream sniper!". The reason why I ask this is because it's complete t. You can't even see people's name in the game and the only time you can is when someone kills someone else in the feed which the streamer dies anyway 'cause they're such at the game. But all in all the game is fun.

review: Pure While being hyped for by the streaming community is the only game i've ever encountered that manages to perform WORSe then AC Unity (an achievement in itself for anyone who tried to play it with any GPU that wasnt a top tier NVIDIA one from the same time period).Meanwhile the dev is currently attacking Epic for making a battle royale like game... but at least I'm willing to imagine Epic will actually leverage the potential from the Unreal Engine which the lack of performance clearly shows these devs have not.While it's safe to argue it's hard to leverage all potential for the Engine to shoot yourself as much in the foot as this team does is yet another achievement in itself.For me the current comparison (as an avid Arma3 BR fan ) Performs worse even multi gpu then Arma3 Single GPU even when PUBG is at the absolute lowest settings spare resolution and Arma is on High with only realtime shadows on medium... and even looks much worse at the same time Has potential to introduce interesting group based systems... but since it's supposed to be a competitive environment the lack of performance is inexcusable... UE has perfect options to include Vulkan support (which would've at least alleved the multi gpu GUI issues which are only matched by AC Unity again) is not employed and when trying to use the vulkan tag and some workarounds from experience with the UE BattlEye is being a whiney little for attempting to use the vulkan dll in the windows sysfolders... REALLY? NO benchmarking/testing options/possibilities whatsoever while the devs better know how bad the performance issues are... are we supposed to join a random lobby and potentially CTD while loading? come on... At some point when attempting Vulkan it turns out the game won't even detect driver version properly and erroneously suggests a downgrade (which I tried resulting in the game CTD'ing henceforth in 4k fullscreen no issues in windowed but even more performance loss and mouse input lag added to boot)This may be early access but at least when using the UE use it's damn good set of assets (Mainly referencing to the shader/SFX here) to your advantage... Or even better pick an engine for an actual reason because I can't find a logical explanation for the current state of affairs.Currently all this game really has is a lot of steamers' hype based on empty promises... If you look at this project from a developmental standpoint it is an absolute joke... not keeping mind of performance for something which is intended to be anywhat competitive... We ain't playing PVE here!

A large amount of players in China still connect to North America servers which leads to desync still being an issue but this is minor in comparison to how it was just a short while ago.All in all PUBG is good again. review: *RE REVIEW FOR LATE 2018Yes PUBG is a way better place than launch. There is no arguin with that it just is. Is that place good enough to stand up against trhe weight of criticism? I dunno. The gunplay is great but the whole game is still clunky as fook. Why Bluehole haven't let us use banadges while moving I just don't know. Why we still have to reload every gun and switch fire mode when you pick a gun up is beyond me. The greed is really showing now too with so many skins for sale that require IRL cash it's pretty disgusting tbh. But I'm an adult and am capable of ignoring microtransactions. $20 for a nurse's outfit is bloody shady though. The cheating seems to have been gotten under control or the same amount of control as other pc games. I still encounter them from time to time but you will never eradicate cheaters completely. As for player morals they have gotten no better. That's all I can say there. Server performance was a massive issue a bit a go causing huge desync and disparity between clients with tickrate being a major concern. I am happy to say this issue has been massively improved by a secret update that improved things all round. I no longer get shot behind cover and no one gets to run up on me and kill me in 3 frames of animation. So while the greedy corporation is starting to rear it's ugly head the core gameplay is now at a level where I can recommend this game for it's gunplay and core mechanics which are now up to par. It's a great game to hook up with friends and go create some epic and tactical moments. Just leave your wallet in another room. If you want clarification or proof of the server upgrades and tick rate look for wtfmoses on YouTube he made a video recently.

review: First of all I want to address the micro transactions. If you actually read the announcments instead of listening to third party information you would know that right now it's just a limited time thing to jump start the competitive community and some of the money is even being donated to charity. If you don't care about this sort of thing don't buy it. Your character is going to look different within the first five minutes of gameplay or will probably die anyways. That being said I understand that people are jaded after many early access games have cut and run after ramping up their player base with paid DLC **cough cough ARK cough cough** and other micro transactions. It sucks it really does. It sucks just as much as all the broken triple A titles being shipped today. It sucks just as much as the insane price of season passes for most online triple A titles. The game industry is just another business. Wether it's your ISP trying to get as much money out of you as possible or your cell phone company trying to tack on hidden fees most businesses will inevitably try to take as much of your hard earned money as possible. That's just how the world is right now.If you've read this far I appologize for the rant but I feel it's nessisary to put things into perspective when it comes to early access games. Early access games are a gamble. You pay half the price of a triple A title with the hope that the game will stick around long enough for you to have your fun. NOW TO THE GAME I really enjoy this game. I have many friends who play this game. I will continue to play this game. I may even give up a little more of my hard earned cash to this game. If my friends can put 300+ hours into this game I don't see why I couldn't get at least 100 hours out of it and that's more than a lot of $60 titles these days. If you like shooters or if the idea of the game intrigues you I would say just go for it.

review: With around 80 hours into PUBG I decided to do a review for people thinking of getting into what should they expect and and what it is.Player Unknown's Battleground's Review Gameplay The gameplay plays out fantastic if it didn't it wouldn't have been able to overcome DOTA 2 and CS GO.There is always that sense of hostility in the air because there is everyone out there trying to kill you unless you are playing squad or duo.There are certain areas and aspects where the game is buggy which is to be expected as the game is still in Early Access.The gameplay requires a great deal of prediction and quick decision making and even more so when playing in a squad or duo.Graphics Well what can I say it is made in Unreal 4 so naturally it is quite aesthetically appealing too.Though there are still some issues with it rendering and problems with the world lighting effects.This will improve over time with patches and updates.Hardware and Optimization I wouldn't say it requires a beefy system to run because 'running' is quite a misleading term.This is an FPS + fast paced so more frames/s means better gameplay output from you.You can't really expect a person with 15 fps on 75% render scale to be able to do anything.I run it with a ryzen 3 1300X + gtx 1050ti 4gb + 16gb at 1366x768 at ultra settings and get easily 60 70 FPS even in the cities.As long as you can run the game at 60 fps even if it is in the lowest settings it is okay but make sure to play at 100% render scale otherwise the game will look blurry af.The optimization kinda is there but don't really expect anything in the optimization field anytime soon.Bluehole will be releasing new content for a while only.Maybe in the monthly update there will be optimization included.Price Well here is the main thing xD is it worth the price of 999 INR ? Well look at this aspect would you play a game for free but it is in both gameplay and graphics or buy a game but get great/good gameplay with decent graphics which you also have fun playing ?The " worth the price " aspect differs from person to person personally for me I find it worth it till the very last dime.I am having a lot of fun playing it whether it is solo or teams.Conclusion Great gameplay decent graphics buggy and rendering issues but that can be resolved in later updates.A must have game inspite of being in early access.Rating 9/10

review: I've owned the game since the end of summer last year during august. When I first started playing everything felt smooth and playable for the most part so I didn't have any issues. While certain weather modes would ruin my performance it would never be unplayable. As the months passed the game improved in performace and content. Although after patch 1.0 which was the full release of the game everything went down hill. The game became plgued with hackers which forced me to go into ffp for the majority of my time playing. As months passed after the chaeaters situation the game was lacking in more content as a fully released game but as each update came the performance began to go backwards . The gmaes servers started to cause stuttering frame loss and crashes. Not to mention recently this year the playerbase has been bombarded with paid crate after paid crate. While these crates were never needed in the first place the developers have ignored the need for performance updates. Recently they have admittted to their faults in falling short in addressing peformance issues which seemed good at first but after this recent SUPPOSSED PERFORMANCE UPDATE. The game has not changed at all. I honestly wish the game would have kept the same consistency it had when it was in early access instead of full release. I would like the recommend this game but with the state it is in now. I cannot bring myself to recommend it to anyone. I love this game and all of its concepts but the development team is killing it with not addressing more serious issues while giving us paid crates that aren't needed.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ok so first off I would reccomend this game at the moment to anyone who gets less than 60fps on CS GO as you'll get like 5fps on this game. Hopefully as time goes on the devs will optimise more though.The game play is fun but can sometimes feel a little repetitive or tedious. For example every game you stock up with good loot only to get sniped from somewhere you can't even see or someone camps in a house with a shotgun waiting for you. However as you keep playing you do get better and have better ideas of how to get into the top 10.The weapons and items are good and theres a range of guns for everyone and what they prefer i.e shotguns assult rifiles SMG's and snipers. There are glitches in this game but I have seen improvements from the devs. The servers aren't the best and I have had multiple occasions where a shot dead on an enemy has completly missed due to server lag.This game is fun to play especially with friends. Although I have made the majority of my review about the negatives I would definatly reccomend it to anyone who enjoys multiplayer shooters. I think this game will be on another level once the devs are finished and take it out of early access. GET IT WHILE YOU STILL CAN! (if you can run it!)

review: PUBG is fun for a while but with gained experience certain flaws become painfully apparent. If you're a passionate and competitive player this game will test your patience in more ways than one. If you usually end up obsessing about improving your skill and enjoy winning heed my warning STAY AWAY! It's one of those games that came close to greatness and have caused me frustration. If you ever jumped on the DayZ wagon maybe you'll empathize. Having given my feelings for this game an unhealthy amount of thought here's me getting my conclusion of my chest for probably nobody to read. Let the rant begin!The network performance is abysmal. Be prepared to get hit behind cover constantly opponents gliding about and crazy peeker's advantage. The movement desync is higher than firing. Meaning you'll see players shooting you before their movement animations represent as much seeing you before turning shooting when stuck in animations. Super bullets you'll get hit multiple times instantly players having shot you for quite a while before you're even able to react. The hit registration is client side and there's no max lag compensation. So a player with 400 ping will shoot you multiple times before you'll even see him effectively killing you before you can do anything. It becomes more about who can abuse the desync better not aim or outmaneuver. If games like CS GO or Overwatch have ever caused you irritation for its desync this is on another level. Seriously stay away.The client performance is also pretty bad. You will need a legitimate beast of a PC to run this smoothly at 144 FPS. Even if you get the FPS high there are constant stutters and hiccups. Mainly because the frametimes aren't stable and 100 fps feel like 30. If you're used to console or deem 60 fps enough you'll be fine. If you care about graphics this game looks like absolute . Like something out of 2003 with glitching anti aliasing. It's an eyesore for sure. Also there are bugs that have been present for over a year now and have yet to be fixed.The gameplay is where the game shines ... for a little while. When you're new chasing the "winner winner chicken dinner" (last person standing) is exhilarating. However you'll soon realize some methods are overpowered for achieving this objective especially passive ones. In example going to remote areas and looting for long periods of time will 100% ensure you're getting geared while others are dying without risk. Then you'll move into the late game. Not having seen enemies for 15 20 minutes this will naturally make you anxious and excited. When you're new mostly you'll just die and loose the gear. Rinse repeat the game soon turns into a looting/driving/running/camping simulator if you're chasing "Chicken Dinners". If that's your cup of tea you'll enjoy PUBG for sure. For most though this becomes increasing tedious and boring because it doesn't challenge you. And this is where you'll face problems if you want to continue placing high because this is the only viable tactical style for continuously winning.So what do most experienced players end up doing? They "drop hot" which is the popular term for starting games in locations having established themselves as popular PvP areas. Needless to say compared to beforementioned passive and tedious strategies this is very risky. Not only do you infinitely increase your chances of dying (or your teammates dying) but there's no reward even if you're successful. Winning these popular drops will not yield you better gear than those who went to remote areas. More often you'll come out with much less having chewed though armor ammo grenades health bandages first aids boosters and most importantly time and teammates. If you want to win doing this just isn't worth it. Ever. Not even close.So why do so many players still do it? Because it's fun and challenging even if it isn't a viable way to win. In other words if you like winning and PvP this game will cause you frustration because you can't have your cake and eat it too You can't have fun and win too. Like ranking up? You'll be better off looting meds for 25 minutes every game and hiding. Actually the rank 80 player in EU right now does this and doesn't actually use weapons. That's how overpowered passive playstyles are you don't actually need weapons he doesn't even TRY to shoot others. (MasterT94).This issue causes a lot of problems and has polarized the community for a long time. It's been an ongoing debate between enthusiasts and frustrated critics and where both should've won the PvP oriented players have lost completely. The PUBG competitions have established a niche community dedicated to players willing to compete at "who can play passive styles better". Employing weapons mostly to scare other teams away out of game handshaking so they don't land on each other or when forced into conflict much later in the game. There's never an incentive to search for action so if you like to PvP but you also want to do well this game will frustrate you. It's not even viable to risk fighting when you're desperate exemplified in article https //www.pubgradar.com/n/5b3fa5a7abd73400213866f8 The offensive side of an idealistic "viability continuum" is none existent and so you're only left with obviously better passive strategic choices and obvious choices aren't choices at all. PUBG have yet to acknowledge such balancing issues. If you prioritize winning you will probably grow bored pretty quickly when you realize the tedious nature of achieving it. And even then if you actually want to gain rank through passive styles The ranking system is flawed for this exact reason and nobody actually respects it. Not even the "pros" who've dedicated themselves to winning at PUBG will respect your ability to win absurd as it sounds. Most lose respect for winning and by extension the e sport competitive aspect is alienating only competing at passive styles of play not encompassing the PvP accomplishments most audiences find awe inspiring. Returning to reviewing the actual game PUBG has a lot of fun moments. Even if it doesn't support long term engagements as I've detailed thus far the short term spectacle can be fun. Especially when playing with friends the gunplay is great in spite of networking issues and a breath of fresh air compared to most shooters. Clunky but very rewarding. Also driving cars throwing grenades explosions stressful situations and many many failures offer its own sort of fun. If you're that kind of player jumping from game to game without the intention of long term engagements not caring if you lose a lot it's probably worth checking out with friends. Is that worth 30 bucks? You decide.I ve played PUBG a lot but stopped trying to win long ago though I never stopped trying to improve (should be complimentary aspects but isn t). It sounds smug but surviving longer isn t challenging and therefore not interesting. I still play because I enjoy the gunplay and PvP in and of itself discarding all chicken dinners in favor of PvP. As a competitive person this has been a very confusing experience. I don t respect the competitive scene at all considering them a niche of commercially manufactured athletes . And the game s made me so frustrated with its development and ignorance I m unwilling to spent another dime on it. In my frustration I ve found myself hoping that it fails. If any other game replicates the gunplay and introduced a wider viability continuum I m out for good.TL DR If client and network performance is important to you STAY AWAY! Else PUBG is fun for a while but not worth a long term engagement. The game isn't competitive as only passive and tedious playstyles are rendered viable something devs aren't acknowledging and generally seem unable or unwilling to make substantial changes.

review: TLDR Performance of game is terrible mods are banning for stupid reasons paid crates in early access and devs are working on console port when PC version isn't finished. Skip this for now unless you have multiple friends to play with and a super computer.At this point in time I cannot recommend this game to anyone. There are multiple problems with this game that need fixed before the developers make this game great instead of good.1. The optimization is absolutely atrocious. Now I average probably about 60 FPS on good areas on the map but sometimes those are hard to come by. My game constantly drops down to 1 FPS (yes you read that right) in areas and it'll happen in about 3 5 second intervals which makes the game unplayable. Now before you ask if my PC can even run this game my specs are an i5 4690k OC'd to 4.2 Ghz with an OC'd GTX 1070 and the game is on an SSD. I have tried almost every settings guide and tinkered with settings for a couple hours and nothing has worked for me.2. Playerunknown (the creator of the game) himself needs to get mods under control. I have seen a couple posts on Reddit about people being banned for "stream sniping" from killing popular PUBG streamers when in fact they were not stream sniping. The mods banned these people without hard evidence that this was happening which is not okay. 3. Last but not least Playerunknown has announced that he wants to introduce PAID crates in an UNFINISHED EARLY ACCESS game. This is unacceptable. There is so much that needs worked on in this game and they decide to try and make a cash grab move before the game is even at full release. Imagine if the amount of time and effort to implement this would go into optimization of the game....In conclusion I cannot recommend this game to anyone without an i7 7700K and a GTX1080 Ti and even then it might be if y. The developer needs to get his priorities in order to make this game better than the average early access DayZ/H1Z1 like game. Edit Playerunknown has announced that there will only be one paid crate as a test in early access and has explained in further detail of how the system will work so point three is now invalid.Also August's update looks promising optimization wise so hopefully some issues will be fixed!Edit 2 After the initial August update my optimization seemed to improve on a small scale. I do get better FPS in some areas and do not have drops but in medium to large towns/cities the performance is still terrible. Mini rant They have now officially announced they've partnered with Microsoft to make a port to Xbox One which is not the right thing to do in my opinion. Without the game being finished on PC I believe they will rush and/or not finish the game for us because of Microsoft's agenda. If this game comes out polished straight out the gate on console I will be furious. Finish the PC version first then port to console.

review: 25 hours played so far and all I can say is amazing. I fell in love with this game it's good cause it's intense and you always have to care of what is happening around you cause there might be someone. So yeah I'll do some Pros and Cons now.Pros+ Very big map you can play on the entire map.+ Variety of gun and accesories. My favourites are the Scar L and a 4X Scope.+ Variety of vehicles. There are cars (Uaz Dacia Buggy) motorbikes and boats.+ Different weather and time modes (Mid day Sunset and Rain + Thunderstorm)+ You can easily have fun with your friends for example by trying to win only with a car etc.Cons And this will be first on the list because many people will be wondering. It's quite bad performance! If you have a bad PC / Laptop don't get it! I have a i7 + GTX 860M laptop and everything on very low except the view distance gets me only 40 FPS normally. Usually sudden fears let's say. As I said at the beggining you might go looking at everywhere and suddendly get shot and you will probably get scared and jump from the seat a bit ) So if you have any heart problems obviously wouldn't be good to get it. Raging. Yeah well you might get flattened by a car or simply jump 200 m in the sky because a bug and die and you will probably rage the f*ck out of you. So if you have expensive things at home be careful when running at an open field not to die from a car cause you might hit something and break something after. Bugs. There are lots of bugs but it's on Early Access so it's ok for me. Bugs can relate with the upper con. Jumping etc. It's quite difficult to get jumping to places but I have heard they will introduce a parkour update soon and that will change the things quite much.Apart from that wouldn't say nothing else. Overall I love this game as said at the beggining and unless I start getting very angry I don't think I'll stop playing it in a while. Hope you enjoyed this review and Like it so others can see. Thank you D

I think EVERYONE here would rather outright buy cosmetic DLC or you know not have microtransactions at all. F*ck off with that sh*t. Not recommended unless they change this.

If you down someone see them fly across the screen like an angry spider and then are killed by someone else you can't report the actual cheater. Cheaters ruin this game completely. In fact I don't even see the point of cheating in this game it takes away from the entire soul of the game. If it wasn't for the current refund policy I would want my money back. review: Pubg a decent idea/game with a completely dev team.If your internet is sub par and you don't want to have to redownload the entire game every single time you want to play then this game really isn't for you.For some reason the devs thought it would be a good idea to have to download the entire game again (around 15gb) every update instead of just downloading the new/changed mechanics and bug fixes. With my internet that takes around 6 hours (download speed is just very slow but I can play with low pings). This means that when I download things I usually do overnight which I did with this game but since updates are so frequent (wouldn't be a bad thing if the dev team wasn't a complete how) I haven't been able to play this game in well over a month as every time the download has finished theres always a new update (I usually waited a day or two before downloading it AGAIN).In other words game is unplayable for anyone with sub par download speeds or a restriction on how much data they can use.0/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Update Nr. 6 Ok this game will be released in an unfinished unpolished state and I can not recommend it ONE BIT. I will now advertise Fortnite BR as being the WAY better game after playing it for over 100 hours! It is amazingly fun and the base building and pacing are such a great step upwards from pubg I have a winrate of 15% in squads in Fortnite and am Top 500 in overwatch so I think I am pretty good at these more arcady shooters but also end up in the top 3 spots in battlefield one the entire time. So what i wanna say is if you are good at shooters like having fun and not waiting around just play FORTNITE instead of wasting your money on this piece of Update Nr. 5 Just play Fortnite BR it's free it's great and the devs don't suck. Seriously it's the better game! Played a ton of it already! Great level design building cover better loot system better gunplay just more fun overall ) And also better pacing )!Update Nr. 4 You might see a lot of people playing this game on steam charts by the love of god don't become one of them this game is average or bad in any respect imaginable. I really really can NOT recommend this game!Update Nr. 3 Oh so now we are at the point where the game has more and more bugs connection issues and even the leaderboards that once worked are now completelty broken (as in they do not record any stats for me). gg wp! Oh and did I mention the ugly sprays everywhere which try to suck off twitch streamers?Update Nr. 2 OH wow so no micros transactions before launch and here they are! Now the devs officially join the ranksd of other scummy ea devs! Congrats! Oh and did I mention they always push back updates further an dfurther and the games launch date? No longer than x months ea my )Update All my points are still valid even months after launch! But we got us a new hero SERVERS TOO BUSY! YAY Now I can finally experience what this game would have been like if it was a hyped AAA release! THANK YOU PLAYER UNKOWN! Yup this is EA alright I think the game itself is good but the execution is Plain Core Gameplay Looting feels laggy and urnesponsive The Netcode is horrible shooting at people feels horrible you never know if your hits will count or not The walking climbing and any collision with the environment is garbage. Feels like a f2p MMO from 2006 The game has a lot of random factors (I won't even start with loot placement) especially the random circle placements in the later parts (top 10+) can be super Scoring system is garbage you get way more points instantly dying cause reaching top 20 gives jack and the base bonus and kills are the main meat. (yeah sure I got a lot the few times I won but that is very rare in such a game) Edit Reached top 9 got oneshot by sniper got 150 points droped down at end of flight got 4 kills on partially afks with my fists (you can even oneshot people with fists! "headshot") got 210 points. 25min vs 2 min. Is this deathmatch or battle royale? The scoring clearly says deathmatchOverall probably the least hardcore/competitive shooter I have played in a long time (thx to random/bad game design) with the worst gunplay thx to the netcode.Should it get better after EA I will feel free to recommend the game atm it sucks more than it should even for EA.

review: Dont buy the hype this is just like every other EA title while has its moments of fun the sheer amounts of frustration you will recieve inbetween those moments will not make up for it.At first this game seems awesome but soon after the glaring problems will frustrate you to no end.I can hear my buddy 2 houses away but yet cant hear footsteps or the door openeing in the same room your in.Server dysynch makes the game just a RNG fest for registering hits. Shoot a guy 7 times with a ak see 7 red splats comming from the target just for the server to go nope and refund4 rounds of ammo like it didnt happen.More rng fun.Wearing level 3 helmet and level 3 body armor just to get one shot from a pump action shotty from across the building yet point blank a naked guy hit doesnt register and he one shots you in the dome with a pistol.Land with another enemy you pick up magnum load it and put 2 rounds sqaure in his chest yet he somehow knocks you out.I know its EA I know it can get better but im not gonna sit here and fanboi this game. Save your time money and frustration level and make these guys earn your cash release a gold level game.Also there are two types of players fighting for the futore direction of this game. The first are the CoD/Halo/Counterstrike/name any other twitch title crew and the other are the Arma/Dayz/realism crew.Right now the twitch crew is winning because I have never deliberately aimed for someones head while running and gunning I still manage to get headshots because EVERYBODY seems to get nothing but headshots in this game regardless of range.Hope with all the effort they have put into this game it just doesnt turn into another run of the mill running jumping and headshotting game but honestly I have zero faith in that not happening.

review: 1.0 and I STILL hate this game.I hate this game with an upmost burning passionate hatred more volatile and intense than a thousand Suns all scorching the Earth till it's nothing but a seeping hot ball of plasma. This game...THIS GAME....First let me start by the things that are less opinion focused and more factual. The way things are rendered in this game are stupidly outdated. Things like Foliage and small structures that act as concealment don't even render properly outside of 250 meters where a lot of engagements outside of buildings tend to take place. So you might think you're being a true ninja sniper assassin bush wookie by crawling on the ground being sneaky like but to others you look like a complete nimrod dryhumping a freshly cut lawn in the open. This is a problem from way back in 2005 where the running gag was that the guy running the GeForce 5500 would be at an advantage due to the fact that the player is unable to see foliage. Why is this a thing in 2018?The movement in this game feels very stiff and unintuitive in some aspects but very arcadey and unrealistic in others. On one hand vaulting feels very slow and feels more like a curse than a blessing. After all why vault when you can simply jump over 90% of the vaultable surfaces? The vehicles control SO badly that they might as well not even be in the game. You could barely nick a bump in the road and be spun out even though you're not turning on the wheel or hitting the gas. And since there is no vehicles with armor or at least better cover there's almost no point in getting into these noisy death traps on wheels. But hey! At least you can peel out like in Mario Kart if you hold the brake and floor it at the same time amirite?Let's not forget the netcode. It's just...very "ugh" to get shot by some dude teleporting all over the place or shooting some guy several times only for them to turn around and shoot you then die moments later themselves. With how much cash this game is raking in there is ZERO excuse by this point for connectivity to still be this frustratingly bad at times.Okay so here's where the more opinion focused stuff comes out so you can agree or disagree as you see fit.The weapons are just...not fun at all honestly. I don't feel any genuine giddiness when I pick up a weapon that has a reputation for being powerful or reliable in real life. I get that they were aiming for a more realistic vibe in this game (which they overall did not succeed) but couldn't they sacrifice just a little bit of fun? This game is trying so hard to be serious and gritty that there's just no room for joy.Second of all this game is about 80% random. Who you're matched with/against where the circle will be where your drop plane comes in from what weapons will be in what buildings where the circle will shrink to and SO much more is flat out random. I mean I get it like items in Smash Brothers having a bit of RNG can help tip the odds in favor of a player that is less skilled to fend off a veteran player and perhaps even win. But people also forget that this can also stack the odds in the opposite direction as well with the veteran being more akin to a god amongst men. Since the game has RNG oozing from nearly every pore and crevasse things like an MMR system wouldn't really do any good as there are far too many variables involved to calculate.And lastly again the map design is so outrageously bad that I feel like a teenager could come up with better map layouts. Again like I stated before the maps have so little reliable cover that it really only adds to the whole RNG/Luck aspect of the game. If someone gets the jump on you you're already dead. There's nowhere to run nowhere to hide and no way of knowing when it'll happen. To piggyback on the weapons the firearms have very similar sounds that only the most dedicated sweaty tryhards will actually be able to distinguish each individual firearm. Because of this you won't really know what exactly you're up against until it's far too late. Trees in the game are pathetic toothpicks houses are typically death traps in many scenarios and don't get me started again on foliage and cover. The maps are just too wide open.From a nitpicky immersion standpoint there's nect to no flow between landmarks. Apartment buildings are in the middle of open fields with no roads connecting to them houses are on top of mountains with no normal way to get to the top the military base looks more like an industrial park with some red stars slapped on for that "true KGB effect" cities will have one maaaybe two roads through the center with houses seeming to be copy/pasted in a row because...reaons. Erangel just doesn't feel like it could possibly be a real place where people once were. Heck it doesn't even feel like an arena. It just feels like some guy lazily copy/pasted the same assets over and over in some places slapped on some roads and passed it off as a map. It's ugly lazy and inexcusable.Lastly I have to say that I dislike how I feel like I get absolutely nothing for my troubles in this game. You get literally or next to nothing for reaching landmark positions like top 50 top 25 top 10 top 5 top 3 or actually winning. And for a game where matches can drag on as long as half an hour that's a whole lot of time wasted running around looting buildings just for some guy who's purposefully downloading video games on his Xbox to slow his connection to shoot you while in his underwear and claim first place. Even so the things you get aren't particularly helpful or exciting. What's the point of a cool hat or hairdo when you'll be wearing a helmet? What's the point of a cool shirt when it'll be covered by body armor? People may have mixed opinions on it but I feel like that's one aspect that Fortnite Battle Royale got right. By sacrificing a little bit of realism for some fun they use shields instead of armor. That way you get to keep your signature look and cosmetics actually have some level of fulfilling meaning. But it's not like that matters because the cosmetics in this game are a joke anyways. There's nothing cool quirky funny or anything that has any level of personality in this game. It's generic to the max.I hate this game's guts and everything it stands for. I only reinstalled it to play 1.0 in hopes of SOME level of change. Instead I just booted up a game that may have been better optimized but is still a wreck all the same 1 out of 5

review: The Battle Royale genre is becoming inflated after H1Z1's release just as the Survival genre was inflated after Minecraft came out. H1Z1 held the crown for best BR game out there because.. Well there wasn't any real stand alone competition. PUBG has smashed all expectations of what I wanted from King of the Kill. (Because lets face it the original premise of H1Z1 is long gone I feel bad for even saying that name.)I don't have much bad to say about this game? It's frustrating to go an entire twenty minutes without finding anyone and then get clipped by a sniper at 100+ meters and it was a complete waste of time.. But the game is solid. Good flow of updates and content good communication with developers.. Blue Hole does seem to have let this whole popularity buzz go to their head but I'm hoping they chill out and go back to normal once it all clears.

review: This is Early access. So keep in mind this review can change.Right now this game is absolute garbage. The amount of time used on doing absolutely nothing is insane. Just running and being bored. Then mixed the boredom with absolutely dreadful game mechanics. Like Problems with getting over small broken fences and brick foundations (no leap over options). Clunky and bad item pickup mechanics. Poor Graphics and rendering. Unrealistic movements. A badly made deployment method. Wasteful and laggy Warmup timer that could have worked better not being part of the gameplay. Laggy movements. Bad shooting mechanics. Hard to use scope mechanics. Flawed reward system (even after i got enough BB to get a boxes it said "Error unlocking the rewards" and i lost the reward crate). A bunch of clothing options that have absolutely no value in game (I hope they add some stats to it or something). Laggy and slow Inventory. Cramming 100 people in to the same aircraft forcing 3 4 players to land at the same buildings punching each other to death within a minute or so from the start of the match. Calling it co op or duo play is BS. After one dies he may wait a very long time for the other player to finish his match just so they can play another one.Only good thing they have here is the idea. And even then they forgot to tell us why we are being dropped on this island to kill each other to begin with?So i wish i could get my money back. I don't see this game becoming anything worth playing within the next 2 years.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: A game whose rapid claim to fame became its greatest downfall. While the game can be very fun and is receiving updates (At a slow rate) to improve it the game is plagued with hackers and teamers (People who play as teams of 4 in 2 man lobbies etc.) this can ruin an otherwise perfect run you and your friends may have invested 40 or more minutes into. You'll find great loot and have all the heals you could ask for only to be shot by hacker 5000 feet away from you. The game mechanically still feels like it's in beta and really feels unpolished with parts of the map having 'bad' textures which will kill you or get you stuck in the unfortunate circumstance that you clip into them. Overall the game needs much work before it is even close to being worth the $30 asking price. Regardless the game can still be fun and if you have 3 other friends who want to join you but be prepared the journey is not smooth.

review: The Game Itself Runs poorly even on high end systems especially for a game that looks as bad as this does. Very very buggy. Often when I land the buildings haven't even loaded in yet makign it impossible for me to loot anythign and a sitting duck for any other players.The gunplay is bland. Every gun feels like a peashooter even sniper rifles. The modding aspect is pretty interesting though.The problem is by the time only a handful of people are left your survival is basically entirely random rather than skill based. Hide and hope you see the enemy first. If you get unlucky and are seen before your enemy you lose. Bluehole's Stupidity The developers are blatant liars saying microtransactiosn would not be implemented until after it left early access then adding microtransactions in early access. Not to mention they said it'd leave early access by late 2017 then immediately said that's not true.They've also been threatening Fortnite a much better Battle Royale game I might add that's also free to play for being too similar. Despite the fact that you can't copyright a game genre. Not to mention this isn't even the first game in the genre.And of ocurse there's the recent issue of in game ads in the Chinese clients advertising VPNs.Also they have the tendency to ban people for killing streamers. Despite no evidence that these people are actually watching the streams.Overall don't give your money to these scumbags. The game isn't worth it anyway.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 06/20/17 Out of the few early access games I have played/followed PUBG reigns supreme. The development of the game looks promising and in the right direction. PUBG in it's current state is not properly optimized but has made great progress each patch so far. The gameplay and its developmental progress is what keeps me playing. PUBG's combat is a more polished version of the combat from DayZ. If you ever enjoyed the firefights from DayZ Arma 3 and/or H1Z1 then this game is right up your alley. Like any early access game or any game for that matter PUBG has its flaws but ultimately the pros outweigh the cons. I am very excited to see the future development of PUBG and would easily reccomend this game.12/17/17 Its been 6 months and I would still reccomend this game. PUBG has gone through ups and downs through these months but overall the gameplay is why I keep coming back to play. Optimization has improved but stlil can be improved. The new map is very big and adds a new dynamic to the gameplay. PUBG is still the best early access game and best Battle Royale game currently available on the store.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Alright let's go straight to the things that make this game a success and why it is a TERRIBLE platform all at the same timePros Game introduced alot of customization that entices the player to find the best loot for their weapons ultimately to continue to top 10 and lastly to be the top team of the game. Firefights when fought are extremely action packed and can be really fun to engage in when with teammates (and solo admittedly). Updates are quite frequent compared to other EA games (before 1.0 update) and has spearheaded its way into setting a precedent for other upcoming developers. When on higher setting graphics the game looks visually appealing.although this game has made an impact on Steam for being the No.1 played game OAT it is still susceptible to stupid shenanigans that the developers unfortunately allowCons Without a shadow of a doubt *SERVER HOPPING* Games such as H1Z1 were riddled with AS server players because they abused the hell out of their ping and this game is no exception since its rise to the top. This is one of the MAIN things that I think needs to be addressed furthermore with the allowing of players to server hop they set a dangerous precedent that will allow other EA or AAA developers to allow such a feature. this shouldn't be the case. With the addition of a couple million users came the hackers you'll happily loot an area only to be sniped from 1000M away and insta die or shoot someone to oblivion only to see that your bullets had 0 affect whatsoever take caution whenever entering new lobbies. Last but definitely not least the Drop System. Have you ever gone to the rooftop of a building whilst someone is downstairs and you go to try to find a weapon only to not find one on the upper floors as the person below waits with an AR? this game is HILARIOUSLY ridiculous when it comes to that. You either find what you need in the first 10 seconds or the first 15 minutes it always seems to be hit or miss and it is something that NEEDS to be addressed.As much as I love to play this game It's the problems with the high ping AS players on NA servers Cheaters and Loot System that constantly push me back from actually enjoying this game hope this was a helpful review play safe!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Well I made it 3 hours into the game before I witnessed the first obvious cheat. I knew something wasn't right when I was killed so I watched the kill cam. I got one shot killed with an AKM from a long distance in the open. The problem is that the crosshair never made it over my body. The guy jumped off the motorcycle and didn't even complete the aim. It was blatant cheating/hacking. I'll probably try again after the next patch. I will say that there is lots of potential.

review: I've had some truly memorable gaming moments playing PUBG. The desperate scramble for a gun while footsteps get closer...the quick flash of a figure darting across a building...the ruthless joy of killing an opponent with a scoped M24... the concentrated panic in the final circle...I could go on.Unfortunately the never ending horde of Chinese hackers have ruined the experience. They shoot you through walls move at superhuman speed take out your head with every shot and heal themselves instantly. More than 5 out of 10 games are infested with them.Bluehole can release as many new maps and bug fixes as they want but this game won't survive if they continue to ignore the problem. Waves of gamers have begun switching over to Fortnite. They'll also jump to the next hot battle royale game that hits Early Access leaving it to suffer the same fate as H1Z1. Maybe there's still hope but I don't recommend buying PUBG at this time.

review: Basic walking simulator where you collect items for the first hacker/camper you come across.Only 3 types of people play this game Hackers Streamers and Trolls. There's no casual element to this game whatsoever. (unless you consider cheating or trolling as such.) Ironically this game makes for a poor competative experience as well as the RNG/luck factor involved being too dominant for a balanced competition.You need a 1080ti to get any use out of your 144hz monitor. You'll still get perfomance issues with even the best computer components.The netcode is an embarrasment.The overall design of this game is total amateur hour.The devs seem motivated only by revenue generation as efforts are made to provide microtransaction options but little is made to balance out the game or address existing bugs. There's no money in solving bugs as players have already paid for the game. So as such we see a lot of gimmics and vanity items being added but core issues being entirely ignored. (or even get denied as actually existing as is the case with cheating. Furthermore this is one of the easiest games to cheat in.) Cheaters are customers too so are stream snipers and trolls so they wont fix any of that.The one good thing this games got going is that it makes for a pretty decent spectator experience. I imagine that's why it's so dominant on Twitch. Pretty sure Twitch is whats keeping this game alive. BR in general is pretty okay to watch and it's only a question of time before an actually competent developer does a good job in making a BR game that is also fun to play.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Let's start off by saying as much as I may or may not critisize this game in my review I believe my purchase was well spent and I have definitely gotten my moneys worth.The game started off extremely buggy just like any early access game in it's early stages yet BlueHole was very responsive and was constantly releasing patches. However I definitely can't say that the game is recieving the same attention now as it did a few months ago.I believe that the creators do care about PUBG and want it to progress instead of being like many other early access scams like dayZ but the main problem is that they arent following up on their promises. Honestly I cant trust anything that comes out of Brendan Greene's mouth after BlueHole promisied to create extra measures to prevent Chinese players from playing on EU and NA servers with 200+ ping (Ping lock) and manifesting TPP and alot of FPP games with cheats yet havent followed up on that and the community got called "Xenophobic" by Brendan Greene for suggesting region locking China where an overwhealming amount of cheats come from. Right now we need some updates to further prevent cheats which will ultimately have to be region locking China.Dont get me wrong I absloutely love this game. I think its an awesome idea executed perfectly. I really like the new gameplay updates coming out (The 2x is finally usable?!?!.) But I still feel like BlueHole may be catering to the Chinese audience instead of the rest of us because it brings in the most money. Hopefully we can get a ping lock sooner or later. Overall I definitely do recommend this game loads of fun with friends or alone heck even with randoms! The nostalgia of being in a top 10 position is insane and getting kills and winning feels much more rewarding than games like Fortnite.

review: Five hours is enough for me to make a review because there isn't very much to talk about. But the game is pretty awesome. The gameplay is intense the controls are easy and the danger feels so ing real. So let's in' talk about that shall we?Okay so since the latest update we have 5 game modes solo duo squad solo FPS and duo FPS. The last two are just solo and duo but there is no switching between first and third person it just stays in first person. Which is pretty cool because it evens the playing field a little. Third person offers a wide area of view and it is much easier to spot enemy players. During shoot outs (when you zoom in) your view will be switched to first person. It can be kind of jarring at first but you get used to it. But the FPS gameplay changes everything suddenly you find yourself very carefully peeking around corners. You soon learn that med long range weapons do absolutely nothing in buildings as it can be super hard to swing your gun around a corner. But an UZI or an UMP is perfect for entering buildings with. The game is fun. That's just it. It's a clear and concise form of gameplay. There is no extra t. Just what you know about the map. I do see a lot of complaints about the Microtransactions. It's stupid for the Devs to do that when they promised that they wouldn't but I most likely will not be purchasing a key to anything so I suppose I'm just apathetic about it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Close range combat is atrocious. Most guns do no damage and are incredibly innacurate. Shotguns? HA! Youre better off yelling insults at your enemy it might be more reliable. Pistols and SMGs are the same way but at least they are somewhat accurate. Mid to long range combat is decent and the game shines when you have a decent firefight. Map selection is a bit dull for a 30 dollar game. Erengel is decent and has a decent amount of diversity. You got you large cities farmlands and hills. Miramar ing BLOWS. Hills and valleys everywhere and the man with the high ground will win. Vehicles are absolutely necessary to staying alive as walking on the road is a guaranteed death. A map selection was in the works in december but I doubt it will actually be a thing anytime soon. Until then the best option is to move or delete the map files from your game installation which will connect you to only Erengel servers. Matchmaking is fast but these chinese players are a problem. They INFEST North American servers with high ping and cheating. You will get shot around the corner and your shots will not hit them. Almost every killcam I watch I see my attacker shoot at where I was 10 in years ago yet he still does damage. Also queuing up with randoms in NA servers pretty much guarantees you will be teamed with a chinese player. How am I going to win the game if there is a very obvious language barrier? Brendan Greene gets his panties in a bunch when people call for a region lock even though these chinese are the biggest problem this game has. Hackers are a huge issue. Hacking runs rampant in this game and according to Brendan Greene the majority of cheats are coming out of China. Thanks to the lack of a region lock these hacking s can take their cheats to NA EU and OC servers. There really isnt any escape they are everywhere. Sometimes its aimbot that killed you or sometimes it is someone running and ESP program. A hacker could be tracking you throughout the game and you might not even really know it. Game runs like complete When into the game for the first time the map will take centuries to load. I will often "load" into the spawning area where I can hear footsteps and noises but I am still looking at the blackloading screen. I have decent internet and a good hard drive so I don't know what the issue is. A friend with nearly identical specs loads in fast yet I am always stuck with waiting to load in. Framerate is ing atrocious even on low settings. I have blue screened multiple times when playing this game even with the most up to date drivers and a very capable system. I only blue screen when playing PUBG so I believe the game is causing some sort of issue. General lack of polish. Vehicles feel floaty and the physics are incredibly buggy. There are certain parts of the map with clipping or floating objects and I've even gotten stuck at a part in the mexico map. This is a game that sold millions of copies in early access and continues to sell as a normal game. There should not be this lack of polish. It is unfortunate to give this game a thumbs down. There really is a good game here buried under all the chinese players. Fun in this game can poke through occasionally but getting to that point can sometimes be a night of rolling the dice and hoping for the best. Perhaps the best way to play this game is to do so sparingly maybe logging on once every few days. Also
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is very poorly optimized (See Same engine fortnite i get 350 frames fortnite in action and between 70 140 PUBG and thats all ultra in fortnite and medium high in pubg)This game like most FPS's suffers from cheating. Its pretty rampant as well. A decent killcam would help with deciding to report or not.The actual coding of the game is garbage and if you think 64 tick in cs is what makes the game welcome to half that or less in pubg servers... They should rename to Looting Simulator 2017.There is no skill to the spray patterns you literally pull straight down and its a laser.The most game breaking part for me is that even when you chicken dinner it doesn't feel good. It just feels like a loss..."well on to the next round"...as well as knowing its entirely RNG as to why you won (loot circles random better positioning due to circles)

review: The game has far too unpredictable of a damage system. It may seem to take you 3 shots to kill someone with a sniper yet they can 1 hit you with a ump. The system is far too clunky and Im not even a competitive player. Also when you first get the game yeah its kinda fun however after a good amount of matches it becomes the most enraging experience ever. Too many tryhards play this and will beat you in every firefight. Loot crates cost money..... why does EA get so much about this and not Bluehole? The optimization is awful I have a decent PC that runs most games very well however I play this only to see that I cant enter buildings because they haven't loaded. ALSO if you have a mid to low end pc do not buy as you cannot handle firefights. If an enemy shoots you there is no time to react as the game WILL stutter and freeze because of the weapon sounds playing. Honestly there are so many better games don't waste your money on this one.

review: I knew I wasn't gonna like this game a whole lot when I purchased it but of these looting based arena's that I've played this is the one I like the least. I found The Culling to be a much more entertaining game.The combat is very centered around guns and even more specifically sniping each other. Melee weapons shotguns etc are *almost* completely useless after the first 10 minutes of a match. The fights are very CoD/BF/CS like where 1 3 bullets and you die I've never liked these types of shooters. Then the map in PUBG is so ridiculously large it is the biggest running simulator I've ever played. The field's center is random. It could be on the very edge of the map even and the death field will close in an ellipses. If you enter the match on the opposite side the field's center which you have no idea where it is when you choose a spawn location and you can't find a vehicle you could spend the entire time fleeing the death wall.Most matches of PUBG either have you drop into a populated area where you rush to find the best weapon you can and have a fun fire fight utilizing different weapons of the game to keep surviving or no one shows up at your site so you spend the next 10 15 minutes looting and running to center or looking for other players to kill. Eventually you may find another player or group where you may gun them down from 200 yards away or you will just get sniped yourself wasting all the time you spent getting gear that never really mattered anyway.I'll most likely keep playing this game with friends only. I'm told I could earn my $30 back if I sell the crates in game but after 14.4 hours I've made $1.80 back. Meaning I may have to put 240 hours into this game to do so.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Already the best of the Battle Royale standalone games. Needs work in optimization and bug fixes but the groundwork is here for a really wonderful and intense online battle royale game. It is easy to learn and get into but tough to master sort of inbetween the silly arcadeyness of h1z1 and the seriousness of ARMA3 but with many of the main elements already nailed.Pick it up now to enjoy some fun or wait until the optimization updates come out so far I am impressed though I hated H1Z1 and The Culling but enjoyed the Battle Royale mod for the arma games and I must say this game is nice surprise so far. Keep up the good work devs I look forward to updates to optimization and also mod support.**100 Hours later and I love the game even more grab a friend or two and get ready for some intense Battle Royale gameplay*****240 hours later and I am still addicted wonderful game good updates.. can't wait for the Vaulting/Climbing and some new maps to come*******370 hours later on the game and I am loving it even more than ever thanks to the 1.0 update the game now runs better has a new awesome map and some fantastic vaulting/climbing that has been added. If they can get the hacking under control this game will continue to thrive****

BAM! hackers shoot you in the face second game you play blue hole almost actively encourage such behaviour with their pathetic excuse of a ban / report system. Third game will be a land in no render and massive FPS drop although you're running a pc with massive spec in comparison to the games requirements . Fourth game you realise other players shoot the same guns faster then you with higher DPS yep that would be the FPS dependant limitations on fire rate just another bug actively preventing by all other game developers . You're their test hamster for a poorly produced game but you should definitely pay for micro transactions to unlock the challenges you already completed. 1/10 wouldnt recomend however ill continue to play and consider alternative methods of destroying brain cells until i find one more appropriate.
