review: Hard to recommend in its current state. Not only is the game hard to run for (most) people including my friends I also hear that all it takes to get banned is for someone to cuss or honk a car horn at a streamer. Right. Everything is so damn censored now a days to the point where you can't have any fun since someone will claim to feel offened and emotionally scarred. Gameplay wise its a shame that low graphics settings give such a huge advantage. The looting system lags and I feel that the hitboxes are a bit off. Oh I know why. ChInEsE pLaYeRs. Please region lock them. They account for 99% of the cheating in this games as stated by the man who created it and cause the lag in the game. Id rate the game a 6/10. Beyond these things it is a fun game to play with friends. I had said that I hoped some of these things improved upon version one release and they still have not been fixed.

review: Seriously this game is terrible i have put 200+ hours into this game and i honestly dont why because it is terrible. The starting lag means that you cannot pick up weapons and are just having to wait a minute before you can move around properly. The close quarters combat is the worst ive ever seen it always comes down to who has the worst connection you will get angry as you die over and over again to people teleporting all over the place. If you are in EU forget enjoying yourself and having fun everyone who plays it is a sweat and is just boring to play. To do well in this game you must be concentrating the whole time and if you have a lapse in concentration you will die by some stupid means. Furthermore it seems to me that as they add more content the game gets worse and deteriorates. The game is nothing more than a fad and as soon as another battle royale comes out that is stable and doesnt have such shocking connection issues this game will go out of style. Trust me it is not worth 27 and in my opinion it isnt even worth 15.

review: 1. Buggy (You can be driving &amp hit an invisible texture &amp die from impact. Vault out of a window or over a wall get stuck &amp die. Parachute will hang on a building/tree &amp drop you 5 stories...)2. D sync (It's the worst issue in the game. You will die hundreds of times to players that do not have line of sight on you.)3. Performance issues 4. Poor Development (They keep releasing more cosmetics weapons &amp maps (very slowly) instead of bug and network code fixes.)The game at this point just feels like a cash grab. It's full of useless cosmetics that are obtainable through in game loot boxes or the Steam Community Marketplace. Some of those loot boxes have to be opened by keys purchased via steam.I can not justify suggesting anyone to pay full price for this game. Much less pay for it at all. It's an unfinished game and requires quite a bit of work that just is not being done or is not being prioritised.

review: Game is OKThis type of Arena Last Man Standing Thing always works for me.Got killed by hackers the last 3 Matches deathcam is proving it. Huge problem in the game!Edit As most hackers join EU servers from China a region lock would be much appreciated but isn't brought into the game by the developing team. Edit 2 New Reasons New 1. My favourite dying procedure is having my game crashed while my team is expecting a fight and my charakter keeps running towards the enemyNew 2. After the Anti Cheat Enhancement Update we couldn't connect to the game servers. At least we didn't join a game with a hackerAs this game has kind of an e sport potential there are some things that I'd warn new players about 1. The round outcome is kind of luck based because of the huge advantage the loot quality provides. Now don't get me wrong. Variance in loot is important but because it's kind of randomized you can be the best player and loose the round to some noob. My recommendation ( brendangreene PUBGCorporation) would be some balancing. Let me set an example From 1 to 3 (in armour levels) the "tankyness" gets higher (as it is right now) but also from 1 to 3 (in armour levels again) you get more stiff /inflexible and slower. You'd need to go with what u got use (or be forced to use) different playstiles depending on your armour level. 2. The game is buggy as hell.It is seriously not great.3. The vehicle handling is literal aids. 4. The weapon handling is . Let me explain it the best i can I originally played battlegrounds in Arma 3. Arma 3 has excellent "clean" weapon handling. Things that are wrong with pupg 4.1 Bullet drop is badly portrayed4.2 Bullet travel time is badly portrayed4.3 Weapon recoil is badly portrayed. Example The AKM the time it takes to get from normal (before a shot) to normal (after a shot) is too long. Your charakter will basically balance the recoil out too slow slowmo alike
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 0/10.Cheaters everywhere.Devs don't care see how fix PUBG turned out and how every update breaks the game more and more.Gameplay is clunky and counterintuitive.Gunplay is laughably bade. See aimpunch for example.Play tactical and slow for 30 minutes get 1 tapped by a corner camper with a shotgun. 30 mins of your life you're never getting back and you never even enjoyed.122 hours in the game 1 solo win and 3 duo wins that's it. Made it to #2 maybe 30% of all my matches. I guess I suck but it's just not fun.Lag and desync galore.Don't buy it. Every negative review is correct. I'm not jumping onto the hate bandwagon. I gave this game a chance and it did nothing but make me despise Bluehole and Playerunknown. This game is becoming more and more irrelevant as other titles like COD are taking their idea and making it better. PUBG will never progress. It's entire lifespan is proof. COD got it right in the first try. PUBG still ing sucks after more than a year of being a wildly popular game. Goodbye PUBG. I'm finally uninstalling you.

review: Hahaha. This game is a ing joke.TL DR The devs are a joke. They are suing another company instead of fixing their ing game that should have been fixed prior to leaving Early Access. So I've played a moderate amount. And I've tried my best to support this game but the game is messed up.So many games are broken nowadays but PUBG took it one step further. They released crates/micro transactions DURING EARLY ACCESS. I disagreed with this move but ey so what. It didn't affect the playability of the game.But then...They released out of early access with a game that ran just about as good as a dog without legs. Seriously PUBG Cooporation? You released an unfinished Early Access game with two maps and a ton of game breaking bugs?But so what? I continued playing and trying to enjoy the game as much as I could. But week after week and the game made no progress.How on earth could a company that has made millions of sales for a game as expensive as PUBG possible not have the budget to hire more devs to get this game done faster? 2 man indie studios release updates faster!!! Well they're also making a new game and Bluehole are no longer the main devs for PUBG. Great less dedication.But then recently still few updates but a new map is coming! Yay! Erm the test servers and experimental servers still have the same bugs in them that the main game does.Then one lovely day I wake up to a BBC article about how the PUBG Developers are trying to sue Epic Games for making another battle royale? Don't get me wrong I dislike Fortnite as it just isn't my type of game but damn they're trying to sue them just because they are making a better game?Holy though. If you actually read the court case it is pathetic. They claim that a ing frying pan is iconic to PUBG. then. My mum can't cook food anymore and will have to stick to pots from now on instead. She might get ing sued.But yeah I keep trying to tell myself PUBG will get better but it simply hasn't. The game was most likely developed solely on the Unreal Blueprint system which would explain why it ran so poorly during early access.I'll probably keep playing it because I must be some sort of masochist or something. I just cannot honestly recommend that people buy this game as it isn't worth it and it should never have left Steam Early Access.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: THIS IS THE BEST GAME EVER

review: Fun at first though that fun feels eternal believe me you will get bored and you will never touch this game after 50 ish hours. 50 Hours is good playtime and the game is addicting in first 20 hours but it gets boring after 30 hours tbh. The only reason I played this game for 90 hours is because I have a friend who is addicted to this game and he is a fanatic. I only play with him when we are out of games to play. As for the review Graphics are not bad. Could be better though. Animations are really clunky and bad. Shooting feels good and weapon recoil is well balanced but shooting someone doesn't make you feel as good as other fps' do. Overall It's a good game to play with your friends but its difficult to completely love this game and enjoy every aspect of it. I would give it 7/10.

review: Gave up after 300 hours. I don't feel any improvements in terms of game mechanics nor performance. Performancei7 7800k + GTX 1080 Ti + 32 Gb DDR4 + Samsung SSD 500 Gb is only good to play on lowest settings. GraphicsThis hurts my eyes. Devs added sharpness setting but still it's quite hard to distinguish enemy from the bushes. My eyes hurt pretty bad after 30 minutes of playing. Although I have no such spotting issues in other shooters.GunfightRecoil.... Just if to compare it with any BF/COD I can easily control recoil of any gun. A gun I have just shots in the direction I pointing to. Good aim good k/d. PUBG just ruins this experience. It feels like your character is not a military guy but a weak junkie with shaking hands.Bugs... Misaligments is a funny thing this just doesn't shoot in the direction you're pointing to because devs are too lazy to test and it gets explored by streamers like WackyJacky.Broken scopes.. Any scope is physically living separate live with image it's showing that is jumping and blacking out the view during shooting... Very convinient... If it's some kind of realism addition then the implementation of it is SoundSound is garbage looks like the game is capable of playing 3 audio files at time that's it. Cars are loud as for no reason just to make hearing issues for players.Server performanceGetting shot behing the cover sync failuers lagging characters lack of proper shot detection.Game mechanicsSuper slow healing/boosting/vaulting/movements/animation of player actions.Way too long waiting time at the beginning. Devs really should have a close look at COD battle royale beta. review: After 180 hours Many kills Many deaths and many many chicken dinners. I can honestly say that this game is This game is not based on skill. Like many multiplayer games in this day and age everything that happens in this game is based on luck. You pick a town if you get lucky you get a decent weapon if you dont you are screwed. Some towns have nothing but shotguns which are worthless for the majority of the game. Then you get the pleasure of trying to make it inside what everyone calls the circle. You may have landed dead smack in the middle or all the way across the map from it. Theres no rhyme or reason to the circle. Its all random. You have to have your head on a swivel if you are going to survive past the first couple circles because people can be hiding behind literally every tree. The second you stop you will get sniped by someone 800 meters away that you cant even see. Or you could get run up on by someone who has been following you for 20 minutes playing it safe. This again is all based on luck. If you are lucky enough to make it to the top 10 you are then going to be forced to either run directly towards your enemy or have your enemyt run towards you with no cover. Basically if the circle chose you congrats you are the chosen one you win. You get to watch the last couple people run directly towards you trying to outrun the blue death that lies at their back. So will you like this game would you be good at this game? The only question you need to answer is can you point and click? if so eventually you will get a win. But more often than not the game will you like its prom night. No amount of skill will guarentee you a win in this game. Ive got a bunch of wins but the truth is they mean nothing. They were all because of luck.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: There are a lot of reviews giving this game quite a few of negatives and honestly a couple are deserved. There is a major problem with hackers and cheaters ruining games and the loot boxes aren't that fruitful usually. Prior to the vaulting update mobility can be challenged by a simple fence reaching up to your knees.With those out of the way I can honestly say this game is 100% a fantastic choice for anyone looking for great team based game play that has a focus not just on run and gun quake style killing but really making tactical choices. That is the key that separates this game so distinctly from other Battle Royal style games like FN. More on FN later. The weapon attachments vehicle choices movement (crawl for safety rush to the zone or loot more and risk taking damage?) and distinct style of each gun really lets you set up for certain styles of game play. I'm the mid low range guy in our group that prefers shorter range combat like shotguns for instance. The que in this game is nonexistent. It's amazing how fast you'll get pulled into a game full team or solo. It almost trivializes death "Oh I got so far only to get plucked by a lucky shot. Ah well." *instant reque*. It goes a lot to reduce frustration when you can just jump from one game to another while at the same time keeping the game intense when scrapping for gear or getting to that final circle. As far as Fortnite goes I hear the two games compared quite a bit and every time always have to bring up the fact that game modes do not mean game styles. FN completely lacks the tactical edge and accuracy of PUBG your guns don't have nearly the level of customization you have to deal with quality of loot and your accuracy with most guns is fairly poor. Use of cover is discouraged in a lot of places because most all cover is destructible . You can build cover and walkways and such in that game adding a very interesting aspect that PUBG lacks but doesn't do much to change how the game is played in a much more run and gun fashion. Overall I would suggest this game to people who are looking for quick intense games that don't require a permanent investment. You won't find any levels bonuses or any gimmicks like that here. Team play gives so much more of a fun experience as well.Hope this review helped!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I am saying I recommend this game becuase there is no 50/50 option PUBG is a fun Battle Royale game that can prove quite the challenge to new comers in the shooting genre!I do have fun playing the game the challenge of going against 100 odd other players each match to see who canemerge victorious is quite enticing and the major variety of weapons offered in the game is quite the treat.This is most definitely not a game for the casual player!Pros Good variety of guns Big challenge and test of skill Very fun to play with friends Strategy is a fun aspect of this gameCons Not very optimized People who are coming from Fortnite to play this game need to have a clear head I think. The games to have massive similarities but they also have massive differences too. The shooting mechanic and gameplay is different The buildingmechanic adds a whole new layer to Fortnite strategy wise but the military aspect PUBG brings a different feel. Fortnite definitely is a lot easier than PUBG but does not make it a lesser game. I suggest if you are going to play this game for the first time see if one of your friends have it and team up with them.The steep learning curve of the game can prove difficult for newcomers and can put people off the game easily. Teamworkis also one of the best parts of this game.The game is very awkward to run and I sometimes have issues with it with my GTX 1080 Ryzen 7 1700 and 16GB DDR4 3000MHZ RAM. It can be off putting but you do sometimes get a good night in where it doesnt bother you.This game is very enjoyable for the hardened player if you like strategy or multiplayer games its a must!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: There are a lot of people giving mixed reviews about this game. Most have invested over 100 hours into this game and enjoyed a good amount of that time. If they didn't why would they keep coming back? If you're looking at this game with no knowledge of it don't buy it on a whim. Watch a few matches on Youtube. You'll get a good grasp of how it works in under an hour.If you know what this game has to offer then think to yourself will I play this more than once? Will I play it for 30 hours? More?I've played 150 hours at the time of this review for a game that cost $29.99.I believe that is around $0.20 an hour. Was it worth that price? Absolutely. Would I buy it again knowing what the game is like? Yes. Is it the best game ever? No. Did I get my money's worth in entertainment? Absolutely. If you buy this game after seeing what is in it you'll probably enjoy it. Ignore the haters. It's fun.

review: Amazing game! When I first got this (During the Steam Summer Sale) I did not play all too much but after coming back to it I've gotten better at the game and got some friends who I can play it with. The game is purely fun if you enjoy intense moments and down right hilarious glitches/moments which happen throughout the time you play the game in the Early Access stage.Only problem I've found was that a few of my friends who have older builds (GTX760 and a 960M) have trouble loading in quickly but if they are in the server but haven't loaded in then they will load in by the time they hit the ground usually.Edit (10/25) After looking over the current reviews I will add this section of the review to state some more stuff 1. Hackers The hackers in this game are horrible. (They can shoot through walls go fast like sonic shoot you in the head from 4+ kilometres away etc.) They seem to not be being dealt with but the real thing is they are but they are able to continue buying the game. (Like in CS GO the hackers do get banned but buy alternate accounts allowing them to hack more and more. Which by the way is not making Valve want to improve VAC so that the games they make are "unhackable".)2. Input Lag The input lag as far as my experience with it is relatively frustrating. The input lag seems to be in the beginning of each game (Warm Up and about ten seconds after hitting the ground.)*Note My internet is 80Mbps download and 10Mbps upload3. Cosmetics They're only purchasable on the COMMUNITY market. The community has items up from other players of the game who achieved the items from playing the game and achieving BP (Battle Points). If you don't like paying for cosmetics then play for them. The only things you can't play for are the outfit sets the twitch prime things and the older items which were taken out of the BP crates.4. Performance Even with my specs (listed in the note below) is either a constant 80fps or less only 100fps+ during menu. The performance needs work but this is still Early Access. If you want to play something that'll give you a constant 240fps+ go play CS GO or wait for further optimization.*Note GPU GTX1060 6GBCPU i5 6400 2.70GHzRAM 8GB DDR4 (I think)5. Servers Need help. More servers which can actually support the 100 players better are needed. Probably more in the non NA servers since I haven't had many problems yet unless the Input lag is that bad.6. Bans The bans are kinda stupid if I base this off of the reviews of others but I've yet to see anyone I know (who has teamkilled even intentionally) been banned. Teamkill bans are from REPORTS posted by players. Not Bluehole watching everything and saying "Oh let's ban him because he shot this guy."After this I hope many misconceptions have been cleared. This game is EARLY ACCESS meaning it may not be as good as a game like CS GO. (Even though Valve isn't doing much with it) The game is fun but tends to not be if you cannot quite understand it. The learning curve took me two months of not playing but afterward the game becomes either very fun or very competitive. Thank you for reading my long review have a good day.

review: Overrated in early release.This game has an awesome concept and it is fun don't get me wrong. However in its current state I can't recommend it. It's buggy laggy and flat out annoying most of the time when you're playing it.When it's functional it's great Yet with bugs like it failing to load the game when you're qued You will be in the game hear the sound hear yourself enter the plane forced out without the option to hit the parachute cause the game hasn't even been able to load yet...then you die because you couldn't open your parachute cause the game wouldn't load on time.Or after you've landed and you're standing in front of a house waiting for it to load so you can go inside and try and find some guns. After 2 3 minutes its still not loaded so you're forced to move on without a means to defend yourself.I've even had laggy experiences where say you'll get hit then the game stutters and and before youre able to even respond from it lagging you're dead.I'm also on a 150 megabit connection so I know my internet isn't the problem.I'm sure with some polish this game could be a lot better but for me personally I thought it was vastly overrated and wish I didn't buy it in early release

review: As of now the game is pretty much unoptimized requiring a higher clocked processor. Core count and GPU don't seem to matter much as I get about the same experience on a GTX950 and a GTX1080 ti.Crashes disconnections being unable to connect party issues launching issues server availability issues. Voice chat working or not randomly.Gameplay glitches here and there. Bad vehicle physics. Bad movement physics.And microtransactions on a early access paid game. That's just shameless. Awful. Incredible.Wait for retail then buy. December 2017 edit They fixed the voice chat issues. I was feeling lots of new stuff and fixed stuff had been incorporated to the game but re reading my old review everything I said before still stands.The game on the so called 'Test Server' now performs at a higher FPS. Anywhere from 90fps to 144fps. It feels smoother too. But at what cost?Well the game just doesn't render stuff until it's on your nose Houses 40 meters away might render with windows or doors closed even if there's somebody shooting at your face from there. Signs boxes etc might just not render so you can see your enemy just lazily standing there on the roof and no matter how hard you try and keep shooting at their head your bullets impact against invisible stuff.Trees keep changing their LOD models every meter you get closer to them going from a 2D sprite to a couple of them to a basic 3d model with some 2d sprites to finally several 3d models of varying complexity.. All that in 3 secs of walking towards any given tree.It looks completely ridiculous. Most building also keep changing texture quality depending if you're 2 meters away 5 6 and a half 8 etc. No need for 37 different LODs please!They've been experimenting with lag compensation and seem to have decided that the player with the lower ping has the truth. So if you have higher ping than your enemy it doesn't matter if you got under cover on your pc if they see that you're still running and shoot you in the head you're dead.If you're ambushing them and the instant you see them you discharge your shotgun in their head you're dead because on their screen they've probably gotten to you and shot you in their face so your shot with 200ms more lag than theirs will not ever register. Oh and also they're adding some lazy attempt at not rendering other players unless the server registers they're on your line of sight.Add the lag compensation and invisible objects issues and you have a complete hot mess of a game where enemies are completely invisible shoot you from nowhere and suddenly pop up or disappear.ESports ready and 1.0 releasing tomorrow.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: For all the hate over the microtransactions off.PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds or PUBG for short is a battle royale online multiplayer game that stretches h1's formula to make it more appealing to new casual and expert audiences. At its core it depends on what mode you play on. There are solos (1 person) duos (2 people) and squads (3 4 people) to allow you to play with friends to get that coveted 'chicken dinner'. Even though there are complaints about the game being too RNG reliant its an amazing move. For instance its an indicator whether you will have a strong start or not it makes you play differently to outlast others (based on what loot you and they have). This aspect keeps the game refreshing and enjoyable and to create memorable moments. If there were definite spawns for guns and other things it would be a constant fight over who gets the spot. This makes up the fact that the map isn't randomized each game but it allows players to create tactics and strategies for different areas. (Other maps are confirmed for the game but no date was specified for release).There has been controversey over the microtransactions that will be implemented or have been (depends on when you see this). People are getting for no reason whatsoever when other games like cs go and dota 2 have similar systems and those items can be really ing expensive. The microtransactions are for the players to show more support for the game and to fund the prize pools for tournaments. This game is one of the top on twitch (at the time of me writing this) for a reason poeple really love watching it. So whats the difference for the pros in a more competitve viewing?

review: Absolutely FULL of cheaters. EDIT IT'S GOTTEN WORSE if that's even possible. At least one in every game. People getting killed with "Punch" while parachuting 1 hit kills seemingly out of nowhere. The Ghost mode hacks are the worst.This would be easy to combat and would work itself out naturally as other online games do if the players steam profile name carried into the game. However the game makes you create a new profile with a new name and DOES NOT REPORT STEAM PROFILES TO THE STEAM SERVERS. Look in the "Recent Players" section to see for yourself.This allows cheaters to wreak havoc with impunity as the average player will only encounter them in passing. The official forums have a "report system" but you basically just open a customer support ticket and have to provide video media. So basically unless you're recording every second of your gameplay you have no way to report other players.The developers have actually openly condoned cheating in their game. They allow shader injectors and "reshade etc" that can be used to remove folaige completely remove any sort of cover making the stealth aspect of the game completely null. This is allowed and has been said as much by the developers themselves. So get Reshade and go nuts. You're actually putting yourself at a massive disadvantage if you don't.tl drDon't buy this game until it runs on official servers or begins tracking Steam profiles. Don't buy it unless you want to run shader injectors to trivialize the stealth aspect of the game. All in all don't buy this game.It's in its current state.

review: Cannot recommend the Game in it's current state.While I understand that this Game is tagged as a Early Access I feel like I have to mention these things because of it's price tag it honestly is just too much money for what's given.Before you ask yes I am aware how many hours I've played this for and yes if you'd look at it with the $/hour it might seem like a good value but honestly a game doesn't have good value if you play it a lot. Most of the time I've played it with friends rather than solo so there goes the value inside aspect.Now what's inside Some Cars(Non Fixable refuelable while being inside the car) Small Amount of Weapons (Expectable but still something to mention) Server Lag Action Lag(Enter Vehicle Pick up stuff etc) Introduction of Skins Optimization issues(like really huge ones the latest patch made it better but still not something to praise) Bugs bugs bugs (Know that glorious feel that you can't move anymore after spotting some people while being right next to them? Gun infinitely reloads in a situation where you might need it? you hit a parked car with slow speed and suddenly you're in the air which will most likely get you killed? Thats just a few examples)All I can say is the game is way better than H1Z1 but it also costs 30 EUR which in my honest opinion is too much I doubt they can expect a lot more money from the Community when the game someday hits the "Game completed" state. They could charge 40 EUR at most when it's done so the initial price tag is way too high in the first place.Sneak Edit Game crashes during actual gameplay are great.

review: Any complaints people have about the game are almost purely external to the game itself. Some community drama with streamers bans and microtransactions. But this is almost entirely unrelated to the gameplay.The premise is a simple Battle Royal 1v99 (Duo/Squads too) deathmatch where you need to scavenge for supplies and weapons while trying to stay alive. You'll die a lot get frustrated get unlucky but what sets this apart is that you'll never waste your time. Everything from the scavenging to the stealth to the combat is gleefully satisfying. And when you die you can immediately queue up in to a new match one in which you'll wait &lt 10 seconds to join.If you like tactical shooters like ARMA and survival games like DAYZ this game has the best of both (Both in gameplay and the fact that the developers of each game are closely related). But the extremely fast turnaround makes games more agressive and exciting. The game is incredibly well made surprisingly well designed and has me coming back for more every day. I've never seen such a stable multiplayer game at such a large scale before. I can count on one hand the number of games that have been ruined by latency or server issues which is an incredibly low figure for a purely online multiplayer shooter.Anyway I'm not great at writing reviews but know that I'm a huge fan of the game. They're incredibly responsive to the community and keep pushing great updates to the game as it progresses out of early access. Definitely a company and game people should be supporting.(Also if you check all these negative reviews still have hundreds of hours. Nobody actually cares about microtransactions they just like to complain. The game is good.)
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan Romano &amp Asiago)Note grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling. In a small mixing bowl add the ricotta and mash with a fork. Add in the 3 cheese blend Cheddar cheese eggs salt and pepper. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth paste like consistency. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough. Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water oil and salt. Mix. Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs water oil and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough. Take the dough out of the mixing bowl shape it into a ball and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic. Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters. With a cookie cutter or upside down water glass cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15 20 dough circles). Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells. Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough. Fill a small bowl with water dip your fingers in and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle. Fold the dough in half over the filling making a half moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a homemade touch as well. Repeat this process for all your dough circles. Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker. Roll the dough into two sheets Place one sheet on the ravioli maker and form the filling cups. Fill with the ravioli mixture. Lay the second sheet of dough on top and roll it out. This will seal in the filling. Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli. Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5 6 minutes or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test. If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time you can freeze the rest Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce grate some fresh cheese over it and enjoy!

review: If you prefer polished nicely running games with a lot of action avoid this!I've been playing two rounds which both took around 30 minutes. In both rounds I was pointlessly walking around searching for stuff and looking for other people. Yes I dropped at abandoned and uninteresting spots. The map is so big it's difficult to even find somebody. So the game has a trick to this it constantly shrinks down the play area. If you go outside you die. So the map becomes smaller and smaller. There is no plausible/realistic reason for this to happen (no fire no tornado...) other than it being a simple game mechanic to make a round end by force.The performance is horrible and as it turns out pretty much nobody plays on Ultra settings since they are unplayable (and NOT looking good at the same time). I'm running an overclocked 1080ti and a Threadripper 1950X but still...I tried High Ultra...framerate was toilet.You need A LOT of time sometimes a lot of luck or at least a lot of knowledge where to find the good stuff. Otherwise this game is downright boring. If you prefer instant quick shooting action with high framerate and better graphics this one here is not for you. Battle Royale? I say walking simulator royale. Typical round?Walking/Looting 23minsSpotting/shooting people or get shot 1 8minLobby/loading times +X Mingame has been refunded btw.Yes there are other people that love it. But it's just not for everybody. Latest AVG Steam rating is only at 63% anyway.

review: Messy unoptimized and unstable client. Crashes you every 30 min exitting a game takes a minute becuase the entire game has to restart (some makeshift fix for memory leaks which are rampant right now). Lots of aimbotters can be expected.Weapons are imbalanced. You will land 5 shots on someone with your AR but then all it takes for you to die with lvl 3 bulletproof vest and lvl 3 helm is one single shotgun blast from 10 meters away (if they have a choke). In contrast landing a headshot on someone with the AWP (the most powerful weapon in the game damage wise) when they have a lvl 3 helmet will not kill them. I would suggest waiting half a year before considering buying this.

review: As you can see I have quite a bit of time invested in this game so it's obvious I enjoy the game even with the game breaking issues. I'm patient and (old) can get past them fairly easily with a flick of my computer's on/off button. The initial idea of the game is good last person / team standing wins Battle Royale in it's latest form. The recent addition to the First Person Perspective (FPP) is smart and welcomed by many. However the game crashes and the moral compass of Bluehole is flawed and has forced me to give this a negative review.* The paid crate system (admittedly my biggest issue) is an awful idea in this game and going back on your word (see lead designers comments at the release of the Early Access (EA) about not introducing a micro transaction system prior to full release) must be held accountable. * Is the game fun? At times it can be a lot of fun but there are still serious flaws that need to get ironed out. I've played many a game in solo duo's and squads where the server completely locks up and everyone has to either exit the game completely or wait for a memory dump error that will eventually kick you back to the main screen. To be fair on this point it's Early Access so these issues are to be expected. Patience is key here... )* There is still the issue of lag (both video and network) that are client related happening. There have been updates that have made this better over the past two months so that's good news.I refuse to recommend a game from any company that continues to try and make money with microtransactions in Early Access. It's morally wrong and we as a community need to stand up to these companies and tell them 'NO'!My recommendation for now is to save your money wait to see the direction Bluehole takes and that all of their game breaking issues are rectified upon full release. The game certainly has promise hopefully their greed doesn't get the better of them (i.e. DayZ &amp Ark).Best regards....
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game has been worth every penny. Hundreds of hours in I feel like I have experienced a little of every major glitch. And I keep coming back for more. Updates are regular content is good. Would like to see more optimization as it runs very CPU heavy. Best enjoyed with friends.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: What a disappointment.Downloaded the game hyped as can be me being a huge fan of battle royale games. I was very quickly disappointed.There was no support whatsoever for my 21 9 resolution monitor. The previous fix that people were using was now purposely removed by the developers. Now anyone with an ultrawide monitor is forced to play with extremely zoomed in nausiating and unplayable fov. The field of view is also cut off on the top and bottom. This is just completely unacceptable if they can't develop another fix then don't completely remove the current fix. You're screwing over a portion of your community because you are too lazy to make a better fix to replace the old one with some considered op.Well let me tell you this how come ultrawide monitors are a pay to win advantage that shouldn't be allowed? Then shouldn't we restrict the game to 480p with 30fps and very low settings? Because otherwise an advantage would be given to people with faster computers! That would be awful now wouldn't it! You might be thinking "Why don't you just suck it up and play it with black bars on the side until they make a better fix?"Yeah that would be pretty neat if it were possible. Instead the game just stretches itself out with the whole thing being completely distorted making it horrendous to look at.The developers are currently sending the message to their community that they are fully willing to screw a decent amount of them if it means less work. Stop being lazy and fix your game. Until then I have refunded the game and won't buy it until a fix comes. For all of you who are on the fence don't buy this game. If this can happen to the ultrawide community it can happen to anyone else. Don't risk wasting your money because the developers want to save their time.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: on 30/05/2017 I was game banned after playing player unknown battlegrounds for the best part of 1.4 hours I found my self wishing I never bought this game so hating ths game and finding myself in dispair me and my best friend/bro decided this game was not worth 30euros so as a joint decision the game was refunded.Shortly after the refund was deposited in my steam wallet I got a message informing me of my ban but not giving a reason for it.I then contacted the game's dev team and got this message back."Your character is not banned in our own system. Sadly Customer Support is not able to lift a ban through Steam.This is not the first time this sort of thing has happenedI just hope they fix this even if steam state they can not remove false game bans.Just thought you guys should be aware of this.

review: Decent game but it's lacking a few simple and easy parts. The game is missing quality it's built good and graphics are good but there needs to be more variety. More custom games and also make it more accessible to the average gamer not just "famous streamers" nobody likes them and let's be honest they don't pay your wages to develop games. It's the general public. Make the servers good nothing worse than a decent game that lags constantly. Make the guns more realistic.... If a pistol and assault rifle battle the assault rifle will always win being able to cause more damage.... Restrict shotguns. Make healing harder and also punish people that stay outside the zone. Punish people that camp. If they stop moving for more that 30 seconds make it so they make to more. Even make it so people can view where they are. Camping isn't good for this game. Listen to average gamers for ideas and possible new features. Also this isn't E Sports ready it never will be so stop dreaming. Make rounds different.... Different modes eg smaller zones faster zones restrict parachute flight and movement keeps people closer together. Also rank/skill matching. When matchmaking only add people with the same skill base together. So new people have a chance to win or get to know the game. Also this means the "pro" players can only play against other wanna be pro players. Make the maps more fun and where you can change certain things in the map that can effect how the game will play out. Loads of ideas but none of you lot read these or would ever take note. Shame really that's why I'll give this a low score4/10 And a No from me .
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Heres a list of things wrong with this game. 1) textures dont always load you can parachute in and none of the buildings will be able to be entered for anywhere between 30 secs and 2 minutes.. giving your enemey a 2 minute head start to find a weapon and kill you before you even get a chance to play the game. 2) bullet damage is inconsistent 3) loot seems to spawn sporadically 4)cars offer no source of extra "armor" if they start shooting as your driving by you have a better chance of jumping out and running to survive. 5) their point system is .. you can earn 200 points if you come in 3rd place... or 22nd and theyre worthless. BP is used to buy yourself new loot crates for items to customze your character starting at 700 for the first 1400 for the second 2800 for the 3rd... so on and so forth. However you can get "white combat pants" in the 700 hundred or you can also get... can you guess? "WHITE COMBAT PANTS" IN THE 5600. There doesnt seem to be any level of accomplishment for spending MORE points and is completely unrewarding.6) your body can get stuck in buildings. 7) servers lag pretty heavy 8) whole game is somewhat glitchy 9)pretty much required to play on low settings for poor optimization. BUT OUT OF ALL OF THIS MY BIGGEST COMPLAINT IS.... YOU SOLD 1 MILLION COPIES AT 30.00 A PIECE AND STILL HAVENT FIXED YOUR "MEMORY LEAK" AND "TEXTURE NOT LOADING" ISSUES.... THE DEV TEAM EVEN ACKNOWLEDGED THEY KNEW ABOUT THIS ISSUE BUT CHOSE NOT TO FIX IT RIGHT NOW.... WHAT THE . This is the BIGGEST Issue with this game i cant play more than 4 matches without the game leaking memory not loading textures and crashing my computer.DONT BUY THIS GAME UNTIL ITS BEEN OUT FOR A QUITE A BIT LONGER THEY CLEARLY DONT CARE ABOUT THEIR PRODUCT.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Wait for full release.. The developers are steadily smashing this game face first into the ground. Update after update the game gets more and more unstable.This game is nothing more than an unstable laggy micro transaction simulator designed to keep Gaben in 4XL pants and Bluehole in gold pated diamond encrusted mansions....As of 10/09/2017 the servers are laggy beyond belief and the development is going backwards. The game started as a reasonably playable title with a brilliant concept it has evolved into something less playable and less enjoyable than DayZ and is getting worse at an amazing rate.21/09/2017 more often than not the servers are offline or lagging so badly the game is unplayable...Developers have carved a tidy some of money out of the game and now seem to have abandoned server stability altogether. I have seriously had to check as to whether Dean Hall has taken over at Bluehole...22/12/2017 Earlier in my running review for this steaming abortion of a cash hole I stated that potential players should wait for full release.... Well in this case I am more than happy to admit I was wrong. The game has come out of Early Access and has crashed and burned dreadfully. The servers are still a complete joke with the first 5 minutes of your game experience being filled with rubber banding (Every single match might I add). This "game" was rushed out of Early Access in a shameless attempt to coeerce mummy and daddy into buying it for their future toxic online gamer. It is very VERY obvious that PC players were used purely as a testing ground for the Console market so Bluehole could get down to doing exactly what they were planning all along pandering to the PS4/Xbox One market so they could sell copies of the game for 79.99/99.99 instead of the 'measely' 29.99 they are tearing out of your wallet for this half baked half finished dog The developers have once again gone for the business model of jamming crappy content nobody asked for down your throat instead of fixing the content they already had. Do yourself your wallet and your sanity a favour and buy something else.

review: After playing this game for 400 hours I've decided to leave a negative review. Two months ago my review would have been abundantly positive over the top positive but that was before I was faced with the myriad of issues that seem as if they'll never be acknowledged by the dev team.The lag the desync the netcode the low tickrate the client side hit registration the early game lag the vehicle physics the lack of transparency between devs and players my list could go on and on but if you've played the game you know all about it.I've given up on this game until MAJOR thorough changes are made to the core of the game itself. I won't return until I'm able to land on a gun pick it up instantly shoot at someone in front of me and kill them with no lag no stuttering no clunky looting no disappearing shots no desync no dying to my opponent that I killed on my screen. I refuse to subject myself to the rage that this game causes me to feel. In the meantime though I'll be playing Fortnite's battle royale. I won't be returning until PUBG runs as smoothly as Fortnite.See you all in a year or two most likely.

Word of caution this game is beginning to be overrun with people using alternative means and additional software to gain an unfair advantage however such talk can cause a ban so I will leave it at that. The frequent updates make for a promising future however. Not recommending for now until a better stance on exploitation management is taken by the developers.

review: Lot's of children here complaining about this game. Don't listen to them PUBG is a wonderfull game wich I will be going to spend a LOT more hours into than I've already done.Review PUBG is a thrilling and exciting battle royale shooter with some serious good mechanics. I've played this game since the first time you could buy it and I still really enjoy playing it casually or just hardcore sometimes. It's awesome playing with friends and even though solo play feels a bit lonely it's still incredibly competetive and fun.PRO'S 60+FPS is the most wonderfull feeling when playing this game wich can now be done even with a GTX 970. Bullet drops is f*ck*ng awesome and feels really realistic. You can honk in your car buggy truck or motorcycle this is a serious +. Vaulting over objects make for fast and smooth gameplay. It's cheap compared to the amount of fun I am getting out of it (30 euros!). The reward system is really awesome and there is NO pay to win aspect. You can actually earn some serious cash playing this game and selling the items you win in game (I've made 114 euros so far). Buy this game! It's good.CONS There's still some bugs here and there nothing major and long lasting. Usually this only happens at the start. Motorcycles are 100x more dangerous than in real life avoid these at all costs or be prepared to die.Again buy this game if you want to have some serious fun. I r8 this game 8/8 m8. If you do happen to buy this game and encounter me in game be prepared to battle because I am starving and I'd like myself some chicken dinner.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game is basically much fun IF it wouldnt crash all the time. Sure it's an early access game and bugs or bad performance is expected but every 3rd round my game crashes. I managed to get around 60fps steady with lower graphic settings but i still have alot of mini freezes while playing which is also annoying.I would not recommend to buy this game right now for this price. In my opinion and I am a game developer myself this is a way too high charge for such a bad performance. I would be ok if there would occur 1 crash in a week but not 5 a day. Unfortunately I cannot return this game anymore. Please wait until the performance gets better or this is in steam sale wouldn't pay more than 15 .Cheers

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS was a game that I was looking forward to playing for a while and when it went on sale I immediatly picked it up. I almost regretted this decision when I started playing the game as I had trouble finding games and also experienced some nasty FPS drops. However today the game seems to work fine for me and I am enjoying the game so much!. I was able to get into quite a lot of games today and when I died I immediatly got put into another game when I searched again. Suprisingly I was able to run the game at Ultra settings at 60+ something I doubted my 970 could handle due to the game's poor optimization. This made the experience far more enjoyable and I'm now loving the game a lot more than I thought I would.Gameplay wise this is quite similar to Fortnite 100 players in one huge map all compete to be the last man or woman standing. The concepts are quite similar except in PUBG it's more grounded to reality and you can't build massive forts and crazy stuff like that. You can chose to go it alone in Solo or witha buddy in Duos and with a Squad of four if you want this allows for some really fun games when playing in a squad with friends. The game may take some practise to get good at as it took me about 2 hours to get my first kill in the game but boy when you do get that kill it really does feel satisfying. So far I have not played with any hackers and I really hope it stays this way as I've had a blast with the game.Graphics are nice and while a lot of people may experience huge FPS drops I don't seem to get any when I play. The visual quality of the game looks really realistic and stunning even the inside of the buildings look so real. It gives you a real sense of immersion in the game. One major problem is that the graphics take about 10 seconds or so to render once I enter a building so it can't be quite fustrating when trying to hide from enemies. If you're getting bad FPS drops I suggest playing on low yes it may look hideous but at least you should be able to get 50+ fps on this.In conclusion I really do recommend PUBG only when it's on sale as paying full price is risky if the game doesn't preform well. My advice is if you want to buy this do lots of research and watch Youtube benchmarks of the game on your system to see how it runs as one person may get really good FPS while another may get terrible FPS. Don't immediatly get this game without doing some research first as you may almost end up refunding it (like I almost did). This game has a lot of great things however it still has a lot of problems that need addressing like server issues bugs etc and I believe in due time the developers will pull their together and dedicate time to polishing the game rather than attempting to sue Fortnite.Overall rating 7.5/10 Good.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: People are acting like this game is the pinnacle of perfection. It maybe the best of its type but there aren't very many battle royale games to begin with so that isn't a good point. Being bad but the best of something doesn't mean it is good. It just means it is the best choice out of a small pool of bad choices. The game does have the potential to be a lot of fun if the developers stop making questionable decisions in regards to both game additions and keeping promises.People are more upset by the fact that the developers lied than the fact that the crates exist as they were always going to be a thing when the game actually launched out of early access. They are very inconsistent about exactly how much is going to charity and the tournament fund. Regardless of them having more than enough to fund both themselves.Only a portion of the profits from the crates are going to charity and the tournament if you bother to read the text. They don't say how big that portion is and every sale of an item or crate on the Steam Market gives them even more money.From the in game text when you choose to open a crate "Partial proceeds of key sales go to charities and Gamescom prize pool."The announcement made it sound like 100% of the profits were going to those and many of the people defending their actions still seem to think so. People seem to not understand it's not the existence of micro transactions but that they outright lied to everyone.I don't even understand how they are going to have a serious tournament when the game has random loot drops plane trajectory vehicle spawns plane crate drops circle location etc. Competitive games need to have more consistency between teams to be taken seriously. The game also suffers from server lag and various other issues. Hosting a tournament for an early access game with RNG on top of RNG on top of RNG is baffling.People need to stop defending shady business practices just because they like the game. I am glad you like it but that doesn't change the facts. With the amount of money they are making off this game they need to invest in more staff so the game can actually be made properly. The game still has a lot of game play issues and it is debatable if they are good enough developers to actually provide the product everyone wants.Accepting the fact that they just outright lie to their customers is a dangerous thing and sends a message to them and other developers that people will just willingly deal with it. People supporting or defending this action in any way are setting a dangerous precedent for the future of what customers will stand for.The industry is terrible about releasing broken games that aren't ready for release day one dlc and season passes no patches after release (NieR Automata Deadly Premonition Dark Souls) tons of unfinished early access games etc. Gaming maybe more popular and accepted in culture than it used to be but it isn't in a good state so people should at least attempt to make a stand against developers that don't keep their word when the game has already made a ton of money and hasn't even released on consoles yet.While I don't think this whole micro transaction controversy should be a complete deal breaker I also don't think it should just be brushed aside and actually defended by some people because they are so blinded by the state of the gaming industry or so enamored with the game. Nearing closer to the actual 1.0 release the game still has many issues it needs to fix.

review: When will this game be playable by people who spent 400$ on graphics cards this year that arent Nvidia? The fact that 5 months into 2018 i still drop to 20 30 fps every time a SINGLE person comes around a corner is just getting ridiculous and im pretty much done with this game until its playable. My 6 year old lap top with a 770 Nvidia card gets nearly exactly the same fps. All the while i run every other game on ultra which my lap top cannot. I would call the optimization in this game sad but that would imply it has any kind of optimization. It doesnt. Dont buy this game unless u have a 10 series Nvidia card and even then u can expect major fps drops when it actually matters (whenever u see anybody)

review: Adding microtransactions is a scummy tactic to capitalize on your games popularity. Yes the crate is for tournament funding but it is also important to note that this game is wildly successful. They have no shortage of funds as is. they don't need your money they want it. It is also important to remeber that there is no gurantee that all of the proceeds earned are going towards the pot. They could take a cut for themselves. There is no doubt in my mind that this was just a cash grab done to bank on the games sudden boom.Even with the scumminess of microtransactions as a concept aside there is actually still a bigger elephant in the room. That elephant being the promise that no microtransactions would be in the game. That statement has not only since become a boldface lie but one that the developers have turned on at the drop of a hat. Worst off it's a lie the developers are allowed to get away with. Early access is a cancer that gives devs permission to lie to their consumers. There comes a point where you have to ask yourself "If they lied about this what else have they said are lies?" There is no gurantee the game will come out of early access at all. None of Brendan "playerunknown" Greene's other projects have made it out of early access. They could continue lying to you until the game is irrelevant if they wanted to. Is that the sort of experience you want?Take the safe option. Give it a few months. See how the game actually comes to develop.

review: Do you enjoy equiping your armor twice? Do you enjoy playing a solo game only to form an alliance? Have you ever wanted to be in a car crash head on only to realize your Jeep does not stand a chance against a tiny motorcycle? Do you think you are capable to learn Mandarin Chinese on the pre flight? Have you ever wanted to be shot in the face by 8 crossbow arrows before you're ready to enter the battle? When you were a child did you ever want to attach a bungie cord around your chest to run forward so you can get flung backwards? Did you ever imagine you could be part of an elite four man tactical squad going Mano a Mano against another elite tactical group only to be downed around your team while a little angry kid disbands his squad to kamikaze kill you so you can spectate the rest of the game? Are you the kinda guy who thinks shotguns have a farther kill range than a rifle? This is the game for you buckle up sit down and enjoy hours upon hours of RPG style looting. The map is full of beautilful scenery that you will have extensive time to view while you are running from on side of the island to the other but don't forget to stop and smell the roses! If cruising around is more your style don't worry we have the perfect vehicles for you. Except when you get closer to the vehicle and enter it only to realize the tires have been shot out but hey just remember the beautiful landscape. Erangel is home to two different types of trees Plenty of wheat fields its very own nuclear power station polluting the crisp air you breathe as you make your way into one of our many unpopulated towns or cities. But don't worry people are around and you will be surprised where you can find them! Make your way to the school that has no sports team or maybe you want to hang out at a prison all the kids love playing in the dangerous quarry or for some reason you would rather spend your time at a city that is half under water. Whether you love getting the end game gear within the first fifteen minutes just so you can support the guy who kills you from his camp he set up in the mountains for the rest of the game or you like going in hot and fast playing 5 games in 20 minutes because some found a shotgun before you it's always a good time no matter what you do! So grab a friend so he can blame you for not supporting him overclock that CPU to get 4 more FPS and remember if you kill a streamer enjoy the stream sniping ban!

review: I do not reccomend this game because it is not fun nor is it a good game. You do not get better over time nor is there a way to figure out any mechanics. I.E refine your sensitivity. This game is fun to watch but overall it is a total dissapointment. You will end up playing enough games a week to get your wanderer crate then not play any more. If you like tedious chores purchase this game. If you like inconsistencies such as RNG with weapon spawns and map placement feel free to purchase. If you like a compete inability to customize the controls once again purchase this game. If you want people to tell you to "get good" write a review like this. The fact is like most games in this time there are people who play 1 game non stop and understand the mechanics better than any causal player. This game is that to the extreme. You will have good times if you purchase this game but they will not last long. Just keep that in mind when you go to buy because you will have more hours of dissapointment than excitement.

review: Cons Insanely bad optimisation. (i know its in early access dont call me on that but goddamn! I have it on 720 and all very low and i still get max 30fps if no one is around me. The moment someone jumps me or anything remotely action packed happens my frames drop under ******* ground and I die. The last update improved the performace slightly but its still utter bull****) It relies way too much on luck if i told you how many times i landed on the roof of the school got a pistol turned around and got shot by some **** who lucked out and picked up an ak or some ****...you would be shocked. A training ground where we can test the guns and improve aim on some bots or something is missing really badly Every match is the ******* same. You jump down if you are lucky enough you get a weapon maybe a kill. Then you run around the map and loot and die for some dumb *** reason (90% shot by someone i cant ******* see beacuse my graphics are so **** i cant see further than like 60m). Its for some reason insanely hard to win a gun fight (note i am very experienced in fps i have 1600h in tf2 and many more in a lot of other fps games im not saying im really good but i for sure am better than what it looks like when i play this shi*ey game) last time i won i killed one person who was camping in the house and then i got lucky with the last circle and three people died out of the safezone trying to get up the cliff and they lost because GUESS WHAT ?? THEY GOT UNLUCKY!! and that win wasnt even satisfying i felt bad for winning that honestly. most of the time i stop playing the game because i rage quit with the reasons listed above. Just a bunch of dumb I want to say you shouldnt buy this game and i will for now maybe if things change big time it will be worth it but for now i suggest stay the **** away....Oh and the pros...well...uhmm...i guess like one out of 60 times its fun because you get lucky (not satisfying tho).

review: Product received for free. EDIT AT TOP It's pure unfiltered absolute TRASH. don't even bother buying it. Absolutely worthless game. Helpful only in bringing attention to the genre. Avoid at all costs.wanted to edit something at the top. If the question is "is PUBG worth 30 dollars?" the answer is an absolute unequivocal YES. Even if you buy it and hate you can sell your crates for a buck a piece and make your 30 back in a week. That said the development timeline has slowed down there have been several KEY broken promises and it is an objective fact that the game is buggy and unfinished. That's not up for debate. The game is still fun the concept is fresh unique and addicting but objectively...I reiterate..OBJECTIVELY..the game is a unstable unfinished and unpolished so buy at your own risk.fun only due to unique mechanics concept and engine. overall a laggy buggy unstable experience that is poorly optimized and amateurishly executed.worth the 30 dollar price tag and wildly popular but go in knowing you'll be playing a bit of an unfinished unpolished mess

review: Full with racist children squeaking i ntheir headsets.I generally have no problem with fun voicechat talk however the community playing this game seems to solely consist of either people never using microphones or those using it in only a negative attitude.The game is an attraction for young people who believe that shouting the N Word all the time makes them edgy and cool. The typical 14 20 year old gamer for you.But today its all about "Memes" right?On top the game serves no content really. 2 Maps one mode. One Mode means literally one mode.At least you can play this one mode in several ways meaning alone or up to four players in any combination. Meaning you can also go into a match as a duo but play against squads.Which is nice i have to admit however the rewards you gain with doing so stay the same which is just showing the beginning of bad design execution that consists in any other regard.The Blue circle is a generally bad idea and absolutely Un Battle Royale.The original idea and movie used the sectors on the map as a way to kill the contestants which means that specific announced sectors became deathzones.Here it just looks like they searched for a way to keep the pressure up and tried to get people to meet each other and the best they could come up with was this.I could continue with so many things but i leave the bad design bulletpoint like that for now as its flaws just jump into your face the first time you start to play.The graphics are somewhat ok but the game runs so bad that you would wish they were worse so it ran smooth. Which it doesnt.Dont get tricked by people coming off saying "Ah but it runs fine for me no lag (spikes) no stuttering no bugs at all.They are either outright lying or they lack the competence to even make such a statement (meaning they just are unable to see its problems or notice them).However there is not only plenty of evidence that the game is technical garbage (netcode is the worst of any online shooter you could pick right now with a tickrate of 17 we already had vastly more when Counter Strike Source was popular thats about 15 years ago).Even if there was not that much evidence the technical issues regarding lag and fps drops are a well known running gag among the community and the games critics.So much in fact that it feels a bit useless to yet brag again about it.The last issue is the game has tons of downtime. Meaning a lot of time where you do nothing or even waste your time without doing anything.Oh yeah you might spend 20 minutes looting stuff ending up having the best equipment possible and fully modified weapons and yet die instantly through a low tier spread weapon in mid range combat. Probably because yet again the game lags or stutters at the moment where someone comes around the corner.Meaning you worked your way to that point with 20 minutes of doing nothing but opening doors and managing that horrific inventory system to then just die and not even using a weapon.Conclusion The games problems are so much in your face that the game is currently i nthe position of being the best example of what to do and what to not do.What to do is investing into good game ideas as people like these new and fresh ideas as proven by the sheer amount of players.What not to do is to fail at delivering and execution. Running worse like Counter Strike Source while also looking worse than it.The game will shrink in size.Others are already in the line to gather its players who are looking for an alternative to escape the hostage situation that is PUBG. You can avoid it currently when you want to play this gamemode (Battle Royale) but as soon as another competent developer manages to execute it better (which is quite a low bar) these people will forget about their Stockholm Syndrome and just switch.And we havent even started talking about the games worst problems like the amount of cheaters being into it.The fact that they are proud of banning a million people doesnt really speak for them.I predict that there are better ways to do this gamemode better ways to technically deliver it better ways to present it and better ways to make it fun and interesting.At the point where a studio does that the games size will again shrink because of named problems.Not only because its an unfun game not only because they deliver no new content not only because of cheaters.But because all of the easily 2 dozen points that i could use to show its bad sides.And i literally can only find one upside.At this point i unlocked enough lootboxes that i didnt open (because i just dont care for the clothes you get through it) to sell them for enough money to get my money back.Sadly refunds dont work after this playtime.I basically now got the game for free. The only plus i can come up with. Ok well the buggy physics are sometimes funny. Crashing into an invisible wall with a car is super fun.

review: This game is probably the best BR game right now. It's a mix between ARMA and Battlefield. It's a got a lot of great elements however the bad parts overshadow these quite drastically. For example The damage system needs a lot of work. A full shotgun blast to the chest within a few metres whilst wearing level 2 armour won't kill you yet a pistol only needs 3 4 shots to kill you whilst wearing the same armour. Very frustrating. The electricity moves at such a fast pace that you're constantly having to run into the safe zone regardless of if anyone is waiting for you. You've got to be lucky to not run into someone waiting for you. There's no time for flanking or anything tactical so praying is your best option in this regard. There are a lot of lag and random hit registration issues which admittiedly are being patched pretty quickly. If it wasn't for these frustratingly bad things then this would rank above H1Z1 and DayZ. As it is it tries to do both but just not as well yet. Hopefully the damage and electricity is fixed then I'd be up for recommending this to people.Update 19/07/2017 The game is still pretty fun for about 5 minutes despite the dreadful hit registration stupid circles moronic campers and awful bullet sounds it's okay. To expand on my previous points Hit registration I and many others have been hit behind trees and walls due to this. When a bullet should hit it doesn't and when it shouldn't it does. Client side hit reg for you though. Stupid circles The circles are completely random which is fine except for the fact that you can drop somewhere and the circle be over the other side of the map. You can't out run the circles so unless luckily find a car you're ed. Moronic campers People will camp outside of the circle knowing they will die just to kill you. There should be some way to stop this such as not being able to see into the circle or not being able to shoot whilst outside the circle adding another element to strategy. Awful bullet sounds The sounds strive to be realistic but are far from it. It's pretty dumb that they intend this to be realistic yet it's not whatsoever. If you want the game to be realistic then make it realistic but don't make it half way between because it's not working. Have it so that if you're shot whilst aiming you obviously can't aim you can't shoot a gun if you're shot in the arm and can't run if you're shot in the leg. Either all in or all out. As of right now with the amount of cons this game has I wouldn't recommend even if it was free.P.S. At least I've freed up some space on my hard drive.

review: tl dr The game is great but feels like it's not finished its mad fun to play and worth the 30 price but only if you can ignore the issues the game has.THE PROS The game is absolutely terrific to play. The gameplay is something that I really really enjoy the overall mechanics the basic idea and the design of the game really appeal to me. The guns handle great in my opinion if you are a casual player like me it's still an easy task to get used to the sistem. The loot system is also great for this type of game I prefer the random loot over knowing what loot is where sure you can get shafted if you loot a whole house and all you have to show for it is a foregrip and a sickle but that for me is part of the fun.As mentioned before I am not a pro player so my hearth starts to race when I get into a top 5 situation but I am starting to get used to it. Playing with friends is also a blast.THE CONS That said I bought this game when it was in beta like most people it was great fun if a bit of a buggy experience but hey it's an early acess game you know what you are getting yourself into. The updates on the test server were regular and you can see that Playerunknown and Bluehole really care and want this game to be the best there is.And this is why I am so confued over why the hell they already released it. It's not a finished experience. I have two computers one with a GTX 950 and one with a GTX 970. Now the final version of the game is optimised performance wise but looks horrible. Even on the very lowest settings at 1080p it requires just shy of 2GB of video memory. This means that no matter how strong of a card you might have if you have 2GB of video memory you will not be able to set the settings higher than the absolute lowest. And if you do it seems like the game blocks the texture settings and everything looks like its made out of Play Doh. On the 970 it's a bit better the graphics look okay but get beaten by really old games like Battlefield 3 at least in my opinion.That's if you care about graphics which I really don't so lets get to the core problem Bugs and rubber banding. The bugs are mainly present on the title screen it's difficult to get into and leave a game sometimes. But when you do oh man does the early game experience blow. The rubber banding is extreme and it persists for about five minutes five most important minutes in the game if you land in a populated area and this for me is unnaceptable when talking about a finished game. The tickrate is also abysmal but i don't notice it so much so let's say it wont get in your way.In the H3H3 Podcast Brendan said that that there will still be updates after the full version releases so why release it in this state at all? I have high respect for Brendan and Bluehole and wish them all the best but untill they fix these very basic issues (WHICH I KNOW ARE NOT EASY TO FIX) I unfortunately won't be able to recommend this game. That said I very much look forward to the update that will change my review.
