review: If you're looking for a game review you've come to the wrong place. But if youre looking for a fantastic ravioli recipe you've come to the right place.Ingredients To Make the Dough375 grams (3 cups) plain flour1/2 teaspoon salt2 eggs1/4 cup (50 ml / 3½ tablespoons) olive oil1/2 cup (120 ml / 8 tablespoons) waterExtra flour for dusting To Make Cheese Filling15 ounces (425 grams) container Ricotta cheese5 ounces (142 g/about 1/2 cup plus 2 tablespoons) "3 Cheese Italian Blend" (Parmesan Romano &amp Asiago)Note grate these cheeses yourself and create your own custom blend.1/2 cup cheddar cheese2 eggs lightly beaten1/2 teaspoon salt1/2 teaspoon pepper ExtrasYour favorite sauce for the ravioli (i.e. marinara/ marijuana)Parmesan cheeseBasilFried vegetablesShrimpFish slicesChicken pieces Make the Ravioli filling. In a small mixing bowl add the ricotta and mash with a fork. Add in the 3 cheese blend Cheddar cheese eggs salt and pepper. Mix all ingredients thoroughly until you have a smooth paste like consistency. Cover the bowl with plastic wrap and place it in the refrigerator for about 30 minutes. Make the Ravioli dough. Crack eggs into a large mixing bowl and beat them with a fork. Add water oil and salt. Mix. Add 1 cup flour to the bowl. Use a fork to mix the flour with the eggs water oil and salt. Repeat with the rest of the flour. Mix until a smooth dough is formed. Clear and clean off a large work surface and dust it with flour. This is where you are going to roll out your dough. Take the dough out of the mixing bowl shape it into a ball and place it on your work surface. Knead for at least 10 minutes or until it becomes elastic. Dust a rolling pin with flour to prevent the dough from sticking. Roll out the dough until it is about 1/8 inch (1/3 cm) thick or about the thickness of 2 stacked quarters. With a cookie cutter or upside down water glass cut out circles in the dough (will make about 15 20 dough circles). Ball up the unused dough and either roll it out and make a couple more raviolis or wrap it and put in the freezer for another time. Dough can keep for weeks when frozen. Just make sure to wrap well so that it doesn t suffer from freezer burn or absorb freezer odor. Fill the Ravioli shells. Take the ravioli filling out of the refrigerator and place a tablespoon of it in middle of a dough. Fill a small bowl with water dip your fingers in and moisten around the outer edge of the dough circle. Fold the dough in half over the filling making a half moon shape. Be sure all the filling stays inside. Pinch the edges together and then seal the edges of the ravioli with a fork. Make sure to press firmly and go all the way around. This will add a homemade touch as well. Repeat this process for all your dough circles. Dust the finished ravioli with flour to keep them from sticking together. Form the Shells and Fill Using a Ravioli maker. Roll the dough into two sheets Place one sheet on the ravioli maker and form the filling cups. Fill with the ravioli mixture. Lay the second sheet of dough on top and roll it out. This will seal in the filling. Remove and separate the finished raviolis.Cook the Ravioli. Fill a large pot with water and bring to a boil. Place the ravioli in boiling water for 5 6 minutes or until they float. You can also test for doneness by nibbling on the edges to test. If you don't want to make all the ravioli at one time you can freeze the rest Take ravioli out of boiling water with large slotted spoon and place on warmed platesServe it up.Top with your favorite sauce grate some fresh cheese over it and enjoy!

review: Update even later "Frick" this. After large promises about not having microtransactions in Early Access and not adding ridiculous clothing they just announced paid crates with random cosmetics including Japanese Schoolgirl Pink miniskirt lady and I don't even know male kill bill cosplayer?. At this point the game has become full on meme.Servers still suck btw.Update 1.5 months later Server and client performance has been patched multiple times making them a bit more stable. Serious rubber banding and mutliple second delays are far less frequent (but not entirely gone) any kind of close range gun battle still boils down to a coin flip imgur.com though. With sometimes frankly ridiculous results imgur.com .Also whoever decided to put a motorbike that throws you off (and usually kills you) when you tip it over too far in a game with vehicle physics this and broken deserves a special place in hell.We're two months into their advertised six months of Early Access performance still sucks and the list of promised/announced/talked about but not yet implemented features seems to be growing instead of shrinking.Review as posted originally Dev promises weekly patches? Let's see how that turned out Release version Alright so this is a buggy mess of laggy t. But there's a good game underneath it let's hope for some optimisation and better servers.Early Access Week 1 Update Fixed some minor issues I guess. Major problems remain. Pressing the "Play" button is still a gamble with an about 30% chance of getting connected to a server that doesn't rubber band and generally lag like Sometime around here one of the "Daily updates to improve server performance" s the sound system making sounds arbitrarily cut off after a few meters. Doors directly next to you sometimes make a sound sometimes don't footsteps become basically inaudible various sounds (most notably bullet "whizzes" and cracks) disappear completely.Early Access Week 2 Update Literally worse than a "no show". The update was rolled back immediately making a lot of people download two 2.4 GB patches in a row for nothing. Promise of weekly patches officially survived zero weeks.A small update is released to adress the sound issues. Bullet sounds are back footsteps and shots are now basically the same volume and carry for ridiculous distances. Annoyed irl that you sometimes hear your upstairs neighbour walking around? Try being able to tell which floor the guy three houses down the street is on! Great "fix".Early Access Week 3 Update Disables the ability to modify .ini files. Many community fixes for problems ranging from FPS issues over mouse smoothing to FoV adjustments become impossible without offering any alternatives. More like Early Access Week 3 Downgrade.Don't get me wrong. Somewhere under this huge pile of bugs lag and stupid dev decisions is a great game. But I can not recommend it in its current state. It needs some serious optimisation and polishing to be considered anything more than "barely playable". In fact the Week 3 "Update" brought it over the edge from "barely playable" to "unplayable" for me personally. Tight FoV and mouse smoothing becoming non fixable were the killing blow.

review: READ IF YOU THINK YOU HAVE A LOW END (660 I3) PC OR MINIMUM SPECS! ''Do you recommend this game?'' My answer personally right now is no but only for the minority of which is the poorer more unfortunate gamers out there that cant afford middle to higher spec'd pc's. SPECS The minimum GPU for this is game is GTX 660 which I am currently using in my build although i belive what ever statistical testing they did to get this (what seems to be) estimate is very wrong same goes for the processor... A I3 REALLY?! My processor is better than that and let me tell you minecraft looks better. its like im playing a classic 8bit with the amount of low res pixles on my screen. GAMEPLAY I know 0.8hrs of gameplay time isn't enough to be making a justification for a game and then making a review as i have little to no experience on what looks like would be a entertaining game from the YouTube videos and my 15 friends that already own this game (I wish i could jump on the ''ban waggen'') Inside joke for all the s ). However from the experience I have and as I say this review is for a minority The game from my specs (just above minimum) was not getting a steady frame rate above 25! I would drop from 40 to 25 then down to 1 freeze for 2 seconds and backup. That ladys and gents is called a ing stutter and a half. Im not complaining about the graphics if the game was still playable i would not of made a refund but.. it's not. Even YouTubers I'll use my boy Nadeshot as an example has a sick new 2017 top spec pc way over 5gs for sure and has to run this game at minimum graphics May I also add in the majority of my long 0.8hrs was spent in the main menu configering settings to all low FFX and FFA all off because i couldnt give a .Conclusion Id say if you have anything ranging from a I5 and a GTX 700series (or a AMD eqivilant) or above your fine to run the game but dont be expecing a ing nice looking 4k BF1 as you will still be on 40fps minum settings with all grass turned off (its pretty much a tactical advantage though). Your still lucky prick. XXX''Do you recommend this game?'' If you have a mid to high range PC yes.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: To be 100% clear i have not had much experience with other games of this sort (Battle Royal) i have played a couple on my own computer and have played others such as H1Z1 King of the Kill on other peoples computers. My specs are listed on my account if needed to base any kind of counter argument or if needed to see what computer i have to get the frames i do get. This game has many pros and cons but personaly i believe the Pros out weigh the cons. At the time of this keep in mind i have only played 42hrs on PUBG.Pros 1 The loot seems to be very balanced and people who land in high populated areas are rewarded by better loot but those who go to low populated areas can still get loot but are usually less equiped than someone who landed in a high populated area.(Example Gatka Low George Pool High)2 Gun fights generally are very fun and dynamic depending on where you land gives you a different kind of gunfight so if you land in Mylta you may get in a roof to roof fight or a close range shotgun fight but if you land in the Gatka you may find your self fighting through water.3 Driving although can be improved my a more fluid and quicker turning and reversing is very fun and hanging out the sisde of your car you shoot someone is badass.4 Gun balancing is very good and most of the time what gun you use it completly down to preference so if you dont like using the Kar 98 you could use an M416 or the SCAR and all the guns aside from the VSS feel like they're in a good place.5 The map is amazing and offers so many different ways to get around the map different settings different kinds of loot and gunfights as i explained earlier.6 This game is also very good to play with other people as you get more kills than usual and you also from my experience get better loot than you would if you were alone.Cons 1 Although it has only happened to me once i have lost connection to servers and have DC in a gunifght i was going to win. This was frustrating but it was at the start of the game so im not to bothered. I will also like to point out many problems that i have had with the game happen in the begining and as the game gets on any problems i had usually are gone and i can enjoy the rest of the game bug free.2 This may be a minor detail but i would still like to point it out there is a rain glich (if you dont know what this is its is a bug in which a player cannot hear the rain and everyone else can that means he can hear footsteps others cannot and is so broken and OP many stermers such as Cohh play music so their sound is also limited.3 This is where Pc specs may come into thingsas my computer isnt some kind of watercooled beast no too often i would say 1 in 5 games i will spawn im parachute to where i want too go and my buildings look like something from that scene in Cat in the hat where they ride Mrs.Quan down the slide. They morph and i am unable to get inside of them which sometimes leaves me DEAD.4 Meds need to be a little bit more common in less populated areas this isnt a huge issue but i go to kahki quite often and me and a parnter will loot the entire thing and come out with 1 first aid and bandages thats it.5 This game is very campy and boring in solo. If you want to run around and get loads of kills this game is not for you unless you're very skilled and know alot about the game. Solo is full of people camping buildings and waiting for you to run into their little trap before they blast you in the head with a shotgun. If you play by yourself and want torun around and get loads of kills i would recomend H1Z1 King Of The Kill as it is way more fast pace and there is also 150people on the map.(Yes i do know H1Z1 has its problems and DayBreak are lazy)In conclution the only big thing to complain about are people who are to afraid to get into gun fights in solo and some connection issues. I recomend this game highly and although a bit expensive is worth it if you have the time to play it.Probably wont get read but i got bored and wanted something to do.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Having played hundreds of hours of the original Arma 3 BR I was very interested to see how this game turned out.I am pleased to say this is hands down the best mix ofthe slow tactical side of Arma BR and the fast pace of H1Z1.Pros Great gunplay mechanics that feel rewarding to master. Quick and easy looting system. Constant updates and bug fixes so far from the devs (A breath of fresh air for Early Access). You can deflect bullets with frying pans like a Jedi.Cons Server lag can be quite bad at times (Devs have already addressed this). Game optimization has gotten better since release but could use some improvement.If you enjoy BR style games or enjoyed the intense playstyle of Dayz without the long downtimes Battlegrounds is a must have for your library!

review: I know this will be drowned under a bunch of lolz reviews but I must say this game is not very good.Its success is mostly meme factor as far as I can tell.Why is it not a good game in my opinion Gunplay is not very fun.Midgame is the waiting game.Graphics/Physics are worst then games from 2009.When it is fun its only because you are doing it with friends. Which says nothing about the game even the worst games are fun with friends.Worst thing is that the game is not even long enough to create stories you will later recall of epic holdouts. Even moments that seem to be exciting at first become repetative due to the nature of the rounds and will not leave a lasting impressionGame loop is Run and find wepons before someone kills you (kind of fun)Mid game wait until the play area shrinks (kind of boring)Last one to get noticed wins. (not fun due to bad gunplay)If all of your friends have it and you dont want to be left out sure buy this game. There are worst things in life.But if you can convince them to play something else together or you plan to play it alone... I would strongly recommand a pass.

review: I am very disappointed in the turn of events and the direction this game is going. If I was anyone looking at potentially purchasing this game I would consider not doing so. This game has blown up and instead of the devs being humble they did a complete 180 and turned their backs to the community that helped this game become so well known. This game has an insane amount of money put into it and its not even out of early release. The money must have gotten to their heads because before they promised no paid in game microtransactions until release. We are still in early access and with one of the most recent updates they rolled out paid in game microtransactions. We all expected and knew that would happen upon release but with their blatant disregard for their community while still being in early access has had a massive impact to their player base and support. If you don't believe me I am sure reading the other reviews may leave you rest assured.

review: Honestly I thought I would really enjoy this but that is not the case.It's buggy as hell. I appreciate it's still early access but they've got the funding. They have a button on the main page to 'refresh the UI incase it's buggy'. If that isn't an indicator of what to expect I don't know what is.Performance is terrible. People with modest rigs still suffer from poor fps.It's so clunky. Things you can't walk up or climb over are just beyond frustrating. Putting your gun to a window or over a desk prevents you from doing so. When you think you're picking up ammo off the floor you end up picking the gun instead you switch back but then have to reload the gun again even though it was previously loaded.The maps are so large half the time it feels like a walking simulator. You spend 50% of your time staring at the floor for items 49% walking and 1% shooting.The general gun mechanics are strange. There's been several times I've pumped a full round into someone (the blood spats are an indicator it hit) and the player is still alive and shoots you dead in one. Other times I've shot someone with a shotgun from 25 meters away and killed them in 1 hit.The devs themselves are poor too and act like children. It's just a massive cash cow now. Here's why Bringing in micro transactions during early access is just unethical especially after the amount it's made in sales there's no excuse. Bringing in micro transations when they clearly stated they didn't. So that was a massive lie. They ban people for stream sniping and even those that aren't. There's no care for their players. They support the streamers because it's their way of marketing and getting more sales. They ban people from their forum that have posted a polite opinion. They cry when another company "steals" their idea even though battle royale style games has been around for years.

review: I'm sure there are 8 million other PUBG players who can put this better than I can but I'll try anyway.PUBG is an excellent game where you're dropped onto a large map with 100 or so players. Last man standing wins. Simple right?I feel like PUBG has an excellent balance between the health of your character and the damage of different weapons. The guns all feel very powerful but you don't feel squishy and vulnerable. There is also an excellent balance on the size of the map it's big enough to feel like you're traveling far from other players. It's big enough that you need to be careful that you don't die outside the playzone. But it's small enough that you can run/drive fairly substantial distances and if you have the fuel a vehicle can take you across the entire map.This game is sometimes quite hard to run. When in cities I often find there are frame drops. And occasionally I get large lag spikes.As well as that PUBG has its fair share of bugs. Such as having vehicles glitch into objects and explode immediately. Or when your gun is bugged and you can't fire it.But take that with a pinch of salt as the game is still in early access and there are plenty of bugfixes on the way.So overall I'd recommend this game if you have a relatively powerful PC patience and the knowledge that eventually you will get hit in the face with a pan and die in this game.

review: Obviously I like the game as I have played far more than I should have over the course of a month.Is the game glitchy at times? YESIs it optimized for best graphics and FPS? NO (not yet)When the glitches happen to you or to others will you be either infuriated or laughing so hard you might bust a rib? Emphatically YES!I can't begin to describe how terrible the vehicles in the game are where you think you are safe driving at speed only to realize either your jeep can do more cartwheels through the air when you strike an invisible rock than a Circue 'Du Soliel performer on Crack or come to the conclusion that you are riding around in a unbelievably loud Steel Deathtrap of explodey proportions. Or when you try to escape a firefight and drive away as bullets are ripping through both steel and flesh as your car takes about 45 seconds to reach blazing speed of 12 kph.Or how after parachuting from the aircraft and landing on a roof with 3 teammembers... and realizing they are not YOUR teammembers as they beat you to death with their fists while your actual teammates continue to loot and ignore your pleas for help.You need to play it for yourself. Grab some friends get this game and have an absolute blast learning the in s and outs of PUBG! Highly recommend.9.5/10

review: Amazing game. Fun to play with friends or solo. Evenly distributed loot airdrops are worth the risk the first person is an amazing added touch graphics are great and matchmaking is instant.HoweverUnder no circumstance will I recommend this game. And for multiple reasons.1.) Every location based server has their own issues. Australia/Oceania's servers are flat out broken. They are basically required to play asian servers so their ping isnt in the several hundreds. North American servers have horrible hit registry. European servers had a horrible desync problem. Yet this is not the worst of the issues.2.) Sounds are quite off. While a lot of time was taken to fix said sounds so location could be made it is still incredibly hard if not improbable to determine whether someone is ahead of or behind you. It just sounds flat. And this is coming from someone with surround sound headphones.3.) My final point and the strongest is that the developers need to stop that god awful lagswitch they built in to deter people from cheating. Its killing the game for me and many other people. I have 150/50 internet and for every three games I only have one that is genuinely playable because "Network Lag Detected" pops up stops me from moving covers my screen in a shadow and prevents me from doing anything at all while the world moves around me. This can happen anywhere at anytime but usually every 6 to 10 seconds lasting upwards of 5 seconds. This places a target on your back when it occurs in game. You cannot loot move open doors nothing only stand still probably in the middle of an open field and hope someone doesn't snipe you. It makes driving impossible travelling long distances implausible and looting painful. And I am not the only one having this issue. It is happening to thousands of others. A simple google search will bring about thousands of threads on steam and other forums that in short say youre SOL. So as much as I love this game as much as I try to play this game and have a good time and how amazing this game is I cannot under any circumstance recommend it for what it is in its current state. The first two issues being very minimal in comparison to the last and able to be looked past. But while the dreaded "Network Lag Detected" lagswitch is implemented I will not be pledging to this game anymore. I would rather deal with cheaters than deal with this supposed deterrent anymore.

review: Been playing this game for about 200 hours now and still feel mediocre at it. Winning fights is a challenge most of the time but that's what makes this game so gratifying. This is the hardest game I've ever played. Yeah you run into the occasional bug but I've rarely run into desync issues especially since the updates. Be prepared to spend at least a 130 hours or so getting crapped on by other players or your own random squad members parachuting to the wrong place. But with the new practice mode and Aimtastic you'll start seeing improvements. Slowly you become more skilled and then you get addicted because you want to keep getting better and better. Every death provides feed back analyze what you got wrong what the other player got right if you had the right gun for the situation and learn learn learn. That's what makes this game fun. Sure there is a little bit of RNG at times where you can't find a gun right away and get killed but it happens to other players. Sometimes I find nothing but a pistol and I go hijack cars from other players. After 200+ hours I still get adrenaline surges and quickened heart beats (which I hope goes away at some point because it'll ruin your aim).Game is highly recommended if you have time a friend you can duo with to teach you and can survive the steep learning curve. If you don't play a lot of FPS it can be challenging but I'm getting there.

review: Just know that about 90% of the time you will land not find a gun in 3 houses and the guy that landed near you will basically land in an armory.Update (11/16/2017) I don't really understand why people are saying this game is dying. There are 2+ million concurrent players and the devs are still implementing new updates and are working on a new map. It's not going anywhere anytime soon. Stop equating it to Dayz they are not the same. Dayz never had 4 times the number of concurrent players as the next biggest game on steam. Just because you're mad about the game doesn't mean that it's dying.Pros Best implementation of the Battle Royale game type that I've seen Devs are very active Pretty good weapon models. Recoil patterns are pretty realistic. Decent graphics if you choose to use them (see cons)Cons Lots of bugs (EA) Car mechanics need work. You'll flip on bumps that you can't even see. Grendades bounce half way across the map when you throw them It puts you at a disadvantage if you use high graphics settings. Low graphics allow you to see players much more easily at a distance because the grass and foliage isn't rendered. They will think they're hidden but you can clearly see them. If you choose to use high graphics do not sit still in a bush and think you are concealed. You aren't. Weapon distribution needs work. Stream sniping bans are BS Jumping mechanics suck Too many hackersOverall I think the pros outweigh the cons in this game. There are no horrible game breaking bugs or power hungry devs banning half of the playerbase. I'm going to pull the "It's early access" card because it very much applies in this case. There is work to be done but it's off to a good start. If it were as broken as the reviews make it seem it wouldn't have 2 million people playing it every day.

review: This game is plauged with terrible bugs that the developers have still yet to fix even though the problems were there from the beginning. This is turning into another DayZ Standalone situation flooded with tons of players who are looking for a great time but are basically screwed when the developers never fix major flaws with that are being basically shoved in their faces by fans. You have made freaking bank selling a of copies but you really have nothing to show for it other than an incomplete game that seems to only get worse and more buggy with each update as you add more weapons and noone asked for. I see lots of reviews about hackers but I have yet to see one personally so I won't fault it on that yet probably because I can't finish a full match without the game ing up royally in some fashion.The game in its current state for me is unplayable with buildings taking 10 20 minutes to load in if even loading in at all once the map itself didnt even load in. They are trying the push the game saying its esports ready when at an actual tourney the ing had connection closed. Not to mention they added in Microtransactions in an early access game. This is ing rediculous. Might as well make it free to play too while you're at it. The game does not need a new bloody map it needs to be optimized and stabilized before you start adding new content that will most likely break the game even more. Don't add the map don't add vaulting and new guns untill you fix your game's bugs and issues. I will say when the game used to actually run I had a ing BLAST. Trust me I WANT TO LIKE THIS GAME infact I DO like it. When I'm actually able to play the game without it freezing crashing buildings failing to load and other t that crushes this game. Gameplay is fun but you can't even enjoy that sadly when it has the tendency to break its own legs then try to run a marathon.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: After rapid development and transparency of developer's actions/targets here everything comes to a stall with numerous issues and degrading community.Pros Excellent gunplay Adrenaline and satisfaction that you get on your 'chicken dinner' One can everytime get a different feel of the game just by changing playstyle (i.e. looting and running camping in bathroom or FFA in Sosnovka MB gathering loot from corpses) Character customization options Improvise adapt and overcome loot is RNG Quick reaction luck and tactics are almost always necessary to winCons Still no region lock Poor netcode and client side hit marking which results in an advantage for players with higher ping (yes there is pinglock but you can just play in different region) Stallment on game optimization especially for AMD's GPUs Frequent problems with connectivity and servers uptime Increasing numbers of bots and players farming Battle Points which results in almost empty map between 1st/2nd circle Numerous players playing outside their regions I haven't encountered obvious examples but other people report about an increase in number of cheaters one can't be sure about that as there is no killcam (unless it's speedhack...) Sounds levels while it could be realistic still it's a pain when you increase volume because you think that you heard steps and suddenly there is an airplane flying above you R.I.P. headphones. There should be a script decreasing Master Sound Volume in such moments really. Pro whiny streamers developer's attitude.I don't recommend this game right now unless developers again start working hard on their title communicate more and resolve problems related from increasing popularity of the title (farmers region locks connectivity).

review: STORY (1/5) What story? Please correct me in the comments if i'm wrong and there is somehow a story here... I suppose you could always create your own? At least explain why we're parachuting onto this island and killing each other? No? Too hard? Ok then...GAMEPLAY (2/5) Fun battleroyale gameplay with exciting weaponry where you parachute onto an island loot to your hearts content and then kill everyone you come across until you're the last one left standing. Sounds awesome right? Well yes you would be right but the game's poor optimization stands in the way of all the fun. I don't have a bad rig by any standards but I experienced a lot of issues trying to play. The forums say its the last patch but I'm not sticking around to find out as I don't have the patience or time to play a game that isn't working up to standards.SOUND (2/5) Sound in this game is important. I can hear people quite well in this game but the quality of that sound isn't super great. In a short period of time I ran across quite a few audio glitches such as sound not playing when it should sound becoming suddenly ear drum blowing loud and sounds like gunfire not sounding like gunfire but more like screaching monkies. Not overly impressed.GRAPHICS (3/5) Graphics are not bad but most people won't be able to enjoy them as they will be set to the lowest quality to maximize FPS due to the poor optimization of the game.REPLAY VALUE (4/5) Replayability of this game is very high due to the nature of the game. Its the games strong suit. You will continue to replay matches over and over unlocking clothes and other cosmetics for your character.DO I RECOMMEND? No. Not really. Its a close call though and it really depends if you are willing to put up with the terrible optimization and bugs. Honestly I'm refunding the game. I've never refunded anything before. This is the first time I've been this disappointed with a game. I see it has potential however rather unfortunately it doesn't deliver due to a host of technical issues. I'll be back in another 6 months or so to check it out again once its had some more development time. If you're willing to put up with everything for an undercooked experience though you may be able to squeeze some enjoyment out of the game.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The gameplay itself is very enjoyable. It's a 100 man free for all deathmatch in a very sizeable map with no respawn and Day Z like scavenging mechanics with all weapons ammo clothing and items needing to be procured on site as opposed to entering the map with a loadout. Players must stay within a certian circumference that gets smaller as time goes on forcing players to continually converge in a proceedingly smaller area. A match can last about 25 30min+ depending on how good/dedicated you are or when the game decides to crash.Weapons are customizeable with attachments you find in the field scopes holo sights silencers etc. Very cool.Items extend from shoes and hats to bandages and medkits as well as melee weapons like crowbars.Your character's clothing and accessories are customizable from the main menu of which are acquired by lootcrates you unlock with battle points earned from matches.But the performance is TERRIBLE terrible for an early access game but even more so for a $30 game. Absolutely garbage performance. In 2 hours I've crashed 4 times and have consistently hit slideshow grade framerates and assets that straight up don't load. I'm well above the reccomended specs and play games like Battlefield 4/1/Killing Floor 2 with no issue.It's really hard to enjoy the excellent game mechanincs and game concept when the game itself runs like a pig. Which is sad because the 'game' part of the game is fantastic.Cannot reccomend in its current state for $30 dollars. THIRTY DOLLARS. $15 would be acceptable $12 and I wouldn't bother to leave a negative review.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The game has very potential but dont buy at this stage the game is to much in alpha they realeased a patch today fixes a bit the optimization ( still stutters alot at the beggining) loot tables got ed up tho.The game is EXTREMELY LAGGY i have a really good internet connection and the game lags like hell when you pick up loot you need to be spaming the button on the item to pick it up and ( EU servers)This game as potential but now its pretty much not worth 30 My most con about this game is really the lag if they fix the servers im happy to upvote itEdite 1 Game is still laggy sometimes still a bug mess and still very unoptimized there is a memory leak problem the devs never adressed ( i used to have 6 gb of ram this game used 5 now i have 14 this game uses 10 gb ram) the game is extremely fun tho but i still cant recommend tthis game was the FIRST most played game in steam yesterday it passes cs go and dota it sold 8 million copies for 30 i think that by now we should have some issues adressed.Edite 2 1.0 out and LAG LAG LAG LAG LAG LAGEdite 3 Still alot of lag when looting on the beggining of the match loot spawns all ed up

review: Probably the best Battle Royale game out there+ Solid battle royale gameplay. Drop from a plane collect loot kill players get pushed in closer and closer try to be the last man standing. The gun play is pretty realistic and it's always fun to get into an intense firefight.+ Great fun with friends+ Very High Replayability+ First Person and Third Person modes.+ Vehicles + Depening on how well you do you earn battle points. You can use these to get crates which you can sell on the market for profit OR open them for a cosmetic item. More of a personal note When playing in a squad it's very common for one of your friends to get knocked down and within a second they get killed with no chance of reviving them. This causes you to either leave the game or your friends have to sit there in boredom watching you play the remainder of the game. Can be frustratingly repetitive. Example Spending 20minutes looting / looking for players and then suddenly getting sniped across the map. Not enough map variety (there are only two maps currently) Lots of bugs... from randomly flipping off a bike taking heavy damage parachuting from the plane glitching inside loading buildings etc.SIde Note This is a game I never thought I'd enjoy
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: 21 9 users don't buy this game. We have the Overwatch fov cropped and zoomed.Optimisation does not exist i5 3750k 4 Ghz RAM 16 Go 1070 GTX. Framerate is awful 22 fps to 110. Can't fight in a town. Hitreg and lag compensation are from time to time really bad. You can empty a mag on a person and yet not get a kill. Sometimes you died behind cover whereas you were hidden for a good amount of time. It's frustating. Expect rubberbanding also. See https //www.reddit.com/r/PUBATTLEGROUNDS/comments/69n3bn/the_reason_why_fights_are_a_coinflip/Don't expect first person server for now it's thrid person only with all the abuses.Overall gameplay is great but it's unplayable with thoses problems.

review: Okay first of all this game has it's moments of being a broken game.Desync Lag FPS drops etc. But recently devs of the game have shifted the entire focus on it. Today was the first update which was released towards it. 60hz better frames better anti cheat (Soon ) better hitreg.And this is just the first patch there is more to come. You can read everything in the Dev's blog a week ago. Yes Locked lootboxes is a thing even if you pay with Battle points. But it's only cosmetic and doesn't affect gameplay as such in any case. I have a gtx 1080 TI and a 8700k game runs okayish for the hardware I have but you'll get constant 80+ fps on a decent i5 now. I have been playing this game on off since alpha the FPS is massively improved but nothing is perfect. Even Fortnite has frame drops(not like pubg) when you land in tilted towers. 8/10 for me slowly reaching 9/10 if the server update works. Recommended not just for the gameplay but for the devs for having all this negetive stuff towards them admitting it and providing fixes for it and also communicating with the players.

review: This game has the potential to be one of the top games out. Playing it gives you that chasing the dragon feel you get from H1Z1. Personally I'm enjoying much more than H1Z1.This game has a much larger selection of weapons and the attachments are a game changer. Rather than shuffle back and forth while tagging each other you can engage in more fulfilling firefights. Combat happens at much further distances thanks to scopes. Tactics are more important than ever none of this hop out of a car and mow people down crap.The game needs some optimization yes but it's already leaps and bounds ahead of H1Z1. The devs are really active that should say a lot for the future of this game.

review: I got fully geared I had a sniper and an M416 with suppressor and with all possible attachments. The end game was near 13 people alive. Im the last one alive in my squad. The circle shrinks I swiftly run towards my buggy parked behind my hiding spot. "This wis the game that Im going to win" I said to myself while observing the war going on between the last remaining squads. My heart's pounding.The circle shrank. I was outside of the zone running to my buggy driving very fast towards a hiding spot behind a couple of stones. I break quickly turning to the left trying to stop the vehicle with my full of adrenaline. Then I decided to jump out of the buggy in its immense speed before stopping... I got ran over by my own buggy and died.I recommend this game.

review: Nervous and Excited 95 other players and myself jumped from the plane and into the arena. I hit the ground and frantically started searching for supplies. Before I knew it there were already 30 players eliminated leaving about 60 to fight to the death. I came upon a church where after searching for supplies and finding an ak12 (or whatever it is) I see a care package falling from the sky. I watched it for a little while to make sure no enemies where in the area then proceeded. To my surprise there was an enemy crouched behind the other side of the package. I was able to sneak up on him and shoot and kill him giving him no chance to retaliate. In the package I found a sniper rifle and 8x scope. Not bad at all. Continuing my hunt there were only 20 players left the play area getting smaller and smaller. I picked a hill that was still in the play area to see if an opportunity to get a couple kills with the sniper rifle presented itself. Looking down the scope I heard several shots coming from my left that were very close which greatly alarmed me. In prone I peaked out from behind a large stone to see ANOTHER PLAYER doing the exact same thing I was only he shot first. Needless to say he lost his life due to his trigger finger. 10 players left. Forced to leave the hill due to the play area shrinking I layed down prone in a field and tried to come up with a gameplan when another player peaked his head out from a nearby hill that was very small. He did not see me and I was able to get a headshot on him with my sniper rifle. The play area shrinked again and I was forced from my cover in the tall grass. Unfortunately I was found and shot by another player. The adrenaline rush and anxiety associated with this game is amazing. I finished #7 a little off but also impressed at my own ability to be a complete jackass to other players sneaking up on them and taking their loot.This game is very buggy but is frequently updated. I urge you to give it a try. I almost didn't buy it because I hate wasting money but I still think this game is worth playing but maybe not at the $30 price. If it's on sale its a no brainer but at normal price it's really at your own discretion. 10/10 would get jumpscared shot again
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Will keep you engaged for hours on end. Great alone or with friends better with friends so you get that sense of self worth when they watch you do something coolNot optimised well which is pretty poopy pants.Come on guys no more Angus memes they're really making me tired . . .
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: We stared at each other across the room and froze! Panic started to sweep over me. The hairs on my neck stood up and I could feel the first beads of sweat forming. I nervously patted my utility belt nothing. The backpack I had just picked up felt light nothing useful in there either. Between us lay a frying pan. I needed it. I could tell he was thinking the same but we were both still. That frying pan is the only thing that will kill him quickly. He knew it too. One of us is dying in this room today. I looked around for a plan. I spotted the pitcureframe on the fireplace. An old couple lived here dead now of course. Ever since the invasion Earth had become just another entertainment channel. Simply fun to watch for the Others. Ever since Arena 2053 opened man and woman have been fighting each other. Not through choice but through necesity. That's the only way out of this place and into the Haven. You have to win. But at what cost?Some choose to play the Arena. Few like it. Most find a hole to crawl up in praying the Others don't punish their behaviour. A gunshot fires in the distance inreasing the urgency in the room. I could tell he was unsettled nervous unsure of my skill. We studied each other's appearance. In the holding area of the Arena you can use influence and money to buy better clothes to give yourself some camouflage. Many would pay extra for this advantage. Everyone else was just grateful for the plain clothes they throw at you. Not ideal but better than nothing.Strange relationships form in the months you wait in the holding cells of the Arena. We all know there can be only one survivor but this doesn't stop people trying to form alliances. Some choose to become subservient and crawl behind their masters hoping for a quick death from them in the Arena. Some try to swim to safety but the Others always see. A floorboard creaked in another room snapping me out of thought. We weren't the only two here. We looked at each other again. "I don't want any trouble mister. I just need that frying pan y'hear and I'll be gone" he said a slight tremble in his voice. A door opened followed by a woman. I recognised her. She was a previous winner. She looked experienced. Tired. Scars of previous battles told stories on her face. Why wasn't she in the Haven? It didn't make sense. She looked at us both slowly and then down to her hands. All of us stared at the shotgun. It was a double barrel. She only had two shots maximum maybe it wasn't even yet loaded. She looked like she was weighing up her options. She could take us out but the shots would have to hit true. If she missed then one of us would still be alive and closer to the frying pan. Whoever was left holding that frying pan held the upper hand. She raised the shotgun to the other man. "NO! DON " BANG!The noise was deafening and shocked me into action. I lept across the room and fumbled with my fingers to grip the frying pan. "PICK UP GODAMNIT!"I yelled. She turned to me and fired. Fortunately the thin wooden chair took the full impact of the shotgun. She looked up and realised her mistake. She started to fumble with her belt looking for any kind of weapon. I raised the frying pan and with all of my weight crashed it over her head. She fell instantly in a heap. Blood trickled out and down between the floorboards. I breathed heavily but this was no time to stop. I grabbed the shotgun and some shells from her belt. Whilst reloading I hear a groan and look over at the man who was shot. He was trying to crawl out of the door with his hand on his stomach clearly holding his intestines in place. He would never make it. I had to do the kindest thing. I walked over with the shotgun. "Please mister. End my pain. Shoot me." He said our eyes locking. I could see the terror the panic. "I'm sorry this has happened to you" I said whilst raising my shotgun and aiming between his eyes. I could see the terror and panic turn to relief.I pressed lightly on the trigger. Then stopped. I noticed how little shells I had left and thought about the sound the shotgun would make. It would alert others to my prescence and I couldn't afford that. I lowered the shotgun and placed it on my back. "W what are you doing mister?"I released the frying pan on my belt and raised it. "No! Please! Mister!"I threw it down and across his face. The sound was sickening as bone crushed and skin split. He was gone. I looked around surveying this horror show. 2 down 98 to go. I walked out of the door and started to run.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is buggy and not fun to play with all of the unbalanced weapons and the terrible hit registration.This is a complete waste of money at 26.99. DO NOT PURCHASE THIS GAME if you are looking for a solid shooter game. The community is one of the worst as 90% of the players are campers. This game is not worthy of the "Battlegrounds" title as there are very few battles going on within the game and if you are lucky enough to get in to a battle you will most likely feel like you are at a disadvantage as the person who is firing at you will probably be out of sight so you will be dead before you get to spot them. Also close quartes combat is quite possibly one of the worst aspects of this game as it feels sluggish and unsatisfying even if you manage to succeed in your close quarters fight. The movement in this game is also dreadful because the characters are so slow in all aspects of movement so good look climbing and jumping over obstacles in this game because the movement makes the characters feel extremely disabled. This game is no where near ready for a full release and it is definitely not ready to even be in early access. Overall i would not recommend this game.

review: Lots of Fun.I bought the game 3 days ago and played a few solo games. Solo isn't that much fun. But I met a few guys and joined them on Discord and we played a few sqad games and it was great fun. Running around trying to find weapons and protective gear and of course always looking out for others who try to do the same. And then thre is the play area that gets smaller and smaller as time progresses. The smaller it gets the more players are in the same area. Near the end of the game it gets intense as a lot of players fill a very small game area. If you dont have a good weapon and at least level 2 vest and helmet you'r dead. As a team based game I'll give this a 5/5. If you only play solo i will have to give this game a 2/5 not much fun. So if you have some friends to play with you should buy it right now.

review: After a near 300 hours playing this game I have come to the conclusion that it is the best Battle Royale game in it's genre and to be fair it wins that title fair and square as PlayerUnknown (the gent we have to thank for the mods and game mode itself) is the guy creating this masterpiece.I don't fully agree with the games early access model and that the game had a seperate external from steam Deluxe Edition pre purchase however it wasn't as expensive as the standard edition and some of the clothing items included with the deluxe edition like PlayerUnknown's Trenchcoat and Scarf are worth more than 300+ on the steam community market effectively making that piece of included digital content more expensive than an actual copy of the game...but I digress.Player unknown's Battlegrounds is a fantastic game for an early access and a Beta and the devs seem commited and active towards fixing glitches issues and adding more content as well as balancing weapons and optimization. Realistically the areas in which this game falls flat is in the minor annoyances likes getting stuck on objects in a falling animation taking random damage from unknown sources out of nowhere low FPS drops in certain areas of the game or if someone throws a flashbang and Sniper rifles appearing to fire higher than where the scopes crosshair is aimed these however have only been glaring issues since the latest patch and will soon be fixed (as of this update the above mentioned glitches and bugs are currently fixed)Looting in this game could use a bit of tweaking as there are ways of looting quicker and more effectively that give you a quick edge competitively early game but this isn't a game breaking exploit there are however some other issues that really break the game and with your perception of if it was a fair match or not such as terrible server lag netcode and such as there's been plenty of oppertunities I've pushed into a building or defended mine from a impromptu home invasion and I fire both of my trusty shotgun barrels into a would be invaders chest and head at point blank range only for the damage inflicted to be completely ignored and for them to slowly pick my health away with a handgun or other weapon at this stage I think the problem is that the servers themselves need to be top notch and seeing as this entire game runs of the pretense of being a dedicated competitive "last man standing" survival shooter then the shooting as well as the netcode should be some of the best you will ever see in a game which currently it just isn't.Not to discriminate but the servers are also just terribly laggy and they really should look at getting some top of the line hosting models and such as sometimes servers just topple over which never makes it a fun game or match as you will find yourself rubber banding glitching through walls and objects or straight up being shot when behind cover or clearly out of "line of sight" of the enemy firing on you maybe on your screen you're safe inside that room or behind that wall but on their screen they can see the perfectly formed red mist spraying from your head...please guys you're games incredibly fun but focus on server stability and optimization of netcode and frames per second not adding content...don't make the same mistake the DayZ Dev Team did.What I will say that I cannot give the development or PR teams any credit for is banning people for honking car horns near a streamer when THEY implemented that feature into the game so what a streamer whines like a little baby to you guys and you decide to throw out a ban for that?! It's pathetic grow the up and tell the streamer if he wants to play with zero delay on his stream then he's a and deserves it simple as.Otherwise I would HIGHLY recommend this game for it's interesting gameplay fun movement and easy to pick up model of play you can get absolutely wrecked and still want to jump into another game and that I find brilliant about this game.Now on roughly 350+ hours and it hasn't gotten any older or boring highly recommend this game it's ing incredible.Ritra out!

What really makes the game is it's use of sound in footsteps and gunshots however the player movement in a word just feels sloppy. Your player gets caught on rocks and steps of cement that barely reach their knees and cannot jump over such without a running start. I understand that the game is in it's earlier stages but with a type of gamemode as competitive as it is the slightest flaw makes the experience too frustrating.

review: I'd rather watch paint dry or better yet loot dirty laundry from around my house and throw it in the washing machine. It would be more fun doing those tasks then putting another second into this game. I've tried getting a refund but that was a no go. The main problem with this game is there isn't any actual skill involved. If you are successful at winning a match you either landed in the dead center of the player circle camped in a house the whole time and ended up getting LUCKY and found good loot. Or you ran around for 30 minutes and stayed on the edge of the player circle laying in the grass hoping no one sees you. In either instance you've done nothing. The fire fights suck poorly optimized even if you have a god tier computer. What I would reccomend is if you want to waste $35.00 (CAD) either go buy some scratch tickets and hope you get lucky or go to the casino and play penny slot machine for an hour. You'd have more fun and you'll get the same result. Luck based.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So I have only got 20 hours on the game so take this short review lightly. I decided to wait before giving the game a review untill I actually won a match. The main thing that I would like to focus on is that you do not need to be good at shooters in order to play and actually win a game in PUBG. Ive never played any games related to this one like DayZ or H1Z1 so this was my first time playing a battle royale style game. Im very inexperienced and I play on a PC that is below the minimum specs required for the game so I deal with lag. I was still able to achieve a win in a duo match with my father who does not play shooters at all so the entire concept from the ground up is new to him. The game isnt based on how good your computer can run the game or how accurate you are with the weapons in the game but more about the decisions you make. Decision making is what really determines if you are succesful or not. The game is also fairly easy to pick up and start playing. Simple and easy to use controls. It feels smooth in my opinion and I would reccomend this game to anyone looking to have some fun. It might not be for everyone but I definetly give it a thumbs up.

review: I bought this title with little to no expectation of it being the title I have since become addicted to.After watching a veritable metric poop tonne of streamers play PUBG and gaining some tricks and tips I parachuted into my first game...The plane flew straight as an arrow as I tried to hastily make a decision as to were I would eject switching between 1st person to see how many battle royale members were still in the plane and referring to the map to try and mark a point where I'd find some dank loot...I jumped out head pointed at the horizon to cover more ground holding in alt and frantically looking around to see if anyone was headed in the same direction... My parachute pulled and I spiralled down trying to land before the who decided my chosen group of houses was a ing shared endeavour did.I landed first on the roof of a building with an m16a4 and 3 packs of 30 x 5.56mm ammo. I quickly drag dropped it into my inventory and loaded it while keeping tabs on the freeloader. He headed off into the red 3 storey building I could see him heading to the stairs leading to the roof. I crouched. Aimed down my sights and waited for him to peek his head up the stairs so that I could give an free close shave haircut on the house. He ran up and tried to jump off the balcony only to get stuck against it. I pressed shift steadying my aim and let a burst fly into his idiot face...As the rounds hit and I got the red notification on screen "1 kill" his body ragdolled violently into the distance. I summarily had my first multiple . I quickly ran to find a kevlar vest optics helmet ammo and more weapons in my compound. MY ING COMPOUND! MINE.I looted mr hackeysack's body and found a kar98 with an 8x optic scope. I was kitted to the bloody nines bois. I had obliviously been looting and taking my time flinching at moving bushes and almost emptying the entirety of my bowels at shots clearly fired over 500m away 2 compounds over.I had forgotten about the circle. It was right on my I panicked. I opened my map and randomly set a marker inside the white circle and began to leg it....I ran through open fields checking my 6 and my 3 and my 9 and my 2 and my 12. Basically I was a running swivelhead. On my travels through the lands of artillery strikes and random gunfire I dropped many a bear sized dropping after being winged and dinged by fellow battle royalers. I reached my destination. Po i city. I remember thinking YEAH bro I have an m16 a kar98 with an 8 x scope lvl2 vest and helmet enough ammo to take on whoever came my way and hastily entered the first building I could reach while under fire from what seemed like Michael J Fox in a full Parkinson's throw. I entered and ran upstairs confident af with all my gear and my 1 kill. I rounded a corner into a room that would have a window overlooking a wide open field and....As the spray of buckshot rearranged my face and my player model quickly turned into what I imagine Jabba The Hutt's mangled turds resemble. I remember staring at my screen with my mouth and eyes wide open for just a second before I vowed that this game was the biggest load of I had ever played.I immediately queued for the next game and cleaned the bodily fluids from the walls and my chair and rig. I had 2 hours of sleep that Tuesday. I wanted to put in a week of leave and drink mountain dew and order pizza and play pubg until I turned into a full blown neckbeard keyboard warrior.I love this game. I also hate this game. I want this game to have my babies. Buy it. Buy it so we can shoot each other in the face and then team up to shoot other people in the face and we can all go into cardiac arrest together and grow matching neckbeards IRL.The Irishman creative director deserves all the money he's made and more. And the dev team who constantly works on performance improvements before cosmetic and useless additions all deserve hourly s and/or cunninglingus. 11/10 IGN12/10 rotten tomatoes7/5 cameltoesI cant wait to get home and do nothing other than play PUBG until the sun comes creeking through the curtains. I've started looking online for a Dacia to purchase already.

review: Since closed beta this game has been more stable and polished than Arma3 which released over three years ago and from what I hear even more stable and polished than H1Z1 KotH which went EA over a year ago and is still in development. That alone should really say something about Bluehole and PU. I haven t had this much adrenaline pumping fun in quite some time.Pros Battle Royale game mechanicsTactical GameplayGun HandlingSemi realismSounds Effect are outstandingNo consistent game breaking bugsDeveloper communicates with player baseDeveloper expects full release in 6 months (no multi year EA bull EA pricing very reasonable for state of gameCons Early Access open beta state (meaning bugs)Servers stability/lag issues a work in progress3P camera mechanics (corner peaking) Hardcore mode (1P) likely not available until releaseH1Z1 players griping that it s too hard and too realisticIf you liked DayZ Mod (not standalone) if you like Arma2/3 BR mods if you like a tactical shooter that rewards thinking &amp decision making skills as much as mouse+keyboard skills then this game is likely for you.If you think H1Z1 KotH is the cat s meow and the metric by which all shooters should be judged and cloned then you are going to absolutely HATE this game better to stick with what you know.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have been playing this game for over 3 weeks now. I absolutly love the game. The thrill you get from it is just what you need in a game. My heart races and a pump of adrenline start flowing through my veins when I'm being shot at or I am some of the few last survivors. I love playing this with friends because it brings us together as a team.As for the game I have a few good things and a few bad things about it.PRO'S The game has a good loot range already with weapons and ammo throughout the whole map. Vehicles are good to have in the game as they are a life saver sometimes. The circle to stay in is a brill way to make the game last man standing. The map is a fair good size. Weapon's feel good plenty of them.CON'S The games graphics should be locked a bit or changed in a way for people using lower graphics settings because lower settings give's you an advantage to see people in the distance. The Rendering distance changes the grass rendering so hiding in grass offers no real camoflauge. Some of the vehicle's need to have their stability tuned a bit for example the motorbike. When at high speeds the bike has the tendancy to drift when taking sharp bends going top speed. Other vehicles do this as well. Another map should be introduced to keep the game interesting to people and the map / server is random rather than people getting the option to pick which one they would rather play on.Overall very good game just needs a few adjustments.

review: (Please take note that this is/was a early access review)The fun of running through open fields shirtles with camo pants on yelling "Screw you I'm Putin an I have aim bot!" then missing shots cause you realize this isn't H1Z1.PROS MotionBlur off by default. Great combat and gunplay. (Every gun feels strong even the pistols) Gun customization. (Suppressors Scopes Grips and more) Much pontential. Great devs. Satisfying map. Tatical Movement (beside trying to jump over anything...)CONS Can put foliage on low or very low for better advantage/disadvantage. (could be a pro aswell) Needs Optmization. (but hey early access) Hitboxes are bad for car. (you can hit someone behind a wall) Short range combat is kinda off. (feels like it could be better but you could just change to fp) Fall damage is random.OVERALL The game is good. Combat is great can get your heart pumping. Now this is what I'm really curious on. Some people seem to have a problem getting the game to run high fps and look good. (from what I saw they even have better rigs) Now I want to see if any one rocking a similar build can run the same graphic set up.My rig i5 6500 gtx 1050 ti and 8gb of ddr4 ramGraphic settings 1080p Screen scale 100 Anti Aliasing Ultra Post Processing low Shadows medium Texture Ultra Effects Medium Foliage low and View Distance High. I get between 65 79 fps. Now theirs some saying there getting that with everything on low and a few have better cpus and gpus then I do. Other then that I really enjoy the game. (I've bought it 12 other times to give to friends) I see great pontential in this game. See ya on the Battlegrounds. xoxo

review: I see a lot of "Not recommended" here from people who clearly do not understand game development and that is perfectly understandable. But please don't naively accept what people complain about here and avoid what could potentially be a very fun experience for a reasonable price.Games development is a business and it is complicated. It takes hundreds of employees working together to build market and maintain a successful (profitable) video game. I know I'm stating the obvious but there are so many people here who seem not to know this simple fact.Bluehole have created one of the top 5 most popular games here (daily) and I suspect they were more than a little surprised at just how popular it would be. Six million copies in early access alone is nothing short of mind blowing for a game with one map and mode (currently). Despite these frankly shocking sales numbers and daily player numbers in the hundreds of thousands Bluehole have managed to keep the game running on dedicated servers with impressively low down time.I see people saying they don't listen to their customers and I have to strongly disagree. Just look at their Twitter accounts forums and the updates pages here to see what has been addressed and implemented at the behest of the players.Bluehole and PlayerUnknown have been incredibly vocal about the progress and hiccups of development for PUBG. I applaud the way they have handled almost every stage. Have they made mistakes? Of course they have. Unforgivable mistakes? Well that's subjective but I would argue not.Have they kept all their promises? No. But personally I think I can forgive them adding microtransactions or slowing update and release dates. I can do this because they have solid reasons for doing so. The crates are optional and only have cosmetic items in them so I see no reason to complain about them implementing something which almost every video game released in the last few years has. Especially as there are AAA games out there that cost more than 3 times that of PUBG and their crates have gamebreaking equipment and buffs in them.If people want to financially support expansion and improvement of the game and to keep the servers running with a pink skirt on their avatar then I'm all for it. Okay so I have said enough to be accused of being a shill. That's okay I wanted to bring a little reason into these bizarre reviews and that is a price I'll gladly pay.Now on to my review.Pros Fun.Solid mechanics. This could be argued because they're still a little clunky but credit where credit is due the improvements are rapid. I honestly expect this game just get easier and easier to control as time goes on. However I have no problem shooting people looting or getting from A to B. Regular updates with noticable improvements (albeit a little too regular and I agree that they should be realeased in a more tested and stable state).Developer to player communication is very good and reasonable visa versa.Down times are very low for an EA.Balance seems fair and when it doesn't they seem happy to roll back changes.Community. I've made plenty of friends in both the game itself and associated Discords.Optional cosmetic micro transactions are optional and cosmetic only (A difficult concept for some but you are actually not forced to pay more than you take responsibility for).Price. The cost was more than reasonable in my opinion and is of course subjective (had I hated it I'm sure I'd be sending this one down to cons).Cons This is an Early Access title so it does have bugs and down times (this doesn't bother me but it is a consideration).The sound design needs some work and there are times when I take my headphones off to cope.There is a steep learning curve if you haven't played this type of game before (again this is just something to consider but I'm okay with).Community. I've been trolled and encountered cheaters. There's nothing new about that in online gaming and I don't blame Bluehole provided they're making a reasonable effort to control these issues (which they are). But if these things really get to you then that's why this is in cons.Jumping over things is a frustration at the time of this review but I know this is likely to change so find out for yourself at the time of your purchase.All in all Game 7/10 and rising with each update successfully implemented.Bluehole 9/10.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PUBG as it is. I have about 60 hours In this game so far and I can easily say that its the best looking playing and operating game you'll find on Early Access this game blows its competitors out of the water being H1Z1 KOTK which PU helped work on but this game is very very polished for it being in the state its in the team really focuses on optimization and gameplay over graphics they listen to their community about what they want to see out of the game and that alone is a feat. What I hope to see. Honestly so far this game does have almost everything I personally think it should be shipped with but here are some things I wish would be added in the near future 5v5 and Up Squad Matchmaking Higher Variety in Pioneer Crates Survival of some sort or other modes (Zombie is WIP) Bigger or different maps Better in game voip Tournaments via In Game Ghile Suits are rare in the world not only airdrops Diving and other finesse moves to dodge vehicles and other actions Maybe some Aerial Vehicles Final Verdict. Overall this game is a solid fight to the death sorta deal with a lot more potential in the upcoming updates has a great replay value intense PvP the perfect example of a love/hate relationship and you can find yourself easily getting sucked in and playing countless hours before really noticing this game is on my Highly Recommend List because it is very solid game and has a great team behind it and the hype train will not die on this game as long as they keep the good updates and finding ways to change it up then they will never see a drop in players and for those of you waiting for it to go on Sale good luck the team needs all the money they can get due to company size so that being said the current price tag ($29.99) is way more than worth it for all that you're getting.9/10

review: I don't want to be the person saying its early access and it's still got some time till fill release but I am having a phenomenally good time on this game. Considering I'm playing it with an AMD Phenom II 555 with 8gb ddr3 and a gtx 970 I find the game more than playable! Theres been a lot of backlash about microtransations recently but I would point out that if you don't like it don't buy them. No one has to buy them and it makes NO difference to how the game plays they are simply clothes for your character. The fundamentals of the game mechanics are unchanged by microtransactions!Back to the game this game is quite simply one of the most intense games I've ever played. When you make it to the last circle with 2 or 3 enemies you can feel your heart almost beating out your chest. Another aspect of this game that makes it fun is to run squads with friends and lay down rules for your squad i.e pistols only cars only. When you do that it makes the game very entertaining and a great laugh.Buy this games its amazing

review: It's fun. It's tactical It's addictive. It's not easy to make a game as massive and have it run so smooth. There are still creases that need to be ironed out but that will come with time. If they carry on this route they very much have a game of the year on their hands. Potentially game of the decade. I implore anybody to try this out. If you're a fan of H1Z1 then definitely because the stuff in that game that annoys you...chances are it does not exist in this game (for me anyway). There is no real sense of "Ah this gun is too OP" that comes with a lot of these styler games. It's more a case of whatever you feel works best for you. At the moment it's a 7/10 but could easily within a few more patches become 10/10.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Hundred hour review.The developers of this game made one crucial improvement over H1Z1 You cannot exit fast moving vehicles without severely injuring or killing yourself.This tiny common sense change completely changes the gameplay. In h1z1 the game is dominated.. DOMINATED by the playstyle of folks driving at ludicrous speeds and teleporting out of their vehicles to shoot people with a tremendous positioning advantage. In BG vehicles are vital transportation but a liability in combat.They also require much more time to accelerate realistically which balances their use quite nicely.Besides the vehicle issues BG also delivers a more engaging realistic and detailed environment than h1z1. I am partial to eastern european warzones so maybe I am biased. The groudn cover is denser the lighting subtle and realistic I feel there are more unique and diverse structures that actually see use in the game the dead zone sometimes ends up in exotic locations weapons are customizable and loot crates contain rewarding hard to find equipment there are boats and above all the dev team seems pro active responsive and competent.When i come in first or second it isn't because I abused mechanics or sheer dumb luck it is because I logically used the terrain or anticipated movement based on the play area. Or what I didn't do like landi in the middle of the most desirable looting area with thirty other killers and expect that i am somehow special and favored by the gods.Game is fun. Not bored after 100 hours which you can't say about much else in the world of comnsumer entertainment.

review: Most common bug for me is aiming and firing. When I aim down site 1/2 the time it will not let me unsight unless I change my weapon.HOWEVER the MAIN bug is firing with full auto. every other magazine it will just stop firing and never let me fire any gun again for the rest of the match. It happens most often when firing in bursts but also happens when just going full auto and holding fire.Hit registration is also sketchy. most of the time it works but I find the longer the shot the less likely the registration is. I have gotten multiple headshots with a Kar98 seen blood and they don't even act they they are getting shot.The last complaint I have which isn't game breaking but still needs improvement is the grass. The render distance for grass needs to be much MUCH further than what it is now. I understand that not all machiens can render detailed grass very far but 70 100 meters is not far enough at all.If these issues are fixed I can recomend this game bus as of now I would not recomend purchasing it.

review: Optimization At this moment you need a GTX 1080 ti and a new core i7 to play it on ultra and even with this specs there are framerate drops to 30 fps. I'm playing it with a 1070 G1 and i5 at 3.2Ghz. On on some areas the cpu is working at 100% and the graphic card is only about 70% I have no bottlenecks on other games so I assume that the optimization is very bad because other games with a lot of screen elements like the witcher 3 works perfectly on my computer. So if your pc is not very fast wait for performance patchs before buy it.About the game Great potential this is one of those "just one more game" videogames. You have to be very careful on the battlefield and it would be boring for some people but exciting for others you need to get lucky finding weapons and gear as well. Sadly most of times the players who win are those ones who camps all the time or others who play on a smart but dirty way (for example parking a car and wait for someone to come and drive it to shoot them) maybe something like a hunger bar could fix the campers problem forcing you to explore the map looking for food.Another problem is that melee weapons are totally useless because damage is very bad it have to be fixed too for exemple with stealth attack executions. Some points you have to know .The gameplay still feels rough the first and third person camera needs some improvements and mouse sensitivity works strange. The servers are working good most of time wich is impresive on an early acces with thousand of players but you need a fast and stable connection to play with no lags. You will enjoy the game so much more if you play with friends so I wouldn't recommend it if you are going to play alone. Well... as I said before the game have a great potential but it's still on early acces many things have to be fixed and it's expensive so I would recommend to buy it on some months...

review: The video display is horrible controls need a rework frame rate is not consistent and it is a very buggy game.But I will still play the s**t out of it.The pacing of this game is perfect. Starting out there is a good chance you will find a reasonable early game weapon (like a shotgun) to defend yourself with. Depending on your attitude it is possible for you can get knocked out immediately or end up in the top 10 out of 100 players left alive.The game is best enjoyed with the maximum allowable party members per server which is four people or one squad. Your squad will fight to be the number one squad left alive out of at least 25 other squads. Calling out potential targets trading weapons mods and armour with your teammates over the course of a 30 minute game is what makes this such a great game. Once they fix all the bugs in the game I guarantee it will be a very popular multiplayer team based game.
