review: This game might be an early access and it could be very early for me to review it before it is being polished so this is just a Preliminary Review I don't get the fuss behind people giving negative reviews about how bad the game is no it is not at all not for me at least. I never enjoyed such a great intensity and pressure that makes me focus I admire the idea and how other games influenced developers to create such an exciting game. People rant about the challenge and how developers don't listen sometimes yes it could be sad but think from the devs' perspective if they are trying to create an e sport game that can stand they need to fill a certain criteria in order to join. We as well don't have that much e sport games in the market and dont go COD or BF bullcrap on me they are more arcadish and more easy to script so never compare a potential upcoming e sport game to a game that can be easily scripted by others just to ruin your fun time.I have other shooter games like CS GO and I had my fun time with it but this one I could play and enjoy daily just for it gives me more diversity. Yes lag issues texture issues etc issues You idiots can see with your OWN TWO BLOODY EYES it is not 100% completed and I bet you some games isn't 100% DONE and they are still on early access and pisses us off and thats my fear from the devs.The experience of this game never got me mad to the level of rage quitting like some other games in fact I love joining another round I get much better experience and better at what I do the ambient and shooting sounds is your number one target and always concentrate on quickness and the flexibility of always moving around.Last but not least either Squad or Duo the communication is vital and very vital without it you feel blind you feel you won't get the statisfaction of hunting others. The Solo Mode is a way to level up your chicken dinner game. Good luck to all of you see you in the grounds. P.S Don't Rant enjoy till it is done and then compare the early access with the finished product.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: EDIT PUBG has officially reached 2M concurent players on steam... No idea how this game is good but NEVER in my mind was this game worthy of being the top played game on the platform. Goes to show the power of twitch and the livestreaming community (and hundreds of thousands of chinese players who login everyday).A slow paced Battle Royale game more tactical and less action packed than the competition but it's also more realistic and has better visuals.First of all the solo mode is bad. I don't mean it's completely trash but it definitely doesn't feel like a game that was created with solo in mind you spend sometimes up to an hour alone listening for sounds looking for enemies in the distance trying to flank other people fighting etc. Where the game really shines is when you get your buddies involved. The fact that you can't stack things like helmets and armor makes sharing alot easier and the slow paced tactical part of the game becomes fun because you can establish a strategy and be alot more mobile. If you're looking for a BR game that focuses on duo/team but has a poor solo experience you should get PUBG (this game) but if you're looking for a good Solo with a decent duo/team i'd get H1Z1 instead. (Edit if youre looking for a more laidback/chill BR experience try Fortnite!)

review: Amazing game for people who aren't lil es. It is basically the perfect combination of H1Z1's KoTK and DayZ. Instead of being arcadey and Counter Strike twitch firing like this game heavily rewards you for playing stealthily and working with your squad. While I love H1Z1 I think PUBG is the game that every KoTK fan wanted KoTK to become eventually. I wouldn't say it's better than KoTK even though I enjoy it more but it's a really cool alternative execution of the Battle Royale idea with a fresh perspective. That is if you're not a lil tiny whiney tear machine.It has it's downsides like it's still laggy but not near as laggy as when it first came out. They are releasing patches rapidly which is quickly making the game a ton better. I have never been so happy with an early access game before and I'm one of those non puss people that can stand huge amounts of bugs for a long time. (I did play DayZ for a long time since it was a mod). The thing that sold me on this game is during the closed beta I kept finding things I didn't like about the game and the next weekend they would be tweaked or fixed. That still seems to be the case though I don't have as many things to complain about as I did then at all.Onto the gameplay it's actually VERY HARD. Not in a bad way though it can be frustrating at times because some people and squads are already very skilled but the feeling of reward for getting better is pretty amazing. It's not just a twitch fire 2 tap headshot game like H1Z1 this game requires a lot more ideas on how to approach a situation. It forces you to think in different ways especially when you're forced to run across an empty field with your squad at the very end of the game. In some ways it's a good thing but it can be equally agrivating when it seems like the safe zone circle is always against you. With that being said wins in this game are incredible especially with a squad. You definitely earn it.So with all this being said replace that filled diaper with your big boy pants if you're going to play this game. It is far from perfect but it is quickly getting there. Once they optimize the graphic performance and smooth out the lag this game will be exactly what I've been waiting for someone to make for years. If you're in for a real man's (or woman's) challenge then this is the game for you but if you regularly can't stop crying about there being in your diaper then stay the hell away from the big boys. Go play Five Nights at Freddie's or Minecraft with some 8 years olds that's where you obviously belong you damn diabolic factory of a baby.

review: A Good Buy or Not? First off this game's mechanics animations and gunplay are all great. Loot is spread out fairly map is big and the community is great! You know those games that each kill means something? It makes you feel great. Not the call of duty kill 30 people and not feeling any satisfaction from those kills. With each kill I get I feel like that kill could be a youtube video by itself! The only problem I have been having is FPS issues. My rig is definitely on the high end scale and yet I only get around 30fps on low settings and even lower when recording or streaming. This is due to poor optimization. The Dev Team has put out that this is the first thing that they will be working on so hopefully we won't have to wait long. But this is definitely a great game and I have fun with every round I play!

review: Look. I'm not going to tell you this is the best or worst game in existence. The game is fun and challenging and requires a certain degree of dedication to bring yourself up to a satisfactory level of skill. The strategies are different between 1rst person and 3rd person for example and different people enjoy the playstyles of each. This game is currently not a full release title. The optimization isn't there yet. The framerates for those gamers that don't have super computers aren't there yet. Frustration exists but the dev team is hard at work. Can you wait for it? Of course. But should you wait for it? My opinion is no. Buy this game immediately so I can headshot you from a grassy hillock at 500meters with my compensator equiped AKM. Please buy this game immediately so I can mow you down with spray fire with my micro UZI when you think you're all alone. Spend your money now I'm gonna like the way you die. I guarantee it.

review: While immensely flawed from the begining PUBG brought a new and intense gaming experience like nothing we had ever really seen before.In spite of the bugs and shoddy servers my friend and I put hundreds of hours into the game mostly playing Duo's and now we consistently rank in the Top 50 players on the leaderboards.Sadly in the last few weeks the game has become infested with hackers and Bluehole has expressed no interest whatsoever in taking serious steps to remediate the problem. Based upon the limited available evidence it appears a Chinese company Tencent has bought a 5% stake in the game to allow it to be sold in China and are creating and selling the hacks on the backend. So basically the developer is in cahoots with the hack devs. Tencent's stake purchases also coincides perfectly with the meteoric explosion in concurrent players on steam stats.While it seemed for sometime the devs actually cared about bringing the game to completion it appears this game will go the way of its predecessors Dayz Warz and H1Z1 into irrelevancy.

review: Bought this game with intent to refund as it did not run well on my older hardware but got hooked. After playing for a few hours I feel like I can make a reasonably accurate review. Pros I've found Good gameplay not just a mindlessly shoot everyone you see game requires strategical planning in order to get a good rank Amazing map massive island which allows for many styles of gameplay from stealth to maniac Very hard to turn off I just keep playing game after gameSome Cons Runs very slow at higher details on my i7 3770 and GTX660 Now at least a stable 60 80 fps in non crowded areas with ultra textures and max screenscale with Ryzen 5 1600 and GTX 1060 I seem to get quite high input lag a pain when looting and you have to go back to close doors a second time. Gone with PC upgrade although server stress can definitely affect it. Jumping is super buggy. Definitely looking forward to vaulting in a few weeks.Some suggestions set the server finder to default to the last used config instead of NA Solo. Fixed Possibly a sort of "sandbox" mode to test weapons and get a hang for the game before playing a match Also a killcam to show who killed you would also be good. review: This game from reviews popular opinion and personal opinion has the best potential out of every current battle royale game to succeed. Currently it is buggy choppy and overall unoptimized. Most early access games like this would normally be viewed as a risky investment. However the developers currently seem to have what other early access games don't have. A release date. They also are very committed to their weekly updates with bug fixes and their montly updates with fresh content providing enourmous boosts toward the finished product. The devs seem to actually be working to complete this game at a rapid but successful pace. The investment toward this game at its current state may be risky to some but I say not as the price may increase further down the road of early access during the release of more content or at the final release. In the end if you are buying now don't intend to get the best game of your life and don't expect it to live up to it's hype simply think of buying the early access as a pre order with a discount and playability. (Early Access)

review: Honestly a pretty fun and addicting game. Here are my thoughts. I will go over the Pros first.Pros Good selection of guns they all fit the balance of them.Great map comapred to King of the kill.There are structures all over the map so don't worry about being stranded with no loot.Attachments with the guns make them very good.Fun to play with friendsGreat to play if you are tired with h1z1 king of the kill.Aiming is very well first and thirdpersonCons This game really is solid for the most part but it has some flaws.Cars are pretty useless sometimes because you can not go full speed and get out if you do that you die. (It does add skill to the game though)This game for the most part needs some big performance updates. It needs some optmisation. This game is pretty good for the most part PlayerUnknown did a good job in my opnion.By the way if you can not run this game well Set all you're graphics options to "VERY LOW" and turn you're resolution down. Now that should boost some FPS. If you still are getting lag than search on youtube about how to increase FPS I have done that using this video https //www.youtube.com/watch?v 3LG78ItS1ZM&amp t 146s. review: I completely regret buying this game. I have never been so bored with a multiplayer experince in my life. You spend most of the game just sprinting towards the safe zone and if you're lucky enough to land in the safe zone you just hide in a bathroom and wait for people to walk by so you can pick them off. I managed to get into the top 3 many times just by laying behind a car for 20 minutes and even managed to get first place a few times. So very boring. It's a perma death game which is fine by me but you die very quickly in most matches and loading a new one will take you about 3 minutes on average. Also the developer is very shady. They snuck micro transactions into the game after many people bought it in early access with a promise of no micro transactions ever being implimanted. The developer also has gotten into the habit of baning players that popular twitch streamers complain about with little to no evidence of actual harrassment leading to many wrongful bans. I deleted this game from my library because I no longer wish to support this developer and I suggest you don't bother even buying it on sale for anything mor than $5.UPDATEBlue Hole is now sueing epic games because they think that owning PUBG gives them the right to every battle royal game in the genre. Do not support these devs in any way. Every bluehole game should be boycotted. They made an inferior far enferior product and instead of improving to compete with fortnite they choose to try and sue them to eliminate the competition in a very facist way. I will never buy a game made by blue hole again. I suggest you do the same.

review: I'd love to give this game a good review however with constant broken promises the ban happy mods and DLC in an early access I just can't. The devs of this game will take the side of a streamer if you just so happen to kill one in game. It's so bad to the point that the devs themselves literally admit the accusation is unprovable. However expect a 7 dat ban if you happen to get so unlucky as to kill a person that's standing in the community. Streamers themselves admit to getting tens of people banned with no evicence on their part other than simply playing the game and them being killed.The DLC for an early access game is simple terrible. They have the audacity to charge $30 for this game (Half the price of triple A yet a fraction of the content). At this point it's clear the devs are more interested in shaking as much money as they can out of the community rather than provide timley content.The devs promised no micro transaction a simple AND keeplable promise yet are somehow unable to do just that. Any promise should be taken with a grain of salt as it's clear they can't even keep the most simple of promises of inaction.Aside from all of this it's a simple map not worth the price tag.

review: Product received for free. Having a blast in this game fun attachments and a lot of variety in guns.However Before I get bashed for this realize that I love this game and only want it to improve and since people are writing so many goddamn positive reviews saying this game is awesome and perfect I don't mind people saying its a good game what I do mind is that people are giving it perfect reviews due to the hate towards h1z1 (which I also own) just because this game is better then h1z1 does not mean its perfect. And trust me I enjoy this game quite a lot however there is many improvement to be made like the following The servers are sometimes so bad they will not load in textures.And the game runs ok (this game needs more optimization anyone with a 950 do not buy this game my friends can barley run it at lowest settings)My specs GTX 960 SSC 4gbCPU I5 6600k16gb of ballistic ram.My Battleground Settings Very low shadows High Foliage medium antialiasing Ultra Post processing Render scale 120 Texture Ultra. and an average of 45 to 50 frames.Conclusion This game needs a lot of work and I hope they update and make frequent changes the game is not excused for being early access I take this as a weak shield to deflect critism. This game needs improvements If you have extra money and you don't really know any other games to buy then buy this game as long as you have a 960 or higher (preferably a 970 or 980) and your cpu is a ryzen or i5 intel series. (sorry for any amd gpu users I have no idea what graphics card from amd side runs this game well just look up some videos)Hope this review is helpful and please don't hate this review as I said I only criticize it for improvment.(edit I do enjoy this game BUT MANY GAMES are almost unplayable and so that is why I choose a negative review Its very fun but if im not enjoying half my games then its not worth a positive review.

review: First Impressions after 3 hours of gameplay Positive Definitely a very very promising game that already kept me rooted to my seat for 3 hours straight. Did I say It's a LOT of fun especially when you team up with some friends. Gameplay is like DayZ but more fast paced. The map is big but there's a nice feeling of panic and paranoia when the "green zone" gets smaller and forces the players to keep moving. Surviving requires a good amount of tactical thinking co operation (if playing with friends) outsmarting your opponents and stealth. Dicking around or choosing your landing point poorly when prachuting from the plane WILL get you killed. There's a decent amount of weapons to be found and you can customize most of them. Each weapon feels different they have different kind of recoil and there's nothing like hitting a half naked guy in the face with a frying pan and taking his Red Bull. Graphics and sounds are nice but there's still room for improvement. Gameplay feels pretty good definitely more smooth than ARMA but there are some moments where it feels a bit clunky. If you die you can just exit the game and join a new one.Negative Dying within the first two minutes still sucks. Had some FPS drops but overall the game runs pretty smoothly on my rig. Luckily the devs are trying to fix this already but those with low to mid range rigs might want to wait for the patch. Didn't run into any game breaking bugs but had to restart it once when the main menu failed to load. The game is fun but needs more content and variety before I can imagine spending +100 hours with it. It can get quite repetitive pretty fast especially if you play solo and lose the tactical squad aspect of the game. It's a bit pricey for early access but after trying it out I don't mind showing the devs some love.My specs Intel i7 6700KGTX107016GB DDR4SSD drives
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is by FAR the best tactical shooter out. Play with a squad of friends and you won't want to stop playing. This game is very addictive. My only problem at the moment is servers are laggy at times but I figure it will get ironed out soon and this game will be my favorite game of 2017.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The Game itself isn't that bad of an idea considering what he did on Arma 3 but when you take to account that the game is really buggy and the MPs and Shotguns are really overpowered compared to the Rifles the story chances quite dramatically... I often see myself dying in a situation I know where he will come from me with better gear (M4 Lvl 3 Vest and Helmet) should easily win these kinds of situations but I often just die so much faster from a Vector or UMP that i could rarerly even hit him 2 3 Times... the game isnt really that good yet. review: Let me start off by saying that This is a good game dont get me wrong. But there are many problems to be found in it.1. optimization is little to non existant.(while droping from the plain frame rate can to drop all the way down to 1fps)2. Its either got hacker or really bad netcode.(it takes me a whole mag that has hit with at least 6 bullets to kill someone and takes them 2 shots to kill me with the same weapon)3. The Zone appears to be either 20 feet away from you or 20 miles away thus not giving players a chance to get into the play zone unless they have a car or a boat.4. The lag is there wheather your internet speed is 1000mbps or 500kbps you will encounter lag that makes the game unplayable.(keeps teleporting you back to the same spot you were at 4 seconds ago)NOTE This is a GOOD game but there is still quite a bit of fixing up to do.Conclusion At the game's current state i would not recomend to buy it. i would wait untill they fix some problems.

review: PLAYERUNKNOWNS BATTLEGROUNDS Ive clocked over 1200 hours on arma 3 now before you stop reading its all connected dont worry. Playerunkown created the battleroyale mod on arma 3 which i played extensivley and thoroughly enjoyed it was one of a the best mods out there for arma 3. When i heard of battlegrounds being in the works i made sure i had all the updates and i bought it on realease from day 1 i enjoyed this game as much as i enjoyed my 1000+ hours on arma 3 although at first i was running around as a naked little man with no clue of how to do anything. after playing for a good 50 hours i managed to get my first top 5 and i felt like i was the dovakihn having just been chosen by the greybeards. But the best was still to come as i made friends through the community and played in squads and duos experiencing a more immersive and hilarious at the least experience. To put it simply this game is the bomb yes it has its kinks like cars blowing up inside walls and severe lag spikes and fps drops on a rare occurance but for a game in pre release state having only been out for little over 5 months the development team have done an amazing job at balancing gameplay improving performance and adding to the game diversity with guns vehicles and more. if you have some money you dont know what to do with throw it at your computer and buy this game. its worth it to hear all the chatting in the lobby before you enter a game. (i lie the start lobby is the most aids place youll ever be placed into in the gaming world but its fine becuase youll soon be transported by a one way plane journey to your death) )

review: PUBG is a typical battle royale style game. Here's a short rundown of a typical match in case you're not familiar. You start in a plane flying over a large island. You choose when to jump out to skydive/parachute to a location on the map. You don't have any weapons so you're best of looting nearby buildings in search of weapons &amp ammunition kevlar vest &amp helmets and healing items. Every couple of minutes the playable zone on the island gets smaller and smaller. If you're outside this zone you will take damage and eventually die. The objective is to be the last one alive there is no respawn.If you like the battle royale genre you will like this game. Stop reading this review and look up the technical problems and bugs this game has to make sure they're not dealbreakers to you.If you don't like battle royal genre you won't like this game.If you have no idea whether or not you like this genre read on.I personally dislike the battle royale genre and this game does nothing to fix the issues it has. However it is probably the best iteration of that genre on the market right now. It hits that sweet spot between realistic &amp arcadey gameplay. If you've always been curious about this type of game I'd recommend PUBG above H1Z1 or the battle royale mod in Arma 3. This genre can deliver some absolutely thrilling moments but it pales in comparison to the amount of downtime you have to sit through.The 2 main reasons I dislike the genre and as such PUBG are as follows 1) The game does not sufficiently promote interaction between players.A core component of multiplayer games is interacting heavily with your fellow players be it fighting them or cooperating with them. Very few multiplayers games don't do this. PUBG suffers in my eyes because I don't feel compelled to fight other players most of the time. This is a problem because that is the main reason you'd want to play a game like this. You collect weapons armor and so on to use it against others. There are multiple reasons why this problem exists Any kill you get has a very low impact on the total number of remaining players. Even getting 10 kills (which is quite a lot for one round) means there are 89 other people who are still around to kill you.Engaging other players gives away your position and exposes you to attacks from other players.No respawn adds a massive amount of tension to the game but also means that every engagement is very high risk. Even if you are very good at PUBG and you have a 80% chance to win every gunfight you take you only have to lose one of them to lose the entire round.Engaging other players consumes resources such as ammo and healing items. There's no guarantee that you can loot the person you just killed to get that stuff back.You can often times land in locations that won't have many other people in them and loot to your heart's content. If you actively avoid conflict you can make it to the smaller zones almost every single round without having fought any other players while still having good loot. This is probably the most important reason why interaction is easily avoided. You'd expect there to be two types of areas high risk high loot and low risk low loot. However there's a third low risk high medium loot. Why take the risk for high loot items when you can acquire similar gear with lower risk? The balance here is entirely out of whack. 2) The developers are adding microtransactions in their 30 early access game even though they promised they wouldn't until release. gamasutra.com These skins will not be obtainable via ingame currency. i.redd.it I'm not a fan of the CSGO system (even though I've indulged in it to an extreme degree) but the developer doing this even before launch when they explicitly said they wouldn't is enough to turn me off from this game. The only reason I will continue to play it is because my friends won't play anything else. Such is life.

review: to preface i haven't been able to play a game for more than 10 minutes in just about a year now because i just lost interest in gaming. After some convincing from my friends i got this. first night i got it we played for 3 hours straight the next day i was off work and school and it was my birthday so i played solo for about 3 4 hours and played squad mode with 3 friends for about 8 hours off and on. this game has that little something you can't explain that makes it so good. It's like when your momma makes dinner and you can taste the love in it. If you're new to this type of game i like to think of it like streamlined DayZ where you cant respawn and the goal is to be the last one alive. the gunplay is great the firefights are intense and whether you play alone or with friends there is always action around the corner and fun to be had. The only bad thing as of now is the optimization like the framerate actually is pretty good once you get past the beginning of the match but in the beginning most of the time when i land i can't get into houses to loot yet because the houses haven't loaded in yet so i just gotta walk around for a minute or so and wait for them to load but i did see that an optimization patch is planned for april 7th. Overall this game will have you coming back and back again and it is a blast i would would recommend it to anyone.

review: PUB is the very definition of 'Refinement" to the Battle Royal Genre. Generally we've seen it been modded into Arma 3 a custom game variant that became H1Z1 King of the Kill to quite a few games just trying it out but PUB takes it to a level that is worth the try.There is Steam Refund for a reason! I haven't played much but from the very few latest patches they have added into it is quite up to the quality we expected in an early access game.FRYING PANS CAN SAVE YOUR . LITERALLY! A simple detail yet worth every penny in a way.Graphics is quite what you expect lush scenery with dense foliage. Quality in textures and though performance isn't it's key currently in the future they promised to address to the performance issues over the course of it's development. Even just to show that performance is being constantly worked on the new latest patch was a big one to help increase performance in alot of areas and so far my experience has had no problems.For the price 29.99$ I think it is a STEAL! This game can soon eventually turn into something bigger and better within the coming 6 8 months. It's understandable why you would want to wait but I believe you would enjoy the experience now along side with us in this wacky NOT Softcore nor Hardcore Battle Royal Game. It is a well polished game from a Early Access View (Suprisingly!) and all it's general mechanics work. Sure rage moments will happen but the game makes you feel "Aw it was just a game no biggie losing" but would still make you want to go for the feeling of "ONE. MORE. ROUND!".A fun shooter to enjoy with friends up to 3 to join you in a Battle Royal.#DamFukinWorthIT

review: More refinements are needed.Good Points 1. The Creative way and Unique experience of battle especially with friends.2. Intense Gameplay.Bad Points 1. The Optimization sucks. My laptop with Geforce 960m graphic card can only run the lowest quality with 48FPS. You kidding me? Everytime I play this game The garbage textures and models make me feel disguested. If the superior laptop can only play with garbage graphics how about other laptop players? Do they need to buy Alienware? My laptop is able to play Overwatch with epic graphic 60FPS but PUBG enables me to cook eggs on my laptop! Besides I noticed that usually when I move from one big area to another my screen just paused for a second because it need to load new staff on the map. It would be a big problem if I was in a fight.2. THE WAITING TIME SUCKS. Everytime I died I have to wait for 8Mins to go back to the battleground again. And the possibility of being killed at the very beginning is 6 out of 10. Even if you survived the first few minutes you died easily with no kills or only 1 or 2 kills unless you are very good at playing this game. Besides This game is not a game for hiding sometimes people got shot from nowhere and the direction is not clear when you get shot. So I mean what really sucks is YOU LOOT THINGS FOR HUNDREDS OF HOURS and SHOOT FOR SEVERAL MINUTES and EVERYTHING IS GONE IN A SECOND and sometimes you don't know who killed you where he was and how did he do it...These are the things that the player need to know after they died in the game. But the camera just faces the ground leaving the confusion and disappointment to the player. 3. The server sucks. It's laggy sometimes when I was killing someone. Sometimes the server just dont response when I was going back from the game to the main menu so I have to open the task manager and the task manager doesn't work because I can't click on it. So I can only restart my computer everytime this thing happens.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game can be just as frustrating to play as it is fun. You can land out of the plane and die within 20 seconds or you can survive longer hunting for all the weapons and ammo in the world only to be taken out whilst having your inventory open or by that annoying blue field of death. Yes its a great way of making players zone into one area for more action but come on does it have to continue all the way down to a few feet in diametre! why not use the zoning area until there is say 20 players left in still a decent size area to continue being tactical without having to just dash out in the open because of that frustrating blue field. I know this is so far just a battleroyal style game but I hope they somehow introduce other game modes/ways of playing in the final release because this game is getting repetative already after 10 hours of play. few other things id like to see in the final product. killcam replay. option to watch the rest of the game until the end. better customization of player.Overall worth playing altho im not convinced its worth 26.99.

review: Holy ing as a guy who loved to play H1Z1 King of the Kill I tried this game under the beta."Not bad got some issues but I like it"Then early access came around and I finally bought it!160 Hours later I have come to a conclusion of this game.After losing countless amounts of friends after trash talking them because of their ing lack of ability to give directions where enemies are. After countless of lobbies where my eardrums has heard the delightful sounds of "RYAN GET ON THE DISCORD" "FOLLOW ME I AM A SNAKE" and not to mention the old classic "CHINA NUMBA WAN"After a nefty amount of chicken dinners some eaten by myself and some with friends.The phrase "RIP H1Z1" as many states does not do this game just.PUBG is a man who publicly humiliated the poor H1Z1 then proceeded to stab him until he was dead.But it was not enough PUBG had the audacity to take a GIANT TURD on the grave of H1Z1.And you know what? People cheered PUBG on as he rode into the sunset.10/po isrsly though devs are listening and are fixing bugs and server side issues. And adding new guns can't wait for the 2 new maps!

review: Imagine this you and two other friends are in a game you drop down to the military base one of your friends go to school because he forgot his lunch box. And the last goes to the shooting range to control their spray pattern. The barrier comes and is thirsting for blood. You try to run to your friends who are trying to survive by themselves. Luckily one of your friends finds a car and saves you from being swallowed from the blue barrier.You drive to your final friend who's in a gun fight with a group of people. You and your allies hold them off in a valiant battle. Surviving to be in the top ten. It's almost time for a all out war in the tiny circle. Grenades! Gunshots! Chaos! It's a firefight in the circle. One of your allies goes down you try covering your friends and end up zooming in to someone's head and fire... You're the winners of this battle royale and will dine on chicken dinner tonight. You can experience this with your friends and acheive victory!

review: As of right now this game is great! For early access and being out for less than a week I can say that this game is going places and can probably replace H1Z1 eSports. However and I know that this is a fresh out of the oven game I don't think that this game should be like Battlefield 1 and 'require' a 6700k/7700k processor in order to run smoothly. I have an i7 4790k processor that has been in my computer for roughly 2 years and I feel that that alone should be able to run this game at a decent rate. The key thing here is optimization as I also have run into plenty of bugs that either won't load buildings/entities properly or just kill my game completely. In conclusion this game has plenty of potential and is already quite enjoyable but it needs time.PS Also every single time I've run into these types of serious bugs I've been playing solo. The worst I've gotten while playing duos was just really bad FPS.TL DRPros Great ideaMassive potentialNice balance of community and competitive scenesWAAAAAAYY better than H1Z1 could ever dream of beingLeaderboards!Cons O P T I M I Z A T I O NHeavy lag at the start of every gameConstant FPS drops 100ms worth of lag whenever I try to pick up somethingSolo games are bug infested (for me anyways)A bit steep on the price at $36.99 CADSuggestions If PU were to add OPTIONAL MICROTRANSACTIONS (which they might have to as you need a continuous revenue stream on games) either make them marketable or make them very inexpensive (50 cents to $1).Alright thats gonna do it. I hope this game gets more optimization soon and I hope you guys will consider buying it!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Absolutely Amazing Only A Few Issues With Framerates Hold This Game Back. When They Put A little Optimization Updates And Make The Game Run Smoother It Will Be Pure Gold. 40 Hours And I'm In Love With This Game. 2 Solo Wins And 1 Duos Win.

review: I love the game a ton but there is one thing that is starting to bother everyone now..... The amount of hackers that are rolling in seriously about 7 of 10 of my games have someone either aim botting or speed hacking. Speed hacking is by far the most rediculous as you can't even hit the person yet alone make sure to not blink otherwise you won't see them. I know this is a beta game but if you don't take action now on the hackers or put on some sort of guard like other games do where the servers can predict you're hacking if the people are using certain programs. review: Going to keep a short review for this one I'm sure many know the details of the game and if you don't just check out some youtube videos which will help you!. This game I'm going to say is worth the money not just because it's a fun and realistic FPS game but you know the devs are behind their title and are listening to OUR feedback. Which in todays gaming industry that's a luxury! one that I think the moaning babies who play this forget. You have multiple world wide servers to choose from so it caters to players all over pretty much you can play alone double team or squads with your friends which is always fun and eventful!. It's a great game with a fantastic mix of realism fun and some seriously nail biting moments. There are issues with the game but they're being stamped out and none that I need to point out in the game. My biggest issues are actually just how the game is played and thankfully the devs are adding things to basically help players like myself who don't enjoy the 3rd person aspect all the time. So soon for this game is the 1st person mode which restricts you from going 3rd person and leaves you only with your front view of your weapons. This is much morer realistic and changes the game almost completely in terms of how it's played No more cheese players hiding behind walls unseen and being able to watch you then pop you in the back of the head. You will be forced to peek a corner if you want to see what's around it making for a much more tense experience. Basically that's my only issue and it's not really something I find an issue it's just I wish I had the 1st person game mode option and as I mentioned it's being added!. So if you do this game you have many many hours to put in and not only for enjoyment but if you're competitive you'll want to really master your gun skill in this game and you will feel yourself improving as time goes on. Which is a great feeling and it's awesome when you rack up the kills and win. There's allot coming to this game and If you buy it You wont regret it!.

review: Great game much potential.Things that have to be done in order to not lose player count optimization maybe a whole engine switch ue4 will never run great on low/medium settings it should be playable without stuttering or texture bugs with 8GB of dram item hitbox fix (sometimes when you drop something it get's stuck and you can't pick it back up or they spawn that way)If you have a i5 older than 4th gen less than 10gb of ram and no ssd don't even think you're not gonna experience stuttering and texture loading issues hopefully the game will run well in the next 3 months!!!In the current state I don't recommend it but once it is optimised and improved I will definetely change my review!!!EDIT August 16thWith the last update my frames improved a lot.. a total of an average 15 20fps so I am getting around 80fps in big cities and 110 in the wild.However I still don't suggest people to buy the game!UE4 can't hold an open world game that's why we are getting many bugs like textures not loading if your writing speed of the HDD isn't fast enough.That's why people are buying SSDs only for thsi game.With the lack of optimization and poor coding the developers broke one of their most important promises.They clearly told everyone that there won't be any microtransactions until the game is fully released out of early access.They sold over 5 million copies and their profit is estimated at around 150 000 000$.They added microtransactions while still in EA to "fund their tournament'.Now I'm starting to ask myself how much money employees get or how much money PLAYERUNKNOWN is keeping to himself.EDIT2 2018 July 6th STILL

review: Id say its time to review this glory of a gameWelcome to PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds a Hunger Games/DayZ/CoD styled theme which actually fits itthis is primarily you versus 99 others or you can get more lucky and have you and one other friend versus 49 other teams or lastly teams of 4 where you must help destroy what 24 other teams? It gets hectic you learn your personal playstyleWhat weapons are considered OP by yourself what isntStrategies to win etc.For awhile youll likely be frustrated I didnt win my first match until last night made consistent top 10s never that number one until I got into a duo with a friend of mine together her and I killed 12 of those players even 6 a piece.Things that would be useful picking what maps you see. I cant stand the desert map. Maybe change how the whole firing through windows thing goes if we spot a player in our secluded area why cant we crouch tall enough to fire through a window instead of the darn windowsill? no logic guys!All in all wonderful game ill likely play it for a very long time but there will be a point the game dies so the devs should look into a form of 'offline' mode where it spawns 99 other bots instead of varied skillI know its alot of work but these are wonderful devsGLWS PlayerUnknownEveryone else I look forward to seeing you in game

The map is huge so it's easy to forget that the game starts with 100 players but this also means that it sometimes lacks action until later in the game once the playing field gets smaller.Solo mode is good but would strongly recommend starting out with a team of (at least) 2 players even if just to get used to the map.Still in early access so I'm sure it has plenty more changes to be made. Definitely a game headed in the right direction.

review: This game is very fun. It's still a work in progress. Whether playing solo or with friends each game you play feels like a unique journey. Duo or squad games are incredibly fun to play with friends. The playerbase in general is very light hearted and fun. Playing solo in a public lobby has me interact with many unique characters. We run around in the warmup say some silly then jump out of a plane and fight to the death. There's no salt or negative attitudes. Would recommend.

review: I really liked PUBG originally but with the announcement of Microtransactions (which I'm not going to cover here because other reviewers have already said everything that needs to be said about that.) I decided to write this due to a post I saw on the PUBG subreddit that made me want to vomit. To summarize this briefly a guy and his friend were playing PUBG and made the mistake of killing two streamers. The streamers got upset and accused the guy of stream sniping and then the streamer's viewers went and reported him for the alleged offense. He was then handed a 7 day ban. He claims that he had no idea who these guys were and wasn't stream sniping. Whether or not he was stream sniping really doesn't matter all that much. What does matter is that even though there is no way to prove someone is stream sniping the developers still banned this guy because they value the opinions of twitch streamers over everyday customers. So if you decide to purchase this game be aware that you are rolling the dice every time you shoot at someone or throw a grenade because if it happens to be a popular streamer you can look forward to a 7 day ban.

review: PUGB. In lobby random white guy with an undercut punches you 32 times Go to plane carefully plan where you're going to drop off. 6 other people had the same idea Battle royale ensues fist some people in the face while they are trying to pick up guns You survived Oh EMP. Better run within the white circle You gather many things you equip yourself with all the best in rural russian technology. (Which is actually pretty damn good why do these people in the middle of Russia have military grade assault rifles? Don't question it.) 23 people left. You know this is your chance you'll go down in history as one of the greatest 18 people left. All 18 people are in this tiny white circle. Things are intense. A half naked man crowbars you to death as you vainly attempt to shoot at his bare chest and miss as he strafes and spins around you in a graceful dance of death You're on your knees knowing no one is there to revive you and you are at Pig_Benis_99's mercy Eye contact is made with his stained white underwear. A thick indian accent comes out. "u snooze u loose stoopid" as he finishes you with a swift stroke of his crowbar.tl dr You go hard and gather all this amazing gear then get the kicked out of you by some naked guy with a crowbar. That's kind of what happens in this game.

review: Going into PUBG you're probably thinking Oh this is that H1Z1 and Arma gametype. You're right!It's got some improvements over the old and some areas still not improved to where expected. Theres three official game types and a number of custom server types. I'll cover the pros and cons per section Squad CombatThis is the most played type. You can que up officially as Solo Duo or Squads of 4 (You will be auto paired if you quo for a team by yourself) drop into a map find weapons try to survive. You will compete against other players and/or squads to do this and often will drop into an area with others and immediatly have to try to fight or flight your way out of it. There is some meta to what to grab what attachments to prioritize etc. But it comes down to a hair of luck and a hair of skill. Communication with your team mates is vital using map pings and Voip (Ingame voice communication exists too.) In custom modes they can alter weapons to specific types or all melee or no weapons at all! Allowing for some forced creativity on victory.Pros High Adrenaline fun push you to the edge of your seat as you go from calm and collected to panicking each time a shot whizzes past your head. Relatively stable servers while there will be some graphical glitches or lag at times I've never exprienced a full ping drop or server crash that wasn't a private server. Lots of weapons to pick from and learn what guns work for you while making due with weapons you despiiizzzeee.Cons There is friendly fire which often means a team mate can just kill you for fun because you have a gun they want or you're the odd man out on a three man group. Or because they wanna ruin their team's fun and run it one man. They can even do it because they are just racist/prejudice trolls. Sometimes you will die to nothing or to complete lag. You can duck past a corner and be in the clear but because on the other's screen you're still in view... Well pop goes the weasel. Custom servers are usually terrible to join. Mostly because its 80% randoms against a team who work together with voip and set up the map's rules so they know EXACTLY what will be in play just not where.ZombiesRecently added and only avaliable as a custom mode. A team of humans must survive against a near hundred zombies. Zombies get no means of protecting themself but are legion. They can break doors but pickup no items. Players still follow the standard rules. Compared to normal this is a different approach but without good co ordination becomes a cat and mouse game where the zombies get scattered and have no idea where humans are until they get picked off.Sadly I can not pro/con this as currently it is just a heavilly flawed gametype. As it's a custom mode usually the humans will all be the creator and his friends. If you EVER get to be the human consider yourself blessed. Following that you're going to experience the same as normal modes but with a massive handicap. Zombie teams teamkill CONSTANTLY. They don't seem to care they will teamkill each other then other zombie teams until the humans get a free win. Threats of being banned off the custom server fall empty since they will either not be banned or just find a new server to troll on. In it's current state I suggest ignore.Overall the game is high tension fun and despite my gripes I heavilly enjoy it. Even when I get TK'd and have to watch my team and grin when they get whats coming to them.Suggestions for the devs Remove Team Damage. Theres far too many teamkillers and currently it serves no real purpose to be able to kill your own team. There is no reprocutions for it pre made teams are using it to farm items and weapons off of a single pug who they will drop in a heartbeat Zombie mode is incredibly flawed because of the TK happy zombies. In most situations a player won't intent to hurt their team mate and accidentally shooting them is rare. But its become incredibly frustrating to que up get in game then drop just to get to play for five minutes before your own team mate shotgun blasts you in the head because you picked up the Vector or because they think you're going to weight them down later. Fix Zombies. Right now it is virtually UNPLAYABLE for anyone but the humans. Zombies have no way to universally communicate with each other they kill each other all the time (see above) and end up running around aimlessly. Atleast restrict the map faster or add some kind of indication for all zombies to see whenever a human player is spotted by a zombie. OR Increase zombie melee damage because right now its pointless to try to gank a human as one squad. Optional Punish teamkillers. Accidental purpose doesn't matter. If there is a punishment its currently not working. Lock them out of games for awhile after a teamkilling make them unable to use two primaries something. Right now no one cares no one has insentive to stop. I'm fine with accidentally being sniped or being shot over good reason by a teammember. But when its not even the first five minutes and I get gunned down from behind and when I ask why their logic being and I quote "Thanks for the sniper ." then being gunned to death mode... Yeah thats going to kill you in longivity quickly.Overall Playerunknown's Battlegrounds is a fun game in early development still that I do recommend you buy. The Dev team do listen to the complaints and criticism and even add things based on popular demand but you will be facing a lot of headaches going forward. You will not win often but when you do it will be the sweetest victory.Also? boats. Just 'm.

review: Let's get things straight. I had 90 hours on the closed beta and got pretty worn out of it. I had 20 wins as solo 15 wins duo a 6 win streak with a buddy and a high of a 12 kill win (SOLO that was actually the WR in EU servers for a short peroid of time). All of these games came from hundreds of played games of course. I enjoyed the time I played and decided to play a couple months later(present day) but I came to the realization that this game was very repetative and was lacking something. I could go on to say stupid uneducated things about this game (and how the silencer is too strong in such a tactically filled game ) but I've summed it up to be 99% faith in yourself 1% actual chance (this is not actual but exaggerated). Out of the 100 players all of them have an equal and similar opportunity to dome you from somewhere you have no idea to find a better gun then you in the early game and to sneak up behind you (maybe that is the beauty of the game itself)? Problem is there is little to no skill gap in the game. The learning curve for this game is pretty simple. Doesn't take much of a player to point at click at a guy who is running in a field because the zone wasn't in his favor or he was "unlucky." However My reasoning for this game not requiring a lot of skill is in the Early Mid game where you have to loot. You can get killed because of the luck in the early game due to someone finding a M4 them finding a vest a helment (etc) and you only finding a pistol. However on the opposite side of the spectrum if you kill the person with the M4 that took skill. Skill is when you actually kill someone who has better loot than you or you get "lucky" and see the other player before they see you. We can all agree most of the kills in this game can be broken down into one sentence You see the person first or they see you. I mean at the E3 interview the interviewer made a comment saying "Thank you for experiences for both the joy of winning and well the joy of a bullet flying through my head from no where and i'll never know why." Brendan Green's response? "You got to love and enjoy the salt." This game is getting a reputation of exactly what I am pointing out. This game is almost too tactical to a point where if forces you to camp because you don't want to die you know? You don't want to be seen so you elimante the factor of sight. On the other hand the game doesn't reward risky players or players who run out in open fields and push houses to kill players.Aggresive players 9/10 times die because the game is meant for a slower pace. So lets take the top 10 players. They are the best they play tactically well and they know when to be aggresive and when not to be. The "average" win ratio of the TOP 10 PLAYERS IN THE GAME is 16%. Meaning out of about 6 games if you are "one of the best" you will win 1 game. Obviously you aren't going to win every game and thats not the arguement i'm making. I am simply stating that to win and actually enjoy the "chicken dinners" is going to take (statistically) 6 games which compliments my argument of stating that most of the wins come down to luck. Now the late game is just positioning based off luck on where the zone closes. There is no arguing that. Late game you have loot it all comes down to these last couple zones. If you were lucky enough to get this far then your death will be even more frustrating because you've just played for 30 minutes looting camping killing 3 4 players who you either saw first or killed because they were unlucky or dumb players exposing themselves. Then boom your dead. Try again next time! But but what about the insane clips of people killing people from hundreds of meters away? I agree that took skill. You don't see that very often HOWEVER it took an immense amount of luck for those conditions and factors to perfectly align hence the reason those clips are highlighted. What's next... you can't have perfect positioning in this game. Period. UNLESS you are lucky. Your chances are SIGNIFICANTLY increased if the zone closes around you. I mean it's a video game at the end of the day personally I don't want to loot for 45 minutes and then end up in a top 5 situation where I get domed into the back of the head where I have no counter play too. Unless however you get a level 3 helment which is rare unless you search tons of houses to find it. But then whats the point of level 1 and level 2 helments if you can get domed from an uncommon gun (Kar)? You can't predict the zone and maybe that is why this game is intriguing? It's all chance. In the end if you enjoy doing the same looting over and over again and dying hundreds of times to get 5 10 wins you'll enjoy this game. I only see the game as a game to play with friends otherwise don't play the game. My recommendation is to wait a year or so before the game is completely finished. Maybe it will be more enjoyable then. I' not going to pull the "buggy" card because thats unlogical and plain stupid considering going into buying the game we know that it is an early access however the game as it is is buggy and needs work. Not to mention the cheaters but that will get fixed soon. I just giving my honest opinion and you can take it how you want to but I don't expect a lot of good responses considering how "brain washed" everyone is about this game. Obviously my opinion isn't the right one but it is defiantly relatable.

review: Absolutely worth the asking price even for an EA game. I have had so many genuinely intense moments playing this game that I would definitely recommend this to anyone who enjoys shooters. The gunplay is well done and the options of gear keeps the game interesting from match to match. In my 40 hours of play I have had two crashes and a handful of instances where the opening menu bugs out. I have not encountered any of the server issues that several people seem to have problems with. I do have to run the game on low settings to get a smooth framerate but it still looks decent. Still requires some heavy optimization but so far I haven't lost due to anything I would consider unfair. Personally no deal breakers here because the gameplay is phenomenal.Get it if You like intense pvpYou enjoy gaming moments that leave your heart pounding and jitteryYou like strategizing about how to approach situationsDon't get it if You need a polished/bug free experienceYou're a sore loser (you will "lose" a majority of your matches)As long as you can accept that this game is being worked on and it isn't perfect you will have some truly amazing experiences. Yes it is frustrating to have a game crash or freeze when you're engaged in a firefight but if you're not willing to deal with a chance of that happening then do not get this game right now.

review: Okay So after approx 200 hrs in this game i would find myself time to review it.Battlegrounds is a very good game apart from it being in the Early Access zone of the production of the game.It has many bugs but thats just a part of the game. (it being as already told in early access.)Pros Devs listens to fans/players Very fun game (Better with friends) Actually non toxic community Updates every month (and patches) And the game is a very balanced when it comes to skill and luck.Cons Bugs (obviously) Bugs are the only Cons i could think of actually.So my review has come to an end where i shall mix up all the things i've said about it and give my personal ratings. Battlegrounds is a perfect balanced game when it comes to everything from graphics to gameplay. It has perfect weapon balance and lovely gameplay mechanics. PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds are one of the best or not THE BEST Battle Royale game you cant get out there. I rate it a good 9.5/10.Thanks for reading my review and have a good game if you are purchasing this beautiful game.

review: This is my first battle royale game so I can't really compare it to other games from the same genre. The game is very intense and not for anyone who is easily frustrated by deaths. Any small mistake can give you away and firefights have high stakes since you can die very quickly. Regardless of me being a newcomer the game is incredibly fun and rewarding when you manage to last into the later stages of the game. There is a thrill in luckily finding some good loot or killing someone with really good loot. The systems and basic flow of the game can easily be learned in two or three matches tops and everything is streamlined into looking at the map and managing your inventory.The only cons I can really give are that the performance is pretty bad. You have to tweak many settings to medium or low in order to make it run smooth. It can still get choppy at times but overally it's decently stable and playable it just won't look like Crysis or anything. The devs have been continually working and will continue to work on performance optimization as this is an early access game. It doesn't hinder my enjoyment of the game.Overall it's a really great game and if you're even slightly interested after watching someone stream it on Twitch or something definitely pick it up. P.S. I've only played it solo and it still manages to be fun must be even funner with a duo or squad.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Was anticipating this game ever since it was all over twitch. I came from mostly playing H1Z1 kotk and since have unistalled that game. Not that it's a bad game but I just enjoy this one so much more I never desire to play H1 anymore. This game plays more tactically and slower paced so keep that in mind. If you want a more arcadey fast paced twitchy shooter you should probably get H1. If you want a more slow paced game this is for you. While it is still early access it feels great. A new patch jsut recently came out which gave me about a 20 fps boost. The game feels great and when you die you dont feel like its because of BS but simply beacause the other player was better in that situation. I can't wait to see how the developers continue to improve this game. Seems like the only way is up. $30 well spent!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Extremely buggy. PUBG has killed me so many times because of stupid bugs. When i join the game nothing seems to load fast enough and i get like 1 15 fps for a period of like 10 seconds to 2 minutes. I have a gtx 1060 enough ram and a good cpu so this shouldent be happening. This happens like right when i touch the damn ground so i either get killed right away or have to sit there waiting for the world to load. Also after playing a few games the loading screen simply freezes and I have to Cntrl+Alt+Dlt and sign out for my PC to do anything. Since the new update terrible things have happended. My game crashes almost every game halfway through. It either says "Your files are corrupted" or simply crashes without notice. Its literally the most annoying thing ever. I tried almost every *FIX* youtubers have reccomended but none of em have worked. For some stupid reason these bugs arent there first priority and the devs decided to add FPP and other gay guns before they fixed these bugs AND the devs lied about microtransactions. BUT the game itself is extremely good and very addicting at that. The devs have listened to the community (Somewhat) and have fixed and added great new mechanics in the last few months. Overall I say get it when its finished. Its much to buggy and everyone is a bit irritated with the devs. SOOO yeah get it when its finished. Im af at this game rn. &gt (
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I will cut right to the chase. I have searched far and wide for a game like this... The tactical play style with just enough action to keep you on your feet and your mind engaged. This game is truly a test of mental strategy from the very beginning dropping out of the plane at a point at which you choose (I find this better than H1's system of random drops) to the end game with your heart racing as you search around you for other players. I very much enjoy the game even in the slightly buggy state it's in. As someone who has played countless clones of this style of game I can assure you this is the very best implementation of the battle royale system on steam. Period. I can't wait to see where player unknown takes it from here. With the addition of new maps weapons and features I see this game hitting the top of the charts for a long long time.

review: Amazing game! Completely adds a new dimension to online multiplayer shooters. Thinking this game will make it very far especially with the talk of cross platform gameplay. I also love the fact that I can play this game with decent framerates on a GTX 965M 4gb. I do like that the unlockable content does not give the edge to someone that has played the game for thousands of hours which keeps the game competative. Winning a game is hard neigh impossible for new players perhaps there could be a training area with moving targets etc. to practice aiming especially at distance. Overall one of the best games out there today and hope the developers keep up the good work!

review: I'd like to start off by saying the dev team really deserve a pat on the back for the dedication towards monthly updates that have been slowly but surely improving the game. Playing with friends really brings out the fun in this game. Tactical teamplay solid communication and using the games mechanics to your advantage (3rd person) are all important factors when going on your adventure in the motherland. Theres always funny moments and derpy times so its not always so serious. Where as solo litteraly gives you paranoia. Constantly thinking you saw someone in the distance only to realise it was a lonely bush. Then BANG a bullet litteraly flies past that naive little head of yours causing you to jump in your seat and litterally yourself. One of the few games Ive played which really gets your adrenaline pumping when the time comes.I couldnt recommend this game more pretty good acoustics a half decent weapon balance (atm) adrenaline pumping and forces players to constantly adapt to their environment. 8/10....and its only in Beta

review: Firstly I'll get this out of the way I HIGHLY recommend to play with friends the game is much more bearable especially since the amount of camping is generally reduced. The solo experience is absolute trash.95+% of the time you're running around looking for a high powered scope some medkits that particular attachment you're missing...The rest is somewhat evenly split among * actually shooting others* getting oneshot by somebody camping the whole match in a room with a shotgun* getting disconnected by some random errors or crashes* losing half your health when leaving a car going at 10kmh* getting hit behind cover thanks to the great netcode (I'm afraid to find out what the tick rate is...)Overall I found it very repetitive and frustrating each death feels like I've wasted the whole time especially when it happens before you fire a single shot.Especially the melee fighting is completely broken I kept punching people sitting still and could barely hit them... and when hits register the feedback (blood splatter) appears after 1 2 seconds. Needs a LOT of work.Yes it's alpha I know I know. BUT I review the product as it is now (it's marked as EA review) If it improves I'm happy to modify my review even though I doubt the core gameplay will change which is my biggest gripe.So far the devs seem to have been quite productive but I'm very skeptical of Early Access games these days. TLDR a grindy shooter with proportionally little action and a lot of time spent running around. WoW with guns.

review: Death by someone a kilometer away with a sniper rifle and a 15X scope is exactly what i call fun especially when I don't even know if thats how I died. I could have been killed by a bird that got a lucky shot in with its s h i t. I could even have been killed by a gentle f u k k i n g breeze for all i know. I'm not going to lie though. This game is extremely fun to play. You feel acomplished when you kill a person and even getting down to the last few people is the most tense experience i've ever had. So if you want to constantly be asking yourself how you died or how you can empty your clip into a persons chest but they turn and kill you instantly with a single head shot then this is the game for you.

review: well the game is good i mean its fun and all and im actually writing this review to state the cons of this game (and there a lot of these) im giving it a thumps up because i cant give it a thumps down while i still play and enjoy the game.cons 1. performance issues fps drops freezes and sometimes it freezes compeletly i need to sign out from windows acc to fix it. i got a gtx 1080 ti.2. no toturial what so ever. i mean the game is not hard to understand but for me a guy who never played game like this before a small tuturial will not be bad idea.3. u cant see ur ping its an online game pls let us have this option.thats the obviuos cons there are a lot of small stuff that will be really appreciated if they add them in the future like 1. a kill cam sometimes a dude kills u so fast that u dont even know from where he was shooting and ur game just ends let us see who and how they killed us.2. there are no animation when u enter/exit a car.i guess all these issues will be adressed after all its an early access game its really fun and if u dont mind these issues just go and get it.

review: iv spent a decent amount of hours playing this game. there a few things i would recommend fixing starting with the small bumbs everywhere tht if you drive your vechcal over you either flip your car up side down screwing your self or you fly 10 feet up in the air and take dmg when you land.. or you just stop completly and ofc there will be some dude with a sniper that one shots you gg. next circle rng for people that don't what it is it's where either you have to push towards the circle while the other players don't need to move good rng for them rng for you.. not the best explenation but what ever google it. 2 suggestion to fix this would be either increase the time left for circle to move on the last few circles or reduce the damge the circle does on the last few circles so you actully have time to move or engage in fights and not be complety screwed because the circle went to the opposite end of where you where at.. last thing i would fix about this game are the shotguns. for thoes that haven't played the game shotguns are the only gun in the game that let you one shot someone regardless of gear if your range of them it doesn't matter if you shoot them in the head or the chest it's a one shot.. some time they might require two shots but only if they shoot you in the leg or something.. for clarification the only other guns that one shot people are sniper rifles that require you to get a headshot in order to one shot if you don't get a headshot then it can take up to 3 shots to kill someone getting a headshot with a sniper rifle is pretty difficult especially if the target is moving so it does require a decent amount of effor however the shotgun requires no effort what so ever it's broken and encourages camping (where someone will just sit in a room all round waiting for someone to open the door) (you have no idea how many times iv spent 20 mins getting kills a tun of good loot just to get one shot by some dude with no gear who sat in a cornor of a dark room and one shot me as soon as i opened the door) getting one shot by a shotgun isn't fun it's probably the worst feeling you will get playing this game knowing you just got killed with the eaiset op gun in the game tht takes no effort no skill what so ever and you couldn't do a dam thing to stop it .. (not taling about the people who run around houses with shotguns hunting you down you could do something about that but the people that sit in rooms waiting for you to open the door ) it's suggestion i would make nerf all the shotguns so you can never be one shot by a shotgun when you are at full health with lvl 1 armor and helmet currently from what i have experinced iv been one shot with level 2 armor and helmet at full health makes no difference which is tbh. fix these changes and the game is golden super fun addicting and overall just a great battle royal.p.s sorry about the bad grammer im scottish and i don't give a .

review: Playerunknowns Battlegrounds is the latest and that much i can say in advance most likely the best last man standing multiplayer shooter that has been made so far. This game with it's overall simple but well executed fun concept kind of reminds of playing a round of Mario Kart or Super Smash Bros when I parachute out of the plane. Just playing the game for the fun of it. That is the way of playing I enjoy this game the most just jump in go ham have some laughs and when it's over just jump into another game. Solo games are great for both very relaxed OR very aggressive game play. Duos can get very intense at some times and squad is prollly my favorite due to it being the most tactical approach if played properly. Needless to say that goofing around in a squad is also going to make up for the most hilarious moments like having your squads car explode 2 seconds after you ran over a full team of 4. For an Early Access game this one performs actually quite well. Gunplay already feels fluid and comfy while perfectly nailing the sweet spot between realistic and arcade style gunplay. Everything works very intuitive and self explaining impactful and right f.e. weapon attachments you find actually do give slight advantages in reload time mag capacity or stability. In the near future the game will also have a shooting range for you to test out any gun available in the game. Developers confimed that the final game will have full Steamworks support in 6 months when it leaves Early Access meaning full modding support for long lasting re playability. Also the price tag will stay the same which will help to keep out a good chunk of people using cheats in the long run. BattlEye is running already and I do consider it to be a not so useless Anti Cheat since it caught me quite fast when I scripted a bit with a paid bypass back in Arma 2 days.My overall verdict for the game as of March 2017 is an 8.5/10... with the potential to become a 9/10 game depending on how development goes during Early Access and what kind of content will get added or altered what issues might come up etc.So you might ask "Is it a must buy then?" or "is it worth 30 bucks?" Well if you ever thought that "100 people fighting each other to death last man standing style alone or in teams of up to 4 on a massive map" could be fun then yes it absolutely is! It really does not matter at all whether your mindset is competitive and your aim is to climb the leaderboards or if you just casually wanna get some frags and fun this game manages to cater to both audiences. Hence why it is so popular with 50k players daily on Steam and about 90k viewers on twitch constantly being the 2nd most watched game after LoL for a week now since steam release... these numbers tell us a lot about how enjoyable and entertaining it is to play (and watch) this game despite it's beta like development stage. We shall see how Early Access goes and what game we get then. If major things change I may update this review at release. Warning If you do suffer from low frustration tolerance and feel bad or even get mad about dying many times in a video game though I highly recommend staying away from PUBG.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Been playing the game for around 100 hours at the time I am writing this review and I must say that I am still enjoying it immensly. Its also one of the most popular game in years with my friend list full of people squadding up to go head to head with other people almost every day/night.The games still have problems but considering that this is early access that is to be expected.Pro's *Fun gameplay. Fighting both solo or duo/squad is quite fun even when you die early. This is one of the games where a win really feels like a victory*No pay to win*Serious developer that want the game to become as good as it can get.Negative's *Glitches/crashes are definetly a part of the game as of writing this. But its not gamebreaking for the most part*There are some network issues but they are being adressed.*I am just to hooked on this game.If you want a good fps/tactical game hybrid this is for you. If you want a twitch shooter look elsewhere.

review: My experience with PUBG so far and what you will experience atleast 9123012 times 1. You start of by joining a lobby with screaming Russians2. You then get teleported to an airplane where you framerates drop despite your computer being half decent3. You now press CTRL + T muting the screaming Russians so you can actuallly focus on where you want to drop4 At this point you can either Jump out into the first main city and hope you don't get killed by some lucky piece of who gets an AKM as their first item Jump down at a small town and hope you get something that isn't a crossbow5. After getting your (hopefully) good loot you decide to either Play aggressive af and hunt down everything that moves Play like a wussy and try to survive with your gear6. Depending on your playstyle 2 things can happen Aggressive playstyle You actually get a kill and while looting your victim you get shot in the head by some camper who got a kar from the supply drop and has the 15x scope equippedWussy playstyle You have now been hiding for the whole game and there is 5 players left you hear shots nearby and think "Hey I might actually win this I can go on ahead kill the guy who is low on health get good and win" and while you're on your way to cleanup the battle that has been going on a few meters from you you will get shot by the other kid who also has been hiding the whole game behind a tree7. You died and you're filled with rage complaining over the newbie playstyle that got you killed but later you realize that you played either played the exact same way or would've played the exact same way if you had the opportunity to do so.8. You now start to think what the meaning of life is. You just wasted 20 minutes of your life and you decide to take a break from the game9. 15 minutes later you return after having seen a pro player easily nailing down 11 players (Referring to www.youtube.com/aculite) 10. You're filled with hope and you're joining a new game thinking that you learned a new way to play but you just can't seem to play properly and the exact same things happen again...This is unfortunately the sad truth of the tough life that many PUBG players experience everyday.Anyways 10/10 would recommend despite the lag and desync the game has (Yes I do know the game is in development) but hopefully this will be fixed in the future updates.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is a nice "The Sims" with migrants.At first you're creating a nice and individually character which fits your personality very well.Then you're on an small island surrounded from water waiting for the plain with like 100 other players. They will yell at you being rude punshing you and sometimes you dont understand them.What does &amp quot " mean? After you found a seat at the plain you will be forced to jump out rushing for your own house and fighting with other migrants for your life.Maybe you will find a house which you can call your own.Living from the trash which other people leaving there used clothes to be more individually and special.But you can never feel comfy and safe. There will be always someone running into your house and shooting at you.So be prepared to be the winner!And if youre feeling safe there will be some weird forcefield and you need to run out of your house while terrorists will bomb the ground.So dont think that you will have a long life... You will grab some stuff die life search die and life again.Thats pretty much everything a big search for clothes and energydrinks.

review: I love this game but adding microtransactions on a game that has only a single game mode (after promising not to do it) with a game that is in early access is wrong. Breaking promises to your customers leads to other promises you can break and my review will remain negative until they remove the transaction. I recommend not buying until early access is over or they drop the price.Also $30 for a battle royale game with one map and one game mode is ridiculous. I understand it is early access but they have sold plenty of copies of the game and they need to use that money to finish the game not try to enter esports.
