review: It's what everyone wanted from H1Z1!This game is incredible its like H1Z1... DayZ style. Although only being released for a week the game is already less broken than H1Z1 and has received more relevant updates than DayZ has in over 3 years of Early Access. As expected from an Early Access game its optimization isn't great however if you don't mind decreasing the video settings the game is perfectly playable in a competetive environment on any mid high end machine. The developers have posted a clear development plan for the coming months of optimization and patches. If you're pondering upon purchasing the game as you're worried about performance on low mid range machines I suggest you wait a couple of weeks for the game to become more optimized.Overall great game!! 10/10 IGN D

review: Hate to Love it! Pros Great gameplayHitboxes are exceedingly fairA great middle ground for Arma fans and H1Z1 fansBetter than H1Z1Quick matchmakingCons Honestly I have a high end PC and I don't notice many of the little bugs or dev issues that seem to be more common on lower end machines so I can't speak to those things very well. The worst part about this game is the community. Not everyone is full of but you should expect to spend two three minutes listening to one person scream "Trump!" over and over whilst another shouts a constant stream of racial slurs trying to drown out the three players running around advertising their twitch channels to the anthem of "CHINA #1!!" Every. Single. Time.Other than that the gameplay is solid satisfying tense and fun. Duo and squad queueing is really my favorite way to play especially when you get a golden crew that cuts the and communicates though you earn less currency and squad games tend to take longer.Still I would have paid $60 for this one. At $30 it's a no brainer.

review: In my second match I got pretty lucky a superman punch after landing netted the first kill while a clip of 9mm into the back of a man running from the blue bagged him as my second. To prove that good thing come in threes I was bandaging up when the bush infront of me suddenly crawled forward. Turns out by swimming across the river to make the circle I had snuck up behind a guy who had probably done the same thing purely by accident.Only instead of KAR98ing this peasant in the back of the head I came to the conclusion that a silent pan death was more suitable and entertaining end to his life. "And baby makes three."Sprinting forward I rained a flurry of furious circular metal death upon him only to watch as each one of my pan swings fly harmlessly over his head as if I was some lowly servant fanning as his majesty lay there enjoying a break from the summer heat.Dude turned around and pumped me full of lead before I could switch to my UMP.

review: not an indepth review here but imo its better than h1z1 dayz and arma 3 combined because it incoroporates elements from all of those games the scavenging of dayz the pace of h1z1 and the tactical format of arma 3. so basically its perfect if you like those games. people are crying that its buggy and poorly optimized or whatever and... it is. but thats because IT JUST CAME OUT.devs will be improving it over time. i wouldnt recommend unless you have a really good cpu and gpu because i have gtx 1060 SC and i5 3350P 3.1ghz and 8gb ram (none of which are not top end but still very good). with that i get 50 70 fps on very low settings which is really bad. i get 25 40 on normal. so i really hope this changes in the future. that said if you can get around 60fps on very low then will be fine. overall its a fantastic game. it is exactly what i want for this type of survival game. they finally got it right.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've had more memorable moments in this game than any I can think of so far everything that happens whether bad or good is enjoyable. My heart has almost jumped out of my chest a couple of times while playing Battlegrounds and my hands have got jittery with excitement and adrenaline almost every game. When I die I don't get angry and want to ragequit usually it was my own mistake that got me killed rarely the game. I usually just want to try again and so I do.This game has massive potential in fact out of any like it I believe it has the greatest potential. It has a seriously sound team behind it and even though it's in early access it is more enjoyable than most "complete" games in my library.Solo is great probably the most heart attack inducing but you feel you're there in the game for every second you stay alive. Duo's and Squad games are where it's all at though in my opinion. The amount of fun you can have making plans and running circles around enemies in this high pressure environment with others is ridiculous it's just a giant sandbox of death and it works perfectly. The future updates to come sound very exciting too so this game is on a path to success I think.I love it I probably won't stop loving it. You can love it too now go. Be free

review: While it can be rage inducing at times I always know that I had done something wrong or had not been careful enough. With a variety of weapons and vehicles and many different approaches to every situation Playerunknows Battlegrounds (PUBG) succeeds are providing an enticing experience no matter how it is played with every round being a different story. From getting everything you need in one building and dieing because of the boundry to only finding a pistol a motorbike and a trusty Frying pan (pick those up they are the best defence) and having an airdrop deliver you to victory. In a group when one of you is put down to 0 hp you get put in a "fight for life" scenario in which you are forced to crawl around on your knees until your either reived by a teammate or are dropped by the opposing players. Of course if neither of these happen you just fall over dead but cross that bridge when you get there.The community is just as crazy with the classic sayings "CHINA #1" and "Angus get on skype!" every time you wait for the countdown you will get a good laugh from someone. I have had some of my best gaming moments in less than 30 hours so I can definately reccomend this game to anyone who even remotely enjoyed H1Z1's King of the Kill 9/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Upon release and for this first two months this game felt and played like the best battle royal game ever and it got a massive thumbs up from me. Then they started to patch and fix bugs and overnight the game became the most randomly unstable and frustrating error prone game in my Steam library. It is now very prone to freezing full blown crash to desktop sometimes requiring a full restart enable the PUBG.exe client down as you can t shut it down via task manager.I've lost count of how many crashes I've had when I have been on decent runs / kill streaks only for the game to crash. It s a real shame and by that virtue I can t recommend this game to anyone at the moment. .. .. .. .. .. .. . . .. .. .. . . . .. . .. .. .. .. .. . ..

review: pros The gamepay is solid feels smooth and doesn't feel clunky like other survival games within this genre. For example like games like Dayz but this may be different by the time you read this review. The gameplay also changes pace quite often sometimes fast and sometimes slow The graphics are great in this game. The map is very well designed with urban areas and small towns and villages to open fields and hills allowing players to make the most of the weapons that i have if they wish to snipe from a hill top they can if they see a drop and choose to snipe from a distant hill they most likely can The last point that i mentioned makes the game very tense because you know there could be a player around any or every corner.Cons As it currently stands of the date 27/08/2017 the game is not worth the price point of 26.99. As it stands the game doesn't have a whole lot of content don't get me wrong i love the game but i would much prefere a price point of around 15 in my opinion. The performance in this game can be quite poor at times. But it's not as bad as it used to be and it is evident that the devs are trying to improve the performance. Glitches with rendering buildings can occur quite often in this game although some players never seem to get them. and some do regardless of specs so it seems to be luck.In conclusion this game is fantastic i would recommend this game however if the game is ever on sale then buy it as fast as you can!

review: MIDGET PORNNow that I have your attention THE GAME IS AWESOME!Of course it has a lot of things to improve (Performance vehicles weapons etc.) but you need to know that the game is in its early access stage. It's going to be developed and changed as we play and submit our feedback!Found a bug? Report it.Have an idea? Submit your idea.The core of all Early Access games is that WE are part of the game as testers and with any cool ideas. If the bugs or if those ideas don't ever leave our mind they are probably going to die in our memory.Don't be afraid to buy this game as I said before it's AWESOME! But you have to know that you will find bugs and performance leaks. Don't ever EVER buy an early access if you want a full stable game.One of the main concerns of players was the lack of updates but let's be honest... the game updated almost two times a week after it's release. Some weeks passed away and after a lot of new and cool items of the agenda were done they decided to take a break. People sometimes get angry because of that but I think that's no problem. We all deserve to rest our brain time to time.QUICK SCOREGraphics 8/10Performance 5/10 (playable)Gameplay 8/10Fun 10/10

review: The Battle Royale / Hunger Games Simulator you always dreamed of... though a bit rough around the edgesDumb name great concept.Buggy jank riddled execution of a concept so brilliant at its base that this game shines regardless of its issues.It will crash to your desktop and when you open it again you'll still be in the same party you were before it crashed.Controls are weird finnicky and many don't have an explaination and are discovered via message board postings. Examples HOLDING the RMB moves the camera in slightly... but TAPPING it toggles you to FPS iron sights.Holding SHIFT lets you run... but when you're in iron sights it holds your breath... and slightly zooms in non scoped rifles.You can only refill a vehicle's gas when you are sitting in the vehicle and it's not moving and you right click on the gas can. ... and it goes on and on...BUT... AGAIN... Despite all these rough edges there is a quality to this concept that it seems absurd no one has attempted it in this way before.I look forward not only to this game as it improves but also to the littany of AAA devs who will take its good ideas and implement far more polished versions of the same concept that this game seems to have nailed at its most base level.A must own for anyone who doesn't mind their blood pressure going up at the thrill they get when they get within the last 10 players and have no idea where their enemies are as the circle closes in.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is easily the most fun I've had in an online game in a long long time both playing solo and with friends. I was hesitant to give a EA game a chance but I'm really glad I did. The gameplay is there and the level of "jank" isn't anything worth complaining about I grew up playing PC games in the 90s so I know a thing or two about jank.The use of sound in this game is incredible. It reminds me so much of Dukematches and how you would need to carefully listen to your environment in order to detect nearby players and instantly come up with a plan to survive. There is heavy emphasis on psychological gameplay when you encounter another player. You must constantly outsmart them if you are to survive.

review: Detailed review?Its just as fun as you think its going to be. Still a little buggy and needs more optimization patches but these guys are really consistant on the updates and no microtransactions in game (Hopefully for good). Singles duos and squad playlists are available and the matchmaking is lightning fast. Limited customization for character appearance but i dont mind too much. You earn points to buy "crate" like boxes that reward you what seems to be a random cosmetic item the price of the next crate increases everytime but resets every week. As far as gameplay my only complaint would be optimization and thats just me being picky. I have a 2 year old system i5 3690 gtx 970 and 8gb of ram and the only times i realy have any issues is when i first touchdown after jumping out the plane but this is improved alot since the last update. Im not running it on ultra though im on a mix of med and low again optimizatoin is in the works i could probably run it higher but in a game like this you really want solid fps without worrying about dips. Regardless it still looks good on the low mid settings this will be the last thing on your mind during the game to anyone who might be put off by this. All that set aside you will find that turning down certaing effects like foliage to "low" will not only help give you a boost in performance but also a slight advantage against somone who has it set to "high". Again thats just me being picky honestly none of that even matters once you get locked into gameplay. You've seen the gameplay you known what this game has to offer. If you have the slightest ich to buy this game i say buy it now its well worth the $30. If you can convince a friend to buy it too you will have even more fun this game gets really intense and the encounters can be crazy having a friend there to experience that with is a blast and the lightning fast matchmaking i mentioned makes it that much easier to just say "one more" as you attempt your shot at being #1 one last time before you go to bed (because you spent all day playing it on accident). This game can be challenging you have to remember there are 99 other people in that lobby and all of them want to kill you but again giving it another go is always just moments away there isn't much to learn if you are new to the genre just watch a few PUBG tip videos or something and you will be ready. Start that download!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I played Battlegrounds after the huge optimization path this weekend and my general feeling is that Greene's aim is looking pretty spot on. If you've played or watched any battle royale matches you know the drill players after a brief and violent wait in the lobby (a small island littered with weapons in this case) board one of several planes that then fly over a much larger island.Battlegrounds does lean a bit closer to King of the Kill than Arma 3's Battle Royale mod in that it is incredibly easy to jump in without having to first watch hours of it being streamed just to know how it works. The houses and shacks on the island are overstuffed with guns melee weapons ammo first aid backpacks and the always startling number of motorcycle helmets you tend to find in the post apocalyptic future. Equipping yourself for combat can be done with a little luck in a matter of minutes. I never tried out a melee weapon tho.

review: My Grandfather smoked his whole life. I was about 10 years old when my mother said to him 'If you ever want to see your grandchildren graduate you have to stop immediately.'. Tears welled up in his eyes when he realized what exactly was at stake. He gave it up immediately. Three years later he died of lung cancer. It was really sad and destroyed me. My mother said to me 'Don't ever smoke. Please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 28 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it because this game gave me cancer anyway.

review: If you are a fan of H1Z1 or the Battle Royale style of gameplay this game is a must buy. I have a 970 and run this game at a pretty solid 60 FPS. It will dip down to 30 FPS during the pre game phase where everyone is grouped up together but once in game everything is fine. The mechanics and playstyle of the game are great the blood splatter is an excellent hit marker and feels visceral. Bullets do intense amounts of damage so firefights can last seconds if someone gets the drop on you making the game more about placement strategy.Pros Good graphics as far as Battle Royale games go. (Better than most) Smooth gameplay Firefights are intense Each gun has it's own use and you can sense the improvement an attachment gives.Cons Sometimes the game servers rubberband requiring you to pick up an item twice to get it or shut a door twice. There is an issue post game where sometimes the start menu won't refresh and you have to manually close the game. No real hit marker to give you a sense of where you are being shot from. Characters hop out in front of vehicles so if the vehicle is still moving even slightly you will be run over.I see my con list more as a list of in game bugs because as for the actual gameplay I have literally zero qualms and really enjoy the game. I'm also pretty anti micro transactions which is a core mechanic of H1Z1 I absolutely hated. How can you justify charging for additional cosmetics when the game itself isn't even finished?In PlayerUnkown's Battlegrounds you get coins at the end of each game receiving more based on your performance (How many kills you got or how close to first place you got) and those are used to purchase the crates for cosmetic gear. Not only that the cosmetics from the loot crates are clothings you can find in game so if you don't have something (like say a gas mask) that you want for your character you can still equip one in game if you find it.Overall I find this to be a very enjoyable and competitive Battle Royale style game. I have really high expectations for it's future as it already has solid grounding in it's features. This game will certainly be on my go to list.

review: OLD REVIEW I know it's early access but it's actually unplayable for me. Terrible framerate and garbled sound. I'm refunding for now I'll think about buying it again if it ever gets fixed.UPDATE Changed my review to positive after applying some tweaks found online. Game is playable now but I have to run it on way lower settings than I feel like I should have to to barely hit 60 FPS. My specs as of writing this are i7 975 Extreme 3.33 GHzGTX 980 4 GB10 GB RAMThat being said the game is still very fun especially with friends. Hopefully it doesn't fall into Early Access hell like so many others. If the game ever gets properly optimized it'll be great.UPDATE 2 4 months in since I bought it and the game has goine through a lot of changes. Performance has gotten a lot better although it's still far from perfect it's perfectly playable and I can hold over 60 FPS most of the time with occasional drops that don't really hinder the experience much. If you're somehow still on the fence about this game or don't really know much about it you really can't go wrong if you're a fan of shooters. I put multiple hours in almost every night with a group of friends and it's still always fresh and fun. Can't wait to see what this game is like in 4 more months.

review: I got this game after watching Viva La Dirt League's blue force field video (awesome vids by the way). Unintentionally death by blueforce field was my first game expperience! But I was #16 so all good! Anyways although mostly you end up dying in pathetic miserable ways the journey there is often hilarious. So far I have managed to get to #3 by virtue of driving around in the final tight circle in a military 4WD until I jumped from the flaming vehicle to my death. I have killed someone with a pan. I have in turned been killed by the silly mistake of not reloading my weapons... twice. I have stolen Dacia's and had them stolen from me while I looted houses. I have made it across a contested bridge crossing amidst a firefight by swimming underneath it. I then died as I crawled away from the scene. Inside is your friend. A vehicle is a lifesaver. Footsteps mean both someone to hunt and also your death. My only grumble is that I have to run in Medium settings and that death usually comes from something you can't see. But it is possible to have quite an adventure without even firing a shot... and still end up #3.

review: At this time I would not suggest buying this game. Instead pay close attention to the comments section and such. Wait for the cheating issue to be fixed. You will find that 3 5 out of 10 times you are killed it is someone cheating. The game is a great concept and could be very fun without the cheating. I will list the pros and cons.Pros As I said above the concept is great. The fast paced yet at the same time slow and calculated game play can be quite fun.The map size is just about right for the way the game plays out and everything looks nice.Offers a first person locked mode.Great fun with friends playing duo or squad matches.Cons The obvious is the bugs given it is alpha but not a terrible many of them but still there.If you are into more realism this is not for you as it is a health bar system and when you hit people they suffer no penalty for being struck by bullets or hand weapons. So be prepared to say WTH quite a bit as you unload into someone with a 5.56 and those 3 center mass shots didn't do anything as they return accurate fire. Cheating which I would put at the absolute top. The game is just swamped with them.Movement is like ice skating rather than walking/running. The walking needs to be tamed down as does the running. Bunny hopping is of course present and should be taken out and replaced with a vault feature or stamina system that limits the jump function. Recoil on the weapons is overly done and needs tamed down. (I have more than enough time with weapons in my profession)There should be a hard core setting which not only forces first person but implements the stamina and improved hit boxes to include a momentary stun when being struck by bullets or objects. The kids can have their 3rd person bunny hopping nonsense but let the adults have a mode in which sound tactics and realistic expectations are present to at least some degree. When you have someone dead to rights and they instead of taking cover run directly at you sprinting side to side jumping around from 50 yards away or better knowing they can take advantage of poor mechanics and not worry as much about being struck down in the wide open while closing in on you that something is wrong. I would say my frustration level with this game is at least a 50/50 or better.

review: 230 hours as of writing and I suppose I finally should write a review for this game (I don't need to explain what the game is. It's currently one of the most played video games in the world second only to League of Legends. If you don't know what this game is watch a youtube video)The Positives Diverse loot system that's being expanded daily. Yes the devs eradicated the weekly updates due to pressured deadlines that as they explained was causing more problems than benefits. (Some people found this fishy unreliable or as a way to break away from having to support the playerbase. This isn't the case. Which brings me to my next point) Regularly updated game with a developer that is actively looking with fellow developers for a way to further his game. Some people are stating that the game is looking like it is going to be abandoned. That's simply not true. There's a map due very soon for Pubg most likely within the next month or two and another one that's supposed to be released before the full release of the game at the end of the year. The original map which is rather poorly done Greene has even admitted to saying was just a base. He said in an interview that they intended on remaking the whole map once further maps have been pushed and their goals have been reached. Greene although he made a very moronic decision to add microtransactions (which was only moronic due to the fact that he told the community they'd not exist in early access) he has told the community that he realized that promising that made no sense and he needed to test the market anyway. Since then the microtransactions have been removed (for now). Ultimately it does not affect me personally and it has not swayed my review for the worse at all. In combat action that genuinely gets your blood pumping. The looting system rewards skilled players and does not leave anyone disenfrachised. Diverse apparel for in game Massive map to play on. A genuine step up from the DayZ mod and king of the kill. Entirely. Greene has made a genuine effort to improve the game. At the time of writing he is attempting to incorporate the amazing water from sea of thieves into the game (at least in a technical sense) and recognizes that the default unreal assets are bland. He got a game out there. It's still in early access and he's working hard to have everything done by the end of the year.The Middling The Gamescom microtransaction was a kick in the face to some and a ball suck for others. I myself bought several of the crates and although they did not yield amazing loot it was by my own free will and I got some half decent stuff. It was entirely optional and is gone now. Some people used mob reviews to whine about this and I thought it was just pathetic. Yes the developer went back on his word for one thing and explained his rational. He's not abandoned the game and I still trust that he's trying to do what's best. Physics isn't perfect yet. It's much better than other battle royales however at times driving a motor bike into a slight bump will just ing stop it completely instead of flipping it. There's some issues here and there but it's not gamebreaking.The Negatives The netcode needs work. There's a decent disparity between the shooter and the one being shooted and it makes it very difficult to have fights at times. Beginning of the matches are almost always laggy but they are making efforts to improve the netcode regularly and I believe they have a path set out to fix this. The game has optimization left lots of it. It hasn't been released fully yet so I can't totally on it for it but there are some times that are just like wtf. Running an RX470 where I can hold about 50fps 1080p maxed out in most places the game will randomly have issues with gpu load leaks which may drop fps or cause stuttering. Again early access and it's not as common as you'd think. It's more of an AMD issue / mid end GPU issue. Most people with GTX 1070 or above can play with nearly zero performance issues.Summary The game is ing amazing as is and has had CONSISTENT improvements. It launched HORRIBLY with optimization and netcode and greene with bluehole have consistently patched those problems and produced a fairly stable game with amazing features. The game has a lot more en route before release as well as more after. I have faith in this company. I genuinely believe they're creating a wonderful game and I don't believe the devs have any intention of abandoning the game. It's huge. Abandoning it would create the most disrespect for the developer now because everyone knows it. The game has steadily increased in player base and will continue to. I recommend.

review: I'm gonna be honest here in this review although I love this game.First let me go over the pros.I definitely think PUBGs has one of the smoothest combat systems that just feel right.It's easy to learn and use interface (in and out of game) there isn't any clunkiness to it.The queue times are lighting fast within seconds you can find a game. Which in games like Counter Strike although in their own right pretty quick. Not even close to PUBGs while also having a bigger player base.I think lastly one of the absolute best things about this game is the team behind it. They're putting out patches daily weekly and monthly basis. At different degrees of course (monthly patches being the big ones) I think it speaks volumes about what they think about their game. Great mix of realism and arcadey style battle royale. Best described as "A mix of H1 and Arma 3 BR" Now some of the cons. This game has a good amount of bugs in action at this very moment. Performance issues. I can't say for myself I run this game at High settings at 60 FPS with an "AMD build". And I have friends with I7s and I5s who struggle to run the game sometimes with what they describe to me as "potato textures". Meaning they won't load.The spectating feature while very cool is quite buggy and won't give you the best display or audio while watching.Some other thoughts. I see some people complain about the price of the game. And about how 30$ is too much but I believe in it's current state it's well worth the 30$.I'd give this game a 8/10 while a great game still needs some work but work that seems to be getting taking care of.My PC SpecsCPU AMD FX 8350 Black Edition. GPU XFX Radeon RX 480 8GB DDR5. MOBO MSI 970 Gaming. Ram Corsair Vengeance 8GB (2 x 4GB) DDR3. CPU Cooler Cooler Master Hyper 212 EVO. PSU EVGA 600B 600W.

review: Highly recommend this game to anyone that enjoys FPS games. Especially prior ARMA Battle Royale Varients. I have put just about 85 hours into the game. Generally speaking the game runs great with minor latency issues. Of the 85 hours I have only experienced 2 game crashes/ disconnects. Im currently running the game with an Alienware Laptop with an 750m graphics card and 8GB of RAM. My processor is an Intel(R) Core(TM) i7 4700MQ CPU 2.4GHz and im getting about 50 60 FPS. So its safe to say im not running top of the line here..That being said there are some problems with the mechanics of the game which are talked about in the forums. Dont let it stop you from buying the game. Game is super fun to play solo duo and squads up to 4. 7/10

review: Even though it's called a "Beta" it's probably the truest beta in the last 10 years. AAA quality game with an indie price great developers great game great community. There is one big issue with this game and that is the fact that "low" shadow and foliage settings give you way too much of an unfair advantage which is a bloody shame since this game looks absolutely gorgeous. Post processing shadows foliage settings being on the lowest possible option allows you to see through places you shouldn't see and it almost completely kills off hiding in plain sight and blending in with the environment hiding in bushes or tall grass is also somewhat useless against players with low settings. The developers should probably make it so that those settings don't completely remove aspects of the map but just decrease their quality.All that aside I highly recommend this game it's a blood boiling battle royale to the point where the survival aspect of the game could even be qualified as the "psychological horror" genre.

review: I haven't played a battle royale game at all. Mostly seeing others play King of the Kill and others they've always hesitated to mention why a player REALLY needs to get this game. But upon seeing this one others have said that this is a more polished version made by the ORIGINAL creator of the first iteration of the battle royale game. That being said optimization is key. This game is in early access obviously so there may be some irregularities and oddities with the visuals. On my rig I have an 8350 16gb of ram GTX 970 and I can run it on 1080p with a mix of high medium settings and get near 60fps. One's experience may vary. Onto gameplay you can run this solo or you can join a duo lobby in which you are partnered up someone else if your friends list isn't that populated like mine. There are weapons and armors scattered on the land one has to scavenge and be able to traverse the land or risk being spotted. Overall I've been playing on the duo lobby for 5 hours straight today and I could easily go for more. This game has the promise to be the most polished version of a battle royale game I don't see any microtransactions in this game yet only a small store that awards a type of tiered version of chest I just unlocked one requiring 700 battle points and the second tier is 1400. Out of 100 players this game can give you an adrenaline rush or you can be sinister and pick off the others once you've found a spot. From here this game can only get better. 9/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I have been a long time FPS player. From games like counterstrike to overwatch. I have also played survival games like rust and the forest. I owned H1Z1 but never played it because it was to much of a hassle and the game seemed to arcadie to me. But this game is something else a great balance between realism and game. The rounds are fast paced and action packed however i feel they could be a little longer. The game isnt fully optimized yet but the devs have already told the community that they are working on it as well as with a date intended for the update. This is probably the best money I personally have spent on an early access game in a long time the devs seem active with the community and i feel this game is going a great direction. I would recomend this to a friend in fact I have recomended this to friends so we can play squad. If your thinking about purchasing this game and youve played fps and survival or even other BR games then as of its state right now i would say its worth the 30 dollars.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Was quite fun and addicting at the start. Gets boring over time but I hope they'll add more content to it. Playing with other people is a bad idea because of team killings and non cooperative players. Also there is a huge amount of bugs. Imagine an ant nest and all the ants are the bugs in this game. It's even too much for alpha/beta. Compared to other games in that stage I've never seen such great amount of bugs. After the last bigger update my PC just crashes and reboots haven't found any fix for that (updated drivers reinstalled the game updated bios and other software that comes with my motherboard). I don't understand why they would launch such a raw game to the public at such early/buggy stage. A game at alpha stage should have only limited mostly working content but not that kind of bug fest.

review: Let me start off by saying that this is my opinion of the game as of 7/3/17.I enjoy the game a lot and am playing it quite a bit with my friend everynight. The game needs balanced bad in my opinion. For 4 games in a row the circles started at the same part of the map and a static vehicle spawn did not work. Not only that but shotguns are super over powered I was killed in three shots by one from over half a block away at full health a level 2 vest and a level two helmet. The spawn quantities for certain ammo types and pistols need taken wayyyyy down or for 5.56 needs taken way up. In one building I found over 140 rounds of .45 but in the 3 apartment complexs I searched I only found 30 5.56 rounds. I understand that the weapons that take this ammo type are high tier but at least give us some more ammo to use the weapons when we are lucky enough to get them.All in all I do recommend the game ever with the balancing issues the optimization issues and lag issues. These are all to be expected in a early access game which is why I dont hold it against it too much. Just do not buy this game and think it is going to run at 60fps constantly and have amazing ping you will not. The biggest lag and fps issue is when you first drop and everyone is jumping out of the plane and you are rendering the world around you all at once. Once again I do recommend this game and hope that it get better and good luck out on the battlefield.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The recent patch which made it so circles could spawn anywhere within the previous circle has killed it for me. Now all I find myself doing is running across open ground from one circle to another instead of stealthily working my way towards the most likely end spot. No point in establishing a secured spot with some good gear when the next step forces you to abandon that and just sprint through a field getting pot shot by people behind you who'll just die to the circle anyway.With no actual goal in sight it's just a crapshoot for who has the best position.Lag/tickrate issues aside I was having fun. I may still play with my son but solo I'm done with this headache.

review: Such a terrible game it had some promise at the start now it's slowly going down hill and becoming a corperate cash cow with hardly any actual development.Pros Fun with friends now and then.Cons Awful gunplay mechanics Clunky controls Full of hackers and cheaters (Shoot through trees and solid objects Sonic running Insta headshot you ing name it) Runs like even on good hardware Terrible framerate Right click to ADS (gets you killed repeatedly) Close range combat is bad (long range combat is pretty good) Desync infested (You will die a second or two after crouching behind cover even though you think you're safe) No skill you're more than likely going to be killed because of coincidence Boring and tedious Running simulator because vehicles aren't around for whatever reason Fog games Rain games (Rain is loud as ) Bad audio (Sometimes the audio tells you incorrect information getting you killed in the process) Colour palette of a black and white movie In first person the camera is in your chest so it feels like you're 4ft 3 Streamer bias ( Dev bans people for no reason just because they happen to kill a streamer) Greedy devs (Said they weren't doing micro transactions but made buyable crates also lowering the percentages for good loot drops in regular crates earn't with "BP" points) (Honestly feels like it I never get decent stuff since the paid crate came out) Esports? (It's an unfinished early access game and it has a ing Esports championship with huge cash prizes what planet are we on?) (It's like having a world cup but the players have to play on concrete wearing ing ice skates) Toxic community (It seems the game has made the entire community angry well at least 60% of it who can blame them honestly they paid for this game)

review: It was tough deciding if this was going to be a positive or negative review due to the onslaught of bugs and frame rate problems with this early access title so this is more of an informative post so here goes Player unknown's battlegrounds or PUBG is an extremely fun game when played with friends if you are a solo player id recommend finding a +1.The minimum spec requirements for this game are COMPLETELY INCORRECT this game is unplayable with those specs i have a gtx 1080 and a i5 7600k and i have serious fps issues with this game sometimes on very low settings i usually get a solid 90 fps but at times that plummets to 30fps or lower for what seems to be an empty field this game is just about playable with 40 fps but you are really not going to enjoy close quarter engagements.I would say gtx 960 or equivalent is a bare minimum along with a i7 cpu as of the time of this post the game is extremely cpu heavy with the so called minimum specs you are going to struggle with getting 10 fps in this unoptimised game.So really the question is if you have a good enough set of specs then go for this game its great but if you dont have good specs this game will cost 200 400 pounds just to get specs to actually run the game without lagging 24/7For better and more researched information go check out the pubg subreddit at https //www.reddit.com/r/PUBATTLEGROUNDS/thanks for reading Player whose friend can nolonger play this game due to the new patch removal of sm4 in steam launch options.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: If you like the looking for gear before shooting people in the face and like the Battle Royale style gameplay then you are going to like this game. If you are reading negative reviews from people its probably because they played for hours and haven't won a single game and are now blaming the developers for making a trash game (ITS EARLY ACCESS PEOPLE)If you want a COMPLETE game do not buy this if you want to have fun anyway and laugh at some of the random glitches in the game because it is playable with out a doubt but under the little video you just wanted is a giant blue marker literally telling everyone this game is not complete.The devs pretty much always listen to a degree but make changes to the game that everyone is always happy for and the devs make weekly small updates and monthly large updates so dont expect huge changes during the weekly ones. The devs already have plans in the works for many new features maps game modes for private servers.I have played enough (have not played since month 3 update) almost 90 hours and still enjoy this game a lot id suggest playing with a buddy or a couple friends if possible as solo can be a bit much your first time and a bit scary.10/10 would follow the snake again

review: I have a love hate relationship with this game Yes it is a fantastic game to play and i have had lots of fun playing it. but i have had equal if not more amount of time being frustrated by it. Also take into consideration the price its way to high for a game that essentially is 1 game mode with no progression other than light tracked stats. BUT the game is in early acess so i would imagine that more will be aded to the game as development progresses.Here is a short list of my pros and cons Pros Great tactical shooter either solo or with friendsGood variation of weapons to useLooks greatNo better feeling than winning a game and getting that sweet sweet chicken dinnerCons if you even have a ball hair of lag your opponents will crush youthe ping i get to servers is a joke (i am fibre 150mbs LAN)takes too long to pick up weapons in a clutch situationannoying "first lag" when you first hit the ground doors wont open and items dont pick upif you turn foliage all the way down players can see you for miles if your opponents have a better pc than you your screwed due to thisruns like if you are on a mid power machineWould i reconmend this game? currently neither yes or no if you have friends to play with the game is a much more enjoyable expirience if your playing solo you better hope to have decent PING and twitch reflexes or you will not enjoy yourself at all.

review: I would like to start off saying that although I do not have many hours on the game currently I have been staying active in the patch notes and such so I feel like I can explain somethings that players may or may not understand. First of all yes there are going to be crates that require keys to open. However it has been announced that only a few crates will require keys to open and that the players will be able to unlock free to open crates normally. Other than that clarification the game is very fun. Every time I start a new match it feels like I just got a new game the excitement only builds as the lobby timer goes down and as soon as the plane lands Chaos happens. Running across a bombing site drving over whole squads and missing every single sniper shot due to your teamates getting in the way are just part of the package. Good luck and I hope to see you out there.

review: Very fun game and can be very tense at times however something needs to be done about teamkilling when playing in a squad with auto team matching. If 3 friends are playing together and decide you the fourth member should no longer be alive there are no reprecussions from that. They can just kill you 1 minute into the round and take your items for their own use. I wouldn't care if this was a rarity but it happens way to often and takes the fun out of it. Serious repercussions and punishments need to be implemented for team killers. EG you're instantly kicked. What if it was genuinely a mistake? happens. You don't deserve to finish the round if you've taken that privilege from another player. It's devastating when you're one of the last few players alive.

review: Okay I'm gonna put this quick and simply. There are two main Battle Royale games out on Steam right now both in Early Access and promising constant support and development towards release. So which one should you get? H1Z1 King of the Kill is $21.99 (CAD) and PUBG is $36.99 (CAD). H1Z1 has gone through multiple re constructions and re iterations through development team changes complete map rehauls and gun balancing. It's improved greatly from its start a few years ago regarding optimization but still needs much more attention towards car physics gunplay and map POIs. It has been floating in Early Access for about two years which concerns me especially on how the devs have been treating the community with garbage in game purchases and long waited patches. Player Unknown's has just released this late March and already has proven to become dethrone H1Z1 off its stage. It takes what H1Z1 tried to do and does it incredibly better. Car physics are realistic but fun gunplay is difficult but satisfying and rewarding the consistent updates and transparency with the development team is unmatched. Running off the constant feedback of the community the dev team is pushing new balance and performance updates regularly backed up with a larger monthly update fixing and adding things into the game. A few years ago H1Z1 showed promise as we waited for it to be Steam's main stay for Battle Royale. It flopped as it had a monopoly on the market so the desire to update it became almost non existent. Player Unknown's has now taken a large chunk of that community waiting for something big and ambitious and now controls the larger passionate playerbase at full force. Either way we look at it competition only helps the consumer as these two games will now fight for our hand to their game. H1Z1 has now seen this and put their team to work and has since the release of PUBG fixed some crucial things but is now behind in the race. To conclude I say yes Player Unknown's has now proven to me that I can trust their team driving this game and to that I can confidently recommend PUBG to any Battle Royale seeking player.

review: For big ARMA/Day Z players this game will probably feel like a good fit. I'm going to mostly compare this to ARMA/Day Z since a lot of the potential players are coming from there. This game feels a lot like ARMA just without the clunk. The shooting feels solid not floaty spam like H1Z1. Those who prefer shooting in first person as opposed to third this game feels like it is more suited to first person than 3rd person. Overall at the time of writing I would give this game a solid 7/10. Once some bugs/performance get ironed out I think it could very well go to a 9/10. Final Thoughts The price point is a little bit high for what you get. The animations and sound could use some love gun sounds are solid however.

review: I admit an addiction. I also admit painful issues. The concept of the game is simple but thrilling. You have one life no respawns chance loot and a heart pounding 1 v all deathmatch. It is on an appropriately massive open world island. There is a race to keep up with the shrinking field of play using cars motorcycles and most often... running in cover and looking over your shoulder. When you (regularly) end up in the same building or field as another poor like yourself... the adrenaline surge is real. It is simple fun. And a big dose of it. But there are real cons and most of that is expected for an Early Access game that exploded in popularity. The most grievous issue is with server desync and server lag. Its not always an issue but when it is think "FPS shooter over 56k dial up". You just got owned by shots that were fired 3 seconds ago long after you moved in to cover. You unload a clip in to an opponent... but not really. Delays and lag when opening doors and making moves. And those moves are life and death. Those issues come and go I would say I experience it 30% of the time. Dev's acknowledge it and are addressing it in future patches (June and later) But the game is still so fun I deal with it. There are some other small issues I dont like in terms of character movement controls being slightly wonky and loot distribution. But those are also issues that the dev team admits and is working on. This dev team seems to work well and seems to be honestly motivated to get out of Early Access and in to GA. So far I trust their work. I would recommend the game if you have interest.

review: I have been burnt on so many early access games as you may all have too. My deciding factor on buying this game was that I felt I could trust my friends who say AS IS that the game is great. While other games have promised features updates and plans of improvement PUBG has an already fun easy to learn and hop right into game. I feel that the game has already paid for itself in the 7.6 hours I have played with only taking a break to get food. I do not feel immediately burnt I do not feel as if it is a game that "just needs a couple of months to get it worked out and then we can have fun and play as a group" and most of all I feel like it has a SOLID starting point as in that we don't have to wait to have fun. The fun is here it will just improve over time. My first few games were with a couple buddies the mechanics were easy to jump right into from playing Arma and such. In those first couple of games I was just getting the hang of it and eventually made it to a #3 spot in the game. That was great I was immersed heart racing yelling with my buddy to push out and shoot people and 100% into the game. By the end of the night I was ready to keep playing. Pros Great Game Not just a base of a game with empty promisesYou can just jump right in and start playingIt has a great map and navigation systemHas a good selection of gunsQuick to get into a game quick to get out and start another.Combat seems to be inbetween Arma and Rainbow Six Siege a good balance.It has realism but not so much that you lose fun just to be more realistic.The vehicles drive well not too arcade esque. Inventory system and attachments are very easy to use.Map is easy to use on the run along with quickly using inventory.The game is quite beautiful IMO with not too much flare that makes you turn down settings to see another player.Lots of little things that you won't notice because they are done right and that's a good thing.Cons Performance is the main one rain needs to be optimized HEAVILY. Opening doors and entering vehicles needs to have a bit of tweaking with the delays.The fact that I didn't buy this game earlier.Network lag is an issue sometimes.In the beforegame lobby when people are shooting rapidly it causes a lot of lag.Parachuting should be a little bit quicker when landing.Footsteps should be a slight bit more pronouncedI'm really nit picking because there aren't a ton of things wrong here but maybe more cars?And also lastly a larger distinction between driveable and non driveable cars.Suggestions Add armor for cars and attachments? More scope varietiesVariety of guns addedInstead of a single plane dropping maybe twoMore carsA player positioning system similar to ARMA 3 where CTRL+W/S Makes you go in (12 positions?) from prone to standing?Obviously more clothing options (I'm sure they are in the works)And lastly add boats I think that would be a very interesting thing to spice things up.All in all I was scared and vowed to never buy another "Early access" title (AKA Give me you money now so we don't have to finish the game). I made an exception when I saw PUBG and I am very glad that I did! Would recommend 8/10 and I am sure that it will soon reach a 10/10 for me.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: GUIDE on how to survive solo as a "JEBAITER" like PRO with minimum effort (Works +50%)EARLY GAME (1st circle) Jump from the plane on the centre of the map away from the main town Grab a med kit/first aid kit a gun in the first few houses and kill any witnesses on scene Check the map and pray that for the first big circle is inside your landed area Find a house with only one exit and a bathroom with no windows Double check if all looted houses nearby is close to prevent any track of suspicious Drop any best loot (medkit firstaidkit) directly in front of the bathroom of the choosen house Additionally if got more loots drop some more medkit etc... in front of the main exit TRAP &amp BAIT ALL SET! Camp inside the bathroom and wait silently for your END GAME loots delivery service Wait for it wait for it! JEBAITED!!! Kill ALL those GREEDY fortunate player on scene.MID GAME (2nd/3rd circle) Loot reset bait and trap repeat as much as possible as long as the circle in play If you statisfied and confident with your HARD EARN loots go out there start mudering people If not then chicken out till there is around 30+ player left.LATE GAME (Last remaining circle) Boost up come out and fight all your way to be the last player alive. Or die within top 10 rank with style on the first player you encounter outside your house(Like ME) 99% will try this at home again

However the bugs are out of control (hence the Early Access) and there is absolutely no optimization whatsoever. I have a gaming computer that can run pretty much any game but at the start of the game I got 150+ frames right now? 30fps on the lowest quality. That is just sad. They have gone farther away from optimization instead of improving it.

It would be great if Australia got it's own server rather than piggy backing off servers in Asia or "Oceania". Until this happens or the servers become more stable I fear I may have spent $40 on a game that I won't be able to enjoy half as much as I know I should. Overall 10/10 game 2/10 servers

review: Im no pro gamer. The learning curve on this game is pretty high despite you thinking its simple..all you have to do is survive. You die a lot but the games start quickly so it evens out.I get that this is EA and that there are 'bugs'. What ruins this game for me is two things 1st. Lag. What has me shouting at my monitor is dying because I couldnt get in a vehicle under fire as Im trying to 'line up' the 'get in drivers door' menu and then to have a half second delay when you finally do. Opening doors in general and picking up items are the same. This kills the game for me. When survival is the point of the game actions need to be swift.2nd. Hacking. Others have commented and I am pretty sure that I have been victim a couple of times. As i said Im no progamer and there are much better players out there than me but I cant help thinking with some of my deaths that it wasnt just a skilled shot that got me..how did you know in the first place that I was even in a room with the door closed? Or manage to one shot me in a car travelling at 65kph that wasnt driving in a straight line?So its a good premise for a game and its good in short stints but I cant recommend it at the moment at the price and until its improved. If I could get a refund I probably would as the novelty is going to wear off I feel.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I do like the game. But since its still early access the game in general still needs to come a long ways. I have over 110 hours and climbing...Plenty of things to point out what needs "to be fixed" just do a search on the game and what others have been saying about performance issues and rendering etc....The two biggest issues I have with the game so far...1 The hackers/cheaters....plenty of youtube videos on this one.2 Team killing...sucks to go into a match with your (pub) team and 15 mins later they shoot you for all the gear you have. Not fun at all.Once these issues are worked out. Im sure the game will be great...Just wait a little longer for changes...

review: Straight up PUBG is probably one of the most entertaining titles that has been released in recent times. The updates are regular the community is awesome and the dynamics of the game are fairly unique (even with other 'battle royale' style games on the market).The sheer amount of memes this game as spawned in it's short life is amazing too from "Angus get on Skype!" "Preorderfag" and let's not forget the timeless classic "CHINA NUMBA ONE!".tl dr just buy this game it's fun af.

review: &gt Join game.&gt Screaming and yelling everyone cursing at one another and shooting each other.&gt In Plane.&gt Silence for the first 15 seconds.&gt Girl talks.&gt Everyone loses their &gt "IS THAT A GIRL? LIKE A REAL LIFE GIRL?"&gt "GIRLS ARE A MYTH."&gt "WHATS A GIRL?"&gt "OH A GIRL?! THIS I'M OUT!" Dude proceeds to jump out of the plane.&gt This all happened in less than 5 seconds.&gt Girl just says. "Um yeah?"&gt Everyone goes nuts again.&gt At this point I jump going to Polyana.&gt Land&gt Find a Kar98k 8x Scope meds backpack.&gt Sees people.&gt Proceeds to them all up.&gt Look up in the top right hand corner. "69 people left. Nice." ( ʖ )&gt In Mylta now.&gt Hears someone talking about not shooting them because they're unarmed.&gt I adjust my volume its a guy and the person pinning him in the house is the girl she's screaming and threatening him.&gt I'm just patiently listening.&gt "COME OUT WITH YOUR HANDS UP AND YOUR PANTS DOWN." She says.&gt I'm completely losing it as he begs her to leave him alone... in PUGB...&gt Slowly I'm adjusting myself into a vantage point on the second floor of the building behind her.&gt Questioning how no one around has yet to attack her and this guy...&gt Dude comes crawling out of the house in front of her she shows mercy for now.&gt Got in position now crosshair on her head.&gt Debates shooting this female... I begin to question life...&gt Dude begins pleading about how hes new to the game and has only played ARMA 3 Breaking Point.&gt She remains silent I see she has a shotgun no match for me at this range.&gt Loves ARMA 3 and played a lot of Breaking Point this man is my friend... a comrade from another game.&gt Slowly begins to descend index finger on left mouse button.&gt I stop mid way when I notice her put her gun away and pull out the legendary Frying Pan.&gt I gasp and shoot as she adjusts herself perfectly so that I hit the frying pan instead of her.&amp gt she knows I'm here now!&gt "I'M GOING TO BUTCHER YOU PEASANT." She screams I'm terrified as she charges my house leaving this dude alone.&gt Guy gets up and runs.&gt I hear the door open and footsteps downstairs as I take off my 8x Scope and stare at the staircase sweating intensely.&gt I realize the windows are able to be punched out and I could jump for it....&gt Gulping my armpits drenched I run to the window bust it out and jump.&gt I survive and turn around to see her in the window with the Frying Pan.&gt She switches to the shotgun and shoots me not doing much damage.&gt I deck it to the other building as I fixate myself in a window as I watch her run down the stairs and come outside.&gt This time will be different &gt I pull out my Kar98k and shoot her.&gt She lives. &gt I shoot again with pure anger in my click this was vengeance now.&gt She dies.&gt I sigh in relief as I look around... still no one. This was odd...&gt Wonders where that guy ran probably just ran to the circle.&gt Speaking of which the circle was closing in.&gt Move up on her body and begin looting.&gt As I'm looting I'm looking around and being careful as heck.&gt Suddenly I hear a voice.&gt "PRESS Z FOLLOW ME." This voice whispers.&gt I turn around 360 about to no scope.&gt The guy I saved hits me with a pan and I die.&gt Forcefield closes in on him hes way too far out of the zone and likely died.&gt Join another match.&gt "Press Z follow me!" This guy chants as he gets a ing cult going.&gt Develop PTSD from that line after the dramatic execution of me last game.&gt Here we go again...10/10 would press Z and follow him.

review: First of this is a new account as I have multiple for the game since queue time's get fairly rough when your MMR gets higher so all in all I have roughly 250+ hours on it.But I'll make a fairly brief and honest review of it.This thing has Game and lots of it. It's addictive It's fast paced It's tense It's the type of do or die type of game where every decision you make can cost you your life.People are not absolute bullet sponges here either nor is it like playing CS GO COD BF1.It's got it's on flair on the DMG and how it works with bullet dropoffs and range factoring in and certain distances but not all.But and there's always a big but . It's unoptimized and with every patch they push out to change optimization it works till the next patch where you're back to square one or even worse than when they first tried to fix it. Netlag is an issue and will get you killed if it's not on your end it'll be on the enemies side remember BF4? It's fairly similar to that and yes I know how the dmg system works how the damage is calculated by the server and what server acknowledges and what it doesn't and why it is that way.But I'm talking about where you're behind a building and you die and on your deathscreen you then see someone peeking around the corner as if they've seen you for 3seconds and already lined up the shot. The server isn't behind by 3seconds everyone knows that. But this will get changed I'm sure of it.The Final Verdict on my end should still be obvious.I love the game I absolutely adore and wish the devs the best of luck in removing all the kinks and I whileheartedly recommend it to anyone who has the money to spare and are up to the challenge because it is a challenging game to get into.You will have to relieve yourself of everything you know and learn it from the ground up tactics that work in other games might not work here as a lot of it is simply experience and being able to analyze every situation you're in down to a T . But it's worth it so do give it a shot and if you have friends.I prefer duoing over full squad but both are a lot of fun but duo is just my style. )Good luck out there and see you on the battleground.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Literally stop reading this and go get the game best $30 you'll ever spend.

review: Alright ladies and gents.. Let me give you my take on this jaunt.This game is pretty ing good. Hopefully if you read this I expect that you have played H1Z1 or atleast know how that game works. H1Z1 being the main competetor with Playerunknown Battlegrounds.I will start with my dislikes of Playerunknown Battlegrounds (PUBG)(Note this game IS EARLY ACCESS BUGS/OPTIMIZATION ISSUES ARE RELEVANT HERE) PUBG definately has it's flaws when it comes to Optimization &amp Performance. Even the most up to date PCs (im talking a 1080 GPU) struggle to substain 60 fps on high/ultra settings in most areas around the game. (We're talking 30 45 fps at best) Running the game on Medium graphics is enjoyable and gets the job done. Give it time they are working on optimization. I appreciate how rare med kits are in this game (Med kits which heal 100% of your health NOT first aid kits) but I don't see why the bandages only allow you to heal up to 75% of your health. / The healing in H1Z1 is a lot better IMO. I think bandages and first aid kits should be allowed to get you back to 100%.PUBG is having HUGE success and I hope they can better optimize their game quickly so more people can purchase the game and enjoy with good frame rate. No 1080 should be taxed like it is here. Lets go to the LIKES of PUBG This game is tactical as . You can't sprint towards people and jump around the corner with a shotgun like you can in H1Z1 first of all you can't jump and shoot like an idiot because that isn't realistic. The slower pace take your moment tactical player will have more fun and will win more games. The Compass and Map being pinned on the HUD is a must have for battle royal games. PUBG does a fantastic job here. The compass on H1 is on the top right corner looks out of place and no map on the screen. The map also shows you exactly where your character is in relation to everything around you. H1Z1 highlights the cordinate (H4) for example. Not a very good system for this style of game. The customization of weapons is ing great! Like I mentioned above the strategic tactical player WILL MOST LIKELY WIN! Do you want an automatic shotgun with a supressor? Sure! How about a sniper with a surpressor? Sure! Favor more accuracy and instead use the flash hider over the supressor to engage in a long range fight? You got it. H1Z1 lacks here but PUBG does a beautiful job. One game you might have a kar98k sniper but are left with a 2x scope. The next game you could have the Kar98k with a 15x scope! Your gameplay changes based on the attachments of what you can find.Now I run this game using a 760 GPU. This card is a good bit outdated so I lowered my settings to the lowest to get the best frames I can get. I can get about 60 80 in towns. The island you spawn on has a lot of shananigans going on and it really taxes my computer. But that's okay.Hopefully if you got this far you learned something about this game If your computer can run it I highly suggest picking it up. This game is fantastic to play solo or with a group of buddies. Vehicles are more common here (over H1) and make the game so much fun with friends. And if you CAN'T run this game stick around watch for updates. They are working on it. ) Anyways I'm tired of typing. Have a good day.

review: This game runs like Worst optimization I've seen in a while. If you don't have a really powerful PC prepare for a experience low FPS crashes and whatnot. Often enough the buildings won't have loaded yet as I touch the ground and I need to wait a minute until my CPU (i5 6600K) can handle this mess of a game. This is the only game my computer has ever had any issues with including GTA V Witcher 3 etc.This game offers a wide variety of bugs to choose from (randomly).This game's servers are a joke. Period.This game's randomness is a bit too much for me (I know it is a BR game). Sometimes I will enter 3 or 4 buildings (after waiting outside for a minute or two until they load properly) until I can find a decent gun.The randomness in this game is a bit too much for my taste (I know it is a BR game). Sometimes I will search 3 or 4 buildings until I can find a decent gun.The only reason this game has so many players is that it's the only ok game of the Battle Royale genre. As soon as a game of this genre comes out this game will be dead just like it happened to H1Z1 KOFTK.Obs. Fortnite follows a different line of Battle Royale with cartoonish graphics and a building system so I am still waiting for a true and realistic BR game to come out.

review: Overall the game is good performance is good for my system but one thing that i really hate about this game is the inconsistancy in damage from weapons its most likely down to hit reg or server lag but every so often i have these games where someone can one tap with a pump action shotty with helmet and chest rig and no damage is given to either piece yet i still get dropped. then other games will happen where i do the same (or so i thought) they take 4 5 hits with the same level armour on them. the game needs fixing i know the server tick rate is most likely the issue as there maximum 15 on tick rate for NA and 10 if not 5 for EU with many sources stating the same online. there servers need fixing fast because the way damage works it can only be put down to poor server tick rate and hit reg issues. and as of right now i cannot recommend this game till the devs pull there finger out of there *** and increase tick rate on the servers. i know this can be done as i have exstensive knowledge on the UE4+networking and this can easily be resolved with better servers to handle tick rate.

review: After almost a year of closed beta to early access and a few years of total development the game is still pretty low budget. the Battle Royal game mechanic is fun no matter who makes a game about it. Don't mis interpret battlegrounds as being a good game just because your having fun with the 'mechanics' inherit in any Battle Royal style game. What the Developers have produced around that game mechanic is a low quality un professional adolescent attempt at a game. BlueHole doesn't have experience making a single Shooter game or First Person Shooter game and it shows everywhere. bad netcode creating incredible inconsistency dying around a corner when a building is completely protecting you from gun fire. lag desync rubber banding Inconsistent weapon mechanics and physics(some weapons act realistic only in certain situations but cartoony in others like the game is having an identity crisis) some low powered pistols will kill somebody in 3 bullets at full health while the next game the same gun will take 7 bullets as if the rules of the game keep changing per match not allowing you to build knowledge and skill around expected behaviours from the game environment and players. Lv. 3 armour will reduce damage one game then reduce no damage at all the next game. paying for keys to get items you may or may not ever get complete rng micro transactions and this is taking place after the game is still a mess and isn't officially released yet oh and also you have to pay full price for the game upfront. Terrible quality textures some textures look like N64 graphics and haven't changed since last year. Gun Damage recoil range and power seems to follow no assemblance of logic or order this is after the developer insists on some extra realism by focusing on there being different bullet types but this ammo will do different damage depending on the gun you put it in. and then also may or may not do a certain amount of damage depending on if armour or helmets function properly or not. HACKERS

review: Well that's a pretty decent game even yet in early access. Few bugs matchmaking is fast and you can hook up some friends to it (it's up to 4 players teams right now).There is only one map and that's a shame but it is so big that there is some places I still haven't discovered yet even with 40+ hours of gameplay (Mostly because I never jump where everyone does).It is really immersive. I have found myself many times with my heart racing when I got sniped when combat was near or when the number of players still alive was closing to 1. So you will rage and cry (mostly because of that mate who S UP) and curse on the silenced x8 scoped SKS or just the random tard who got you twice in the head while you were spraying him for 5 mins. Great moments.Anyway worth a try worth buying good to play with friends bound to become greater if handeled well.

review: I wish there was a "meh" button because I neither like nor dislike the game. Since there is none I go with the dislike and here are my reasons why 1. The game is poorly optimized. It consumes way too much resources for what it does. Maybe this will be fixed maybe not. But everyone with a system that is older than 3 years can forget to get anything higher than 20 fps on low settings.2. Despawning grass. The fact that after a certain distance grass just despawns is a joke considering the game tries to emphasize on hiding in it. There are multiple ways to fix this for example they could increase the draw distance for grass (but that would require even more resources) or they could simply remove the grass and emphasize more on the bushes placing more of them for cover.3. The vehicle handling is laughable. You can have a lot of fun with it and create a lot of funny accidents but IMO it is unacceptable to ask 30 for a game where the vehicles get send sky high because they so much as graced a small ledge or if you tried to ram a jeep into a motorcycle (savest way to get the jeep flying).4. The sound. I don't know what it is with the steps in this game but more often than not it sounds like there is an echo to your steps right behind you which can be irritating in the beginning. 5. Texture bugs. I had more than a few rounds where the textures of buildings would not load correctly and therefore render me unable to enter them in search of loot. This usually comes with a coin flip if the textures get loaded within 20 seconds or not worst case so far the textures didn't load for 4 minutes and then I got shot. And no it is not a problem on my end since this happens only every 4th or 5th round still it is an annoying bug.6. Grenades. They bounce back as if they are thrown against a rubber wall. I once threw a grenade right in the face of an enemie it just bounced back to me and I had to run away from my own grenade which I had thrown roughly 20m.Those are the things I dislike about the game. But there are a few things I like as well but they usually are fun because my squad and I are going for a troll tour. For example crossing the river in a yellow car or flipping it in the middle of the end zone and staying in it because nobody checks a flipped car. Overall you can have fun in this game if you don't take it seriously. For it being actually competitive it is way too unoptimized and unfinished. I wouldn't buy it for 30 again it is more like a 15 20 game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I normally hate all PVP games but I watched a ton of videos from some of my favorite Youtubers and figured I'd give it a chance.Sooo glad I did! Most fun I've had with a game since I got super into Insurgency! Definitely some bugs to iron out but that's kind of the point of early access so hopefully by release it'll be rock solid. In the mean time it's just absurdly fun hilarious thrilling heart pounding excitement every match.EDIT After seeing a lot of complaints in other reviews about campers "ruining the game" I felt I should address this in my review for anyone who wants insight from a semi competent player.This isn't CoD. Camping is part of the game. I don't personally think it's the best strategy for every match because my favorite part of this game is that there IS no single best strategy. Running and gunning is viable. Camping is viable. Running and gunning can get you slaughtered. Camping can get you slaughtered. This game is about choice and about weighing possibilities at every turn. You can't take out the campers any more than you can take out the runner/gunners. But you can outplay people by being smart and playing tactically.You think it's unfair that a guy posts up in an outhouse the whole match? Toss a grenade in there and solve the problem. You don't want to be killed for going through a door onto a shotgun? Don't open the door and walk straight in like a chump then.

review: so i have over 600 games playd with a 13% winrate and a 33% top 10 in both duo and solo so i feel like i can recomend or tell about this game in better detail.i wanna start by adressing the issues ive had the last 7 days. The "Lost connection to host" has been a huge problem for me. it have only happend 11 of my 600 games but its still really annoying because i actually loose the game i was inn when the host disconnects. (frustrating when you try to get a good rank.)Another very common issue is the server laggs. the laggs is global so it does efect everyone and not just you.Another big problem is the circle you have to outrun. The last few rings are too quick and they hit for too much. Now to the things i enjoy the most about the game! It is pretty much a combination of the battlestyle from Arma3 and the battle royale from H1Z1. The guns are very balanced where you can snipe people with a M416 just as good as with a SKS witch doesent make the snipers Over Powered. you can allso find Kar98k (sniper) in regular houses so you dont have to find an airdrop for the snipers. The rank system is allso very good where you have 3 different ladders. one is for the overall score one is for wins and one is for kills. Hope you can relate to this review if you got some games under your belt aswell!Good luck!

review: Let's be clear this game is early access as hell but the fact that the basic concept shines through so well is a testament to where this is going. Battle Royale (the Japanese pre Hunger Games Hunger Games) is an amazing movie a decent magna and I've heard it's a pretty good novel too. This game is the closest approach to it I've ever played. Getting there is very difficult because a lot of FPS games have little to no consequence for playing badly. You can run around in Halo get noticed take a few rounds and the shields will save you and later recharge. You take 3 rounds in this game and you're likely to be mortally wounded bleeding out crawling on the ground hoping they don't see you. The tension this inspires is amazing the level of tactics you have to apply to stay alive on an island with 99 other players is ever climbing as people learn the game.Grab a rifle if you can find it hide in a building or out in the forest and try not to be seen. It's far harder than you think.

review: Really good game! I love physics and the game world. There is just some things to change/fixThings to fix You cannot jump while ALTing (looking around you) Huge server lag EU which forces me to play NA sometimes NA is fine. Weapons clipping through walls and doors Parachute landing too slow f*ckfest (You should be able to cut the parachute mid air) Spectating is totally a mess sounds come from wrong directions and it lags like hell.Things to change Area NEEDS to come/move faster its like 20 mins before people are even on a similar area.. Sounds need to be heard much louder if someone sneaks up to your house you cannot even tell. Non drived cars should not have lights on. This is not necessary but i think it would be cool to see the next area (white circle) on the ground too so you could take better positions etc.. I dont think it would make the game too easy just much more enjoyable. MORE GUNS! ) Color variety in Dasia not only blue (Things that are awesome! Guns are very fine balanced! Attachments are really nice! Cars are working really good too if you drive carefully.After 60hrs i can say the game is solid and not bad for early access only thing to be worried about is that will the fixes and content ever arrive or will this be another DayZ?

review: I never was big into Battle Royale/King of the Hill mode games until I got this game. I played H1Z1 KOTK and Just Survive (prior to that being basically abandoned) and it was just a meh experience. As a veteran of many FPS games tactical shooters and having 3000 hours of Arma 2 and 3 combined I'd say this is a great blend of both styles perfectly executed. I've been one to fall for the bait of Early Access games that never finish or come full of empty promises. The devs of this game are doing a great job out of the gate and the future for it looks very bright.There are currently some optimization issues but the transparency of the devs with a timeline of when to expect certain things help greatly with knowing when to roughly expect what to be done.Every match is intense from start to finish your adrenaline and anxiety is through the roof. Winning a match is a very satisfying experience and is a challenge that is hard to find in shooters. This game is well worth the $30 cost of admission and if you're looking for something with more realism better shooting mechanics slower pacing and strategy involved than KOTK than this is the game you must get.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS
