It has quick loading times you can spawn whenever(drop out of a airplane) You can actually see the reticle and the invitory is amazing and adding scopes and modifications is as easy as easy as can be. The one thing i have about this game is a few small glitches but that is to be expected in a early access game. One glitch is only being able to move in one direction which at that point you need to reset your game. My fravorite thing is that dying in this game doesnt make you want to refund it. You always get some sort of reward allbeit small but still you get something. If your looking for a fun game with a fun adn funny community get this game. 10/10 so far.

review: I love this game. It's a survival battle royale type game. I do reccommend this game... but ONLY if you have a medium system or above. No lower end PC's will run this game just forewarning. I played H1Z1 King of the Kill. Had been playing it since before the game split into two and went full access. But this game... this game trumps it by 110%. I'm gonna make this review easy by putting pro's and con's. Pro's Attachments for guns A wide selection of weapons to find Backpacks Helmets and Vests have 1 to 3 lvls The ability to revive your teammates when downed. (obviously only duos or squad) Vehicles are nice and very common so you don't feel trapped Gunplay is nice being able to play first and 3rd person The boost system for health regen and movement speed is awesome Devs are on top of things and are adding new updates all the timeCon's Very unoptimized so lower end rigs can't support it. ( I deal with the problems because I love the game and I have a mid ranged rig ) Campers galore!!! Hit detection is horrid you never know where you are getting shot from. ( especially if they have a suppressor ) Some bugs not a tremendous amountI have plenty more to say but for now that is all. This game has only been out for a few months give it time and it will be amazing. So much potential with an active development team.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Ok so some of the experiences in the old days of the DayZ mod were priceless truly moments that I wont forget.I've struggled since then to have those 'moments' recreated...UNTIL NOW!Holy crap I've played 2 hours of this and it's been amazing. My buddy sat on the water tower by a small town whilst I was in a nearby house watching his flank from a balcony. As the map starts to close In we realise we are in perfect location and didn't need to move. We saw 2 guys heading across the field to loot one of the larger buildings in town we see them in the windows watching over and as true pros we count down our shots 3.2.1. Bang one hits the deck and instantly dies whilst the other got away hiding in one of the small rooms.We left him there for a while until 2 men roll up in a vehicle not realising what the hell has just gone down. What house doo they choose to loot the one with Mr Hiding man upstairs we could have taken the shot at these guys but watching it play out just seemed like the better option. Flashes and gun shot sounds echo out across the field to find that the guy hiding took both of these guys out. He thought they killed his friend... he was wrong.Just when he thought he was safe he started to make the way towards the vehicle the others left and boom 5 shots in his back brought him down. Was such a great moment. This is what i've missed. Great for alpha stage and ran surprisingly well on my now slightly dated machine. Worth a try? Damn right it is. You won't regret this purchase.

review: First of all I do recommend this game but only if you are willing to look past some of the issues the game currently has. My personal issue is that I have a system that is somewhat over the recommended requirements. Only problem as I can see it is that my Graphics Cards is kinda old GTX760 4GB. Everywhere i checked and calculating how many fps i should be getting on the medium to high preset of the game was around 80 90 fps though I get 30 50 on very low low presets and some rounds that it takes my system 1 49 minutes to render the houses when i first land (yes i set a counter P ). So this leads us to the first and major flaw of the game in this stage of it's early access. It's a bit of a gamble i have to say as there are games now out from bigger studios that still have the same optimization issues as they did in their early access. I hope the developers will look more into the issues than the cosmetics... So far the cosmetics are dropped from cases which you can get with ingame money (BP) and they are free to open. I put this much emphasis on free cause of the game that introduced/popularised skin gambling (CS GO) and it created a terrible microtransaction trend.Now another big issue of the game is the server issues. FIrst day I got the game I was kind of sceptical about it as 30$ for an early access seemed a bit too much. Anyway when I first entered the menu i was greeted with a massive issue with the server. I even set a reminder in my pc so I would not go over two hours of gameplay to be able to refund. With my internet connection (250 mbps) I should not have any connection problems with an EU server. Despite my internet connection being supperbly good though I got a ton of "Network Lag Issues" and I died many times for that reason. This is as big of an issue as is optimization but I'm willing to overlook that for it being in Early Access. The reason I recommend this game after three paragraphs of salt is that the games that I actually got to play ( 15) were really fun and stressful in a good way. The adrenaline in a gunfight the hapiness from finding a good gun/equipment the satisfaction of a long kill the tension on the coming footsteps the feeling of teamwork in Duos with friends(or strangers) that delightful feling when seing that #1 (I came first two times D one in solo and one in Duo D but my friend died T_T ). And the overall feel of the game is amazing. I only recommend it thought to people willing to put up with some potential issues. I will probably update this review if things change with the issues. P.S. I usualy become saltier when a game pisses me off and BOY THIS GAME...
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

Something just feels off with it to me. I have no problem with gambling in real life but to do it through a game that you love that hasn't even left EA yet is purely a cash grab. review: Let's get right into the bad news first off because that's what a review is about right? This game is pretty decently hard to run I run it on very low on every setting and I have a GTX 770 with a i5 4690k the sounds can mess with you every now and then the ghillie suit doesn't blend in nearly as much as it should the blood and bullet effects drop me down to 4 FPS when I'm close enough and the guns aren't really plentiful unless you spawn in the right spots but that's about all I've got really. Now let's talk about the good.I addressed the sound issue which they'll be fixing real soon (probably sometime early April) along with some FPS issues people are having. They already have huge plans for the game new maps fixing issues they actually listen to the customers which is really unique in a company. The game is loads and I mean LOADS of fun it's so satifisfying killing people with whatever weapon you've got the playerbase is really kind honestly and I haven't really been talked to badly yet. It's beautiful to look at if you can run it consistently and the gun play is amazing. Like top tier amazing. The game feels like ArmA in a lot of ways which is really good the character movements guns they all kind of feel similar. I'm so happy this game was released so fast and kind of came out of nowhere I thought I was going to be a little disappointed but I'm not in the slightest. Amazing game really amazing. TL DR it has some issues right now that are to be fixed real soon it's an amazing shooter with great mechanics feels nothing like H1Z1 (thank goodness) and it's 100% worth the buy if you've got an up to date computer
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is hands down the best battle royale game ever made to date it is everything that was good about H1Z1KOK merged With PlayerUnkown's Arma 3 mod it is just the right mix of arcadey gameplay and realism that makes it so memorizing to play and it is still in early acess which means it can only get better. What i do advise though is if you have a lower end Pc then i reccomend you wait for the game to become more optimized at the moment the game suffers from rendering issues with systems that either don't have 8 gigs of ram or without an ssd.

review: What we have here is the culmination of work done by Brendan Greene through his work on his Dayz mod Arma 3 and H1Z1 all of which i played many times. After the slew of trash "AAA" games over the past few years it was refreshing to buy a game (for not 40) and watch the hours played grow much more than some games. When it first released there were indeed problems i remember the sound was properly ed and the optimisation was a true flaw but having put the graphics on very low i could easily play it with friends and it was a good time. As extremely sizeable patches came out Very low changed to low and low changed to medium. Optimisation is working and the game as a whole is getting even better than at its release. The gunplay from day 1 is still next to none and the mechanics that are still being largely expanded upon are brilliant. Then comes the reason recent reviews are mixed. Apparently Brendan promised no microtransactions until out of alpha and with an update added invitational crates you could earn for battlepoints but could open with a key. My favourite quote some guy in the forums said was something along the lines of "they are milking us dry with all these microtransactions!!" which i laughed at as it is the most optional thing i have seen. I really couldn't care about cosmetic microtransactions i firmly believe i owe it to the team for making such a good game. Now if they started adding meaningful content behind a paywall THEN we have problems but being able to earn crates i can sell for 2 just benefits me. So yeah if you are on the fence having played king of the kill buy this one its actually good.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Player Unknown's Battlegrounds or PUBG is a game in the battle royale sub genre of the first/third person shooter market. The basic premise is 100 players drop onto a large map filled with numerous buildings villages towns and other major structures such as a prison and airport. Your job is simple. Kill everyone else and be the last man standing.The idea isn't original by any means as H1Z1 king of the kill came before but PUBG has produced a somewhat slicker and more technically stable product though that isn't to say it isn't stable all the time. The semi regular patching cycle does fix and add new items but it also breaks the servers for long periods or creates odd bugs that can persist for days at a time. This happens nearly everytime but they do fix the issues pretty fast so it isn't unstable for long.It isn't all solo shooting as you and upto three friends can battle in squads to be the last squad standing and honestly this is the way the game should be played. While solo has it's moments being in a duo trio or full four man team creates some really memorable moments and if you can get friends to play with you the game is so much more fun. There is also a first person only mode that is currently in beta at the time of writing for those who prefer that view mode for play.Players can use a variety of weapons from pistols smg's shotguns marksmen rifles sniper rifles assault rifles and light machine guns. Some are obviously better than others and usually you will want to scavenge as much as possible to find the best gear. Vehicles are also available but they are strictly for transport so don't expect to take tanks or APC's but hell you can run people over for a few quick kills.Probably the most contentious issue is the store which isn't asking for micro transactions but items bought using the coins earned in matches can be sold on the steam market place. So expect to see items on there for incredible sums of money for no reason other than it's apparently rare. Luckily the store only rewards clothing and not items like weapons or skins for those weapons. Though give it time.In summary the game is good but does need work to fix some server side issues and expand the content to add more map types and game features though these are in the works. Remember it's an early access title and so you should be aware that one day it might work and the next it won't because updates happen and the game changes.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Addictingly fun and getting better all the time.A pulse pounding paranoia inducing all PvP battle royale. Drop with up to 99 other people either solo as a duo or in squads of up to 4 onto an abandoned island chock full of weapons gear and supplies and just try to be the last surviving individual or group as a slowly damaging barrier gradually closes in forcing everyone still alive into the same spot.Starts out as a frantic race to scavenge decent weapons and gear. Then it slows down a bit as you travel the 7km diameter island trying to stay within the ever closing barrier. Once you get down to the last 30 survivors or so things start to get CRAZY. Suddenly there's a person around every building behind every tree and squatting in every bush. And EVERY SINGLE ONE OF THEM wants to be the one to kill you.The graphics aren't spectacular and honestly the game is pretty unoptimized (I can run most games at 4K with no sweat this I have to drop to 2K with all my settings at 'Low' just to get a decent framerate) however the raw fun factor is undeniable and the devs are working hard to make the game better all the time with new content added monthly and bugfixes and performance updates coming every week or two.I can't wait to see where this game goes but no matter what I'm hooked already.

review: I do and also don't reccomend it... lmao. So I realize this is early access as of August 2017 so hopefully this will be resolved but from what I've seen (happening to me as well) their is a game breaking bug involving the homescreen of the game. You load into a main menu in which your character isn't there. You can see the church in the background but not you. Their is also no option to queue up in the top left... you are basically stuck. I recommend purchasing after this is resolved. Other than this the game is overall very fun. I enjoy the aspect of a brushed up better version of H1Z1. Can be very intense depending on where you land and how you play. Or it can be very slow and sneaky. Either way I enjoy it.Edit A new update was released fixing the problem entirely. Other than few minor bugs great game.

review: I bought this game to play with some friends and I did just that. The first couple of games was a bit of a learning curve to determine whether to be a hoarder or just be happy with what you got. After overcoming that hurdle and surving to the top 25 I think of myself as a Rick Grimes but with less zombies I'm on top of the world.. But glitches when getting out of a vehicle or just randomly flying off into the distance bring me crashing back down to Earth. Oh and the hackers will most certainly make you smash your desk.Edit If you equip the fry pan and run with it in your hands you get the odd sensation of being a jedi dodging bullets... It's not as cool and definitley not effective.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: My review may or may not be helpful depending on where you live. I live in Hong Kong (Yes no need for VPN) so I don't go through what people in the states and I don't deal with the outrageous things that people in mainland China do. What I can tell you is that I face absolutely NO problems with bans and all of that. The game runs surprisingly well on my core i7 7700 with GTX 1050 16GB RAM LAPTOP. I can get around 100 FPS on a good day and 45 FPS while accidentally running google chrome and wallpaper engine in the background.The game is brilliant in terms of combat the only thing I would say is that the Aim Down Sights should be holding right mouse instead of clicking. As an active Call of Duty player (yes I know shame on me) it just feels right to hold down right mouse.Another thing is that there should be a guide of some sorts to help you out when you start. I remember my first game I didn't know how to bloody jump out the plane. I also didn't know how to aim. Something to do with the map and it's spawns as well I think that vehicles should spawn MORE. The chances of getting to the circle at the other end of the map is slim to none without a vehicle and from what I have played vehicles don't spawn often.For weapons i think the developers have done a great job. They could make it better by adding some sort of advantage to the holographic sight because in my opinion the red dot is better in every way. I also think they should add laser sights (yes my COD self is coming to the surface) so that aiming from the waist is slightly easier.In conclusion if you live anywhere outside NA or China I would get the game.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is leaving early access this december.I had a blast playing this battleground.It's a generic 3rd person shooter without unnecesary competitive mode like any other games so maybe that's what makes this game more fun to play because you play without having concern about your rank tier or whatsoever but maybe not for some player who want to treat this game as a competitive one.The pressure you'll be experiencing is different with any other survival game. It's something new in gaming world.The physics still kinda buggy but acceptable. Note that this game is still in beta access and still developing. Vaulting and physics correction are coming on December when the game is leaving early access.Play alone 100% fun guaranteedPlay with friends 400% fun guaranteed + extra salt. steamsalty TL DR This game is GOOD and hella fun but don't expect this game to be a non buggy one.Recommended.

Only option you got is paying 3k game currency which will take a lot of time to get unless you plan on playing 8hrs straight which might not sound like a lot but it's no f*cking mmo#4 this game is 'ok' at best. What are all those morons getting excited at?#5 optimization is non existent in this game#6 no kill cam (might sound like a petty thing but when you get killed 20th time and you never saw the enemy you start wondering was that even a legit kill? cuz I've been sitting in a building not even remotly close to the window never heard any1 coming and boom I'm dead. review: By far one of the best early access games I have ever put money into. Imagine 100 players all air dropped onto an island with nothing but their parachute. You land! Then race is on to find as many decent weapons and supplies as possible to eliminate all other players within the map. At the same time the impending force field that is hot on your tail will slowly push you all together towards the end of the game and cause one hell of a mexican stand off...I rate it highly and would recommend to anyone that enjoys the battlegrounds kind of genre. Plus if you feel like teamwork is more your strong point they have the options of being in a duo or four man squad. Try it. Play it. Love it. Die millions of time.... 10/10 would die many more times!

review: Fun value(solo) 6/10Fun value(with friends) 8.5/10Game value overall 4/10At the moment the game is not recommended for Solo players but I can probably recommend it if you have friends to play with. Here's why...PROS +The game is about "last man standing" but you can win together with your friends if your squad mates are the last people alive+The sound is awesome guns actually sound like guns.+Great for casual players who can't really commit to a videogame(like being online 24/7 or you get raided overnight and lose months of progress yeah you know what I'm talking about) +Pretty fresh concept so long time fps players don't have all the advantage which means it's ok to be a noob.CONS The game is pretty laggy because of "poor coding" plus bugs and glitches. (To be expected because it's "early access") The biggest con by far is that currently is that there's absolutely no reason to stay. The gameplay is fun and all but there's no real progression. When you win you get some currency. But what is that currency for? Just some box that gives you a random clothing. The problem with the box is that it can give what you already have. Not only that but the price of the box keeps increasing. If you got 3 white T shirts then boo hoo.In conclusion the game is pretty fun but there's not enough content to play with at the moment. I need better reasons to stay. Otherwise the game will probably die like Titanfall 1Edit 8/28/2017Well Early Access and they introduced microtransactions for "cosmetics" only. That stuff doesn't fly on this type of game where camo is extremely crucial. Also streamers seems to be entitled in this game except of being you know JUST ANOTHER PLAYER. At the streamers' word you can get banned. I thought PUBG was headed to being an actual good game seems like I was wrong. PUBG got lucky on being popular and it seems like they are trying to push their luck. At this point I cannot recommend the game at all

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I'm having absolute blast! PUBG is a product full of contradictions. It's ugly for 2017 standards interface is clean but clunky smoothness is a rare occurence and there is only one map. Game is extremely hard. Not only you fight with enemies but you fight with yourself trying to keep the emotions managed so you don't suddenly start rushing to that house on the other side of the street or won't jump out on much better equipped enemy. And here lies the secret I've never played a game before which would beat my butt every round and force me to restart again but in the same time give so much fun that I forget about whole world for this 20 30 minutes of playthrough. You have plethora of weapons with mods (silencers scopes grips you name it) variety of vehicles to drive with random equipment spawning and constant feeling that you want to learn to get better. Save yourself some pain and watch youtube guides first otherwise you will do what I did on my first playthrough when I didn't find any weapon apart from crowbar and was trying to outsmart a guy with SCAR who came in a buggy. While he was chasing me around I tried to jump into his buggy but did that from the back and ended up in some kind of weird backseat with my butt directed right at my enemy's gun. Guess what happened. A mix of masochism with big learning curve (game is VERY easy to play and VERY hard to master) a refresher in boring world of COD's (every series with same issues) or Battlefield (big chaos). Here you actually need to think. And I mean really THINK. Not about large scale tactics. You have to make decisions Should I stay longer behind the tree? Should I enter the house on the other side of the street? Why the doors are open? Why they are closed? Why this guy left the M16 on the gr.... *booom*! (headshot!) There is a lot of negativity lately with regards to cheaters. I play on EU server and have not encountered one (or they hide well) nevertheless I believe they are somewhere as in every game. The review is based on solo PUBS. I haven't try squads yet I'm aware lot of people advertise them but for now I like to battle with 99 souls and my own fear.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Out of the time I've invested in it which isn't a lot ( like 20 something hours) I can highly recommend this game.Out of a 10 I give it a fair 8.It's not a bad game nor is it the greatest thing to come out like sliced bread but it's good.It would be higher if it weren't for some bugs.Like the optimization issues and some shooting bugs.For example in order for me to avoid getting stuck on a building if I land on it or it being loaded well I set my graphics settings to low then after it loads and I get my gear and ready to roll I set it back to high.After that I have no issues through out the game this issues occurs when I land not in the lobby island.That's my only main issue I have in 98% of the time.But I have bin told it's because of the ram I have 8 gigs.So maybhe if I had more it would fix it and also bin told installing it ON a ssd might help too but I'll figure that out.But for the most part the game is fun and hella addictive well for me and friends.All bugs aside the game is pretty good so far.It is Early Acess after all so the game will improve with time.For me it's worth the time.It's best played with friends but solo is great to sharpen your skills.Update Upgraded to 16 gigs of ram over a month ago and I rarely have any rendering issues.So if you have any rendering issues upgrade your ram if you have 8 gigs only.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Its a good game you can gear up fairly easily its not too hard to make it pretty far but winning is a real challenge. It usually feels like a solid luck/skill balance. However the one thing that would make this game really good is a killcam. Nearly every time I die I hear gunshots see my health drop then i just drop dead and never had any idea where the enemy was. Then I'm dead and it still doesnt tell me where the enemy was. If at least in solo mode once you died it could show you the 10 15 seconds leading up to your death from your killers POV that would be really great and would make the game a lot more fun.

review: Well I gave Bluehole the benefit of the doubt but nothing has changed in regards to cheaters. On November 3rd they posted on Steam apologizing to the players for the amount of cheaters we have all continued to experience. They claimed that they would be releasing stronger anti cheat measures the following week. In October about 33% of my games had cheaters in them. In November about 50% of my games have had cheaters in them. It would seem that Bluehole's apology was nothing more than an attempt to save face with the community rather than provide any sort of solution. There was plenty of evidence to be skeptical of Bluehole's integrity 6 months ago...as of today any faith that the community has left in this dev is a delusion. The level of incompetence and unprofessionalism from the executives at Bluehole has been demonstrated since the release of this game. Not once have they delivered on any of their promises update deadlines or development target dates. Hopefully one day the gaming community will get tired of being dumped on by game developers and actually start moving towards taking back the industry that we helped build throughout our lives.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So i wanted in a long time to buy a new game and i found out about this game in twitch. Me and my friends/squad instantly got hooked by it. We kept an eye on it for 1 week to check about the game's perfomance etc and the we got conviced that this game aint gonna go by the dayz develompent. So we bought it. The learning curve was medium after you learn the weapons bullets etc you are starting enjoying this game especially when you squad up.Finally i would like to add that there is a circle mechanic that control the map and make the players come up against its a little bit rng so be prepared for some random circles trolling you.All in all Pubg is a fun game that you can try hard or troll around with your buddies. Sure it requires a lot of development (bugs perfomance etc) but its the best game of its genre so far.

review: I guess I will weigh in here...To everyone who is complaining about microtransactions....did you bother to read what it goes towards? No? SHOCKING you people don't ever read anything.The money from the keys are going to the prize given at GamesCom it's a way for the COMMUNITY to help fund a professional competition for PUBG.Now on to a more formal review This game is both enjoyable and frustrating but still enjoyable while being frustrating. By that I mean it's highly enjoyable to shoot people get loot find the best/most tactical way to engage in solo/duo/squad play...but also enjoyable when the physics (or lack thereof) make your car launch in a random direction that causes utter panic on if it's going to right itself or if you are now in the middle of a field with no cover and now no vehicle.It's nothing but pure win and most of the "negative" reviews are probably from people still playing "The Division" so they are a bit confused on what a good game actually is!
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: //Second review I have 60+ hours of gameplay on PUBG so the things I say are based on first hand experience.My first review was mostly positive but after some time I have changed my opinion.PUBG is a simple game with a simple idea set on a fairly well designed island with great spots. But the game is currently hardly playable Below I'll point out the reasons why.REASONS I HAVE STARTED TO HATE PUBG#1) Sound problems of the back sounds is a disgrace directional sound is incorrectly implemented from a correct sound concept. Sounds aren't were they should be when it counts. Normal stereo sound is wonderful if you are looking directly at a moving car or directly at a shooting enemy the problem occurs when you get shot at from an unkown position. If a bullet passes by you from the left as an example the sound will put you off and will sound like it is from a different location like right back. This makes it nearly impossible to find the shooter if you don't understand the broken mechanics of the sound engine This MUST get fixed it is a 10/10 problem that can and most likely will get you killed making the experience unjoyable. A simple fix would be too remove the current sound system and use ARMA's sounds instead.#2) Textures not loading this one has been an issue from day one. Textures not loading and causing the building to look like mushy two toned roblox creations. This is a game killing bug that kills me 9/10 times because it stops you from being able to loot the building and if you force youself through the wall you have a high chance of getting stuck in the wall or table or whatever is in the house worst when stuck you can't get out and if you can you will die from falling. This happens more and more after each repeated session only after I leave the game and go back in those it stop or load faster. I have rage quit because of this. A fix would be to optimize the algoritm which loads textures and set a higher priority for building textures.#3) Network lag this one I can let slide for now. It does seem you are fixing network and server problems which is great.#4) Just optimize the damn game already you are using UE4 a powerfull engine with the capabilities to optimize that a simple game like this can get played on a low end pc THIS WILL INLARGE THE PLAYERBASE AND BRING IN MORE *PROFIT*.#5) A reason I like the game it is fun it requires skill and it keeps you busyI give PUBG a 7/10 rating and a NO RECOMMENDATION until above mentioned problems get fixed.//Thank you have a nice day

review: Land in a highly contested area. Pick up a pistol and one opponent runs past. 1 kill. Loot his body and find he somehow got a M4 but died to your pistol. Proceed to the middle of the city and kill three on the way. Feeling like Rambo now. The first safe zone appears on the map and you realize its gonna be a gauntlet on the way to a safe hideout. Proceed to the safe zone and kill 1 on the way with a well placed headshot. When the brain matter clears the air you see a buggy glinting in the sun. Fueled and ready to drive to safety now. LETS ROLL OUT BOIS! Get some sweet air over the first hill and hit the open plains ready to fire the boost and tear flipping everyone off as you pass by. WAIT!!!!!! Whats that? You didnt even notice til the last second. Oh its a tiny bump and you hit it and while in your second mid air flip the game crashes. Rambo sad.

review: I saw this game getting a lot of attention and decided to try it out. I thought MAYBE it had some appeal that I couldn't see after watching some gameplay and reviews. I was wrong. It was exactly what I expected it to be.Technically the game worked. The graphics were decent (even though i went low for the competative edge) the mechanics worked. The problem isn't so much the game as it's the concept. My first match went as expected I made it to the mid 30s. 2nd Match 3rd place. 3rd nearly as well. Why did I do so well? Because I camped. I camped hard. I spent 95% of each match reading a book on my e reader crouched in a windowless room in game.Fact is I see it like this. I could either A) have fun and lose or B) Camp till the last 5 and have a shot of winning. Neither option wholly appealed to me so I'm refunding. I completely recommend this to any and all campers in any other FPS I play. This is your home. Go home.

review: Player Unkowns battlegrounds is the perfect mix of the arma style BR expirience and the h1z1 BR expirience. I ing love this game with a passion since it takes all the things about h1z1 I dislike and adds onto them. this review will focus mainly on what is in the game that is not in h1z1.#1) Attachments system and the large amount of weapons (still growing!). something kinda boring about h1z1 is the small amount of variety. its AR 15 and Shotgun with the occasional ak and or sniper riffle. end game combat is allways samey and its kinda like playing a cod game where one gun is overpowered and it oversaturates the gameplay. in this game however you have no clue what your enemy may have. he could have a meriod of assault riffles which all have there strengths a high power sniper rifle a dmr a sub machine gun. you never know! and it makes every engagement so much more fun. and to add atop the guessing game of engaging an enemy is the attachments. with a wide variety of low to high power sights a few grips silencers and a few oddballs every gun can be tailored into something you like. it makes looting dead doods more than getting some more ammo and helmets.#2) Armour done right! Okay the armour system was something I thought would turn off a lot of players. but I was totally wrong. everyone seems to love this new system they used for armour and I love it too. the difference between H1 and PUBG is that you can only carry one helmet and one vest at all times. this makes breaking helmets a hell of a lot more scary than h1. carying 2034 motorcycle helmets in a backpack seems kinda stupid if you ask me.#3) Tiered loot. the vests helmets and backpacks are "tiered" in this game from 1 3. 3 being best. this makes looting something more than an early game strat. getting better gear as the game goes on is part of the fun and trying to find higher tier loot is essential to victory. unlike h1 where you find a helmet and its the best helmet you can get right away its a little bit more expanded from the 1 helm 2 bag 2 vest set up h1 has. 3 of each means a ton of weird and allways differing combos.#4) Healing. Healing is a bit weird at first but I really like the way it is handled. healing is done in 2 different ways. dirrect and boosts. direct healing fills your bar up to a set amount so bandages are 5% and first aid kits are 75%. however dirrect heals can only get you back up to 75hp. boosts are a long term lingering effect that provides regen and faster movement speed. a bar above your hp will show the amount of boost you have after using a boost item (energy drink painkillers adren) and depending on which bar its up to (out of 5) it will give you specific effects. ex___ ______ ________ __ small decent good regen amazing regen!regen regen +speedas that bar fills the beter the effect is.#5) Vehicles that act like vehicles. since this game is built on a very modified version of the arma 3 engine this game has vehicles that ya know.. act like vehicles. not toys. and theres a pretty large variety of vehicles!#6) Bullet physics. this game has them.#7) weapon handleling. I love the fact that this game pretty much forces you to use first person in combat. unlike h1 you cannot hipfire 3000 meters out. you must ads to have accurate shots and unliike h1. the first person is more than just a gimic.#8) Squads vs solo's. In this game squad combat is the general synopsys I get from the comunity as being the way to enjoy PUBG. and solos is more fun in h1. I dont really believe that because I prefer PUBG across the board but its pretty fun.#9) Optimization. okay. the hugeeee downfall of this game as of current is the fps drops and overall problems. due to some very hard to fix reasons this game must be played on low settings to ensure a 60+ fps count on a decent rig. (I maintain 45 90 with a rx480 8gb with everything very low except textures being high)Overall I love this game and the constant additive of new content and feedback from the devs ensure this game will take over the battle royale market once and for all. I love the game and I think if the optimization probs are fixed I will be able to give this a 9/10. give it a try if you have the extra dosh! thanks everyone.

review: All the problems aside (which are going to be fixed in future patches for sure) very solid BR experience. More fun in Duo or Squad que Solo just feels bit booring since there is no one other to talk about tactics etc. Solid 5/5.RE REVIEW after first monthly patch (http //playbattlegrounds.com/news/68.pu) More than a solid BR experience now. Almost all the server lag/rubber banding/etc problems are gone. There are couple times in 10 hours of playing about when you might get shot when you're already in cover but that might be because that player is playing for other continent than you so the ping between you and the enemy is abnormally high.Framerates has improved a lot no more laggy 40 fps with my rig (see my profile) near Georgopol or other bigger cities.RE REVIEW after several monthly patches (08/26/2017) With every patch this game has improved a lot. First person especially is golden. Flanking is so satisfying and very rewarding. No more "Oh I got shot" prone and med up while you look for your enemy.RE REVIEW after 1.0 launch Very great progress performance wise thanks Bluehole. Also new map is refreshing tho there is a lot of camping possibilities inside the houses but there is a lot "bumps" on terrain so you have a lot cover atleast on one side.Can't wait for possible winter/night map or mode. And the jungle oh that is going to be fun!

review: Ok since I'm recommending the game it's obvious I like it. It's a lot of fun and matchmaking is super quick. Really that's all I'm looking for in an online game. I do have a few gripes though there seems to be an issue with viewing your online friends to invite them to a game sometimes there are framerate drops and it would be nice if there was a killcam or spectating option. However I know this game is still early access so I believe it is safe to assume the friends glitch and framerate drops will be hammered out by the time the game actually releases so it kinda has to get a pass on those for now.EDIT the game is now fully released and there is now the option of a killcam and they implemented something better than spectating (the recording feature).

review: PUBG is a awesome game! In short...The bit longer explained You and around 99 others parachute onto an island that is huge! You decide where along the planes path and so does the other people. Then you loot what you can get boosters guns ammo protection and so on. Then there is this "anoying" circle that makes the game happend!It starts out pretty big then you have to get inside cirle. At a certiain time the blue circle (around the white circle) begins to shrink.... gets closer and closer towards the white circle. If your outside the blue cirle you take damage.More damage the smaller the circle.Players outside that dosnt make it inside the blue could end up dying!Along this circle thingie you need to take care and kill the other players that you see. Last man/team alive gets that sweet chicken dinner!!!!!Personally i think its an awesome game great fun great frustrations when you land on the east coast and the damn white circle is aaaaaaaaaallll the way over at the west coast And there is no car in sight.... damnit!And best as you think "aha there is an house i can loot/hide in"You go in look around enters the fu.... bathroom and BANG.... there was one hiding... damnit!I have played it around 66 hours so far mostly with my friends. You can go solo duo og squad and play. Ive had some pretty funny moments and had to swallow my heart at times )but but butYou must remember that its early access atm.There are bugs strange things cars flying funny etc. But def. playable.So would i recommend this game? Hell yea!Go get it so you can taste the sweet chicken dinner (the win chicken dinner..) )

review: I'll cut to the cons first as they are far outweighed by the pros it is pricey for an early access game (that is far from finished) the game is quite buggy at times there is still a fair amount of hacking (is getting better) still doesnt have a very rewarding ranking system server hosting has still not been released for public use (only partners) in my opinion it lacks attachments for weapons very luck based (all battle royale games are though)now thats out of the way i can move on to the pros by far the best battle royale game out there lots of guns good weapon balancing exellent weapon mechanics one of the quickest matchmaking sytems i have ever seen since the most recent update it is pretty well optimised a great map (hopefully more to come) a very fun feel while keeping the game serious no micro transactions/ingame purchases with real money beautiful graphics great vehicles the adrenaline rush from getting a chicken dinner THE FRICKING UMP BOIIIIIIIsorry if i mispelt anything i wrote this very late after playing this game for a few hours

review: After playing just under 100 hours of PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds I feel that my opinion on the game has some weight to it.To start with this game is beautifully made! Yes the optimisation leaves a LOT to be desired but after playing for a while on a reasonable gaming PC it feels plays and acts perfectly. Battlegrounds has a simple premise of kill everyone else. That it. The controls are very easy to pick up and learn. The character customisation is done well enough to satisfy most and the currency system rewards getting a high rank doing loads of damage and the amount of kills you get making someone who has a lower skill level late game still able to get plenty of points even without getting near the top ten making the game more rewarding if if you have trouble winning.I would seriously recommend this game to people new to the battle royale genre and experienced players such as H1Z1 and The Culling players as its simple objective and easy to pick up controls make the game plenty of fun very quickly for new players and the strategy and awareness that goes into playing the game makes it even more enjoyable for experienced players.

review: I don't know much about Blue Hole's promise about promising to not introduce microtransactions during EA but I think the introduction of microtransactions creates a bigger problem for the community.My thought process of the microtransaction is more about how it creates a market of cosmetics where people want for insane prices (hundreds of dollars for a skirt from a box that costs BP + 2.5 USD is an insane profit) even if you don't get the best item several cosmetics are still fairly high in price and a huge window of income for players.With such crazy profit waiting to be made the hacking scene in PUBG now has a major motivator who are the devs themselves. I don't really know what PUBG gets from having an unhappy community but I guess cash grabbing is cash grabbing and the reason games are created nowadays are for profit not for enjoyment.So what I think is happening is thatmicrotransactions introduced (profit for Blue Hole) &gt People wanting new cosmetics (creating demand and profit window for hackers who can farm BP) &gt hacks being made (third party benefitting from microtransaction) &gt People getting banned for using hacks (more profit for Blue Hole and third party because people will try to go back to the game and use it more subtly making it hard for Battle Eye to detect) &gt Prices go down due to demand being met &gt Time to introduce new cosmetics in new boxesQuite disappointing as I really enjoyed the games before the microtransaction got introduced. Even though there is fairly low chance of meeting hackers it ruins my gaming experience as I don't know when I'll get shot from hundreds of meters away because he knows where I am without having to spot me by looking.

review: This review is going to be a bit of a roller coaster of emotions folks. Read through to the end please.This game is fantastic in concept mechanics and in gameplay execution. In spite of this I simply CANNOT reccomend this game in it's current state. Unless you have a computer that is leagues beyond the listed reccomendations in hardware (of which I should note my computer is far better than the requirements) you are going to have a rough time. In order to get this game to stop stuttering at the slightest hint of activity I had to force it to run on DirectX 8 for those who don't know what this is long story short I had to make the came hinder itself in order to achieve a playable framerate. This is AFTER I lowered the majority of my settings both in game and through basic file editing. I am running a GeForce GTX 970 with an additional allocation of RAM. This game will STILL often drop frames on multiple occasions even after every single fix I have tried found and experimented with. In a phrase the game is poorly optimized. However the developer has openly acknoledged this and has shown to be working on this other fixes to the game and working on eliminating the amount of "hackers" that have been present. The game is still fun to play when it runs smoothly and even with the drawbacks I find myself returning. It is for THESE reasons that while I cannot reccomend the game in its current state I can reccomend it as a whole. It IS in early access and the developer IS doing well in communicating with the community and fixing the problems. I have great expectations and plenty of evidence that these expectations shall be met in as swift a manner as they can be. Moving away from the issues at hand the game is as polished as it can be when it comes to the base gameplay and mechanics. It takes the "Hunger Game/Battle Royale" formula and focuses on it. Other games have added this as an afterthought more still have simply failed where PUBG shines wonderfully. With the addition of custom servers on the horizon the antics are sure to only grow in hilarity and fun.As such I reccomend purchasing PUBG supporting the developer and enjoying the game as it grows and improves.

review: This game started off as a great idea and that's about all I have to say that's positive. I've waited about 5 months to write a review to see if the company made progress on making it better but they didn't. The initial 5 minutes you will have to pray to whichever God you believe in to not get rubberbanded around killed behind corners or have bullets disappearing. You know stuff that probably shouldn't be happening. And every update I hope they optimize the game then afterwards watch my fps slowly drop from 200 to now barely making it to about 70 90 if I'm lucky. I've lost faith in this company that they will actually try and make it better. But you know another map and more guns are way more important than what everyone is asking for in optimizing the game.

review: I bought this game together with 5 friends . What a new and great experience . Being in the last 10 survivors can be more intense and stressful than a final exam . You can begin the game with a very powerful sniepr rifle or with a bag and a cooking pan this makes every new game you participate different and your survival can last from 10 seconds to half an hour . We had tons of laughs in the beggining dont always take this game too seriously fool around a bit . Its not an easy game especially if you are not familiar with these kind of fps games ( good luck cod and cs players ).The thing is that now the company has made a SH!TLOAD of money and everyone thought that they deserved it. The game was new and early access so there were countless bugs and gliches . Everyone was expecting that these problems would be deal since they got so much money but its quite the opposite they just keep ignoring them . The servers suck big time when a lot of people are logging in they will often crash and even disconnet you from your current game and not allow you to participate for some time . The bugs are still there with no change at all and for some reason that i dont know hackers have multiplied like bunnies in the last few weeks a problem that is also not being properly dealth with. Instead of developing and "fixing " the current game they are realeasing a new map .In conclusion Pros New experience Skill based game really fun with friendsCons Devs not giving a sh!t Countless bugs and glitches Terrible servers way too many cheaters Really bad engine ( i get 50 fps at tops with an average gaming system ) Not fun at all after some time You can choose to wait for it to be properly published .

review: Wasn't sure if I would like this game based on what I saw sometimes no action just running to a destination on twitch and figured there would be a lot of camping (as is the nature of these types of games). However this is not the case. Pretty much the whole game you will be making life and death decisions deciding to loot an area go investigate a distant gunfight or make it to the center. And at no point will you get bored of running to a destination because you need to stay alert will most likely get shot at or run into a gunfight. And finally it is so rewarding to get a kill or even to make it to top 30 and feel the stakes rise.Pros + good servers for early access+ good hit detection + responisve fun mechanics+ good sound + good matchmaking and pretty much no lag+ devs have and will continue to put out a lot of content and patches updatesCons okay graphics bit of a response delay when picking up items opening doors etc. lots of clipping that gives you away user interface could use some workOverall great game that does its genera (battle royale) really well.9/10 for early access 8/10 if it was full release

review: although i enjoy the game quiet much the performance and optimization are such a turn off as if there are not enough games that never left this stage of development i am fearful this game will see the same fate i am running the game on i5 4690 and gtx 980 strix game is installed on 850pro ssd still experiencing too many frame drops and very weak performance during battles i find my self entering a building where i know the enemy location and i instantly get my screen freeze for a second 99% of the times where fight starts in a building losing all advantage i come to hold to bad performance and freezes.i wouldent reccommend this game at this stage unless you have faith in your specs to run this smooth (i run all settings on low and distance is on ultra).on the game itself its addictive and very rewarding could get your heartbeat to the sky close quarters on the other hand is where who has better PC wins this is how it feels at the moment the reason i cant recommend it at this moment is becausei have never seen an early access game that ran so flawed and eventually patched into a performance beast its the core of this game using very lame engine unlike battlefield where if you found the right settings for your specs you could ping your mouse with your finger and see how smooth the screen moves even with all kind of things going on in it i decided to write this review so you can save yourself from another disappointment if you are planning to play this on the long term if you have a beast PC you can definitely find joy in this game as it is now.

review: I don't tend to review things but here goes.This game has some fantastic potential barring a few server issues here and there (Peak time latency and picking up items) and a few crashes on my end (Possible memory leak) the game itself feels solid the audio design feels like it's on the right track and player engagements feel incredible.I'm not sure why some people complain about campers you've got a constantly shrinking play area and of course you're going to pick a building to hold up in for a short while. That being said running around for an entire match? Totally plausible. Just pick your cover keep your eyes peeled and take shots when you think you can do well.For an early access game some of the polish feels great. I look forward to seeing how the game develops as the playerbase grows and hopefully the devs will listen to the players to help build this into a fantastic Battle Royale.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Overall I think this is a pretty fun game. Only a few hours in and I think it's worth the money especially with friends. It's amazing to see how quick 100 people start getting picked off. Pro Fun exciting gameplayeasy to find weapons and armorgood sized map with plenty of hiding spotsonly takes a few moments to get into a match despite 100 peopleCons Optimization. I play at med settings at 1440p with a newer i5 and a fury x. Still get fps drops in combat sometimes that are game ending. Some rubber banding as well. Buggy botty. Look not sure what the cause here is but something is off. Watched my squad mate get headshot by a rando we never saw while being in an enclosed hall with no windows. Another one of my friends got headshot while going over a bump on a motorcycle without seeing a guy muzzle flash nothing. It's annoying but not game breaking yet.Character creation. There is like 8 different models and that's it. Yeah you can customize a bit with different outfits but they're time consuming to unlock. Would like at least more hairstyles if not things like beards or faces. Made my character before seeing what my friends look like and well I'm now one of a triplet.Price. I really only got this because so many of my friends are playing it. If not I probably wouldn't have bought it due to the price. For an EA battle royal with really only 1 non custom game mode $30 is kinda steep. I think it would be more inviting at 20 25. Hopefully more content and modes makes the price more appealing.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: It's been a while since I've been addicted to a game such as this one. It's fun frustrating infurating adrenaline inducing tactical non sensical and the best time I've had in a long in time. Usually games can't hold my attention these days. It's nothing for me to play 4 to 5 hours straight in PUBG. Trying out different "strats" (AKA not going balls deep right after getting off the AC130) makes it entertaining as well as playing with friends. 8/10 right now because of some performance issues and bugs but that comes with the Early Access territory. Buy it. Play it with friends. Laugh your off. Good times.

review: Battlegrounds has huge potential to grow into a realistic Battle Royale game. The developers are on top of it and come out with patches and updates almost every day to help reduce lag in game and improve optimization. Definitely worth $30 and 100x more fun when playing with friends. The only thing I would like for the developers to improve is the rewards in Squads. Getting 2nd place only gave me 140 BP whereas if that was solo it would be close to 1 000. To me Squads seems more difficult than Solo. Fantastic game great developer team and huge potential. Can't wait for this game to run smoother! Keep up the great work devs.

Every now and then I crash but its not too often and the fact that you can boot the game and get into a match in less than 2 minutes makes crashing more tolerable. The performance does need some work but I still get above 30 almost always. (I have a 144hz monitor and it hurts my eyes to see 30 fps in games but its not too eye jarring in this game.)

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Here's how I see this game.Pros Very few hackers. Fairly well balanced weapon choices. Fun to play solo even more fun with friends. Winning quite literally means "you played better than 99 other people". Or at least got luckier. Choice between third or first person depending on your style. Graphics are polished and nice to look at. Chicken dinners are tasty.Cons Playing with auto matching in Squads or Duo is very risky almost unplayable because of friendly fire. You can report now which is good but it's still super annoying to deal with. Can get repetitive after a while for some people. Network lag hits every now and then. If you're unlucky enough for it to happen during a big fight it's very frustrating. Few but deadly game breaking bugs such as building textures straight up not loading at the start or cars going through walls killing you inside buildings. Likely to get fixed in the near future hopefully. Lobby voice chat is unappropriate (but this isn't really unique to PUBG). Basically unplayable for low end PC's especially in big cities.Overall it's is way worth the price imo. I personally tend to dislike shooter games and was very skeptical about this game but PUBG has managed to convince me otherwise. If you're bored and you never tried a Battle Royale style game before this might just be the game you've been waiting for. If not then it's still worth a try get it on a sale if you're really skeptical but it definitely lives up to its good reputation.

review: Product received for free. similar to all the other survivor games but still plenty of fun. This game still has a long ways to go but hopefully the developers do it right. Right off the bat you can tell there is a huge lack of polish and the UI system needs some help. The animations are no where near the quality of a AAA title and the server lag is also an issue. If you're willing to ride out the development process and want to play a pretty popular survivor game then check this game out. In the current state I give it a 7/10 with a chance to hit a 9 once it's fully released.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is honestly one of the best video games I've ever played. It is so much endless fun with or without friends. I know the game is still in early access which scares a lot of people but I'm telling you it is still an extremely fun game and is nothing like H1Z1 or DayZ where the bugs make the game unplayable. There is also an extremely low number of cheaters which is another plus considering H1Z1 is riddled with them. The devs are constantly adding new content to the game and are really working hard to get this game out of early access which is another bonus. If you like battle royal or shooter games I really think you would enjoy this. I will say that you need a fairly decent PC to run the game well (I have an i5 7400 AMD RX 480 4G and I get 60+ fps with medium settings). Playing this with friends definitely adds to the fun but solo matches are still just as fun and if anything they are much more intense. I hope this review helped and if you are on the edge for this game please just give it a try I think you will thoroughly enjoy it!

review: When I had first heard of this game through an article on facebook I was entranced and immeadiately bought this game. I had thoughts that it may turn our like DayZ or H1Z1 and what have you but I gave it a chance and I was surprised at the results. At first it is a difficult game to get used to especially considering how well optimized this game is from the start. Yes It is not complete. But it is much more playable than the games I mentioned earlier. Yes there are bugs but it is early access. This is the first game in EA that I have played with so little to complain about and the fun I have compared to the qualms I have with the game completely outweigh the latter 10 to 1. If you're on the fence make the plunge. You'll be happy you did so long as you have a decent computer. Lastly get yourself on discord and make some friends. You won't regret it.

review: Honestly this is a very good game in my opinion. The game maker's ability to listen to the community and actually implement things that matter is a little bit lacking though. Although the game is constantly improving. I do genuinely enjoy playing this game when I'm not getting shot from absolutely nowhere. Speaking of the community though this isn't the game for you if you can't handle being called a name or two... Or perhaps a million. The community is certainly something alright. But sometimes the best thing that you can do is just change your voice chat channel to team only. It'll save your sanity and your IQ level. Anyways this is an amazing game for being Early Access. The devs are doing a great job forgetting about their deafness to the community. I look forward to seeing the game grow. Even if that means hearing more of "I'm a snake follow me."Take a chance on this one. It won't be an investment you'll regret if you enjoy working together with a team in Squad mode or just need some good alone time in Solos. But I think we can all agree that if Brian just get's in the ing Discord everything will be a hell of a lot better... )Cheers and good luck! )
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Yes hello So i bought the game about 2 hours ago and have played it for about 30hours now. I have played both dayz and h1z123afck23 so i consider myself an experienced player in this sort of thing. This game is amazing i used to have a stable hearthrate of about 50bpm. But after playing this it dosent drop below 200! I can stay up all night now since the ptsd i have will keep me awake so i can play even more. Its to easy tho and there are not enough dinozombies. The vehicles are great and all but i would enjoy the game more if they added some more military esc stuff. Like an amtrack exterminatus or a bradley. No tanks as that would be overpowered (lol)! Overall the game is fine and lax KAN DU STANNA BILJÄÄÖÄVELN
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Meh Recommended read the review if you need to. This game is hella fun. Most of the non recommended review currently are about the developer breaking a promis about Micro Transactions but if You look past that you see a game that will define what a Battle Royale game is supposed to be. However this game is riddled with bugs and glitches but that is understandable since the game is early access but I cant stand the ping lag and crashes. For a game priced at 29.99$ Daybreak (developers of the game) can atleast fix the fact that if i shoot a guy first with a shotgun and all my pellets hit but he shoots me after we both die at the same time. This game also has a toxic community with me learning the chinese word for N****r and connecting into a game instantly drowning below the comments of "CHINA NUMBA HUAN" and the song "Alabama N*****r" If you can see past some of the problems then this will be a fun game for you. review: The battle royale we need but do we deserve it? The game is slow and more tactical than it's counterpart KOTK but it is far more promising than what other EA br games has to offer. This game hits the nail on the head on many issues that has been plaguing br scene for a while and it's beatiful in most aspects. While the game has many familiar issues like most EA br games does it still looks very promising. The good Amazing atmosphere Plenty of gameplay inside it you got always something to look out for while playing either weapon gadgets or healing equipment Solo gameplay is tough but the gameplay is by far best when you play with friends. Spectate feature that worked on a fly Cars and boats are means to travel from one point into other. They are means to travel you don't want to stick with for too long Different guns for every purpose. Gameplay rewards for each match in terms of statistics or points that can be used for cosmetic purposes. IT'S FUN. You get to dictate starting point in the game. (More of it in neutral) Second chance feature in Duo/Quad game modes. Your game won't be ruined by random lucky headshot from other side of the game. Gives tactical depth in group play.The neutral Starting the game is slow jumping in takes ages. Still it's tactical manuever so this is just personal preference. Like most EA games lacks optimization in order to get solid fps across entire game not just inside houses. Limits low/mid end computers pretty heavily. Hopefully will be fixed in near future. Gadgets like Silencer dominate extremely heavily. It's almost like invisibility.The bad Trying to jump over obstacles or stacks of junk is pure nightmare. Gameplay hiccups like getting stuck or massive lag but i'm confident these are gone by the time this game is released.Overall it's quality game and the dev's seem to have extreme serious attitude towards delivering THE prestige battle royale game we all want. While i never can advice buying EA game unless you are willing to accept the risks involved i still hope anyone looking at this will give it a shot specially if you got friends to play with. This game is amazing as a group play.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Negatives Simple1. Macros are real.2. AFKers are real (been in games where it had 30 45 afk as you can imagine...funtimes had looting with no shooting)3. Cheaters are real (watched a hacker through a 4x tele 20 or so afk to is location and pistol whip them all...while looting a create. Sadly i wasn't recoding this to post a pointless report that would not get anyone banned)4. Bugs are real (free wall hacks through random selection on texture rendering or should i say lack thereof)5. Worst of all devs that think content fixes bugs by replacing bugs with more bugs.6. FPP is the only game mode worth playing yet is only available for US asia and UK...As an Ausralian...180+ latency is soooo joyous in a shooter.7. Report mechanic is pointless...just there for peice of mind.8. 3rd person gimps the game9. frustrating built element scale...i always wanted to feel like i was 4ft tall10 Armour is pointless...bug or glitch this I am unsure of...i have been 1shot through t3 gear with AR's11. Zone mechanic takes emphasis off gunplay and player vs player interaction especially at later zones where players are destroyed if they have no meds or are being engaged and time flies you by.So onto the Positives 1. Gun fights are addictive2. Made steam money off crates3. can team up with 3 buddies...the other 12 or so have to wait because teaming is banable supposedly....(still unsure about this positive)4. Great Map design5. Back and front flips on motorbikes

review: This is my review for PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds.I overall really enjoyed the game. Jumping in at anytime and trying to survive gives a lot of exhilaration and adrenaline rush. PUBG as of now also hit over 20 Million players so more and more people play this game. There are a few different game modes like Solo Duo and Squad. I have played all these game modes and I have to say it is a lot of fun to play this game with friends. You can also team up with a random person too.The game is expected to have an official released somewhere around December and also it is gonna get a new Desert Map which is awesome. I really enjoyed playing the game but now lets go over to the cons.Cons 1) The game is pretty badly optimized and you would need a pretty beefy system to run this at 60 FPS. There are a lot of bugs for a game in Beta even though it might be early access but it should be better later on.2)The developers are also banning hackers too which is a good thing but there are many hackers still which ruin the game.3) Many people have reported being banned for stream sniping or other reasons but I have never been banned. You can always send an appeal and also give your in game footage too I believe.4)The Character creator isn't strong but I am fine with that but some people might be sad with that.I am very satisfied with this purchase and I will be sinking more hours into the game!I have a YouTube channel called Fat Vorior and it would be awesome if you could check it out. I post PUBG Moments and Compilations.https //www.youtube.com/channel/UCc0T4JymbXJg8NKyIrOn2YwThanks for reading my comprehensive review!

review: (UPDATED 10/17/2017) Read the TL DR at the bottom before you downvote this At first I was very impressed by the reviews and really went along with all the hype. YES this is an EA and quite literally EVERYTHING CAN be subject to change OR NOT for anyone like myself who has been playing EA games for 15 plus years we all know that by the ToS Agreement it really REALLY depends on the credibility of the Developers THAT BEING SAID these are actually very good developers. Solid know how. Very dedicated to what they are delivering. But Trynnun why the negative review then? Simple Accountability. No Developer regardless of greatness and credibility should be opposed to criticism in a negative review. EVEN MORE SIMPLY PUT I want these problems FIXED because I am addicted to this game. Yes Yes... The hype is true the game is great ASSUMING SERVERS and things like I am about to list get addressed. Remember this game is rated Mostly Posistive and we all know that can be a dangerous thing for an EA game to have ESPECIALLY when it has bugs and errors. The more and more I played this game the more I began to notice things and problems that were NOT on my end but specifically with the server As more time went on I began to get very upset by these problems as I noticed that the Majority of my deaths were not actually caused by a player killing me but by the game and map killing me itself Whether it was falling to my death from getting out of a still car (not moving) or getting stuck (EVERYWHERE) and waiting to die from the play area moving away from me. It was never ending it seemed. So I began to screen shot things as it happened. I created an album that I will be updated as I find these problems and it will be linked here. Each photo will have it s own little description/background. Some Individual Examples http //imgur.com/fHiYW5c http //imgur.com/iFQtUgg http //imgur.com/m2KdDKp http //imgur.com/Zazq8jl http //imgur.com/mJLVCTu http //imgur.com/APRzIVd http //imgur.com/NgvLZUb http //imgur.com/fg80niv Album updates 10 May 2017 3 games added 1 nasty glitch found of total control loss The WHOLE Album http //imgur.com/a/ikPGK Again I just want to clarify a few things. Sometimes the game runs great but then you run into some major glitch or the game runs really bad and yeah. So again The game itself is FANTASTIC despite the pain of all this. EDIT I used to feel this way but now you can just buy it all in the market place so now it doesn't matter... way to ruin something cool Developers... Here is how I used to feel... (Speaking about character attire only ) I also want to say I especially love the rarity of all the items and I desperately want certain items and attire and I hope they do not change that system at all unless they at least triple the amount of awesome items you can get then maybe instead of you getting one item from a box maybe you have a chance to get 2 items instead. &lt (so yeah... before items would drop and you had a decent chance and getting something cool if you played enough... now just f*** right off with it.... Seriously... What a broken money grab now.) TL DR DON'T buy it ... just don't... IN A NUT SHELL Developments since release&gt Kill streamer Get banned&gt honk at a streamerGet banned&gt you like free cosmetics ?Now pay for them&gt performanceStill sh t&gt servermega sh t&gt Cheaters and Hackers In gameALWAYS!!!Unless you want to deal with a whole lot of frustration during a BS drawn out EA process where there is poor server optimization and Devs care more about selling the game then and promoting it cattering only to streamers WHO ARE ALL MOST LIKELY USING SUBTLE HACKS save for a small few. FYI I will delete comments outright if you are going to talk about streamers. The whole topic is BS since they are the main marketers for the game. NOTE I will say streamers like DocDisrespect actually look like legit players with the way they move and play with no questionable play mechanics in their performance unlike other streamers *cough* grimm *cough* F.Y.I. BattleEye Reported in the month of October of 2017 in response to the Dev's of PUBG and their Marketing team that they ban more than 350 000 players per month which is way more than what the Developers and marketing teams reported. They responded to this because it was like a slap in the face to all their hard work like "What??? We do WAY more then that are you kidding us???"...and every seaspmed player paying attention to this is like "Oh gee... I wonder why... _ " In every major review of this game where they talk about the games ups and downs they never mention the biggest "down" which "IS" the games LARGEST problem and that my friends "is the hackers and the constant cheaters!" Now with all the updates as of todays latest patch it takes forever for the game to authenticate and start up and cooperate with steam then when you do finally get into a match let's say you are playing by yourself joining "Squad" you're entire team is speaking some asian language (IN THE NORTH AMERICAN SERVER) in a game where communication is paramount... as if the RNG wasn't bad enough in this game you now have THIS New Game CHECK LIST ....STEP 1) Connect... (dissconect)... try again... connect... something about steam... TRY AGAIN... something about httprequest(WTF???)... TRY AGAIN... bad client... TRY AGAIN... failed to authenticate... TRY AGAIN... failed to connect... TRY AGAIN.... ect. (5 8 minutes later proceed to next step.)STEP 2) Start a new Game and "Click Ready"... canceled... TRY AGAIN... canceled... TRY AGAIN... servers are too busy... TRY AGAIN... (game crashes restart from STEP 1)STEP 3) IN Squad/duo GAME&gt Pre Game Island waiting Things you need to know 3a) Do you have a full team?3b) Does your team Speak the prodominant language of the region of the server?3c) Is your Team From your server region?If you answered no to any of these continuing playing at your own risk and try to enjoy that horrible experience of a team that can't Communicate with you drive you anywhere (most likely) and will go off and do what they want and put you at a disadvantage. (Advise restarting from step 2)FINAL STEP 4) Couping with the RNG and all the Hackers while in game Soft Aim &amp No recoil shooters are the worst... Advise uninstalling game. EDIT Wow the BS bans are real. I have never so much as had a warning or a ban however all al my buddies that I played this with are all banned for killing streamers during their stream. We all only ever use Teamspeak and Team talk in game. So it's LITERALLY IMPOSSIBLE for them to be harrassing other players while they are talking to us. I'm the worst player out of all of them. I have never had a chicken dinner and I do all the same things they taught me. They got dinners all the time and now they are banned...... makes me wonder if the Devs are only banning good players and leaving the bad ones in as fodder for the streamers.EDIT 04SEPT17 DO NOT BUY THIS GAME Still no warnings or bans however with as much money as they are making the problems are the same with their servers after all this time. review: After sinking 100 hours into this game i finally feel comfortable in giving it a review and overall wholeheartedly recommending this to anyone who is a fan of the genre or even shooters in general. Whilst the game is still in Early Access and games in this genre typically have a bad rep PUBG has to be one of the most addictive game experiences i have in awhile. The gunplay reminds me that of Battlefield a blend of tactical but not overcomplcated gun mechanics with each gun having its own recoil pattern statistics etc. and is extremely rewarding. The Zone sytstem keeps things interesting and there is strategy in howw you use it do you get in the Zone quickly and set up and mow down unsuspecting players or do you frantically rush whilst it's behind you and try and catch people by surprise. It's this kind of fun but intense gameplay that makes it fun. The game isn't perfect and thats putting it nicely. Sinces it's Alpha there are bugs to be expected (One annoying one i experienced included me getting stuck inside a box that didnt allow me to move into the next Zone causing me to die very frustrating) the hitboxes and netcode are abit wonky and the Sounds whilst on the whole good can decieve you when it comes to postioning and distance. Despite the bugginess I can 100% recommend this game if you have a few friends who are willing to buy it to as Squads and Duo is extremely fun the Solo experience is also good but its hard to warrant the asking price for this kind of game if your willing to only play alone. The dev team also seems to be keeping to their promises with weekly updates which keeps the game somewhat fresh and the updates consistantly improve the game unlike other EA games of this kind. My hopes for this games future is more cutomization to warrant having a marketplace that doesn't just consist of 3 overpriced gear pieces and a load of generic shirts and boots (Jacket for lyfe) more weapons and maybe even more maps but we'll see. Right now I'd say the game easily an 8/10 for being a fun tactical and sometimes even paranoia filled battle royale that is easily the best of it's kind through content alone and for being one of the most addictve 'Just One more rounds' games i've ever played.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKONWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS is a game in which multiple players fight to be the last player alive. This game will test your patience reflexes and your ability to survive against unpredictable odds. PROS+ Up to 4 friends can be in a squad+ Tight controls+ Vehicles+ Character customization+ Character aesthetics+ Plenty of online players+ Gigantic Map+ Reasonable price+ Intense gameplay+ Beautiful graphicsCONS Can only have up to 4 friends in a squad (Which is fine although 50 vs 50 would be tight) Tiny bit of a hacker problem The vechicles flip way to easily off road. (Please for the love of god fix that) If you don't like how your character looks anymore that'll cost you 3000 in game units (Loot boxes cost less) Character aesthetics can only be earned through loot crates Their's a 67% chance you will get banned if you kill someone who's streaming Only one map so far You can't pay in game currency for aesthetics only real money Only one gamemode Extremely unoptimized resource heavyIn it's entirety PUBG takes what we love from the strive and survive genere and builds upon that to create the most immersivesurvival shooter i have ever played. It definitely is more than a mindless shooter as it requires you to take risks and plan your next move. Although it does unarguably has a few kinks it needs to be worked out the developers are working hard to make sure it further locks its position as the #1 game on steam with the most concurent players.9/10
