review: Summary Have luck Have friends Have aim Run over people Snipe people Survive PatienceIsKey.jpg You run in houses like an MF elephantGameplay Luck of the DrawThis game is generally amazing for being in Alpha. Yes the game has it's bugs rendering issues server connection issues but it's in Alpha for a reason. Pick a house to go in. &gt &gt Are there weapons? &gt &gt Yes? Good &lt &lt No? You're ed. Run to another house creeping along trying not to be shot. Pick up all the things. You've run out of space. WhyCantIFindABackpack.jpg You run past a building. You get shot in the head. WhyMe.jpg You wonder why you can never find a gun in the first building.In general terms it is a luck of the draw style gameplay at the beginning. Where the essentials Backpack Long Range Weapons and of course the Pan are required.PanSaveLives.jpgFrom then on out it's a game of strategy and are you in the proper positioning compared to your opponents.That Play Area ThoughAnother luck of the draw is the place you decided to drop at anyway Shipping Crates Cities Apartments School Tunnels Military Base etc. The play circle may hate you the RNG circle gods have you cross the map in 2 minutes because hey they just don't like you. Or you're the lucky one that's already in the play area set for life with a Sniper Rifle and a ton of patience to sit behind a rock. h2 Friendships /h2 Duo queues and Squad queues Let the mic spam begin. PressZFollowMe.jpgWhen in groups survival rates should go up? Haha okay. Now there needs to be double triple quadruple the luck to find guns and items to survive in the wilderness of deadly tree campers.Let's not forget the plsDontHitMe.jpg cars for days.Steps Find car Find multiple cars See group in field FloorIt.jpg X was knocked out by X X was ran over by X Winning.jpg Oh niper.jpg Team mate gets killed in vehicle Bye FeliciaSquadron of cars is always scare Rule #2 Double Tap.

review: Despite having major graphics issues crashes and wierd player glitches this game plays very well. The combat doesn't feel clunky like DayZ and isn't too "arcadey" like CoD. Teamwork (if you're in doubles/teams) is essential so having a mic is a must as there is no text channels. All of the guns react and fire the way you'd expect with projectile dropoff and penetration. There is still some balancing that needs to be done I feel but overall the weapon choices make sense and all serve their purpose well. The game looks great on high settings albeit quite laggy even on mid high level systems. From forums and the discussions here on steam though it seems like even enthusiast builds are having issues with FPS so do not expect the game to be like most other triple A titles out there in terms of FPS. Turn all the settings down use the launch options and it will be playable. Overall I would reccomend this game as someone coming from ARMA mods and DayZ. Do not expect this game to run well on all systems however. If you can't justify the purchase based on that give it time the gameplay is top notch!

review: Been playing for a few days now. First off the suspense that this game builds is palpable. Headphones are an absolute must the sound in this game encompasses a wide dynamic range. Most of the time you are only going to hear the enviromnet but when the shooting starts it gets loud! This makes for some very tense moments where you all of a sudden hear a footstep and you know its time to prepare.Despite being an Early Access title the shooting mechanics are pretty spot on. Movement mechanics need work and the UI needs some streamlining for sure. Pick this up now!

review: With 352 hours of gameplay i feel i need to add another review about the game. This is going to be a long one as i love this game as much as i loved world of warcraft when it launched! So ill go ahead and start by listing some pro's and con's of the game. PROS Blue Hole does frequent updates play with friends or alone very tactical game fun to stream/watch Vehicular manslaughter!!! You have to have skill to shootCONS It's early access (bugs) Community (not gonna lie 50% of players are rude)With the pros and cons out there i dont believe there should be any doubt about purchasing pubg. There is a new topic that has some pubg players worried and that being micro transactions. It's now $2.99 to purchase a key to open certain crates. There are so many people that are upset with this change in the game but in my eyes you dont have to buy the keys as the crates dont drop any special guns or anything to benefit a player in any way shape or form. My love for pubg has even gotten me to purchase the game for friends!! dont worry about salty players they are everywhere in this online world. Hopefully something i posted will help someone make up thier mind on purchasing pubg.

review: First time writing a review.513 hours into this game and 513 hours of fun this game has been a hell of a ride for me and my friends. It is a very very enjoyable game to play with your buddies... BUT...1. Due to being early access this game is not well optimized prepared to suffer textures problem due to the high memory usage of this game when runned (6 10gb) random lags/freezes etc2. I went through my first 500hours or so while meeting only 2 hackers however in just tonight as alone (before i write this review) i met hackers in 8/10 games. I know for the fact that every game has hackers but the high amount of hackers in this game CURRENTLY is making it unplayable.I really do hope the game can be optimized in the near future and also perhaps the team of PUBG can figure out a way to prevent hackers.. but for now.. i must say its hard for me to enjoy it with my friends ATM

review: I recommend this game and I don't. There isn't a neutral option but let's start off with the Pros and the Cons.Pros You'll find a game in less than a minute due to the active player base of over a million players a day.It's quite easy to play (Not that hard to learn how to shoot and heal)Every game is different safe zones will be different each timeThe environment is awesome (rain fog sunset day time ect)The guns are all nice but definitely shotguns just destroy everything at close range /.The crates could add some more loot to make it more worth but other than that it is usually rewarding.The voice chat is cancer but can be hilarious (Ctrl T to mute)Pans can 1 tap people and after you knock someone out in duos or squads talking smack is hilarious.China numba wan?Cons (Personal issue) I sometimes get a texture issue where the game is not fully loaded in and I can just walk through buildings. It's hard to pick up loot however it gives a network lag and you will be frozen which makes it impossible to play.I have yet to see a cheater but there are tons of cheaters in this game but chances are you will be fine.The safe zone never ends well for me honestly! But I mean that's called RNG so this point is invalid.Some guns are not balanced like the mini 14 however it is fun to use.Sometimes it takes years to kill someone like damn!Probably missing a lot more but that's all I could think of I have a GTX 1060 6gigs of vram and 8gigs of ram. The game is playable with a steady of 50 120 fps on all low. You don't need to make everything ultra the game is just fine on everything low except FOV and anti aliasing those are important.Squads can not be taken seriously like no joke knock like 2 3 people but the last guy can just obliterate you making the knockdowns useless. I wish they revamped the knockdown system to like 1 revive per person or even a hardcore mode adding no revives.Due to massive amounts of people on the game servers can be really laggy at times which is a pretty big issue.Thanks for reading my opinion.I also need more ram.

review: PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds Will get your heart pumping for sure!Check out this video! https //youtu.be/wE_PnAO0NxwIf DayZ and H1Z1 King of the kill had a baby it would be Playerunknown s Battlegrounds. That might sound pretty bad but I mean that in a good way! Personally I think both DayZ and H1Z1 suck for many reasons. But the concept is good!In PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds you start by jumping from a plane above the map. You can drop out whenever you like and choose where to land which is great!When you land you basically run around looting gear in buildings much like in DayZ. But you will get pretty good gear a lot faster than in DayZ and can get straight to the action in a matter of minutes.After that it s a lot like King of the kill. There is a circle in a random spot off the map that will get smaller and smaller forcing players to eventually meet in the middle and fight until there is only one man standing.PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is a very exciting game that will get your heart pumping for sure! You can either focus on killing a lot of enemies or trying to hide and wait it out for as long as possible if that s how you like to play. Either way you are about to have a very exiting experience!The game looks great with high/ultra settings but the fps might suffer a bit depending on your rig. I decided to set everything on low to make the game run as good as possible. It might not look as good but it feels awesome. PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds is definitely worth buying! The only negative I see about it is that the fps could be better on high/ultra settings. But with a little bit of tweaking settings and such it is very playable and so much better than H1Z1! It s a great game and it will give you many hours of heart pumping joy!(Update 2017 11 22 I still love it)See you on the battleground!/ HEARTGRIND

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: As of writing this review (11/11/17) I am fully aware of the bugs and the hackers that plague the game as of late but I still suggest people play this game. PUBG is one of those games that gives you an experience you really can't duplicate in other games. The panic of trying to survive in heavily populated area such as School or one of the city areas gets my blood pumping and that feeling almost never goes away for me. Depending on the terrain gun battles are just a blast to have whether you win or lose because in my expereince I never had the same kind of fight. I always had to adapt and use my surrounding to my advantage because if you don't then that's when it does become repetative and you aren't adapting. One fight I'm going in with a fully decked out M4 and other battles I'm holding on to pan waiting for a good opening to either retreat or hit the sucker with it. Playing with friends is also a great time too! With this game being in Early Access there are minor bugs that can ruin the expereince for some but for me and my friends we take bugs and laugh because some of them are just really silly and they don't necessarily break the game. In the end PUBG is a fun game. Look past the bugs and the hackers because they don't take away from the core expereince that is to be had in this game. Having played the other BR type games on the market this one is my favorite and I really suggest you try it out if you are on the fence.Update Doing this for Steam Awards

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Game makes your heart race everytime you enter a gun fight if you're up for some thrill. Grab a buddy and have fun making your way to the top. Although a lot of the time you'd be running and looting the game does a good job of keeping you busy with all the choices you have. Like the places you can drop to fights you can take and avoid positions to hold and a variety of weapon combinations. The only Con to this game would be the poor optimization if you don't have a beast GPU like the gtx 1080 and i7 then forget about running this game in higher settings. If your PC build is on the lower side then you might want to upgrade them first before buying this game. i'm using a GTX 970 with Intel Core i5 4670k 3.4ghz fully overclocked with lowest settings in game and I still can't maintain a solid 60 FPS. The game also has a tendency to stutter during loading and may even crash on you. Its still in EA so things should hopefully get better.

review: I dive out of the plane naked as a newborn from the womb. I hit the ground in a semi populated area my squad mate landing near the building to my East. In a flash an enemy lands next to me. I turn tail and head for the closest building. He leaps forward fist cocked back ready to end me. I manage to get into the building and slam the door before he reaches me.I turn around and his head is stuck through the door the rest of his body left on the outside. I walk up and proceed to punch him to death watching his head bounce back through the door as I do so. Like a game of paintball every single match of PUBG seems to result in a story.

review: DO NOT BUY THIS GAMEI have 500+ hours in this game and this game is by far one of the most fun ideas I feel has ever been conceived. This being said this game could NOT be more poorly executed. Should you so choose to buy this game god help your computer for this game is so poorly optimized that I do not think you could distinguish if you are playing PUBG or minecraft. If you have the displeasure of playing this game at a prime time you will not be able to join a game because of the disposition where the servers are being overflooded. God forbid you join a game it will take you regardless of computer specs at least two minutes to function because of the overwhelming amount of DSYNC that accompanies. The developing team is working hard at adding more content to the game with evidently little interest in fixing the true issues with this game as previously shown by prior months of patching. This game is in early access and I understand completely that it will have bugs. This being said do not buy this game until it fully releases and is the true experience with execution it deserves.

review: Yes this is a negative review. But I would start it by saying this is an AMAZING game. If you are a fan of the genre you will enjoy it. The only reason I give this a negative review right now is that the last several games I have played have ended in me getting killed by someone obviously employing an ESP or Wallhack cheat. I have been lying prone in a grassy field watched someone run over a hill 200+ yards away from me and within 2 seconds of them clearing the hill they have shot me in the face. When you play for 30 minutes crawling your through a field for a chance to win a 100 person ffa falling victim to this kind of thing repeatedly is a major issue.I think alot of this problem could be avoided by instituting a killcam and review system in solo mode. (could not have a kill cam in duo or squad because it would be used to pinpoint enemy positions) It would be nice to be able to see HOW another player killed you in solo and them submit it for review if they are blatantly cheating.

review: This game is dope
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I wasnt sure if to recomend it or not.I had some experience with H1Z1 but for most part Its my first battle royal game for me So lets begin.+The game itself is great.I like that the shooting mechanics are fairly simple and u wont have much of a problem to get a feel for the game.+The 3rd person animations are great and i really like them and the FPP although a little bit clumsy its definitely playable.+There is a variety of weapons each of them with different uses and there is no weapon that is OP and gives u a complete advantage.What i mean by that is that all rifles are good and its definitely a persons preference at what to use and what weapons to combine.+The graphics are quite good and the addition of weather effects adds a more realistic feel for me although some players dont like the weather effects at all.+The qeue for the game is quite fast and there is no penalties if u want to leave the game u just leave it P.+The game i dont thing it has a skill ceiling so every time u play u will definitely be better and u will accually see the progress for your self.But the players with previous FPS experience especially csgo will have easier time to get used to the feel of the game.Now as far as the bad stuff The optimization is just non existed.Its early access i know but if someones pc is not high end WITH ssd will have fps drops and even when u land the game will need 2 3 minutes to render everything and u will be stuck with 1fps or u will not be able to do anything so practically u will be afk. The rng in this game is just overwhelming.Now some of u will say ''git gut scrub'' or ''u need to think ahaid'' and there is some point in their saying but i cant remember how many times i got facked up because i am 1vs1 with a guy both behind a rock and then the circle end up with him so i have to push him or else i will die from the circle.Another problem is that the cirlcle later in the game closes so fast that u have to stop fighting in order to not die by it.In solo's or even duos the fights wont last that much but in 4 man squads if u start a fight will either end in 10 seconds or will fight for over 4 5 minutes which is huge in this game and appart from that u will have to stop fighting because in 1 minute the circle will have to close.Although the bad stuff are less than the good stuff the bad stuff outweight the good in its currect state but the game is really enjoyable even with its big flaws imo. Give it a try for yourself.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Yes this game is bugged but so is every other early access game I have ever played. Anyone who puts negative comments up around that should really do a brain cell check as I think we are only up to week 22 of the game. Now all the whingers about paid content for the game all need a head check because the paid content is absolutely 100% not required to play any part of the game. It is just to change your chartacters appearance which I personally don't give two hoots about since all I want to do is get chicken dinners. Now gameplay is lots of fun. I mean who doesn't want to parachute into some old soviet island with a few of your mates try to one up each other with what loot you have found and then gho kill some players. Yes the game has some optimisation issues but the big difference is that the developer bluehole is very transparent around what the problems are and once they have been notified about any proiblems there is usually a facebook post letting you know they are working on a fix. Don't let the haters push you away from this game this is a true battle royale which isn't for the faint hearted and you should give it a solid crack. Although it might take you a little while to get your chicken dinner

review: Product received for free. Recieved this product from a friend for free.What's Good?1) Shooting feels good and hit registration feels correct 95% of the time. 2) Loot seems spread pretty fair everyone seems to have a chance.3) Vehicles are abundant enough if zone does you dirty you usually have a pretty good shot of getting back into the fight. 4) Peeking and crawling feels good fighting in fields crawling around doesn't feel awkward. 5) The combat is just great honestly when the servers are working no other survival/hunger games shooter feels as nice.6) Jump punching people to knock them out when you could shoot them but wanna really flex those muscles on the poor noob who couldn't find a gun is great. 7) Bombing zones are random and certainly change your thought process when inside one but are not soo damn annoying or overpowered that u can't move or fight they feel about right. The Salt?1) I'm GREAT!! *Terrible* at this game2) Camping is a very good strategy one I refuse to do but every other looooooser likes to sit in the lone shack on the hill so look in windows before you open that door since you might need to click f four times for the damn door to open only to have it somehow wack u in the face and daze you while your opponent comes out and drags his balls i mean akm across your face. *note it didn't quite happen exactly like that there were wayyy more curse words involved*3) The bomb zone is programmed to chase good players like me it's packman after blazing up with the munchies and I'm a juicy cherry. 4) Sometimes you will just die you won't know how or where from and it'll feel unfair but that's every game like this I just wish they would put a kill cam in the game with a report option if the person seems sketchy. I watched a guy headshot like three people back to back to back within about 1.5 seconds each shot with a sniper but they were in complete different areas and were not drawing attention to themselves. Obviously there are good players but im sure it being early access we also have hackers we can't escape that in an game it seems. (the good note this is experienced in maybe 1/20 games if that)The Bad (1) The servers are complete trash!! *insert 1980's rusted toaster pic here* &amp desync is crazy sometimes ill shoot at a target and they'll teleport 5 feet to the left giving away my posistion. &amp NA servers are constantly laggy bogged down by the number of players currently wanting to play this fun game it causes people to freeze or disconnect completely. &amp Playing on asian servers feels better than any servers NA that's right 45ms latency on NA but 150ms 200ms on Asia feels smoother wtf!!!! and Im in the middle of the US ..... this shouldn't be a thing so many streamers and players hop over to asian servers from the US just because we get constant lag and disconnects to NA.2) The F BOMB no not the word i mean curse word..... GOD DAMMNIT CAN'T TYPE!!!! THE F BUTTON thats right that key you press to interact with all the doors and cars and loot Doors you feel like you have your hands taped to your back and your trying to open the door with a giant erection. it's that bad sometimes you click it and wait a few seconds then click again because it couldn't have worked but then it opens and you try to run out and then it closes and smashes ur erection in the crack of the doorway and all you can do it take your computer outside and proceed to beat it with a sledgehammer. you notice I complained and made a lot of references there it's because of all the extra time I had to think about how i was going to about opening doors and getting into cars while waiting 3 5 seconds ever mother ing time u hit the f button in this game!!!!! and yeah you hit it a lot a one story house usually at least mmmmm 4 times that's 12 20 seconds of waiting loot four houses 48 80 seconds but you don't even have a helmet loot eight more and hop in a car 108 172 seconds waiting doesn't seem like that big of a deal now does it 3 minutes of a game even if u make it to number 1 it's usually a 30 min game that's nearly a 10th of your playtime just sitting there waiting for doors to open? well play ten games a day now that was 30 minutes of your very important life lost watching a door stare at you or a character sit watching a vehicle sitting still while all the ing loosers are shooting you in the back laughing at the pleb using is small to open a door and slipping on the handle. Play 10 days a month that's 5 hours lost sitting at doors. Get millions of people around the world to play your game and stare at doors .... priceless. laugh at us all you want pubg I know your doing this as an evil plot to ruin our lives I don't even want to go to the bathroom in real life because I'm afraid i won't be able to open the door after playing this game. Overall Great Game!!!yeah that's it just two things servers and unresponsive f key if anyone makes it to the bottom of this please vote no because I probably just wasted your valuable door opening time reading this post hehe gotcha !!!!

review: TL DR This game is so addicting and fun to play but it lacks overall quality of matches.I've played quite a bit of this game since release and I must say i've enjoyed it a lot more than I expected. The balance of weapons armor and vehicles has been exucuted quite well however they still do have some work to do on some things.Overall doesnt seem like any particular world spawned item is overpowered which is very important in a game like this. Crate dropped items are good enough to try and attempt to get if dropped near you but not too overpowered where its an automatic win. Crate drops also create areas of intense battle at times which can be frustrating but very rewarding. Some problems I have with the game are general server issues which include random DC's rubberbanding and walking in place. Cheating is an unfortunate part of the game while this isn't the devs fault it still makes the game that much more unenjoyable. Terrain is a pretty big problem when trying to drive you might be driving on what looks to be a flat field you hit a tiny bump and your flying 90 degrees into the air flipping the car on its back. The circle is the last issue I have while it is a practical idea for this type of game it lacks the right kind of skill based mechanic I desire.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Welcome to random drop simulator! Start out a match with some relaxing skydiving! Then pull your parachute and realize you haven't thought this through and you're already hearing gunfire. Run towards the nearest house to either find full body armor + helmet and a full auto machinegun with ammo or a can of energy drink. Then if you survive that you also have to frantically battle against the clock in the mid to late game while a glorified electric circle slowly closes in on you to crush your dreams. After playing 20 games you fight even make it into the top 10 by sitting in the house you started in with a shotgun because the safezone decided to center on you. Don't worry you'll get shot by someone with the vector. Then after 50 hours you're a battle hardened veteran of the game and you win. Now uninstall and cry about the time you could have been spending with your family.Great game

review: This game is great. Its early access now and the amount of interaction and update from the devs has been pretty spot on. They released a patch in beginning of Aug that was accompanied by lag and frame rate drop issues. They found out and started to fix it within hours making it back to normal the next day. Everythings not perfect and sometimes when stuff gets released to a large crowd something unpredictable happens the part that makes or breaks it is the devs response to said issues. As for the "Micro Transactions" They put a crate out there which can be bought free (With in game points) but cost $2.50 USD to open the case with proceeds going to CHARITY and the FIRST Tournament prize pool for the game and will be removed at conclusion of said tournament. People complaining about this and saying they arent putting the time into fixing a game that gets weekly and monthly patches to improve it are dumb. May change review to negative and stop playing in near the future if the developers keep going on with banning people for stupid reasons such as honking the car horn they implimented due to it annoying people.

review: After seeing all of the negativity surrounding the recent updates of this game and being a recent player to the game I'd like to put my point across. Firstly the gameplay mechanics are by no means polished but for an "EARLY ACCESS" game I feel people are expecting too much especially with having to provide servers and optimisation for millions of people playing the game at once. Now I havent been around this community very long and at the time of this review I have 40 Hours on record and I have won two games its so rewarding and I feel thats why the player base is so large.The optimisation of the game isn't the best I still get texture bugs on medium settings with and i7 and a 960 4GB and I would only recommend this game if you feel your computer can run any modern title In my opinion the developers havent taken the best approach to this game but they are developing new maps modes and mod support So your paying for an ever expanding game at this point in time and I do feel that this game will only get more popular than it already is.So finally I would recommend this game but only to people with low expectations for an Early Access title and a rather good perfoming computer I'd say an i5 upwards and a GTX 750ti 760 thats until the optimisation is fixed anyway.

review: For a game in early development I must say this game is quite the experience. Every time you spawn into the game you have a completely unique experience whether that means dying immediately or getting all the way to 1st place.Pros Random loot spawn you never know what you'll get. Lots of weapons/attachments and more on the way. Large Area map to hide on until the force field swallows everything whole. Fresh Loot from dead bodies The ability to link up with friends in duo or Squad mode. Very few glitches i've experienced Vehicles to drive and run people over with Beautiful graphics that only keep improving Great physicsCons Sometimes you die immediately The game does lag sometimes Some areas don't spawn good loot Heart attacks heart attacks everywhere The random screaming in languages I don't understand. Those guys who can hit you from a mile away with a tiny pistol Cars flip quite easily.I highly recommend this game it has lots of weapons and lots of addons to the weapons it's always a surprise what you'll find and it's always nerve wracking when you find other players in game to shoot at. My Tip Move fast stay out of sight. Happy Hunting!

review: Review after 150+ hours. Let me start by this. I dont get why people so ing hate the "microtransaction" thing. Most of them are like "Your promise was lie.". First I was little angry too but after devs explained it. I am fine with it. To be honest who the would thought that the game will become so popular and literally nothing goes to devs pockets. Other thing is that people are constantly crying that instead of cosmetics they want new stuff. There is new update every week and BIG update every month and if you didnt get the memo Dev team is really small like super small for this big game.If this is not enough for you to stop crying go play other "great" early access games where devs promised ton of content and it never happened. *COUGH* *COUGH* Ark DayZ H1Z1 Conan and other *COUGH* *COUGH*And now the actual review.Pros Really great game to play solo or with friends (If you have any) It is fairly competitive or you can go full casual and just enjoy ing around Guns have really amazing sound and every single gun feels good. For me its pro for some no BUT cars physics is really funny. ! Stay away from motorbike if you dont want to risk dying! Really big gun arsenal. You can choose where you want to land. You dont need to kill anyone to be in top 10 or you can go nuts and kill everyone Difference in armor or helmet not that big if you play smart You can win without even shooting once. (REALLY hard) Updates Weekly smaller one. Monthly bigger oneCons Poor optimization. You can run the game really good on low details but really bad on Hight so dont expect stunning graphics It can get repetitive sometimes. Circle can you up really hard sometimes and you need to run 70% of the match (Really frustrating) and if there is open field in late game and you are unlucky you have 80% chance to lose. (ALWAYS Have some smokes) Push back lag on start of the game sometimes. It goes away around mid gameNeutral stuff Shotguns Never fight shotgun in close combat. It is really frustrating to get 1 shot sometimes You can get easily between 2 enemies so watch out. Sometimes you will get 1 shot by sniper in head. If you want challenge try playing with crossbow. It 1 shots to head every helmet in game

review: PUBG is a fun game but there are many problems. The game is poorly developed it feels like this game could have been released 10 years ago and would be good at that time. I have never heard of devs banning people for stream sniping and it happens to people who I have heard are not actually stream sniping but happened to kill a streamer. Streamers can make hundreds of thousands a year and more so it is expected that they have some difficulties with fans joining their games. Streamers can hide the server selection their minimap or simply add a 30second delay. Banning a sniper is a good look at how the devs are clearly new to the gaming community. The game has lots of RNG which is okay. I have trouble understanding why they have "The Red Zone." From what i have gathered from friends and streamers to put it quite frankly very few people like it. It doesn't serve any purpose other than making a ton of noise and the worst part is that it is not even random. It drops near Po i way more than any other place. I have had 6 back to back red zones in the same place. It can also kill you if you are in buildings sometimes. My biggest concern overall with the game is the lack of effort. It seem's like the devs and owners are doing a classic money grab. The game has i believe over 5m downloads which means that the game has made at least $100m. This money should be used to optimize and make the game smoother for people who dont havwe $400 graphics cards. I get 25 40 frames on this game with a 1 year old card. I also have had situations in the rain where it goes down to 15 20.It's clear that the devs are amateurs who found out that they can't handle a platform this big or simply don't want to.If a top tier gaming company made a battle royale hunger games production i fear that this company and others involved would be destroyed. This game is fun only because its genre is fun not because of the specifics or followthrough on the product.I would rate this game a solid 4/10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Due to the minimal amount of actual content the game has to offer I think it says a lot (for me anyway) that I've played this game for as much as I have. What I mean by that is this the game only has 1 gamemode. Essentially it is a battle royal game akin to games like H1Z1 and you'll play as a customizable character and parachute into a large map along with 99 ish players and battle to the death using whatever you find which is mainly firearms and the occasional melee weapon such as a machete frying pan etc.The game is in early access and therefore has very limited amounts of content basically you have the one game mode in which you can play either with yourself or up to 3 other players. The game is fun whether alone or with friends and both give a different experience to the game as your playstyle changes to keep up with the pace of the game. What I that is so grand about this game is the simple fact that every single game is a new experience atleast that's how it has felt so far. Most of the time I land in a new area I've never been too and it's a always a heart racing dash to the nearest household to look for a gun to kill the guy that landed 10 meters away from you hearing his footsteps as you scavenge. From there it's kill or be killed and if you're victorious you spend the rest of the game either hunting down others and stealing their loot or taking a stealthier approach and avoiding adversaries as you wait for the amount of players to go down as they fight and kill eachother or a mixture of both. Sometimes you die early on sometimes you die at the top ten either way when the game ends it takes only seconds to get back into another one and start the whole exhilerating experience again.Now for what I feel is upsetting about this game it's essentially a gamble in the beginning. Whether or not you'll run into a building with a weapon and even then a half decent one. It is early access so I understand the lack of weapons but some of the guns already in the game are so useless that they might as well be taken out. Firearms like the UMP45 and the GMC are good for around 30 seconds to a minute in game just good enough to kill anyone in the immediate vicinity but then for the next 10 30 minutes the weapons are obselete as the assault rifles blow them away with superioir firepower and accuracy same goes for the pistols as I never use them outside the first minute or so of the game untill I find a better gun which is no hard task btw there's one in every building practically. The last thing I can think of is the fact that the shotguns are way too overpowered. They are everywhere and its as if even the game thinks they are useless hell sometimes I'll even find two in one spawn. But the shotgun us undoubtably the most powerful weapon in the game as it can outmatch any firearm in the game in a close quarters fight (duh) which happens to be every single building in the game so it is an amazing building clearer. It also has a suprisingly long range about 25 meters if I'm not mistaken and generally if someone's within that range no matter how much armor they may have on a single shot from a shotgun will instantly kill them (trust me it's how I've won multiple firefights). Right now the shotgun is the best gun in the game and is also the most plentiful one so next time you see one grab it and prepare to win every confrontation.All in all I think it's a very enjoyable game and I'm so excited to see where the developers take it!

review: This game has it's ups and down but that is what makes it so great. Best $30 i have spent on a game for sure. Hours of fun and every round is a new experience. At first it is intense! getting into top 10 my heart is racing and i panic and freeze up like a dear in headlights accidently press the toggle program button on my mouse and hear myself get killed. So much fun. I think a lot of people hate on it for some dumb reasons and it does have some issues but that is what makes me keep coming back. Sometime i land and cannot find a gun so i just charge at people with a pan. Sometimes you get a nice gun and the before you load the ammo someone kills you with a pan.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Playerunknowns Battlegrounds If to be a honest i've spent 7 hours in this game and i can tell about it. First of all its an early access game and as always it has a lot of bugs and optimisation is If you have weak computer dont buy it. PUBG contains 90% of H1Z1 features and other 10% ARMA 3. For me both games are cool so the mix of them is very nice. About bugs and laggs Originally posted by Developer We don't expect that early access will last longer than six months . So if you dont want to play with laggs and buggs just wait a half of year and then buy it the price after early access will not change. I have GTX 750 Ti AMD A10 7850K 8GB RAM and my average fps is 40 on low settings and due to very slow loading of textures on start i cant enter buildings. The problem of this i think is an amount of video memory. So as i said before the mix of H1Z1 and ARMA 3 has turned out good. I have no claims to gameplay but iam waiting for adding more features for example hardcore mode (1st person only). This game has very strongly impressed me.You can modify your weapons Time of narrowing of a circle and time of a match isnt huge but you have enough time to loot camp on the border of a circle to kill some running guys to the circle etc Good ballisticsOption to mute general voice chat (Team only) you will understand what am i talking about when you will start the first game.And this is just a small part of good features.DEVELOPERS FIX OPTIMISATION PLEASE!

review: First off PlayerUnknown's Battlegrounds or PUBG is a Hunger Games themed type of arena combat. You drop in from an airplane find loot and kill other players. While unique In Its own way people still compare It to the other popular tile H1Z1. I personally own both but from what I can tell they're completely different This doesnt mean these games dont need tweaks I can think of numorous bugs poor optimization unfair weapons and most importantly RNG systems (PUBG is really bad on this one). Now everyone's experience with the game might be different but from my standpoint ive been ed over many times by this RNG looting to a point where I get so angry I want to jump out my own window. But when It does work properly and when you do find good loot god Is It satifying.The gunplay In this game is spectacular compared to other titles It feels like you're actually holding the gun and you can feel the kickback. That being said there are some other guns that are god awful. Like I said before there are some bugs in this game that really irritate me from people sniping with shotguns and when shotguns take 4 body shots from 2 meters away to down someone this can ruin the flow of the game greatly and drive people away like It did me for a couple of days.They could really improve on shotguns to make then better and worse to an equal ground they might want to fix a little on the optimization side of this game too. Its understandable because It Is still in early alpha but at some points no matter what cpu ram or graphic's card you will drop frames randomly. One problem I ocasionally run into Is when building don't load in their meshes if you will. this can make you wait around for as long as 10 minutes after landing.TL DR This game has It's up's and down's but Its still worth the retail price.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Product received for free. Alright I see most users have written negative reviews and I honestly dont appreciate it. The game is still in early access so you must have some understanding. I will be writing pros and cons of this game so you can decide easier whether you want to buy it or not.PROS TPP cameraFPP camera (with squads now)Realistic Grenade cookingAim systemWeather changesVechicle mechanicsZeroing distance and gravity.No fall damage if you jump out of 2 floor building.Game is being optimized almost everydayVault system (in progress)Crouch jumpingLanding animationsParachuting animationsPANCONS Unstable bikesCheatersUnloaded building (less than 16gb ram)Low optimizationStutteringLuck dependent(red zone loot)Non realistic scope distance measurementRunning simulatorNo Mic teammates in random squads/duosEven though there are a lot of bugs i still recommend buying this game as it is very fun even with random squads.(If ally has a mic in squads its probably a russian and will shout 300 and such.

review: The game itself can be very fun but there are some fundamental problems with the game that can distract from that fun factor and make it annoying. GreifingAbout half of my matchmaking squad games end up with me dying because of a greifing team member friendly firing upon me. I believe either friendly fire should be disabled or a report system introduced. It ruins the fun of the game to wait to get into a match only to be shot by a jerk team member Menu systemIt seems that the menus are very glitchy and sometimes can take a while to load. Considering some matches can only last a few minutes before being killed it would be better to have snappy responsive menus load quickly so I can get back in the game quicker.I do have some more opinionated issues with the game but they don't effect the fun but rather the balance. Third personI don't personally enjoy third person mode being the default. Boring end gameThis might be due to the third person but usually the end game is everyone laying prone waiting for someone else to pop up. I don't think its particularly fun. TLDR I think this game has potential but some more fundamental fixes &amp systems need to be introduced before I can recommend this game.

review: Going into this game I had no battle royale style experience under my belt and I purchased it because it looked interesting. I didn't expect it to become one of my favorite and most played games in my steam library but I was pleasantly surprised. The game is very impressive for an early access release. There's skill to the gun play and strategy throughout each match. One thing that really is great about PUBG is the ability to just jump into games over and over. Have a bad game? Oh well minimal time lost just ready up and you're back on the field in a flash. Every game brings new experiences and challenges. The game is just overall fun and feels good to play. I look forward to see what the dev team behind it has in store for the future. This isn't to say everything is perfect. There are many bugs and lag issues that happen throughout your time in PUBG. I just personally dont lose my enjoyment of the game due to a laggy server every 5 or so games although some people definitely do. Hopefully any lag or desync that is occuring now will be ironed out in the coming weeks. I highly recommend this game. $30 is a great price for the amount of fun that awaits you on the battlegrounds.

review: The game is in early access but it has been for awhile. Plans are for full release within a couple months. Not sure I can recommend this game in its current state if you plan on taking it somewhat seriously. Need a maybe vote. The server performance and hit registration has taken its toll on my group to the point we dont play much anymore. The game mechanics are fine been playing this game type since it was a mod on Arma 2/3 but much work needs to be done. The graphics are below average but thats not why we play this game. We play this game to be competitive and best other players by using tactics and good gun play. We play for the rush of the end game where player decisions not game/server performance decide the ending. Poor registration and performance is easier to accept in quick respawn games. NOT when you wait for a lobby to fill parachute down spend countless minutes looting to get smashed by someone when you appear to be behind cover or you fire 30 rounds into someone doing no dmg and they turn around and one bang you. I dont mind getting out played....but I hate wasting so much time to just die saying WTF over and over. Frustrating!The game is still fun and all of the Dinners have been pretty darn satisfying. Its a good game it just needs so much work to be ready. Its early access and it feels like it. Will it be better at release? I dont believe so as the performance has gotten worse with every update. You can still have fun just dont take it too seriously and expect alot of bad to go with the good. Is it worth it? Depends on your wallet and personality. I would recommend this if it stayed at its current price on release with a much smoother game experience. I have a feeling it will not get better anytime soon and will probably jump up in price on releae which then I would not recommend it.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS or "PUBG" is a Battle Royal FPS that incorperates jumping out of a plane with 90+ other players all with nothing on them but the cloths on there backs in a fight to the death for the chance to recieve a "WINNER WINNER CHICKEN DINNER" reward. if you die thats it! no respawn.the concept is fairly rinse and repeat. Jump out of plane &gt try and find (armour weapons first aid) &gt make sure you are always in the circle &gt try and be the last man standing. you would think that over time this would get pretty repetetive but that is sooo far from the truth. and its only in the beta stages!the variations of outcomes based on your decisions make for a very unpredictable and exciting time. playing solo is always a rush but with a squad is where teamwork really comes into play!All in all this is a fantasic game. loads of hours of gameplay to be had!

review: I bought this game back in July. I think I played it for about a month straight. I'll get straight to the point and cover some pros and cons of the game.Pros No game is ever the same due to the plane trajectory loot and cars all being variables in the game Variety of weapons attachments and clothing Looks like more customization is being added. Addictive. Very rewarding when you get your first win / top 5.Cons The crate system being garbage Bugs and crashes First 10 minutes or so get pretty boring since there's very little action or pressure going onBut overall I like this game. I play on NA servers but it's a shame what's going on with advertising on Asian servers.I would recommend this game.

review: I love this game.There were a few optimization issues when I first began playing but once you get that out of the way this game is amazing. And it's in early access not even complete yet. I've played it just about every day and it's a different experience every time. I'd been dreaming of a concept like this hunger games but with guns. And the kills are soooo satisfying too. Can't wait to see what the devs are gonna do next with it looking forward to a first person only mode CTF and even zombies hopefully. So much potential.And as far as the arguments over if this is better than H1Z1 it is. Much better gameplay and much more popular. You'd have more fun starting out on this.

review: So far I enjoy this and it looks like it will fill the Battle Royal itch I have been wanting since I became aware of the mod for ARMA. It is early access which is pretty evident but for the first day out it is surprisingly less buggy than full release AAA games. It is a very demanding game especially if using another program to stream or record but playing it without that I didn't have a hard time keeping above 55 frames on my 970/i5 build. If you want this game then I say go for it but if you are on the fence then just wait for the full release since history shows not to trust in early access games ever being more than what they are at launch!

review: This game is too big for its own good dont get me wrong it has the potential to be good but between bugs that prevent buildings from loading 100% of the way and the laggy stuttering servers its no good right now. I purchased this game knowing full well it hasnt even been out for a year yet so i didnt expect a fully completed optomized game. At first i was fine with the stuttering servers because they used to be few and far between i was also only mildly irritated with the bug that prevented the buildings from loading because i figured fixing game stopping bugs glitches would be the number one priority in future updates. So when a massive 6 or so GB update (if i remember correctly) was released i rejoiced and anxiously waited for the update to finish the content of that update you ask? Two new terrible weather variants Rain and Fog a few updates to the guns and a new rifle. No fixes. The game actually has gotten even worse as its climbed up the steams most concurrent players. dont get this game yet wait for the Devs to actually fix the real problemsRunning simulator 20 10Battle royale 8/10Devs 0 10
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: The Matchmaking system is incredibly fast. In most of the other games I played dying in an arena mode was very frustrating since the time spent and time ahead that I have to invest to achieve such progress again was way too much. With PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS fast paced concept losing a match is actually enjoyable. You take it as a lesson and can requeue in an instant. It takes you about 2 3 seconds at max. to find a game if not one of your friends is too stupid enough to forget to click READY every single time.In general you hop in and hop out. You build no real connection to the match as you know it could only take you 10 seconds to be in a complete new round. For me that's a super plus and a real reason to consider buying for anyone that enjoyed the Battlegrounds mods as in ArmA 3 but was disgusted by the time it took to actually participate in a match!

review: I have never ever touched a BattleRoyal game because i have never feeled the joy of it but after PUB released their Early Access and the explosion of streamers streamed it. I thought i NEED to read about this game stalked the /r/PUBATTLEGROUNDS/ and read about how the health of the game was. Watching beginner guides on YouTube.I decided to give it a go to jump in to the BR gamestyle.After around 10 hours in to the game i'm having a blast. It's so intense it's so fun Solo or Duo.Early Access you say? How is it? The first optimization patch will arrive 14th April and it cant come any sooner. It does need to optimize the game. They are improving the servers every day but during peakhours here in Europe it do does lag with rubberbanding effect to it.It's a slight delay when opening doors or while looting it's like a small lag or not as a lagg more like a delay of the action. It does need to improve but the game runs on a UE4 engine so i'm not worried. They are doing a great job so far.It can only get better.I do recomend it! 5/5!

review: A very addictive fun to play game. Originally I was off put by the style of game (Survival) but over time have come to really enjoy it. This game really has some of the best moments of gaming when teamed with friends in squad matches and something new and funny always happens.Latley I have seen alot of negative reviews due to micro transactions. Although some people may be angry for unknown reasons I feel this is unfair to the creators. ten to one all the players complaining about this most likely do not own/run thier own business and have next to no idea about ongoing costs to do so. End point with no exceptions is that this is a business and if money isnt being made and saved for future expendature There will be no game to play. Time is money and the employees working on this project deserve to be paid for their time. And ongoing costs need to be taken care of to ensure the longevity of this project.I feel like this game is heading in the right direction although not available on OC servers yet. Applaud the implimentation of first person perspective to the game. Hopfully this will appeal more to the FPS community and bring more players to the battleground.Every round plays different with RNG being a major factor in loot spawning. But that can somtimes be half the fun with not all rounds playing out as expected. Running players down with vehicles is very satasfying equally killing full squads in vehicles while camping a major road/bridge.I give this game an 8/10. To rank higher I would love to see More base spawn weapons rather then air drop creates. More Vehicles (less FWD and more RWD/4WD vehicles). An RPG to kill room campers/vehicles easier for lolz Crazier looking cosmetics the more outragous the better (personal preference). One to two more maps * Not going to complain at all about server reliability or optimization since this is Early Access and to do so would be unfair since this is not at full release.If the game keeps heading in the right direction and at full release some of the above have been implemented into the game and it runs silky smooth may be a 9/10 10/10 game. Will have to wait and see.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Pros +Tactical intense and overall fun gameplay+Players are able to decide how they want to approach situations with different guns and attachments.Cons Buggy as WAY too many cheaters 3rd person crosshair isn't consistent with 1st person so you actually have to SWITCH PERSPECTIVES to have the advantage at sometimes which sucks since that's not personal preference Your stats and leaderboard won't update until the next day which is really ING STUPID FIX THAT BLUEHOLE YOU S REALLY limited character customization. Shotguns require SO MUCH luck and positioning rather than skill. It's actually t how I need to spend 1.5 seconds with my ak on auto fire to kill a guy when that guy can TAP ME ONCE in the ing BODY and die. WITH ARMOR. NOT EVEN A ING LEVEL 3 MILITARY VEST CAN STOP IT. NERF. ALL. SHOTGUNS. ING RIDICULOUS. So in conclusion this game is absolutely ing . but there's just something about it that pulls me towards it. Everytime I look at my desktop I see PUBG and frown... but still double click on it. Then I play a game and get to the top 10. Next thing I know I started playing at 3 PM and went to sleep at 2AM after a long day's work of updating my kd.That was a story summarizing my love hate relationship with PUBG. I love it and the potential but it's just not ready yet. Honestly all I want is for Bluehole to lay off on adding new weapons and and start fixing major and minor bugs. Hell that's what every negative review wants. This game isn't as skill based as H1Z1 KOTK which means everyone can win but holy hell it needs SO MUCH LUCK. You have to be fortunate and lucky to have a 1.5+ kd on solo and 20%+ top 10 on solo stat like I do. This game enrages me but time will tell.

review: I wasn't going to review the game but the recent that has happened is kind of forcing me to want to share my opinion. For starters I think the gameplay itself is a blast. However with every new update there seems to be more and more issues. First there was server lag that plagued most of the user base. Now there is constant stuttering and frame drops. The door and sound bugs aren't exactly every person's dream either. Normally I would just assume it was just my computer since I would consider mine about a mid range pc. But with all the complaints on reddit and watching one of my friends have the same problems on a pc much much better than mine it's getting harder and harder to justify recommending the game to someone. And as the cherry on top the fact that the developers are going back on their word about microtransactions and dropping the ban hammer so willy nilly is making me lose way more respect for the company itself. If they can fix the most recent issues and create a more community centric model for their company I will gladly eat my words and start recommending the game again.

review: This game is lots of fun. I usually approach multiplayer games with the idea that every Euro I've payed translates into one hour of game time as a baseline. With this game I've reached that baseline so here's the review + Good fun on your own in duos and squads of three or four players.+ You're free to play as you want fast paced drops onto the military base and straight dives from the plane scavenger style games where you hunt for cars on the road to go for far out places or fly directly toward them to be stealthy or aggressive.+ The gun fights are fun there is a decent selection of weapons and attachments. Yet even more so I enjoy planning out my route constantly making adjustments to it and looting gear. + The map. There's lots of variety to be found here. Depending on the plane trajectory the games always play out very differently. One game a place might mean a massive battle and the next free safe loot.There's also a learning aspect here. As you play the game you start to recognize the towns villages and intersections how they connect to one another and their properties (i.e. sightlines) however the loot is randomized.+ The shrinking battlefield guarantees a timely endgame and makes for intense fights.+ The endgame is also varied as sometimes you'll be fighting on a level field with only trees to give you cover and other times it will be in the center of a big city or ruins. Due to poor planning or poorly timed run ins you might end up having to run through nowhere's land for several minutes straight before barely making it out alive underequiped and in awful position for the next phase. Generally there's not much feeback. It's hard to make out where your bullets end up unless they hit the target (which results in a visible spray of blood). After over thirty hours I still have no clue how to use the zoning properly or the general range of my weapons how much to lead at what distance etc. . . . A simple practice range would do the trick. It's also not obvious how Energy Drinks and painkillers work and sometimes you'll die outside of the zone because you didn't properly estimate the time it takes to heal up and the amount of damage the zone deals. As a casual you might never learn. Game breaking bugs. Had a friend jump down the stairs while I was moving up and as a result he cratered and was stuck. Lots of other bugs involving fall damage vehicles teleporting doors and so on. Poor fps and lags albeit playable. The two markers bug I'd prefer more functions for the map such as markers for spare loot zone movement plane trajectory looted buildings players vehicles directions . . .All in all it is a great game that has the perfect mix of relaxed and intense gameplay. Even in its current state it is heaps of fun and as (or if) they fix the bugs and framerate it will only get better.

review: Product received for free. My fiance gifted this for me for my birthday I was a bit 'eh' about it because over all it looks like a sweet game and lots of fun plus my friends have it and say while it can be buggy its a good time. Plus the reviews were all hit and miss. But since it was a gift I gave it a go. Thanks Bae.First off it is buggy as textures take too long to load there is clear server lag things glitch often and it crashes from time to time so there is still a lot of work to be done for the game. Keeping in mind however that this game is early access and only $30 (US) I let those things slide (for now). OMG the griefing and harassment though! Geez! But it is kind of excpected from these sorts of games so if you don't like to be picked on or trolled in voice chat turn that noise off. There are hackers but I only came across one so far hopefully they crack down on that further.This whole thing with killing streamers and getting banned sounds odd concerning and a bs thing for developers to do but it hasn't happened to anyone I know and hopfully they fix that cause even though I didn't buy it I don't really wanna be banned because I out did someone who just happens to be streamingWhen it does work it is a great time trying to survive to the finish escpecially with your friends and nothing feels greater then over coming all obsticles to come out on top.This game is only half a game and I would recommend waiting until a full release or at lease until they've fixed a majority of bugs and add a bit more content. If i didn't have it gifted to me that is most likely what I would have done.While I am having a lot of fun playing this game with my friends there are too many cons for me to recommend this. Even though it is half the price of major games it feels like you're getting less. If the game was around the $15 $20 price tag I'd say go for it and see what you think but until alot of things can be fixed or a full release happens save your wallets for something else. Or don't It's your life do whatever.Nominated for the write in award. "Long drop with a short stop"

review: This game is one of the most fun games I've played in a while.NOTE TO NEW PEOPLE You will see many comments regarding micro transactions and how Bluehole and Playerunknown said they will not be adding them. However these micro transactions are simply for cosmetics and the money goes to fund the new tournament being held!PUBG is not just a shooter or a PvP game it's a battle royal. I know that doesn't sound very interesting but battle royale games that are made well (this one) are full on horror games. The fact that I could walk into a house while someone is looting it scares the out of me. I really have a great time playing this game especially in the duo and squad modes. The only problem I have with this game is that it takes a lot to run well. I can run this game at 60 fps on low settings but I'd like to go higher. Although I have high hopes for this game for it has responsive devs who update this game all the time. BUY THIS GAME!! MrToasti

review: I am going to make this as un biased as I possibly can. This game is an amazing KOTH styled arena game simple as that. Are there bugs? Of course it's early access. Is it worth it because the bugs are minor at best? Yes. I've been hear and seeing people just simply go bonkers of micro transactions and all I have to say about it is this. You don't want to spend money on a charity or to fund a tournament? Then don't it's simple. It's all comesmetic and nothing is really worth buying so save your money and everyone's time with your complaint. Now that I have that out of the way here's some quick pros and cons Pros The game is fast paced and quick Guns are realistic and powerfulThe landscape is jaw droppingThe que times are so short I can't even use the bathroom in between matches Cons Minor bug issues (I've encountered 2 since I started playing)Huge learning curve Network Lag pauses match for a couple of seconds All in all it's an easy 10/10 seeing how i bought this game 4 days ago and already have 60 hours easy into the game and my friends and I simply can't get enough Now on another note. Quit giving a good game a bad rating because your butt hurt. The game is good and you should let people know the good and the bad and stop acting like butt hurt children.

review: Incredibly good game especially for early access games. Combines the realistic combat feel of Arma games with the hectic yet tactical gameplay a BR style game gives you. People might not agree with me but the movement is really damn good for a game like this it feels fluent allthough not being able to jump over a small wall might be annoying allthough Vaulting is being introduced in an update later down the line!Combat feels incredible getting shot at running through an open field hearing the (Incredible may I add) bullet sounds zoom past your ears trying to figure out where you're getting shot at it really gets the heart pumping. The guns are hard to handle giving them a very needed learning curve once used to handling them they can really be powerfull. A thing I personally love is that the guns don't just feel like reskins that you can attach more or less attachments too the guns feel different. A Scar feels COMPLETELY different from an AK for example. Attachments have a meaning since they can completely change the way a gun plays find a suppressor and suddenly you'll find yourself sneaking around hunting people find a compensator and don't worry about running into gunfights since you'll be able to control the recoil nicely.Sound is incredible the level of detail in every sound is very nice allthough certain sounds can bug every so often but that is expected for an Early access game. Sound is a very VERY important tool in games that try to give a realistic experience and the team did it right. It's not as easy as hearing a gunshot hearing its from your right side and turning around and spotting the enemy bullets actually fly past you and every so often you'll find yourself looking at where the bullet impacted rather than where it was fired from.Overall for 30$ this game is definitely worth the money especially if you can get some friends together to play.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: I've put almost 300 hours into this game. I still play regularly but I can't recommend anyone buy it. Cheaters poor optimization desync and lag. You'll encounter all of these within almost every match. Bluehole seems to not really care about it or about what they players are saying. At this point we have to assume Bluehole has taken the money and run with it. This is solidified with the announcement that they are working on a new game. Why not finish the one you started first Bluehole?I'd say save your money until the devs fix all of these problems. Until then I'd recommend Fortnite BR. IT's faster paced better optimized and more fun.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Battlegrounds is in my opinion the best battle royale game out right now. I've played H1Z1 and can say that Battlgrounds is a lot better. There are more guns armor and overall customisation and depth. If you have played the BR game modes in ARMA or H1Z1 this game should feel familiar. The gun play is great and satisfying and a lot better than H1Z1 since there isn't anyone jumping over your shots and blasting you with a shotgun. The inventory system is basically the same as ARMA.Battlegrounds really shines when you play it with a full team or another friend. There isn't a better feeling in this game when your team has an all out gunfight with another team. Battlegrounds will also get your heart pumping which H1Z1 didn't seem to do to me as much. However Battlegrounds is not optimized very well. I play at 2560x1440 with a GTX 1070 i5 6500 and 16gb of ram and have a mix of 40 70 fps with a mix of high and ultra settings. There is a lot of lag at the starting island and when you start the game. I still recommend this game since it is the most fun battle royale style game out. Edit Just go play fortnite at this point lul

review: Oh man where do I start. Apparently I've played about 104 hours to this point... and i've only won maybe 7 10 games total between solo duo and team play. I was sceptical about buying this game as I've been burned with early access before but the devs are very active. They have updates constantly There are new guns and new maps in the works from what I hear! The optimization is a little off but I'm sure they will fix that with time. I've heard people complain about hackers here and there and while I have met some very "questionable" opposition this game is not rife with it if it were I wouldn't have won ANY games. I do wish there were some way to report players that were very questionable though but oh well. Don't let people that are bad never change their strats make bad jumps and run into crap headlong then complain about hackers keep you from buying this game and having tons of fun. In all the time that I have played I've only met a handfull of people that I seriously question I think that is saying something.TLDR Buy it get super paranoid get shot in the back of the head when you run into a house after making sure no one was in there facepalm start over.

review: Edit for 1.0 release the 1.0 update feels like an ubsubstantial patch that has seemingly fixed nothing. Performance is noticably worse than the test server feels like about 70% the fps I used to have. I used to have a smooth ride in cars but now you can really see the framerate even after turning a few settings down. All the lag and rubberbandi g remain. The game still has its moments of fun but for a game that has brought in 100s of millions of dollars this is a pathetic excuse for a full release.Edit Game is steadily getting worse/more broken. Level geometry fails to load now. My friend loses 20 seconds of looting waiting for his game to load while he is playing it he is running an i7 8gb ram and 1080ti with 11gb of ram. But this game cannot figure out how to load geometry ruining any chance of us actually playing an aggressive early game. Crashes continue to happen. Server crashes happen often enought to be annoying especially after 25 minutes of getting god tier loot but having no kills. In game ads now after selling 10 million copies. This developer has stated that he doesn't really care about games and you can tell. He made his mods then he made his game with the quality of a mod and it doesn't look like he has the skill or is willing to hire people with the skill to make this game actually work now. Total piece of crap at this point.Original review below Good concepts and decent mechanics BUT the developers dont seem to be acknowledging that their basic netcode doesnt work. Nothing like spending 30 minutes in a game then dying to lag spikes. Nothing like being in the top 5 and getting a .2 second lag spike every time you point a gun at someone making your 2nd thru 5th shots impossible to land. Nothing like getting the drop on some loser from behind only to get a fat lag spike dropped on you so hard that you lose all advantage. Seriously dont support this game right now. Close range combat is nearly impossible and medium to long range is a crapshoot whether or not you will have a lag spike. Should have known. Early access is for devs that need to figure out hownto finish making a game. Another crook dev.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: So how this game works is.....Jump out a planeWait 45 seconds for the buldings to render and the server lag to go away....by that point everyone else has guns.Die soon after rendering buildingsRepeat.I really like this game it has so much potential to be a brilliant game. But it has 1000km to go before it is a decent game the servers feel like they're 2 lemons with some wire attached the weapon damage is so inconsistent (i have had multiple occassions of 5 or 6 hits for them to turn and shot me twice and I die). The hackers in this game toxic being shot through walls and trees is not fun.I understand this game is still in early access but enough people have bought this game they should have the money to finish it.....or at least make the servers useable.I'd love to give this game a thumbs up but there are way to many problems that need fixed before it can have it.

title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Bought the game yesterday and I just want to get back to it over and over again.PROS 100 players matches (huge player base make finding games instand so you can play over and over again without much waiting time) variety of weapons with customization (they'll probably add more in the future) vehicles aren't indestructible and require fuel to work huge map character customization voip available (but possible to turn it off if you are tired of kids screaming in their mics) seperated queues for solo duo and groups matchs don't last too long (restriction of map happening at a very decent rate &gt low enough to let you loot quick enough to avoid having games that last 1h because of people hiding) tactical/stealth playing (noises are very important and you can get really better cuz of it).CONS graphics aren't very nice and everyone keep them low to render as less things as possible (boost of FPS and less stuff blocking your sight) alot of glitches and some lag (but it's early access right now so they'll probably work on it til full release) high learning curve (at beginning you'll never understand why you get killed wont spot much players will spend forever to understand what you looted and what you want to keep and what you want to throw away etc)NEUTRAL Rage personnally this game doesnt make me rage because there is 1 chance on 100 that I win the game... so you're not going for win you're just trying to survive as long as possible and if you take down 1 2 targets you already feel happy.. I feel less like being competitive (therefore raging) in this game than in games like Overwatch. So it's not making me angry.. when I die I usually try to understand what I did wrong laugh a bit then exit and start a new round... all this based on solo queue I have no idea how it could be in duo and group since have no friends playing yet.EDIT Me not raging could also be due to my addiction to Bob Ross that I'm listenning at while playing.. but not too loud.. you want to hear those happy little footsteps if you plan on not dying too early!Overall I'll give a positive review. The game is early access so it still has glitch and bugs and features missing. They could have a bit more guns but I'm pretty sure they'll add both guns and weapons part in future. They said they would not increase price on release so you can easely wait longer before buying and wont be penalized for it in term of price. Due to high popularity righ now it's very likely this game will end up in something good because devs have more than enough funding to get going. I feel like it'll be better than H1Z1 (this is probably why everyone left H1Z1 to come play this instead). I'm having great fun and it works fairly well on my 4 years old computer (GTX 760 and I 3350P 3.1Ghz 16Gb RAM).If you are not sure you'll like it you can also purchase try and refund if you don't feel like it's your kind of game or if it doesnt work well or if it makes you rage too much! P This is what I was planning to do and I decided to keep it. GG D

review: I'm not sure if I recommend yet...So it's been fun walking around with friends kinda reminiscent of Day Z.Duo and Team games are a lot of communication scavenging and keeping on the move and even if you don't win it's a good rush of fun.Downsides Oceanic server seems to lag a bit so when it comes to shooting it's not great.Solo queue is find a house and camp as best as you can no one to talk to constant fear that you will die... I guess that's what they're going for haha!I'm hopeful as it updates it will become more responsive and I see this becoming an incredible game. So I guess I would recommend but only when it's out of Early Access

review: One of the most addicting tense games I've played in years.It's fast paced and semi fair with the Random Number Generator (RNG) being not too bad most of the times. Even if you have the top tier end game stuff if you don't plan ahead and play the odds right you'll be forced to run into the zone out in the open.Plan ahead and calculate your odds.With some team members and coordination it's too tense.Your odds of winning are low. Approximately 1 5% with basic tactics. So whenever you win it feels incredible.Have you ever played that sniper level (All Ghillied Up) in Call of Duty 4? This is that game!

review: I've only played the game for 2 hours so take my review lightly but I do have some real concerns about the game.MISLEADING SPECS The system requirements only list a GTX 660 as the minimum required to run the game but I must say this is very misleading. Although 30 FPS is a playable framerate this game requires so much attention to detail that it is almost impossible to have fun in this game without a smooth 60 FPS throughout. This is a huge issue because not even a GTX 1050 could handle the game at the lowest possible settings without averaging 30 35 FPS. I found myself constantly handicapped against players that could clearly navigate better due to better framerates being able to run and gun hide and quickly adapt to a scenario without missing a beat. I found that I was not alone either as I played the "Squad" version online where it pairs you with 3 other people as a team and found other players had trouble quickly getting into and out of firefights. While this could be the result of inexperience with the game the bottom line was that I couldn't find myself playing at 30 FPS and having fun.KIDS SPAM VOICE CHAT I found myself having to mute everyone in the game as it wouldn't allow me to mute specific people talking in the FFA version of the game. I would say a good 30% of the community are little kids and the ones with mic's constantly spam and annoy the living **** out of me. This is also made a larger issue because the game clearly has a high learning curve with no introductory tutorial and having to play with limits your ability to learn with others.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Bottom line... FUN and highly recommended! Seems to be lots of hate recently over the micro transactions... so take that for what it is broken promises and all (they're cosmetic however).
