review: Everyone complaining about micro transactions is either an idiot or to poor to afford a $2.50 key. They think that downvoting the game is justice and that they're a big person for doing so so ignore them and understand that there is a reason this game sold so many copies and that all of those people downvoting have over 50 hours played in it. Its a well crafted game that only gets better. Micro transactions can be ignored because they're just for cosmetics and there are plenty of cosmetics ingame that you can get for free. Enjoy the game as it is and ignore the small crowd of protesters in the corner thinking they're making a difference when the dev has literally posted he's ignoring them. Also stick clear of the reddit its got 3 sections "Streamer love" "Look at the cool thing I did" and "Constant complaining and trying to make the game what I want not what the devs want"This game is a solid 8 on 10 and its playerbase is well deserved.

review: If you're a fan of Arma/Dayz you'll like and wont regret purchasing this game. It encourages and rewards tactical play no match is the same either. There is a lot of potential additional content with every hope being it doesn't turn into a cash grab like the other title we all know. Judging by PlayerUnknown's background and reason for development of Battlegrounds it seems unlikely that this game will fade fast. That being said even as it currently is 30$ is a more then reasonable price.There are a few gripes I have about it that seem to be shared with a lot of other players which is the lack of realistic servers(the 3rd person really needs to be taken out) and of course server stability fixes.

review: This game is an upgraded H1Z1 king of the kill that is more tactical and realistic. The game is extremely buggy as it is brand new and in early access therefore I can't recommend this to someone looking to buy a complete game. I would say their current version is the skeleton of what the finished product will be.Stand out Pros Weapon modifications Tactical gameplay results in intense firefights (Or you die out of nowhere with no chance to fight back ) Combat (for the most part) is smooth Vehicles aren't over powerd and are best suited for traveling rather than combat Gas moves quick to keep games moving sometimes it is annoying but overall it enhances gameplayStand out Cons Losing connection to servers FPS drops and lags Picking up and switching guns is buggy half enough to be noticable Map is decent could have a much more creative design Weapons withing a class (ie. Assault rifles Sub Machines guns snipers pistols and shotguns) could have more distinct trade offs that defines what the strengths of each specific gun are compared to the counter parts within the class.Parting ThoughtsPersonally I enjoy this game and look forward to the developers improving the game. If you are willing to deal with early access growing pains then I suggest purchasing it.

review: Not sure why there are so many salty reviews considering this is still in early access.I've currently got over 60 hours in the game and I'm still having loads of fun both playing in solo and with friends. Yes the game can be improved in terms of optimisation but to be honest most games I have zero problems. The popularity with this game for me is the balance it provides based on other games I've played previously. DayZ was way too big and slow to get loot but in PUBG depending on where you drop you can be fully kitted out within 10 minutes and already have kills under your belt.Yes it can be frustrating and you might find yourself getting shot time after time but look at what you were doing. Maybe there was a better route you could have taken maybe you should have moved slower or maybe you just need more practice.For me it's the randomness that keeps me coming back. Which direction is the plane going? Where am I going to paradrop with my team? Where can I find a vehicle? Where's the circle going to minimise down to? All the mechanics make the game very challenging and also fun. I believe with more maps better anti cheat measures and new features this game is going to be with us for a very long time.Seriously if you haven't got this game give it a go. You won't regret it in the long run.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This game is ing sick 10/10 from me honestly a worthwhile pickup even in EA in my opinion the graphics might not be to everyones taste just yet(which I believe they have said they will overhaul it is in my opinion pretty darn good just take away the slight blur to textures in the distance and I'd be more than happy note one can use reshade.me aka sweetfx to make this game look better) so what is the pro's and cons? Coming from an exlusivley almost only hardcore fps/realism shooter gamer I will try to give a fair unbiased opinion on the stated of the game so far here we go.So lets start with the gameplay for the average gamer this game should be extremely easy to pickup and get the hang of with the current game mode one jumps into a cargo type jet after screaming &amp quot " or any other profanities at other players and puffing they're chests you then skydive at your choice on any point you choose during the flight if you don't get kicked out automatically with all the other AFK's and parachute or technically HALO into a position of your choosing on the rather large map filled with military complexes bunker systems farmlands or towns along with typically 99 other people...it is at this point you get your into gear and start checking for loot spawns which can be quite varied but overall very well done after aqquiring a weapon grenades like molotovs m67 frags stuns or smokes some clothing meds and a backpack. one then either premptively decides to or gets caught in a blue wall of your HP every few seconds or put simply a circle which closes you and any others players closer and closer at the cost of being outside dying slowly or quickly depending on the stage the circle is into the game.it is this very system which unless you are very stealthy and good at avoiding players will push you into firefights with other players at varying angles and situations.You are your decision in this game you forgot to pickup that med kit? guess what you've now gotta find one of a dead player who ran into your house wanting to put a 12 gauge shell in your face while the circle eats away at the 50% hp he took of with one hit your lucky if he had that bad a shot.The game is like so f******g gruelling and aggressive to everyone that every factor plays in in a splendid way yes luck plays a part but it is very miniscule when talking of the actual game balance and mechanics usually its you your decisions your hard drive failing due to too many porn videos or that crappy internet you've been having to deal with because your parents spike it up and down with they're 20 browsing tabs they leave open on they're phone.So the quick verdict then...will I have fun with this game?You will you most definitely will just make sure you don't have crappy connection(servers NA SA EU OC/AUS/JAP I don't f******g know oceana or what you call it ok?)and that if you have a potato of a machine that first you learn how to work with that system and that your not half clueless with how a PC can be put into optimal use for this application and that if that is the case that you don't write a bad review because your salty you bought a game which won't run on your toaster with multiple bad sectors a clogged CPU cooler and a 2001 APU or some s**t that is probably well under the recommended/minimal specs.This game will make your heart jump up to like 144bpm at some times and at some times it may make you want to throw your PC against a full speed truck but it's worth every bit of cash I payed for it and the Devs are definitely doing a f'ing A grade job and making a difference to not only the game they're making but also to the image of gamers read the latest dev blog to see they raised something around 200000$ for charity...Player Unknown...bloody well done salute!

review: PUBG is a solid Battle Royal game with survival elements. Currently in early access the game is being developed with community feedback. The game can be played in either first or third person perspective. Squad sizes are limited to four players and servers are limited to 100 players.Even in its early stages the game provides very fun and intense gameplay. The gunplay is very accurate and the map works well and is quite detailed. Everything flows together very well. You don't end up spending half of your game organizing your inventory because of their quick gear swapping system. It currently needs optimization so you will probably need to tweak the settings to have a smooth game experience.

review: The gameplay is extremely fun. Fast paced intense rewarding shooting feels good extremely fun to play with friends and it has awesome small mechanics that makes the game more enjoyable. However in the state it is in right now I can't recommend it. The optimization is beyond terrible. At lowest graphics I still have problems getting the game to run above 40 fps. FPS is important in games like these if you can't get a good framerate then it's going to fu*ck with your aim. Also if you just meet the minimum requirements for this game then you aren't going to be able to run it whatsoever. I feel as if you need a really good computer to get decent frames. Also I understand the game is in Early Access however the optimization for the game is a huge issue and is ruining my overall game experience.I'd wait until the game moves further along in development and when the dev team optimizes it a bit more before buying. Specs Windows 10 64 bitRX 480 8gb GPUquad core i5 6400 processor16 gbs of ram

review: PUBG is a very fun game that gives players heart pounding moments. There are however some very big issues that the game needs to fix (I know the game is still in early access so hush child).The game is mostly well designed. The gunplay the intense moments and the duos/squads is all done very well. There are however three things that in my opinion really ruin the game sometimes. 1) The poor optimizationThe optimization of the PUBG has gotten much better since the launch. There really isn't much to say regarding this. I would suggest asking people with the graphics card that you have and see how they run the game before you buy it. The game was and still might be more heavy on the CPU. If you're in larger cities of the game and starts lagging it can take away your ability to fight and aim properly to eliminate other players. This can be annoying. 2) The serversThe PUBG servers are pretty bad. In the lobbies it can be very frustrating to not be able to see who and who isn't in your squad or the lobby UI not working and having to refresh it many times or losing connection midway throught the game. This can be annoying. (Side note They did add the feature to rejoin the game if you crash which is great) 3) RNG (Loot and Safe Zone)RNG in the game will have a major impact on if you win or lose the game. The loot on the map has chances to have better loot in certain areas (Military Powerplant etc..) this is not my problem with the game. You can go into several houses at a time and not find a single gun and another person can walk into another house with end game loot and curb stomp you. The next problem is the safe zone. If you're in top ten and you don't get a safe zone spot with no cover you will more likely have a more difficult time winning the game. These things are annoying.TL DRHas problems but very fun to play with friends.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is gonna be a longass post. I recommend this game to anyone who wants to have a fresh breath on the battleroyale side of the gaming community its more advanced than at least a dozen other games in the scene that have mid range player bases it has a great open world and system to add to your liking. And they finally callobrated the game so people with higher end pcs with better cores and graphics cards dont have to be restricted by the game and have lower fps I was finally able to crank up my setting to ultra and then have 70 fps avg. Its in early access so do expect a bug or two every now and then but I only experienced a bug once while others have a dozen of times. Its obvious this game will go down as a great one the fact the game grew just on streamers alone is amazing but there two sides of the penny. The rules are very strict like private school white kid strict. Dont bother honking your horn ever. You'll just be accussed of stream evading and if you kill a streamer its a 40/60 chance you'll get suspended or banned for alleged "stream sniping" its really aggravating to the community. Now the bugs and glitches never take advantage of them if they screw someone else not only cause its a move but because you'll (you guessed it) get suspended or banned. Now the fact that the devs introduced microtransations is annoying to the community I myself dont mind since I will never bother with that but the fact that a skirt is $400 dollars is bs I must admit though the fact that you can EARN some of the crates by getting the curenccy is fine by me but the idea that you have to pay for a key for the gamescon crate is its already rare enough and the fact that many people expected this game to be something different since the game is so good for being started by very few people and then breaking their promise on not putting microtransactions and then doing it just pisses the community off but I do like the idea of the fact that partial money will go to charities. Like I said there are two sides and I do recommend this game but I want people to know the whole picture before going in.

review: EDIT PUBG team has really let me and many other people down with recent PR moves. Firstly they've falsely banned a person for stream sniping which is ridiculous by itself as it is very hard to prove. It's streamer's responsibility to hide server ID to prevent stream sniping instead of banning people for it they have to take that risk by openly streaming the game its their choice. Secondly PU promised that microtransactions won't be in the game until the full release. I don't have anything against microtransactions themselves but the way they are implemented. I think they are kind of necessary to keep the game up and running for such a big playerbase. But the way they should implement it is like Overwatch did all crates are free and you don't need a key instead u get to buy them with real money. CS GO crates prevent you from getting items at all without paying. It is too much rng. I'll change my review back once these issues are adressed.OLD REVIEW I really enjoy this game the gameplay is crisp there is no desync and everything works as intented. Optimisation is not the best at this very moment however i was able to pull 60 fps of without any problems on my system. I expect that this game has a bright future if it gets developed in 6 months as developers said. Also I really hope that it is not going to end up like other early access games stuck in development for years with patches releasing rarely.I haven't played h1z1 king of the kill so I cannot compare it to that however I have tried arma 3 battle royale and this is in my opinion far more superior both especially in gameplay aspect of the game since there are no fps issues nor weird clunky mechanics.I give this game a big thumbs up! Keep it up PUBG DSpecs im running I7 4770k 8gb ram gtx 1070

review: I'm going to CAREFULLY give this a yes. And be short about it. Pros Can be lots of fun no matter if you're the first to die or the 55th to die Always more fun with friends! Every game can be a new experience no matter how many times you play Lots of different strategies to employ and use so it can fit anyones playstyle in games Fast matchmaking wether solo duo or squad TONS of control customization most precise game I've seen with nearly 10 different sensitivity optionsCons Main menu UI is a ing joke and piece of If you NEED refresh buttons on your UI you're doing it wrong. Hitboxes can be wonky melee fighting can be a wild ride of swings and misses even when staring RIGHT AT someone Not yet fully optimized graphically. I run it on Ultra and can run steady 120 fps but dips are abound at random times On that note sometimes you need to restart your game everyother game due to artifacts or other glitches showing up Hackers not really under any control. If one is in the game you'll know Vehicles are really only usefull if you don't hit anything larger than a molecule on the ground and launch yourself into space. The timing with squads before the circle of death starts closing in needs to be longer and heres why If youre not playing solo or duo resources become scarce way too fast. ONE teammate will have A good gun with SOME ammo the rest will have a pistol or a melee and no backpacks on average.That's really my only gripes and likes about it you can jump into a new game as fast as you get KO'd of another which is nice too. Honestly watch a stream or YouTube video or two if you're unsure.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: Exellent game even at this early stage be it solo duo 3man or a full team of 4 friends this is a fantastic pvp battle royale game tough to learn from scratch without friends and often frustrating when you die BUT when I die 9 times out of 10 it was because of something I did wrong or could have done better and not the game and I'm cool with that when it's not something I did wrong its usually that I was outplayed or out shot which is also fine tbh. Practice practice practice! I find that unlike alot of other PvP shooters in PuBg If I'm killed I just think 'Damn I should have done XYZ instead that's my fault'. I've noticed this alot. It can be easy to rage at a game but in PuBg it's YOUR choices that shapes the game. You'll know when you did something stupid or look back and think 'Why did I push that guy?' etc.There are sometimes however when you do feel that the game really wants you dead more often than not it's a series of horrible zones to traverse or distance between them. That or landing and searching several buildings and finding nothing of use when an enemy could land and in his 1st builting be armed to the hilt that is a bit frustrating. That being said a skilled player / team can make the best out of a bad situation and still come out on top.Bad zones you can play around by being more aware of the time and distance and allowing making sure you're not cutting the time to get there fine. This can be easier in a team to begin with as there are more of you to keep an eye on the zone situation. Regarding the current game situation at the time of writing WHY OH WHY are they making the Groza 7.62 a supply drop only weapon!? When the VSS which is a deadly deadly gun is so horribly misrepresented in the game anyone who knows the specifics of the real gun or have played S.T.A.L.K.E.R / DayZ will tell you the same. Easy fix make the Groza a semi rare assault rifle with a spawn rate perhaps simular to the SKS maybe? Remove the VSS from standard spawns and make it supply drop only like the M24 and AWM but! Actually represent the weapon properly give it it's corrrect ammunition (9x39mm subsonic) it does not fire pistol ammo irl. Giving it its correct ammo but in a limited quantity like the AWM would prevent it from being overpowered you cannot upgrade the scope past its current (4x?) PSO type and the bullet drop and travel time of the rounds make it difficult to land a shot on moving targets. Surely some other players who are familier with the weapons attributes and how it currently sits in the game meta can agree? /rant.

review: I've been reading through some of the stuff here and I've seen a lot of people doing negative reviews because of the developers. Now I wouldn't say that I'm fully aware of all the things they've done but I'd still like to express how I feel.First I wanna talk about the micro transactions.Is it pay for convinience and how much do the clothing help?I was actually quite suprised that a lot of people complain about this I've been running around in a white t shirt during most of my playtime. And I've never felt like I've been in a serious disadvantage. Most of the time you'll have trees etc as cover. And your clothing won't really decide if you put a bullet between his eyes or not.And the fact that I haven't really been bothered is because you pretty much get money to buy clothes for playing the game. Those Gamescon crates went for like 2 euros while they were available. I think I've been able to get like 18 euros total from just playing pubg and the camo clothes do not go for a lot of money. You can literally buy a black t shirt for 0 05 and a pair of black jeans for 0 06 . The most expensive clothing that you can buy on the market is the infamous mini skirt and that isn't more camoflagued than those 0 06 pants.Yes bluehole has been banning people for reasons.Streamsniping is obviously a problem and I can't say they're doing a perfect job of preventing streamsniping by banning people who have literally no clue that they killed a streamer. But the thing is the people that have been banned have been able to contact the developers and gotten themselfes UNBANNED. They're not s and if you do get banned for no reason whatsoever don't just get mad and quit. Contact them and tell them what happened politely and hopefully you'll get unbanned.Lastly I've read about people complaining that there's too many "try hards". And they gave negative reviews because they never win. And I'm sorry to tell you but the sole purpose of this game is to win. The ONLY objective is to be the last one standing. If you can't win because you're not good enough don't expect the developers to make it easier for you.You can't bring your halfassed gameplay and expect to win. This is battleroyale and if you're too casual to even compete with the rest of the community.G I T G U D .Overall I think this game is great. YES it has bugs YES it does crash. But the majority of the games I've played it's been working and It's most definately playable. I get around 40 70 fps on the lowest graphics with it being on 55 65 on average. I've been experiencing very few crashes i've seen some of my friends crash sometimes but they have been able to come back in without any problems. The core gameplay is great! It feels super rewarding to get kills.Veichles are fun to drift around in and winning is not impossible.I really like PUBG and I rate it 9/10

review: Faster than the snail speed of DayZ. Pace is slower than H1Z1 but it's not cartooney. This is a bad a$$ battle royale alpha that has dominated the charts well before it's full release. You will hear people whine about bugs and other imperfections let me say it again it's an alpha. Of all the alphas I've played I've never seen a development team be so quick to respond to criticism and fix the mentioned issues. This game is extremely well crafted and needs only polishing. With that being said buy it now before it doubles in price upon full release. *Fair warning* for all of you CSGO or CoD lovers prepare to either 1) learn patience and get good at a different style game or 2) cry about "camping" and a plethora of other tactics that relate to this game. Battlegrounds is not about kills it is about survival. You can accept that adapt and enjoy the game otherwise I look forward to reading your salty rants about how bad you are in forums or social media.Cheers

review: PUBG REVIEW Presentation 4/10 Graphics 2/10Sound 1/10Gameplay 0/10Lasting Appeal 5/10Overall Score 0.4/10That was a joke but here is my actual rant essay The concept of the game is pretty good and it's something I've always wanted to see done well but the game itself so far is massively broken.. There are things that I like about the game The item and looting system is good and the map itself is pretty good. The game has vehicles. I even like the fact that the game has a projectile system as opposed to a hitscan system. The problem with these things is that they simply don't work in a consistent way.. At all. Gun fights are just broken unless you are sniping a stationary target. In every other situation it seems extremely inconsistent and broken. Every once in a while the game works you might land a few headshots or body shots and your opponent will die as expected considering weapon damage and your opponent's armor. But most of the time you will find yourself landing an entire 25 round magazine into someone's chest or shooting them in the head 5+ times with blood spraying everywhere only to get killed by a single bullet. The game is obviously based around RNG which means you will spend the majority of your time getting screwed by crap loot and unlucky circles. Unfortunately gun fights are also RNG and much more so than any game I have played in recent memory. I am not exaggerating and I feel I have given the game adequate time to evaluate its condition thus far. As someone who has spent thousands of hours practicing and playing competitive FPS games such as CS and R6 I can say that my aim spray control situational awareness etc. are all sufficient to play this game except they aren't because the game doesn't let you use those skills (unless you happen to get lucky and the game works). I play using Hyperx Cloud 2's alternating between stereo and virtual 7.1 surround sound as I see fit and the sound in close quarters works pretty well. For sound over 100m or so away however it is extremely inconsistent. You will find yourself looking in the wrong direction sure of where the shots are coming from only to die from behind because it was actually coming from the opposite direction. It also took me a little while to get used to distinguishing the sounds of bullets flying by or hitting the ground from the actual gunshots but in those situations identifying the direction of that sound is impossible. It literally sounds like the gunshot is coming from every direction around you. The biggest problem with the sound though is the volume of gunshots. There are threads out there that examine and explain this issue in great detail so I won't go into it but if you want to play the game at a volume level where you can hear your surroundings whatsoever prepare to be deafened by every bullet fired within 25 meters of you. We don't need that level of realism. I have had to use Windows 10's loudness equalization feature as a band aid fix but it makes it a bit more difficult to judge gunfire distance. The movement was the most disappointing part of this game for me personally. And I'm not talking about weapon sway or anything like that. The movement just feels like something you would expect from an old N64 game or something. There is nothing about it worth complimenting every aspect of it is really attrocious. It really hit me when I played Conan Exiles and felt like the movement was several times better than the movement in PUBG. That is a really really bad and confusing thing. I will say that it LOOKS better in third person but the problem is definitely not just the animations cameras or FOV. I can ignore all expected bugs like getting stuck in objects buildings disappearing etc. but the physics in this game just don't make any sense.. Getting tapped by a vehicle rolling at less than 1 mph will kill you. Getting out of a vehicle moving 5mph will kill you including boats... Lifting your bike off the ground will kill you. Honestly literally everything about the vehicles (especially the dualsport moto) is a mess and while bouncing around and flipping wildly to your death can be fun for a while it gets old fast. I could definitely go on for much longer about all my gripes about the game's execution but the real problem with this game along with almost every other early access title is the business strategy of the publisher. There are major issues with SELLING early access titles which has become apparent to me over the past year or so. One of these is the fact that managing and supporting a released game requires a lot of effort on the part of the developers and management and it makes actually testing and fixing the game much more difficult. Traditionally games would make it through beta testing BEFORE being released and those testers were paid to play the game (not paying to play it). This meant that adequate funding had to be raised BEFORE testing to ensure that the game was in a decent state for release. Actual alpha/beta testing is intensive and focused and probably tens of times more efficient than widescale public testing. What these small companies are doing essentially is using their sales during early access as funding for development. This is the kind of stuff you hear about in case studies in business school as a lesson on how to not go bankrupt. It isn't just morally wrong it is just a bad strategy. The fact that most people who would play this game at release have already bought it for $30 means that they have forgone nearly half their potential sales income when they could have finished developing the game and sold it for $60 like every big studio does. There is a reason the big game companies are still in business (well some are adopting similar poor business strategies and committing suicide) and that is experience. Most popular games have had budgets of several hundred million dollars knowing that they can make a profit by selling their game for a higher price and introducing microtransactions. I haven't seen Bluehole's financial statements but I don't need to to tell that they are sacrificing long term gains for short term profits which historically has led to dead games and companies. I probably don't need to mention the obvious fact that their investing in the esports realm is a sign that they are getting way ahead of themselves and spending money in the wrong areas. This game is casual entertainment. It is not an e sport and it never will be simply due to the nature of the game. The invitational was a clear indication of this. I don't even need to elaborate. No other esport is as luck based as this game and it doesn't reward player talent nearly as much as it needs to. Long term I would obviously love to see them improve this game but as someone with an education in business I can't say it looks good for them. The DayZ/Conan/Space Engineers strategy is massively flawed and you are just repeating those mistakes. Forget new content. Screw your new map and vaulting system. FIX THE GAME MECHANICS. Even Ubisoft is starting to show some promise with their strategy. Stop letting your $30 dollar sales get to your head and think long term. Sorry for the essay.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: *I will update this review if possible (or write a new one) when I see changes...*I really want to recommend this game! But at the moment it has some issues. At first when I started playing before the last patch I had no major issues apart from the expected "Early Access" type stuff you get in games that aren't polished yet. (Everything is Early Access these days... So expect to not always work...) Aim through scopes Horrible De sync / Overall lag Horrible Stuck in plane Horrible UI Refreshing... Gosh I haven't even used my browser's refresh that much #_# Damage on point blank Horrible (And all the other things many mentioned... Water planks cloth and so on) Fall damage is ridiculous (You can jump off rooftops and get no damage most times but dare jump of a bike going 1mph... you dead son!) Try jumping over a low wall without a run up... HorribleSo yeah loads of horrible crap but whatever its Early Access I'm fine with that. Those are all things that are manageable... The main thing that made me choose "thumbs down" is the fact that since the last patch every single match I have to ctrl+alt+del and select sign out so that the OS force closes the game. As soon as the match ends and I select "Return to Lobby" the game hangs. No alt+tab No Alt+F4 no nothing works... The game keeps the focus apart from the ctrl+alt+del screen. This means I have to re open everything Oh and since the last patch I also have to explicitly run Steam as Administrator... Just for Pubg... End of the day this bug is really F&amp king annoying... It extends the time between matches so much that by the time I rejoin the team I don't really feel like playing anymore because death in game sucks so much more...To the devs / CEO / whatever Stop worrying about Fortnite really it maybe the same genre but its nothing close to Pubg. Fortnite for me is a kiddy version of something nothing like Pubg apart from the main mechanics fornite is a joke its nothing serious. Not once have I had any similar feel while playing it over Pubg. Instead you guys should focus on what you have. Fix the bugs that cause major issues instead of chasing after epics fornite... who cares. I don't want to bash fornite its something of its own but bleh I don't see why the fuzz... The only thing fortnite does better than pubg at the moment is it runs pretty well. Anyways...I read that you guys are busy with the server side stuff another reason not to worry about fortnite... You guys have millions of connections to handle... *facepalm* key word is millions... Instead of chasing after them and what they did and how you feel about that... Search for devs rather so they can start working on optimizations and the rest of the mid/high layer. !!! Focus on getting the application to run fine without making it literally unplayable. !!! These are things like the main bug I and others have atm.... It makes it unplayable... Not having balance or falling damage that s insane or a scope that doesn't really function In my book those things aren't making the game unplayable... it makes it more interesting... Some will disagree again who cares its early access...And fix the coloring... Geez learn something from Re shade do some tweaks on the post processing...Okay some goodness.This game is definitely a recommendation its great! Broken somewhat but great.Every single match had me in a place where I haven't been for a really long time just the right amount of "Juice". The sound in the game for me is Perfect for what they have it really drives the game. Hearing shots in the distance or someone walking around on the floor above you while you thought you were all alone is just an amazing feeling... Heart racing. The other day I had to beat someone to death with my fists (in game ofc) because I were to slow to get into the house I came down just after him and entered the same house soon after... While he was busy looting I sneaked up on him and killed him even though he had a nice SCAR... D The game is full of awesome moments... It makes you want to retry and retry and retry... Until &gt /Winner winner Chicken Dinner!

review: Here's my honest review and suggestions for you if you're going to purchase this game**DONT BUY THIS GAME**1. if you aren't willing to invest time into this game to get better2. if you easily get triggered/salty**BUY THIS GAME**3. if you're looking for hours of fun and a different situation every match4. if you're a highly competitive player or a non highly competitive player this game can be great for anyone who plays itWhether you're here to buy the game to play it very competitively or very non competitively this game is for anyone who enjoys action packed battle royale style games FPS TPS strategy skill based play and or just for fun and to try a new game. After investing almost 100 hours(at the time of this review) I can say this was well worth the $30 and I'm surely going to keep playing this game. If you can play and look past the early access stage and the bugs that are with it (the game is still extremely playable on all levels.) you will enjoy your experience. The community isn't bad at all not anywhere comparable to some other games horrible communities and you usually find nice teammates if you solo Q on duo or squad matches. I overall reccomend this game to most players who want to play a battle royale or a new style FPS/TPS game. The developers are always working on new updates even after the game being out for like 5 6 months and they respond to community feedback. Hope this review helped and leaned you toward purchasing PUBG. Thank you! DDisregard the people complaining about the micro transactions they don't mean much to the game and it's your choice solely if you want to purchase keys for the gamescom crate(limited edition crate)

review: Started Playing this game a few days ago and its been nothing but fun!! there are bugs but what do you expect for early access? The game is good at keeping you tense a house? Do you forage it for supplies? Or is someone waiting inside ready to put a bullet in your head? This is one of the many decisions that will plague you whilst playing. It has its amusing sides too. Like when i chased a guy in just his underpants into a house and found him hiding in a bathroom with no weapons and shot him. Another time waiting prone in the long grass with a rifle watching a fight unfold before killing off the victor and then another poor soul who'd come to investigate the gunfire. Every game is different and this is what I love about this game. You will long to be the last player standing. I think with regular updates(which it is getting so far) this could be a great game that will be around for a long time to come. Keep up the good work!!!!

My mother said to me "Don't ever smoke. please don't put your family through what your Grandfather put us through." I agreed. At 23 I have never touched a cigarette. I must say I feel a very slight sense of regret for never having done it Because this game gave me cancer anyway.

review: Brutal and fun. Good responiveness to the gameplay and guns. They sound great and feel great when using them. I have a love/hate with this game. I keep coming back to it and it slaps me down when I'm not paying attention because other players (100 per game) give no mercy. So expect all the tricks in the book baiting supply drops ambushes campers etc. But its fun and the gameplay speeds up as the map area decreases over time forcing player confrontation to push the campers out of their hidey holes and into the fray. If you enjoy a slight lul in the beginning while players gear up and then hectic firefights after 5 7 minutes then you'll enjoy this game. There is no single player or AI it's a straight up deathmatch with single or squads coming together for a full on battle royal.

review: I was hesitant to purchase PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS as I am not traditionally a fan of battle royales. Although the amassing attention PUBG was gathering peaked my interest.While the game itself is rather enjoyable I believe Bluehole it's developers are doing a terrible job at administering the game under all the publicity PUBG has gathered. For instance Twitch streamers are seemingly being valued by Bluehole over the majority of the user base as evident by the recent "stream snipe bannings". To place this into perspective a Twitch streamer could die and claim "stream sniping" on a completely legitimate kill and the other player would be completely defenseless to argue otherwise. This isn't just a hypothetical scenario as it's already been reported to have happened multiple times now. PUBG should respect it's Twitch user base yes but they should also stand by their common user base rather than favoring Twitch players.I'd also noticed a "PUBG Rules of Conduct" notification in game and after reading through it I'd found myself almost baffled. It's good that the devs. are attempting to keep their game as non toxic as possible however these "Rules of Conduct" were horribly vague and simply ridiculous. For example one rule if I recall stated "do not stalk or harass other players". If I'm to understand this correctly you are not to stalk/track enemy players in an attempt to kill them or other players that might be drawn to said player's movements? These "Rules of Conduct" appear to contradict the very nature of the game.Regardless the game itself is rather enjoyable and had it not been for Bluehole's actions I would've left my review positive. (Edited to address PUBG's development)

The game is really fun. You can take a different approach every single time you play and thats what makes it unique. It's a basic concept. You're in a plane you eject find weapons and try to survive. Each game is different. You can play it out different eject differently use a more efficent strategy to survive longer etc. Once you get into the top 10 people remaining alive and the map keeps getting smaller and smaller... theres few games out there that can deliver adrenaline and excitement like this game does.

review: Having only played a handful of games I can only warn you that this review may not be as accurate as some. As some one who generally detests fps (bought battlefield1 and hated it lol) I can tell you now that this is immense fun!! I have never enjonyed being killed by other players so much haha. The graphics are on point as is the sound both allow total immersion and really convey the feeling of fighting for your survival. Running around desperately trying to find the kit needed whilst avoiding getting your head blown off leads to some real edge of your seat tension. Gun play is enjoyable without feeling as if you need to treat it as a job you dont have to spend hours practicing your 360 noscope to be competitive. This is essentially an 18 rated hungergames and all the better for it. The game is not without it's faults there seems to be bugs applenty but not in a game breaking way and will no doubt be dealt with in upcoming updates it is early days after all. i have no idea why people are throwing their toys out of the pram re. micro transactions you can buy cosmetic items which in no way give you an advantage? Oh no! somebody call the police!! Seriously though complaining that the devs have added another way to earn cash (irrespective what they are using it for) is pretty juvenile and niave. If you want to support a fun and high quality product buy this. Or becoming one of the growing masses of sjw's who down vote the game because the devs havent done what you think they should do. Bottom line this game is fantastic fun and i would be suprised if you were dissapointed by the game.

review: After being thoroughly addicted to this game for the past 2 weeks reaching roughly 100 hours on it I believe this game deserves my effort on making a review for it. I will say this I have never made a review for any other game in my library nor will I if it can't reach the same standards this game has raised and set. First off this game is not made for everyone. Some people may not like the whole genre of 'battle royal' and I can understand that it gets frustrating because there are so many variables to consider and one can easily become overwelmed with the amount of things to keep in mind to survive. To those who are complaining about those issues I wish I could do something to help alleviate your situation in game because I believe this game should be enjoyed by all. There are also those who complain about the performance issues. This game is early access. I repeat EARLY ACCESS. You can't expect the game to be running smoothly with opitmized settings when it was just released a couple months ago. Its like expecting a 2 year old child to be able to take apart and put back together a handgun blind folded. So what do I enjoy about this game may you ask? Its simply the utter turbulance and exhilarating nature this game can produce. If anyone has ever been in the top 10 they know how nerve racking things can get. No two games are every played the exact same with the same items in the same place well not for me yet lol. Each match holds an infinite amounts of routes and decisions I can make to win. One can play sneaky or one can go guns blazing into the cross fire and somehow make it out alive. This game does take abit of concentration and understanding. One must know their location and the sounds of gun shots around them to make an educated decision in order to survive. Do we engage the enemy team or do we let them pass by undetected of our presence and ambush them later? This free range of decisions with the size of the map lets one take hold of their own fate every match. Another thing I like about this game is not needing a team to play with but if played with friends it is a ton more fun. Playing solo in my opinion is alot easier since you don't have to worry about your team mates going down and having to go back to them. Playing solo also makes one more apprehensive of their decisions making one think of their next move more carefully rather than to 'Call of Duty' the situation lol. However playing as a team can make you more of a formidable force on the map if the group is well coordinated and has a good shot. Is there anything I don't like about this game? None. I have no complaints in this game just yet. Everytime I have died in this game was not because of hacking or for trivial reasons it was all because of my own decisions in the game itself. For instance neglecting to close the door of the house I just entered behind me which resulted in me being shot in the back of the head. Another being gunned down while running through an open field when I should've stuck to the tree line for cover. I believe the developers of PUBG hit the nail on the head of this genre of 'battle royal'. They incorporated a strong sense of realisim from the bullet drop to having to revive a fallen team mate who needs help to survive. I am looking forward to the development of this game and I hope the dev's put their hearts into this project. Thank you.
title: PLAYERUNKNOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS

review: This is my first survival battle royale styled game. I have always thought they were fun to watch. Once I bought PUBG after watching it on Twitch I was glad I had done so. The game itself seemed overwhelming and tough at first but you pick up pretty quickly. I myself am not that great and have only won 1 match so far but even if I die to some lame BS I find myself ready to queue for another and go back at it. It is early access which comes with its flaws but the devs seem hard at work to keep things running smooth. There is still a lot of kinks to work out and the game is still fun so thats a bonus from me. Hopefully once they implement more maps/gamemodes this game will really hit its stride.Worth the $30.

review: I'll preface this review by saying Battlegrounds by no means complete nor well optimized in it's current state. However that does not mean it is unenjoyable or unplayable. Despite my short amount of time in game I can confidently say is much better than it's counterpart H1Z1 King of the Kill for a number of reasons 1. Its weapon variety is much healthier and (somewhat) balanced in customability strengths and weaknesses (and will evidently grow in number).2. Some central mechanics of the game are much more realistic and less buggy in comparison to its counterpart (you can't jump out of cars that are flying at the speed of light and live weapons actually hit where you aim at least along the vertical axis bullet drop is a thing!). 3. There are tons of servers already and they are more often than not at least playable (I've only had one account of having to leave the game due to horrendous lag).4. Graphically it's a beautiful game at its highest settings although it is nearly impossible to play with said settings effectively due to poor optimization and thus FPS issues/inconsistencies.5. The Steam Market already includes the game's in game skins and items available to characters another thing worth noting here is that it's relatively easy to earn "Reward Points" from simply playing the game. With this you can gradually purchase crates which will randomly drop said skins.6. The game actually feels fun and fair to play. There are a minute number of instances that feel like I was killed due to poor game design or exploitations. Again this game is by no means complete or the absolute best thing I've played thus far but it's shaping up to be extremely promising. The Battle Royale in the Arma series were extremely fun but just a little too slow paced it seemed H1Z1 had and has a number of problems that are fundamental to a game's success and playability Battlegrounds appears to be setting a new standard in battle royale type games.

review: There's a huge island and you and 99 other people will fly over the island. You can jump out of the plane whenever you want to find a good spot to land.Once you land you'll look for gear. A weapon as first to defend yourself in case other players chose the same location to land. After a short while a circle will pop up on the map. You'll need to get there. You can run or maybe find a vehicle.After 2 4minutes the circle will shrink and again you'll have to get there. If you don't reach the circle in time you'll start to take damage. The damage is low with the first few circles but will increase each shrinking circle. Once the circle is small enough you'll need to locate yourself in the correct position where you have the advantage against the other surviving players. Soon you'll reach top 10 and that's when the game actually starts. Intensive gameplay assured.

review: Ive never laughed so hard in my life. This game is able to go from dead serious tactical and intense suspense to out and out balls to the wall hilarious. Playing in a squad is this game at its very best but all modes from squads to solo are an experience not to be missed.I always tentatively purchase alphas &amp betas but this has been worth every penny so far. It has that one more game appeal that will have you fumbling through your daily life like a zombi telling yourself that 3hrs sleep a night is in fact perfectly healthy. Its when your out walking in real life and you start considering what loot might be in that house over there and where the best cover is that you know you have a problem.Anyway not going to talk about optimisation and crashes its still early access you have to expect that and to my experience I have had hardly any issues and when it did freeze a quick relog is the solution.Gameplay wise the combat and mechanics are all responsive if a touch clunky (ala arma) but combat is fun and kills are highly rewarding.I highly recommend this title and when you get your first win the sense of acomplishement is on a par to losing your virginity.

review: As I spiralled down towards the farmhouse in my parachute I spied another falling player out of the corner of my eye."It'll be alright " I thought to myself "I'll be able to get the goodies inside before he lands"After hitting the deck I rushed hopefully towards the open doors of the farmhouse and saw the same player hunched over some boxes at the far end. In a mad 'it's him or me' moment I decided to try and rush him. It is possible to beat someone in hand to hand combat after all. As I drew closer I realised he was clutching a frying pan."I still have a chance " I thought "This is not a Looney Toons cartoon"Wrong. As it turns out a frying pan does top trump fists when push comes to shove. What followed was a desperate square dance involving a great deal of crouching jumping and flailing wildly that resulted in my character having virtually no health and my foe having barely a scratch on him.Desperately trying to remedy the situation and live to fight another day I made a break for the open doors at the other end of the farmhouse and set off sprinting across the fields. Two minutes later I dared to look over my shoulder only to discover the same player was still in hot pursuit. A swift crack to the nut dumped me out of the server and back to the main menu defeated yet oddly satisfied.GG would play again 10/10

review: One of my favourite games right now not worth spending that much time in Quickplay imo unless you have friends with you as it's almost always 5 dps and nobody is really trying to win. Competitive mode is well.. competitive.. for the most part. Unfortunately there're a decent amount of throwers and leavers since I got into master it seems like in every game whichever team doesn't have the thrower/leaver just landslide wins off the bat. There're always some heroes that feel overpowered like pharah symmetra's and her beam sniper (that actually isn't that good but everytime she kills you it feels like t) D.va's defence matrix that never seems to be out and scatter arrow from that head you know the one I'm talking about.. Nevertheless it's still one of the best games being on a good co ordinated team feels amazing and it's really satisfying to get elims. Slicing through teams with Dragonblade is some of the most fun I've had in a game in a while..

review: If you are thinking about buying this game do not choose to do so by reference of the trailer on steam. Go to youtube and look up someones gameplay. If you cannot run youtube on your computer your computer will fry attempting to run this game. Most bad reviews about this game are over in game lag and connection issues or crashing. I personally have not experienced these issues as much as other players seemed to have but if you really want to play this game I would suggest investing in a good computer. Now that my jibber jabbering about the requirements is over. GAMEPLAY. I cannot express enough how happy I am BlueHole decided to take up this project. At first glance this may seem like another hunger games gun kinda thing like arma battle royale DayZ Or H1Z1 excetera the list goes on but what is in common with all 3 of those examples is that the execution whether it be lag or development coming to a stop (LOOKING AT YOU DAYZ) the games are so close to being something great but just cannot achieve it. BUT NOW FOR THE FIRST TIME EVER A GAME THAT ACHIEVES THE ADRENALINE RUSH YOU HAVE BEEN LOOKING FOR PLAYERUNKOWN'S BATTLEGROUNDS finally a game with this genre of gameplay has sucssefully produced a tense fun and addictive game that will keep you up till 3 am saying "Just one more round" Yes development is not complete yet and no game is perfect I believe that this one comes pretty damn close. You can play alone or with your friends in a single double or quadruple team. In a multiplayer match you can either play well and have a great sucess story with your friends or goof around and see if you can land a supply drop on your jeep. Either way youll be smiling by the end. I cannot reccomend this game enough and if you have 30 to 40 bucks to spare as well as a nice pc take a spin at this game i promise you wont be dissapointed!

review: PUBG is not without flaws but the overall design is traveling exactly in the direction it needs to go to keep me interested in the game for a long time to come.As a fan of DayZs gunplay PUBG feels right at home on creating a mix of satisfying looting sneaking and midrange combat. The only issues I've had with combat outside of the occasional server lag comes from melee where especially in the early parts of the game where it matters you are unable to hit other players and often be hit yourself. It seems completely random whether your attacks will register with a target. On occasion I'll punch someone in the head and down them while other times I've been in a point blank fight with a player for over a minute with neither of us landing a hit. It seems the best option is to just run.Many players have voiced their concerns on optimization and I can say I'm in a similar boat. Despite having a GTX 1080 the game runs around 80 FPS on low settings at 1440p with drops down to the 40s in large cities. Optimization is at the top of the developers list but be wary for players with older graphics cards or CPUs.If the game looks fun you should look into buying it. It's a great value at 30 and you can refund it if you can't run it. Try to play duos as it's the most engaging mode in my opinion. It will take a while for you to get used to leading shots and looting quickly but once you've spent a handful of hours in it the game is rediculously fun.I have high hopes for the future of this game.EDIT I'll leave my initial review up but I feel PUBG degraded in quality from where it was initially to the point where I can't really recommend it anymore.
